Notes: First day of camp at Sampson's cabin. I wasn't in very good shape since because of severe over training during my freshman year I wasn't able to really start summer training until late July.
We drove into Hayward and ran on the Birkie trail.

Attempted a progression run with the team. We sped up too fast and I got dropped, so in order to get something out of it I slowed down for another mile or so and then picked it up more gradually after the turn around. Hit 15 minutes of 5:40-5:50 pace on the way back.
Last run of camp before heading back to campus.

1.........16.....400 Meters....____....80....100m jog....____
Cool-down: 

Thunder's annual 'as sure as death and taxes' 20 x 400 workout. I knew going in that since I wasn't in good shape I wasn't likely to finish it so my goal was to get 15. 16 ended up being where I pulled the plug. Logging this in 2013 it's crazy to think that this workout was hard. Now it's basically my goal marathon pace.

Alumni 5K. The alums won, for probably the last time ever. I ran in no man's land for almost the entire thing and it was pretty much a tempo rather than a race. Ran 17:50 and got 4th on the team and 8th overall. I took a wrong turn in the last half mile which probably cost me about 10 seconds.
Ran with Krahulec and Forsberg in the arbs. I was totally dead at the end.
First cross campus of the year, and also the first practice of the season that the new freshmen attended. Pez was worried that all we ever did was dick around.

7 mile progression run. It was something like 90 degrees out.

6:55, 6:23, 6:27, 5:33 (short), 5:52, 6:00 (uphill), 5:49
Streaked the outdoor movie
At the start of the run we did the 'Last Beer'. At this point in my life I had never had a beer so I drank a lemonade.

5 x Thorson
5 x Old Main
3 x 4th Mile
Ran Ostrich at night by myself

9 mile progression run
Last 5 miles: 5:45, 5:50, 5:50, 5:58, 6:00

I was hitting the wall a bit the last 2 miles and watched the rest of the varsity guys run away from me.
Skipped the mile repeats because I wasn't in shape for back to back workouts yet.
7 x Thorson

***RACE***
Race Name: St Olaf Invite
Terrain: X-Country
Warm Up: 3
Cool Down: 2
Overall Place: 141st
Age Place: 9th on team

I wasn't quite ready to race fitness-wise but since the meet was loaded (everybody came to see the course for nationals) I didn't want to miss out on it. Woke up feeling a little sick. Rivers, Tim, Schwock, and I ran most of the race within shouting distance of each other, then those guys got away from me on the fourth mile. Adrian got me with about 1000 to go, but Schwock came back and I passed him in the last straight.
Sick
Ran with Group X for their threshold run, which was basically just a normal run for me. Started antibiotics for my sinus infection this evening.

13 min, 7 min, 5 min @ tempo pace
4 x 30 seconds faster

Did this by myself on the Jefferson loop rather than running mile repeats with the team.

Biked 35 minutes. I figured I wasn't going to gain any aerobic benefit from a 5 mile run so in order to try to get healthy faster I would just give the lungs a complete day off and get the blood flowing by biking easy.

***RACE***
Race Name: Blugold Invite
Terrain: X-Country
Warm Up: 1.5 shakeout, 3 before race
Cool Down: 2
Overall Place: 73rd
Age Place: 6th on team

Good race considering I was sick all week and still felt bad the day of. Worked really hard and was dead afterward.

7 mile progression run
43:18 total time, last two miles were 6:03 (uphill), 6:00

Must have still been feeling some effects of the sinus infection.

Race Name: Pre Nationals

Age Place: 5th on team

It was 80 degrees and super humid, so this was miserable. Lots of guys dropped out and some had to go to the hospital. Cullen and I struggled together the last couple miles. Slowest time of my college career.

9 mile progression run
53:47 total time, last 3 miles were 6:00, 5:50, 5:57

Got dropped the last two miles and after this decided that for the rest of the season I would stick to the 7 mile route on Mondays.

Cool-down:
Ran with Cullen and Krahulec. After the run I told those guys, 'I feel like I'm finally starting to get in shape.'
Jon Chang came to practice drunk and ran straight into 'the sign' at Carleton.

20 min tempo
4 min rest
15 min tempo
4 x 200m strides

Since I was in Appleton for fall break I did something different than the normal Monday progression run.  This workout felt really good.

This went much better than the August 20x400 workout.  I kept the reins in pretty tight the last 5 or 6 when the other varsity guys started hammering.  Last year after hammering this workout my legs never came back the rest of the season.

5 x Old Main
4 x Thorson
7 mile progression run.  5:50 last mile.

Easy 400s workout on the track.  A bunch of guys raced the last one and I think I was the last person on the team to cross the line because I didn't want any part of that.  Felt really good and ready for conference.
Ran Cornhole by myself before Green Monster.

7 mile progression run
Last 3 miles: 5:40 (slightly short), 5:58 (uphill), 5:50

The other guys I was running with turned off at 5 to do 9 and despite their yells for me to join them I continued on the 7 mile route.

With Sampson's help I convinced Thunder to do this instead of doing 5 x 1000 at  3K-5K pace.  I felt really good through 7 and even the last 3 weren't too bad.  Thunder got Cullen and Green riled up towards the end and they ran something like 2:11 on the last one.

Ran early with Green so that we could go watch the Olaf v Carleton soccer game during practice time.  The game was sweet; a nail biting 1-0 upset win for the Oles to end the Carls' season and send our team to the MIAC final.

Ran by myself before Karhu.  The Carls were heavily favored based on the MIAC results but our boys went out and kicked their butts.  Chris, Krahulec, and Adrian dictated the race right from the start and by halfway it was over.  Really inspiring race to witness and I still believe it was the turning point for our program.

6 x Thorson
2 x Norway Valley

This was easy.  I was really glad we didn't do 20 x 400 again.
Woke up early to watch the Marathon Trials, then ran afterward.  Felt inspired.

7 mile progression run
42:44 total time, last two miles were 6:17 (uphill and into a stiff wind), 5:50

I ran almost 2 minutes faster than this on the Monday before regionals my freshman year, but in doing so I left my race on Old Dutch Road, so I (as well as the rest of the team) made sure to keep things pretty relaxed today.  There are no awards given out for performances on Monday afternoon.

Pretty much the same thing as before conference.  Felt really good once again and after this workout I was really excited for regionals.  On the cooldown we decided as a team that we were going after it.

Started a little early since I thought everyone else would just want to do cross campus.  After the run we all watched Letich run a mile time trial since he was going abroad for the spring and wanted to try to break 5.  He ran 5:02.
Pre meet run for regionals on the course.  With all the teams running around it felt like the day before the Super Bowl.
Regular morning loop
Went to Pierce Park and back, did several pickups on the way back that ranged from 15 - 90 seconds. Felt pretty strong.
Really tired this morning so I didn't run before going to physical therapy. Did a longer run in the afternoon to make up for it.
Did a couple strides
Was too tired to run in the afternoon so I went at 11 PM after umpiring. Probably a waste of time.
Really hot this afternoon, went out the CE trail to Fieldcrest Drive. The way back felt like it took forever.
Thought about just taking the day off but decided to run. Did a six mile loop then my usual 'day before race' strides. I am not ready to race though and tomorrow could be ugly.
Shakeout run before I drove to La Crosse

***RACE***
Race Name: Shithouse 5K
Terrain: Road
Warm Up: 4 miles
Race Splits: 5:08
Cool Down: 1 mile

Went out with Green and Chris but I did not feel good and they pulled away from me just before the mile mark. After seeing my mile split I decided to ease off and just cruise the remainder of the race because I did not want to bust my ass to run a crappy time. Oh well, I care about races in November, not July. At least the party was awesome.

Thankfully I was not hung over after my first night of heavy drinking in a few months, just a little dehydrated. Green, Rivers and I ran up the bluff (tough climb) and down some trail in the forest. Ended up on the La Crosse campus and was tired, hungry, and thirsty at the run's end. It was a nice change to run with other people though - running by myself has gotten quite boring.
Ran the regular morning loop and tacked on an extra mile because I felt good. 5th mile was probably under 6:00.
Did some strides afterwards. Felt really good today.
Shortened morning loop, had to get to physical therapist appointment.
Wore a watch so I could make sure I'm not running like 7:30 pace. Not bad, but not great either. My dad thinks I am over training, I guess I'll see after tomorrow's workout.

3.5 mile warmup, 2 mile cooldown

3 x 10 min at tempo effort with 2:00 rest, covered over 5 miles so I'm pretty happy with it. Good first workout of the summer. Did strides afterwards.
Kept it really relaxed, felt good
Easy
My left shin hurt really bad so I turned off and only did a five mile loop, then when I got home I was pissed about going so short and did three more inside.
7 miles inside, wanted to stay on a soft surface because of my shin.
Went outside, shin hurt a little bit but not as bad as yesterday. Did a few short pickups on the way back.

I had planned on doing 15 today, but it was really hot so I decided to try 10 and then add on if I felt good. Around 4 miles I started feeling awful and slowed down to probably 8:00 pace. Eventually I stopped to walk for a while, then decided I wanted to make it home before dark so I started running again. Felt a little better but not much. I don't know if I was just dehydrated or what but this was the worst I've felt on a run in a long time.

Felt way better than yesterday. Ended up being at work until 6:45 so I didn't get to run until this evening. During the run I saw two high schoolers all over each other in a driveway. I thought about yelling something but decided not to. Did 8 100m strides and afterwards did push ups, dips, and curls. Not sure when I last did these, but I am weak.

In other news, Brett Favre reported to training camp today. Mike McCarthy better make him the starter; after Aaron Rodgers' performance in the scrimmage last night there is no way you can convince me that the team has a better chance to win with him under center than with Favre.

3 mile warmup, 2 mile cooldown

20:30 tempo run - Ran first mile in 5:47, last mile in 5:27. Good effort, especially considering it was about 90 degrees when I did this. Heart rate when I finished was 165, less than 2 minutes later it was around 120. Did four long strides afterwards.

Inspired by Chris and Phil's run from yesterday I jogged over to Reid Golf Course and ran barefoot. This was one of my favorite runs of the summer, just cruising along on the grass with nothing else to distract or bother me. Unfortunately no sprinklers were turned on so I was unable to use one as a bidet. Overall today was an awesome day of training.

Ran an extended Xavier...felt pretty good after yesterday. Four or five police cars passed me around Pierce Park, but I never found out where they were headed. Didn't hear any sirens so I assume it was nothing serious. Then I went to Memorial for my last night of softball for the summer.

Treadmilled it so I could watch the SportsCenter coverage of the Brett Favre trade. I'll be cheering for him as a Jet, but it's really disappointing that everything had to end this way. It still doesn't make sense to me that the Packers didn't want one of the best quarterbacks of all time who often happened to be coming off of a career year. They put out a statement a month ago saying they wanted to 'protect Brett's legacy,' but then they released false stories about a comeback in March that didn't happen and about Favre using a team-issued cell phone to talk with the Vikings, tried to buy him off to stay retired, compared his return to crossing the Rubicon, and held a press conference claiming 'his head wasn't in the right place.' Real classy guys. Kick your hall of fame quarterback to the curb for no real reason. Yes I know he 'retired', but give me a break; he changed his mind before anything of significance happened (he first told the team he wanted to come back in June). If the Packers had wanted him back it would have been no problem and Aaron Rodgers would have been the only person upset. So now instead of having everything back from a team that was a play or two away from the Super Bowl we have no quarterbacks on the roster that have started an NFL game. If the Jets make the playoffs this season and the Packers don't Ted Thompson might need to pull a Theo Epstein and leave Lambeau in a gorilla suit. Boom, outta here Ted.

Did an out and back to Appleton West with a two mile add on at the end. Felt awesome and if it hadn't been 10:00 already when I finished I might have gone 3-5 more miles. I was just in the zone tonight. There were some shady people heading to the bars downtown - many of them were quite confused as to what I was doing. A couple old men thought they were so clever yelling, 'Run Forrest!' Yup, never heard that one before. Followed up the run with pushups, dips, curls, and abs. Today was my last day of work for the summer; now I just get to relax and have fun before camp. Starting tomorrow I'll be up in Door County for 10 days.
Easy Run + Strides before leaving for Door County. Last run over the College Avenue bridge.
Took a break from watching the Olympic Opening Ceremonies to get a second run in. Felt pretty good, running at night is fun.

It was nice to get a good long run in for the first time in a while. When I left the Brewers game was 0-0 in the sixth inning, and I was very surprised to find them still playing when I came back. Kapler hit a walk off HR in the bottom of the 13th to win it for us. Then I watched the most exciting swimming race I've ever seen, the 4x100m Freestyle Relay. The French were talking smack and the Americans took the win. Booya.
Did some strides after the run
Really tired this morning so I just did a short shakeout run rather than a regular morning run.

20 min warmup

20 min @ threshold, 4 min rest, 10 min @ threshold

Strides

Cooldown

No mile markers on this but it felt like I was running fast. Felt a little weird at the start but quickly got into a rhythm. Wouldn't be surprised if my last 10 minutes was sub 5:40 pace.
Kept putting this off. First thought about running at 11 AM, didn't get out the door until 2:30. Oh well, not like I had anything else important to do.
Morning run before going out for breakfast at Al Johnson's. Best breakfast there is: sweedish meatballs & sweedish pancakes a la mode with strawberries.
Had to take a crap in the woods, some little kids saw me and started laughing hysterically when they figured out what I was doing.

Spent the entire afternoon in the pool and hot tub, as a result my legs didn't feel good at all on the run. Did a few strides afterwards. Michael Phelps might be inhuman after that win in the 100m Butterfly. Also have to give props to Shalane Flanagan for picking up the bronze in the women's 10,000m.

20 min warmup

3xHill, 8x1:30 @ 8K effort, 3xHill (90 sec rests)

Cooldown

This ended up being fairly easy, it was just something to start getting the legs used to running fast again. The long rests prevented me from getting into any oxygen debt and I felt great throughout. Next workout will be a bit more challenging (20x400m with 40 sec rest in 2 weeks).

Last run of the vacation. This has been a really good stretch of training and I feel like I'm ready for the season to start. Just have to make it through a few more days of running alone and then I reunite with the guys for camp. Watched six straight hours of sports tonight: Favre's first game as a Jet, the Olympics, the Packer game, and the Brewers game. Favre looked like he hasn't lost anything and Aaron Rodgers looked terrible. Packers management is not real high on my list right now. Phelps completed his amazing Olympics, and Usain Bolt ran an insane 100m, easing up 20 meters before the finish and still breaking his world record. Then the Brewers came back, blew their lead, and won in extra innings.

Felt pretty good after about 3 miles. Was hoping to do 15 but had to shit really bad and couldn't motivate myself to do 10 more minutes afterwards. Oh well, there's not that much of a difference anyways.
Nice easy run, once again done at night. Felt pretty good the whole time. I started packing things up today; I guess it really is time to head back.

Ran with Boyd at High Cliff. It was nice to be on trails since I've been running 99% of my mileage on pavement all summer. We did a 1 minute pickup every 10 minutes, but the pickups weren't a ton faster than the rest of the run. Didn't eat very much before the run so about 20 minutes in I got hungry, but that went away after a bit. Felt really good the last 10 minutes.
Just another boring double.
Last PT appointment this morning

20 min warmup

13 min @ threshold, 2:30 rest, 8 min @ threshold, 2:00 rest, 1 mile fast (5:15)

Strides + cooldown

Felt like crap on the warmup but the workout went awesome. On the first threshold segment I was 5:41 at the mile; that was the only split I got until the last mile. On the last mile I was shooting for under 5:25, and running 5:15 felt really easy. Best of all my heart rate was only in the high 150s after each segment. Tomorrow I leave for Northfield, so any sleep I get before 2 AM tonight is a bonus.

I was up until 2 AM packing and then woke up at 8, ate breakfast, and ran. Dropped off my fantasy baseball entry fee at Ehlert's then ran down Memorial for the 567th (and last) time of the summer. Then I drove to Minnesota. The USA sucks at passing the baton; it was clear that they had never really worked on their handoffs before the 4x100.

Ran in the arb with Green and Krahulec, then added short Ostrich. Felt alright, just a little thirsty. We went grocery shopping with Lundin and Griff and bought way too much food. For dinner a bunch of us went to Hogan Brother's and then Taco Bell...delicious.

First day of camp! We ran an out and back from the cabin through downtown Sayner; it was nice to run with the team again. Then we watched the Olympics and saw two nice USA victories in the 1600m relay and Kenenisa Bekele win the 5000m with a disgusting 3:56 last mile (and 53 sec final lap).

Ran 10 miles on the bike path from Sayner to Crystal Lake. A guy drove past us and yelled 'Faggots,' thinking he was really funny. After everyone pooped at the Crystal Lake campground we turned around, only to discover that someone had stolen Pez's shirt that he had thrown in the woods on the way out.

Doboul, Rivers, and I went six, everyone else went 4. Nothing exciting happened on the run. At night we went to the Sayner Pub, but it turned out to be a disappointment. However, the bartender directed us to another bar called KD's, so we piled in the back of a pickup driven by a drunk townie named Jim and went there. After getting to KD's we played beer pong, which took forever. Midway through the game we noticed a Red Dog sign on the wall, so Rivers went to ask how much the bartender wanted for it. Kari refused our initial offer of 2 pairs of pants, and eventually we negotiated that she would give us the sign if we ran back to the cabin (5 miles away) naked. Kari gave us Crowne Royale bags to cover our manhood, and we stripped down in the bar. When we got outside she changed her mind and said we only had to run back and forth twice on the road in front of the bar. We did this while singing the Olaf fight song, and the sign was ours. We then got a ride home from some other townies (we had a sober driver this time).

Long run day. Pez, Doboul, Green, Rivers, and myself went 16 on the path from Sayner to St Germaine. I added on about another half mile during Chris' two poop stops. Felt great, no effects from my night of drinking the night before. The last mile we picked it up a bit because we were eager to be done. At night we went bowling, where I fluctuated between mediocre and very bad. The first game I rolled six first ball 0's, and ended with a 102 thanks to a 25 point 10th frame. The second game I was a little better with a 116. Team 2010 finished second both times.

Ran with Chris and Pez through Sayner and down by the golf course. Chris stopped at Mobil on the way back and took like a 10 minute long crap, and after this we sped up a bit. Talked about shoes, Gear West, and Run N Fun.
Just an easy 30 minutes and strides by myself. Cullen, Pez, and I went mini golfing - I lost in a playoff after making two really lucky putts during the round.

We did an 8 mile threshold through Sayner and on the path we ran on Monday. Our turn around just happened to be in front of KD's. It was supposed to go 7:00-6:45-6:30-6:15-6:00-6:00-sub 6:00- sub 6:00, but be got a little ambitious in the second mile and dropped all the way to 6:15. My actual splits for the first six miles were something like 7:08-6:15-6:18-6:04-5:58-6:06. The group pulled away from me around the five mile mark. At six miles I stopped to piss and then stood for like an extra minute, hoping to recover enough to run the last two miles hard. I was 5:53 on mile 7 and kept it up for another half mile before I hit another wall and just shut it down.

Shortly after lunch we discovered water in the basement of the cabin. This had happened before and usually meant a problem the septic system, so I called a septic worker to come look at it. He said the septic system was fine, and that the problem was with one of the tanks. He shut off all of the water to the cabin and gave me the name of a plumber to call. This plumber came a short while later and told me that a pipe in the neutralizing tank had burst and that was what was causing the flood. Thankfully it was not something caused by the team.

Short, slow run before cleaning the cabin and driving back to Northfield. I did a bonus half mile at the end to get to 45 minutes. I doubt we actually covered 6.5 miles, but it all evens out in the end. Drove back with stops at Stanley A&W and Chris' house in Andover.

***INTERVAL***
Warm-up: 
Set...Reps...Distance/Time...Goal...Actual...Rep rest...Set rest
1.........16.....400 Meters....80 sec....80-81....40 sec....3 min
2.........4.....1 min Meters....5K - 8K pace....____....1 min....____
Cool-down: 

Today was the annual 20x400 workout, and for the second year in a row I didn't finish. We ran on a 1K loop on the course that had a few small hills and the grass was a little long, so Coach Lundin figured it would be about 3 seconds slower than on a track. After the first couple I consistently hit 80-81 through number 14 but then a gorilla jumped on my back as I struggled to an 84 on #15 and an 86 on #16. Since I had been dropped by the group at this point Griff had me jog a few minutes to bring my heart rate down then do 4 1 minute runs @ race effort with 1 minute recovery. Pulse when I finished this was 183, so I was working pretty hard. The rest of the team looked good as six guys all finished together. Not being up there was a bit frustrating, but I'll bounce back.
Ran Iron Bridge with some of the guys, not too big of a turnout for this.  Wasn't real sore from the race but my shin hurt a bit.  The next few days are going to be really hot.

Ran to the Iron Bridge again and then Doboul and Cullen led us into the depths of the upper arb.  For a while I didn't quite know where we were.  Felt pretty good the whole way and it was nice being able to do basically the whole run on trails.

Ran on the course.  Legs felt fine after this morning's run but I am tired.  It was really hot out and after the run I couldn't stop sweating for a long time; it was gross.  We moved into our new locker room...disappointing.

Ran Iron Bridge for the third day in a row.  It was very humid.  Cullen, Seth, and I went to Fat Tim's house and woke everyone up; they had beer cans and liquor bottles all over their lawn.  I think their whole house hates us now.

Cross Campus with a little extension at the end.  We had some new freshmen come run with us, they seemed pretty cool.  We did the usual peeing on the stadium and screaming by the library, but there wasn't an audience so nobody hit the sign.  Lundin put us through another circuit afterward.
Morning run with Chris.  The weather was really nice and we ran through some Northfield neighborhoods.

Ran the Jefferson loop with Chris after everyone else turned off to go shorter.  Felt a bit tired, I need to get more sleep tonight.  Did a few strides while Chris was taking a dump in a port-a-potty.  After the run Lundin had us do more plyos and strength training.  I think this stuff will help quite a bit in the long run.

We did 15 minutes at race pace on the CC course.  Pez and I stuck together the whole way.  It felt like we were moving pretty well, but we didn't have any splits.  My legs felt a little heavy, but not any more than would be expected with the number of miles I've been putting in.

Ran Baby Arb with the entire team, wow we have a lot of people this year.  Then we had the 'Last Beer' in the basement of the Sin Bin.  Unfortunately no freshmen participated.  I found it ironic that we were doing this hours before half of the team got loaded, but oh well.  Pez, Schwock, and I ran on the course for awhile afterward.

Ran for 100 minutes at Big Woods State Park in Nerstrand.  It was a nice change of scenery, but the trails were full of rocks and roots.  We didn't know the paths so we hit a few dead ends, but we had plenty of time to figure things out.  I was impressed that some of the freshmen stayed up the entire time.  I was tired for about the first half hour (going to bed at 2 and waking up at 7:15 in not a recipe for success), but felt really good for the last hour +.  Lundin had some good comments about Thunder on the van ride there.
Ran Cornhole to Canada, coming back through the arb.  I was the only person that woke up for our '10 at 10.'  Spent the rest of the afternoon watching football.
Just getting the legs moving before the threshold this afternoon

Ran the 9 mile threshold.  Splits were 6:50, 6:30, 6:25, 5:38 (short), 5:38 (short), 5:40, 5:25, 5:28, 5:34.  Total time was 53:08.  Just before six miles Doboul started to pull away; I felt pretty good so I decided to go with and try to give him someone to run with for as long as possible, but on the seventh mile he surged again and I was stuck by myself.  Chris and Green caught me with a half mile to go and I stuck with them for basically the rest of the way.  In hindsight I should have been more patient, but I think I still ran pretty well.  Doboul ended up running his last mile in 4:49 and probably did his last 5K sub 16.  The team looked really good with 7 under 53:30.  On the cooldown my right knee locked up and I couldn't run without a limp so I just walked in.

The pain in my shin finally got to the point where I could not walk pain free, and to make matters worse my knee also hurt whenever I pushed off.  Looks like I'll be taking a few days off from running.  Did 50 minutes on the bike and some general strength circuits.
45 min bike, 15 min elliptical
Still not responding to the days off.  I'm seeing Dr. Koehler on Monday, probably going to get an x-ray.  45 min bike, 20 min elliptical today.  Felt like I was working hard.

AM: 35 min bike

PM: 60 min bike with eight 3 min pickups (2 min recovery)
50 min bike, 50 min elliptical
Took the day off, more for mental reasons than physical.

AM: 40 min bike (6 x 2 min hard, 2 min easy)

PM: 45 min bike, 15 min elliptical.  Got light headed and really hungry so I shut it down early.  Saw Dr. Koehler today and had an x-ray.  Don't know anything yet though.

I had my bone scan today and ended up getting really bad news.  I have two stress fractures on my left tibia - one in the middle of the bone and one by my ankle.  Not sure how long this will put me out, but I WILL run at conference in 6 1/2 weeks.

Didn't work out today.  Starting tomorrow I really get after it.

AM: 40 min pool.  Swam 1000 yards, aqua jogged for about 5 minutes, swam another 500 yards.

PM: 75 minute bike.  Brandon let me take his bike out on the roads, which was a lot more enjoyable than sitting inside Tostrud.
53 min on the bike...back inside.  Also did Waterloo and Pedestal.

70 min bike, 30 min elliptical.  Worked hard, heart rate got into the 170s.  I felt pretty good considering I started this at 7 AM after going to bed at midnight.  I brought my portable DVD player down and watched The Matrix Revolution, which made the time pass quicker.

54 min biking.  Waited too long to do this so I ended up finishing in the dark.

Olaf Invite was this morning.  It was a bit depressing not being able to race, especially since I think I could have made up the two points that separated us from UMD.  The team ran well though; Dobuol looked really strong getting the win, Cullen had his usual solid race, and Pez bounced back after last week.  The freshmen did well in their first 8K.  Did a little jogging to different spots during the race, my shin didn't bother me so that's a good sign.

Biked 65 min.  A dog chased me and tried to bite at my feet.  It took about 40 seconds of pedaling really hard to lose him; it was seriously terrifying.  Last 1/3 of the ride was into a pretty strong wind.

AM: 45 min pool.  Swam 1775 yards (just over 1 mile).  It was five swimmers and myself in the pool this morning.  They made me look uncoordinated and slow.  Took a short break after 1200 yards and aquajogged for a few minutes, but this was more of a break from the boredom than an actual rest break.

PM: 85 min bike.  Ended up picking a crappy route and had to ride back into a bad headwind.  I was pretty dehydrated when I finished.  What a day.

AM: 40 min elliptical.  I overslept a little bit and missed the start of practice, but still got done in plenty of time before my 8:30 meeting.  Heart rate was 145-150 the whole time.

PM: 15 min bike before running

Ran the cross country course.  Felt awesome to be back out there, didn't really feel any shin pain.  It got sore again at night, but not a ton more than usual.  It didn't help that after the Brewers game I basically sprinted back to Ytterboe from the Science Center and jumped around a good bit.

Ran the warmup with the team and then added on a little bit to get to 25 minutes.  Felt alright, a little sore (not the shin) but nothing too bad.  Did a 3 minute pickup and a 1 minute pickup at the end.

5 min on the bike before running

After running I went out for a 50 min ride.  I went pretty hard with eight 2 minute pickups, a 5 minute pickup, and a 1 minute sprint (2 min rest between everything).  Afterwards we did a pushup contest - I did 32.

AM - 40 min elliptical.  HR in the 140s the whole time.

PM - 10 min bike before run, 10 min after run

Ran on the course.  Felt good, thought about the Brewers making the playoffs for most of the run.  I really hope this happens.  Did six strides afterward, felt weird but didn't hurt.  Then Lundin had us do Waterloo and Bataan 30s on/30s off.

100 minute bike ride on some random country roads.  Wasn't in a very good mood when I started; didn't get a whole lot better while I was out there, especially riding back into a 20 mph headwind.  I hope I don't have to do this again (next week I'm hopefully going to try to do a long run).
Ran around at the Griak meet.  Did a 30-35 minute run and also sprinted to various places on the course.  Greeno had a really impressive win, and Hamline looks tough.
First time I've run an hour in 3 weeks.  Felt pretty good, it was great running weather.  Shin is a little sore now after spending the afternoon at a water park.  THE BREWERS MADE THE PLAYOFFS!!!
40 min elliptical

Ran a little over an hour on the course, then did six strides on the indoor track.  The strides felt really good.  The women's team was doing intervals on the course so I saw them a few times.  I hope Coach lets me do the workout tomorrow.

10 min biking before run

Did the workout with the team today - it was good to be back.  The workout wasn't designed to be really hard, and I felt pretty good the whole time.  Aerobically I don't think I've lost much, my legs just need to come around.  I ran with BTW and Adrian.
32 min bike, 2 mile run on the upstairs track
15 min bike, 35 min elliptical.  HR 150-155 during the elliptical portion.

Felt like crap today.  I ran with Dobuol for 30 min, then he went in since he's racing tomorrow.  I intended to do another half hour, but I was incredibly tired so I called it a day after 50 min.  This morning was the Press Box Breakfast; Lundin loved it.

This was a good solid workout.  I was shooting for tempo pace on the 2Ks and 8K pace on the 400s.  The first 2K I was 5 seconds slow, but 4 of those seconds were in the first 400.  Felt fairly relaxed.  The 400s were harder than I thought they would be, most likely just because I was not used to the pace.  I did manage to hit 75 on the last two without any extra effort.  The last 2K felt really good.  It adds up to 8000 meters in around 27:10; not bad considering how little running I've done in the past month, but I need to get much faster in the next two weeks.

The team ran really well at Colfax.  The conditions were perfect and the course is fast as it is, so times were crazy.  We lost to UST by 3 points; frustrating again because I know I could have made that up if I was healthy and fit.  Still, 3 guys under 26:00 and 6 under 27:00 is faster than Olaf has had in a long time.

10 min elliptical before run

Ran 75 min on the treadmill at home.  I felt strong and my shin didn't hurt, two good signs.  I was watching the Penn State v. Purdue football game and during commercials I would mess around with my speed to make it a little harder.  Then my dad and I went to Game 3 of the Brewers/Phillies series - it was one of the most electric sporting events I've ever been at.

Did a 'triathlon' of sorts down at Tostrud.  Didn't get down there until about 8:30 after driving back to campus and then sitting around for a while.  I did 30 min on the bike, 30 min on the elliptical, and then ran 2 miles.  Changing from one thing to another broke up the monotony and I got a pretty good workout in.
40 min biking

The plan was a 20 min tempo and then a fast mile, but that didn't happen.  I felt terrible on the tempo, my breathing never got into a rhythm.  I was 5:48 for the first mile and 11:36 at two, then 15 minutes in I shut it down.  I took a short rest then ran 3 x 1000 just shooting for a faster pace than the tempo.  The first and third were the fifth K of the course which has a hill but was mostly with the wind; the second one was the fourth K which is flat but was mostly into the wind.  Felt a little better.  Then I did six long strides and cooled down.  Overall I was just really tired today...I think that's because this was my third workout in 24 hours and I didn't get much sleep last night.  My shin also got a bit sore, hopefully that doesn't happen tomorrow.
40 min bike.  Pretty boring.
Ran on the course for 50 min.  It rained all day so the course was soaked and there were puddles everywhere.  Saw Corey Barwick's mom and sister - that was a little awkward.

Did another workout on the course.  I felt pretty bad all afternoon and on the warmup, but the workout actually went fairly well.  I ran with Schwock, BTW, Adrian, and Anders.  Schwock pounded us all pretty good but BTW, Anders, and I stuck together for the most part.  My shin didn't hurt at all during the intervals and was only slightly sore after the cooldown.  I feel like I have the aerobic fitness, just need to add the gears to get ready to race.  I'll be ready.

10 min biking before run

Ran Iron Bridge with some of the guys.  Felt ok, my shin is sore but I don't have time for any more time off.  I'm gonna tough it out and hope it goes away with icing and rehab.  At this point it's more discomfort than actual pain anyways.  And I need to get in there and help the team.
Did a short run on the course before meeting Mike Stumpf.  I did six 30-40 second pickups during the run, then 4 strides on the indoor track afterward.  Felt ok, less soreness than yesterday.

63 min elliptical.  I worked pretty hard (HR well into the 150s).  Got to watch football during it so that made the time pass pretty quickly.  Had intentions of doing another half hour in the afternoon, but that didn't happen.  Oh well.

Ran 12 miles on the treadmill.  Not the most exciting thing in the world, but I only want to pay an entry fee at High Cliff once this week, and I'm saving that for a workout.  Thus, the 'long' run had to be done inside.  HR was 165 at the end.
Ran to Hoover Park and ran around there for a while.  Did 8 strides after about 40 minutes.  Felt pretty good, no pain.
This was the first time I ran twice in a day in 5 weeks.  Did an easy five miles on the treadmill and felt pretty good.

Morning: 20 min elliptical + Pedestal

The afternoon workout went well.  I went out to High Cliff to run on trails, and it was really nice.  Aerobically I felt strong the whole way - the tempo was much easier than last week and the shorter stuff felt more under control.  No pain during the run or immediately afterward, but after the drive home I was sore.  That went away after icing.  Not sure what I'm gonna do about the race this weekend - I want to run but I'm not totally sure if I should.
40 min elliptical
45 min bike

Ran in the arb for a little while, then Chris, Burseth, and I added on on the course.  Started getting tired toward the end but I could still talk without too much difficulty.  No pain during run and very minimal pain after run.

I'm trying something a little different today - I did my regular pre-meet run and strides in the morning and then did another short shakeout in the afternoon.  It's a way to get extra miles in, since any extra fitness I can gain in the next two weeks is key, and I don't think two short jogs will affect my ability to run a tempo and a couple of hard miles tomorrow.  The pre-meet went well, did it by myself on the course in a light rain.  Felt good during strides.

Sang to the football team and then jogged around the course for 25 minutes.  After stretching I spent too much time putting spikes in my shoes and started getting sore, but once I got ice I was fine.  Tomorrow I'll need to keep moving after the race.  I'm excited to get out there, it's been a long time.
Shin was sore.  It wasn't localized pain like before, but it was uncomfortable so I shut it down.

Chris and I did a different workout than the rest of the team since we had to stay on the course.  Ours ended up being more difficult, and we ran it very hard.  This was the first time besides the late August 20x400 that I've done an anaerobic workout since track season and it felt really strange.  The first 3 sets went fine, but I had no speed for the final 30 second intervals.  At the end I was spent.  This is what I need though to be able to race well in 12 days.

45 min bike, 30 min elliptical

Went to practice with intentions of running, but never got outside.  While warming up on a bike I figured that today or Thursday would need to be a day off of running (I can only run 4-5 days in a row), and since I wasn't terribly motivated to run today I just cross trained.  Now I should be able to run the rest of the week.

This was a bittersweet workout, I felt really strong aerobically but my shin hurt like hell.  I stuck up with Cullen, Pez, and Schwock for the intervals that I ran but had to cut out early (the others did 2 more 3 minute surges, then 6 30 second surges).  Guess I'll cross train tomorrow and hopefully be able to run Friday and Saturday.
50 min bike ride.  Really windy outside, but I enjoyed it.
50 min of aqua jogging with Krahulec.  The time passed fairly quickly since we had a conversation going the whole time.  Afterward we had a shower beverage.

2 campus hill loops, then 6 100 meter strides on grass.  This was pretty easy, the only semi-challenging parts were Thorson and Old Main on the second loop.  On the first loop we ponded Paul.  Shin felt ok during the run, was a little sore both during strides and after I finished.

12 mile run in the arb.  I drove to Carleton so I wouldn't have to run on the road at all.  Felt awesome aerobically.  The first 30 seconds were painful, then I could feel it again for a few minutes around an hour, but other than that the shin felt fine.  After I drove back to Olaf I was sore.

30 min bike, 30 min aqua jog

Put in a half hour on the bike, then went in the pool with Green, Kurczek, and Cullen.  It was a pretty easy day.  It snowed all afternoon - not cool.

AM - 35 min bike

PM - 45 min bike, 20 min elliptical

Ran on the course by myself.  I did 4 1000s that were supposed to be at AT pace; I ran them slow and felt awful doing them.  My shin wasn't bothering me, I just felt like I had nothing to give.  Chalk it up as a bad day and forget about it.

Last tuneup workout before conference.  We did a 4 minute surge, took 90 seconds rest, then did a 3 minute surge.  The surges felt harder than they should have, I need to make sure I get my rest these next few days so I'm ready to go on Saturday.  I could feel my shin every step of the way.

55 minute bike ride then 10 minute run.  It was a beautiful day, so the bike was fun.  I kept it relaxed, just wanted to get something in without beating up my legs.  Had to ride back into a headwind.  The run felt pretty bad.
Pre-meet run and strides on the course.  My shin didn't feel great, but I need to forget about it and just suck it up and race.  Aerobically I feel good, so it'll be interesting.

40 min bike, 30 min aqua jog

I got blitzed last night so I felt pretty bad physically for a large portion of the day.  About halfway through my bike ride my hangover finally broke and I felt decent.  Thought about the race...I still haven't come down from the high.  The aqua jogging was fun, a good way to relax and work out the junk in the legs.

2.5 mile warmup

3 mile tempo (5:33, 5:47, 5:21, 16:41 total)

3 mile cooldown

I went with the team on a Monday for the first time in 8 weeks.  We did a three mile tempo on miles 6-8 of the 11 mile course.  I felt pretty relaxed the whole time.  Shin got a little sore on the cooldown so I hopped in Griff's car rather than jogging 2.5 more miles.  Did 10 minutes of biking when I got back.
37 min bike

56 min bike.  Did basically the same route as the past two Thursdays, although I had to take the long way around the elementary school.  Afterward we had Green Monster.  The upperclassmen won 7-3, and Rivers and I hit the first home runs in team 2010's career.  Boom outta here.
30 min bike.  Really tired this morning.

This was a good workout for me.  I felt strong aerobically, and my shin didn't bother me a ton on the intervals.  The warmup was painful, but I decided to try it anyway, and sure enough the intervals were fine.  I did cut out a little early to make sure I didn't do anything dumb.  Schwock, Pez, BTW, and I stuck together for everything and all felt pretty relaxed.

10 min bike before run

Ran on the course for 40 minutes, then ran around at Karhu for a bit.  The guys looked awesome going 1-3-4-5-6.
31 min bike.  Daymont came over and talked to me for a while.

2 campus hill loops.  Not sure how much I like this workout, but I'm sure it's beneficial.  It was snowing while we ran, that was quite the change from the 70 degree weather we had at the beginning of the week.  Finished it up with 6 100 meter strides on the indoor track.  Felt fast.

'Long' run in the arb.  Felt pretty good, a little tired from lack of sleep but ok.  Some of the paths were a bit muddy.  Unfortunately this will probably be the last time I get to do this length of run for quite a while.  This afternoon I got a pair of Matumbos.
45 min bike.  Pool was closed, so we didn't get to do the usual Sunday aqua jog.  I hate the Vikings.

5 x 3 min @ threshold pace (1 min int) on the CC course.  I fell asleep and didn't wake up until just after 3:30, so I was late to practice; Phil and Griff gave me a pretty hard time about this.  Felt pretty good, could feel my shin like always but I'll be ok.

Ran on the course with Pez, Perk, and Anders.  It was really cold and at the start of the run it was sleeting.  Everyone else ran upstairs but I didn't want to do my entire run on that track so I went outside.
30 min bike.  Not much motivation to do this.

Last tuneup workout before the race.  Felt pretty good, my shin hurt but I'm used to that.  The course was sloppy from the snow last night, but surprisingly 35 degrees didn't feel all that cold.  Finished with a couple laps upstairs and talking about indoor track.
52 min bike, 10 min run on the upstairs track.  There was some awkwardness during the biking.
Ran the regions course and did strides.  It was raining and the course is not in very good shape.  Nonetheless, everyone races on the same course in the same conditions, so we can't worry about it.

30 min biking, 30 min aqua jog

IT'S OFFICIAL, WE'RE IN!!!
35 min bike.  Last double of the season.

Ran in the Arb - Pez, Tumnus, Schwock and I went a little further than the others.  The first half of the run was 'make fun of Pez' time, which was amusing.  It was 30 degrees out, I am going to have a rough readjustment after I finish my time off.

Last 'workout' of the season.  Did it on the course with Rivers and Schwock.  The first minute of each interval was supposed to be a little fast to simulate the start of the race, then we settled in to pace.  I didn't feel very good today and fell behind on most of the intervals.  Not worried about it though.

I did a bonus mile and a half inside before practice to try to help my shin get warmed up before the workout, but I think all it ended up doing was making me tired.

Short Arb loop with some of the crew plus Zombo, Frankie, and Tumnus.  Had some weird conversations.  This could have been my last run in the Arb until spring - I hope not.  We leave tomorrow for Hanover, I'm so jacked.
40 min bike then ran a little over a mile before we left for the airport.  I was tired after only getting 5.5 hours of sleep.

Ran the course.  It doesn't look very challenging, I found it funny when the Point guys said it was the hardest course of their season.  With a bunch of loops it should be nice for the fans.  There were a lot of teams there and the meet really does feel like a big deal.  After the run we got our free stuff.
Day #1 of the off season.  Traveled back from Hanover.
Day #2 of the off season.  I think I'll take five days off then decide if I want to start cross training.
Day #3 of the off season.  Drove home for Thanksgiving break.
Day #4 of the off season.  I'm getting fat.
Day #5 of the off season.  Ate a gross amount of food at Thanksgiving dinner.  The 'week of fat' victory will be mine.
Day #6 of the off season.  Was going to work out today but instead I moved stuff around in our storage locker and saw Quantum of Solace.  Maybe I'll do something tomorrow.

35 min elliptical then pedestal and some other general strength stuff.  I felt fat and out of shape - probably what I should expect with my lifestyle of the past week.  The AE CC Alumni Turkey Trot was this afternoon; a 50 year old guy won (7 participants, the youngest of which graduated in 2001).  Maybe next year I'll just pound everybody here.

Last day off for a while.  While driving back I hit a traffic jam around Hudson and it took almost an hour to go 25 miles.  It was also snowing for a good bit of the drive.  The Packers are killing me.
60 min bike.  Worked hard, and didn't get too bored until the last 10 minutes.  Also did Waterloo and Pedestal.

65 min elliptical.  Listened to Jim Rome rant about Plaxico Burress.  Got my heart rate up around 160 for a while so it was a good workout.  Afterward I did pushups, dips, curls, and a bunch of abs.  Letich and I went to the Gophers v. Virginia basketball game - it was fun.

45 min bike, 30 min elliptical.  Didn't plan on going this long, but after an hour I figured I might as well since I wasn't bored out of my mind yet.  The women's team was doing some type of interval workout on the treadmills.  No motivation to do abs today so I only made it halfway through Pillar and then stopped.

60 min bike.  Read Game of Shadows.  A girl was on the bike next to me talking on her cell phone the entire time.  Not sure how you can get a workout doing that, or who would want to listen to someone for that long.  Lots of miscellaneous general strength afterward.
45 min elliptical.  Had to do it a little early so I could go to Christmas Fest.

I opted out of the ABR figuring that a 10+ mile run would be stupid with my injury, plus I'm not 21, so I did a 95 minute workout instead.  65 min bike, 30 min elliptical.  Watched The Empire Strikes Back.  A guy that must have been 70 came over and asked if that was 'my stimulation for the day' and wondered why I was going to exercise for so long.  I explained why, but I'm not sure he understood.  I actually felt pretty good the whole time, but was glad to be done.  Immediately rushed back to Ytterboe to watch Florida v. Alabama.

40 min bike.  Had no motivation to work out today and eventually forced myself down to Tostrud at 9 PM.  The first 10 minutes I was extremely tired but I eventually warmed up.  Also did pushups, dips, curls, and abs.
70 min bike.  This went pretty fast since Kurczek and Krahulec were each next to me for a while.  Felt a ton better than yesterday.  Did Pedestal and some of Waterloo.

60 min elliptical, 15 min bike.  After a warmup I did 7 x 2:10 hard / 2:10 easy.  The fast segments were about 200 strides per minute with increased resistance.  It got my heart rate up and I think did a decent job of simulating the 800s the other distance guys were doing on the track.  I need to get more sleep, but that will probably be impossible until next week.  Might try running on Saturday.
55 min bike.  Did it early so I could help run the pentathlon for the sprinters.

45 min bike, 20 min elliptical.  Today was reading day, and I didn't get as much done as I would have liked.  We did manage to have an epic banana fight during the late night breakfast.  Felt tired during the workout.
36 min elliptical.  I squeezed this in between studying and an economics review session.  As good as I felt though I wished I could have gone longer.
65 min bike at 7:15 PM on a Saturday evening...wow I'm awesome.  Watched Coach Carter on my portable DVD player.
50 min bike, 15 min elliptical.  Got really bored today.  I'm sick of cross training and sick of school - basically sick of life in general right now.

Tostrud has reduced hours now so it closed at 6.  I didn't make it down to workout before dinner because of a final, so I got screwed out of a workout today.  I did 20 minutes of continuous calisthenics in my room before just saying, 'screw it,' and calling it a day.  I'm pissed.

First day back!  Ran 2.5 on the upstairs track with some of the guys.  Leg felt as good as new.  Now I just have to build up smartly so I don't have a recurrence.  Now that finals are over the next few weeks will be a nice chance to relax and focus on training.
60 min bike (30 before run, 30 after)
70 min elliptical after driving back to Appleton.  Felt good and the time went really fast - the ability to watch TV makes a big difference.  Then I ate a whole pizza.
Ran on the treadmill, once again mostly pain free.  My parents freaked out afterward.

AM: 35 min elliptical
PM: 40 min elliptical (20 before run, 20 after)
73 min elliptical

102 min elliptical.  Felt good the whole time, did it during the second half of the Colorado State v. Fresno State game.  My break has been the least exciting of anyone's - all I do is workout, watch TV, sleep, and eat.

66 min elliptical.  I've spent more time on the elliptical in the past 5 days than ever before.  It'd be nice to have a stationary bike, or even nicer if I could just go for a run.  I'm seeing a doctor tomorrow so we'll see what he says about that.  The wind chill here was -26 today.

70 min elliptical during the Packer game.  Sorry Chris, that's why I missed both your calls.  I'm glad the NFL season ends next week - this weekly losing on the opponent's last possession is getting really old.  I saw a Dr. Mejia today - he said that I do need more time before I can get back to full time running.  Fuck.

AM: 35 min elliptical
PM: 50 min elliptical + 25 min run

Nothing exciting happened today.
80 min elliptical.  Watched The Muppets Christmas Carol in honor of Christmas Eve.  Classic movie.  The workout got a bit long towards the end.

30 min run, break, 52 min elliptical.  The plan was to do this as a double, but I woke up late and then we started with presents and lunch, so I did everything in the afternoon.  Did the first half hour, took about an hour break, then did the second part during the Lakers/Celtics game.  Felt really strong and did some simulated strides.

1:30 PM: 70 min elliptical
9:00 PM: 35 min run on treadmill

Watched the movie Wanted, which made the time pass really fast.  It was 35 degrees outside which would have been really nice for running; that was a little depressing.

105 min elliptical.  The first 90 minutes went fairly fast but by the end this was definitely getting long.  I feel like I'm keeping most of my aerobic fitness, so when I start up again for real I should be fine.  I just want to run...

52 min elliptical bright and early in the morning before leaving for the Packer game.  I kept it really easy because my legs were sore and I was tired from lack of sleep.  It's weird that I did a workout twice as long as this yesterday but this one felt longer.  The Packer game was awesome - congrats on the 0-16 Detroit!
Also did 38 min elliptical.  The majority of this week's running was done in secret from my parents.
Ran in the morning and then did 70 min elliptical in the afternoon
Ran on the treadmill then did a half hour on the elliptical.  Watched the Badgers beat up on Michigan.

Easy run, wasn't doing anything so I figured I might as well get a few extra miles in.

Overall 2008 was a pretty good year for me running wise.  The top moment was definitely coming back from my stress fracture to run an amazing race and help the team win the MIAC cross country meet; the nationals trip and my 10K at outdoor conference would be next.  I also had two separate blocks of strong training (January, August) where my confidence was sky high.  As for low points, I had a serious injury that cost me the cross country regular season as well as any real training in December, and I was embarrassed in the indoor conference 5K.
Ran on the treadmill while watching the college bowl games. Spent basically the entire day watching TV.
Did another run at about 11 PM after the rest of my family went to bed

Did this at midnight because I procrastinated all day. We took our Christmas tree down and to the storage locker in the morning, then I was going to work out before going to see my grandpa at 3 but that didn't happen, then I was going to do it before dinner but we ate early, then I was thinking maybe an 8 PM workout but Marie wanted to hang out. Didn't want to take the day off so I ran after she left.
Boring. Can't wait to get back to school, maybe even run outside.

The roads were extremely icy so I couldn't leave Appleton at 9:30. Thus, I didn't get back to Olaf until 6:30 and was unable to watch the Vikings lose. Oh well. Managed to get a run in during the evening down at Tostrud. Interim starts tomorrow!
Just an easy shakeout run before class. Ready to really start getting after it.

Ran on the upstairs track. Ran with the mid d guys for 2 miles, then by myself for about a mile and a half, then the rest with Chris. Talked about our injuries and how it's time to get back at it. Felt great. Then did Pillar and Waterloo and could tell that I hadn't done any General Strength over break.

Ran 10 miles on the upstairs track. Started off with some other guys but ended up doing the most of it solo after they left to go do 200s. My legs were sore but I didn't have any shin pain. Aerobically I felt fine. I think it'll take about two weeks to get back into the swing of things, but by February I should be ready to race fast. Did a dumbbell circuit and probably won't be able to walk tomorrow.

Morning run with Green and Dobuol. They were both late so I had a mile and a half done when they showed up. The first couple laps were very slow but the run gradually picked up. Afterward we went to the caf and got breakfast burritos.

Ran outside for the first time since nationals. Rivers, Tumnus, and I ran Bryce Wandrey to Woodley then some bonus laps inside. It was below zero with the windchill and the way back definitely felt cold. It was a lot better than the upstairs track or the treadmill though. Finished off with four strides; Lundin made a comment during each one. My quads and hamstrings are extremely sore both from the mileage and from doing squats and lunges yesterday. Walking up and down stairs hurts.

Ran Cornhole to Canada with Chris. The roads were terrible, it was so icy we should have been wearing skates instead of shoes. Won't be running this route again for a while. We saw the Carleton team - they all run outside unlike our team. Chris got more and more angry as the run progressed. Did a mile inside when we got back.
Was still tired when my alarm went off at 7:45 so I went back to sleep for an hour and ran by myself later. Felt fine.

Ran cross campus with Mike M then added on in the neighborhoods after he went back. It was a pretty nice day outside for January; unfortunately everybody else chose to run inside. I figured I want to run outside now since next week it's going to be below 0. I'm on pace for a 75-80 mile week, which is more than I had intended on but everything feels good so I'll just go with it.

Ran Bryce Wandrey to Woodley with BTW, Green, Schwock, Tumnus, and Jenna. After a long night of drinking nobody felt like pushing the pace at all. It was 0 degrees but since there was no wind it didn't feel cold. Did four strides in Skoglund afterward.

Ran 10 outside with Chris (Jefferson loop) then 3 inside. I wanted to watch both football games this afternoon so we didn't end up running until 7:45 PM. It was dark but not real icy, and we only encountered a few cars. I felt good but Chris did not due to the festivities of last night. This was my longest run since September 6th.

Ran two miles with Chris and Burseth then the last three with Dobuol. Felt alright, a little tired from lack of sleep but no other problems. I woke up at first and was going to go back to sleep but then someone knocked on my door so I decided to just get up. I was glad I did. Ate a big breakfast afterward.

It snowed hard all afternoon so we were stuck running inside. Felt pretty good for the first seven miles but then got a bit tired because people were one stepping. I slowed down and was fine. Then I went in the ice bath and got really light headed after 4 1/2 minutes - not sure what the problem was today.

Ran 7 miles on the upstairs track then did 8x200m strides with Nussbaum with a 200m jog in between each one. The first 7 200s were in 36 then the last one was 34. These didn't feel hard aerobically but I felt like I'm missing several gears. Finished up with a mile and a half cool down. It was -18 degrees this morning and didn't get above -10 all day.

Still way below 0 so I ran another 10 on the upstairs track. Got to watch Dobuol and Green do some 62 second 400s, that was quite impressive. Tumnus and I ended up picking it up the last mile and a half to two miles. Finished with Pedestal and Bataan.

Ran solo on the upstairs track. Daymont was down there walking with three other people and every time I lapped them I'd almost run into the wall because they were taking up the entire track. Felt great, got into a nice rhythm for the last half of the run.

Was only planning to do 5 or 6 but ended up going 7 since I felt good. Didn't get down to practice until late because I went to the math colloquium (gotta get some brownie points), so I ended up running the first part with Tumnus then finishing alone. Did four strides during the last mile. Also did Pillar, push ups, and dips. Solid day.
Easy morning run by myself. Was going to run again in the afternoon but didn't finish my take home test until 5:00 and was too lazy to run after that.
Ran by myself since I overslept the start of practice. Felt ok, tired from going to bed at 2 AM.

Ran an easy 6 on the upstairs track. Krahulec ran with me for the first half. I got the Big O tattoo this afternoon and then went to Bethel to watch the last part of the meet. 

Quotes of the meet:

'I got here right at the start of the women's 3k.'
'Well you didn't miss anything in the men's 3k!'
-Paul to me after I showed up

'Paul, you might need to time your team with an hourglass.'
-Thunder to Paul within the first 100 meters in the 4x4 (Paul was timing the B team)

Ran about 100 minutes. Felt ok for the most part, about halfway through my left arch started to hurt but that went away after 10-15 minutes. The snow made it hard to get into a rhythm. I ran an extended Jefferson loop with cross campus at both the beginning and end. Then I drank Endurox and proceeded to sit in a chair for 2.5 hours watching football. When I got to the caf I was shaking because I was so hungry...in the future I'll need to make sure I eat more on long run days.

Ran the Jefferson loop again with Adrian. It was a really nice day outside. Tumnus turned off at the high school to poop; I thought I would just continue back to Olaf but I made it about three more blocks before I had to stop. Felt much better after this. Finished up with 8 strides on the indoor track, gotta get back the limited leg speed I used to have.
Ran a quick six on the upstairs track by myself. I was hitting about 6:15 pace for most of this. I was surprised I felt so good after only getting 6 hours of sleep each of the past two nights.

Bryce Wandrey to Woodley. Cullen and I pulled away from everyone else, which was strange since we were probably barely running under 7:00 pace. I felt good again and the run went by fast since we were talking the entire time.
I was pressed for time so I had to cut the run short.

Cornhole to Canada with Adrian. It was a lot better than the last time I did this run, but Canada Ave was all full of packed down snow. The wind coming back on 19 was noticeable but not terrible. I felt pretty tired, probably because I've done 87 miles in the past 7 days (and one of those days was a 5 miler). That was pretty dumb, but there's nothing I can do about it now.

Ran a slightly extended version of the Jefferson loop. Everyone except Schwock and I only did cross campus, and then he turned off on Woodley so I ran the last 5 miles by myself. It was a great day to run outside and I felt strong, so the run was awesome. Finished off with 8 strides on the indoor track.

Was planning on running twice today but I got terrible sleep last night so I didn't get out of bed when my alarm went off. Ran a little over an hour on the upstairs track in the afternoon - the guys racing were only doing 3-5 miles so I ran the last bit by myself. Felt alright, got better as the run went on.

Ran easy on the upstairs track during the meet. Kept it really relaxed and felt good. The meet was fun to watch and made me eager to get back to racing. Most of our guys ran pretty well - Cullen soloed a 1:57, Dobuol and Green ran ok times in the 1000, Perk had a nice mile, and Tumnus ran a lot better than last week. The 3K was disgusting, Gleason went out and ran consistent 34s like clockwork, but Gamble stuck and eventually ran the last 400 in 61 for the win in 8:25. Wow. I wish I would have gotten a double in one of these past three days, but I suppose the little 'break' will help.

Long run with Nussbaum and Adrian. We did Cornhole to Canada to Jefferson, then 10 minutes inside. It was below 0, but I was dressed warm enough. My face and left hand got a bit cold but other than that I was fine. For the first half of the run my stomach felt bad because I ate lunch too close to the run, but for about the last six miles I got into a good rhythm. It was really nice to have companions on this run - I definitely would have cut it short without those guys there.
Ran a very slow 4.5 before class. My legs were heavy from the long run yesterday.

Didn't want to go outside so I ran upstairs. Ran with the mid d guys while they warmed up for their workout then finished by myself. Fairly uneventful run. Still tired, need to get to bed earlier tonight. Also did strides.

I was really tired this morning so I didn't double. Tomorrow I will make myself get out of bed. Keegan tagged along with us in the afternoon and when everyone else turned off to just do cross campus it was just me and him. He kept up and when I suggested he join the team since he's running everyday anyway he said he might at some point in the future. Whatever... Felt better at the end of the run than at the beginning, just need to make it to the end of the week and then over break I can make up for the sleep I've missed.

21 min tempo, 3 min rest, 7 min tempo

Finally got around to doing my first workout since CC nationals. I did it on the upstairs track in the morning so I wouldn't have to go around so many people. Felt strong and could have kept going if I needed to. I didn't take any splits but it felt like I was moving well. HR at the finish was 156, I recovered quickly. Hopefully this means I'm in decent shape.

Ran cross campus with Letich then did strides and another mile inside. Felt great on the run, legs were a little heavy during strides (that's what happens when you do a workout in the morning). Good day.

I woke up at 3:30 and debated for a few minutes whether or not I wanted to go to practice, and I decided I should just go. Ran a couple miles with the guys but they were done early since they were just doing a pre-meet run, so I continued on by myself. Felt alright, very tired, but that's what you get when you stay up until 4 AM.

***INTERVAL***
Warm-up: 
Set...Reps...Distance/Time...Goal...Actual...Rep rest...Set rest
1.........12.....400 Meters....____....75 average....1:00....____
Cool-down: 

Ran my first track workout since the end of cross country before the meet. It was a shock to the system, especially since I started too fast. I wanted to start at about 76 and work down from there, but I ran the first two in 73. After that I ran 75s with maybe 2 76s thrown in there. The pace felt harder than it should have, not surprising though considering it was my first time on the track, I've slept 11 hours total in the past two nights, and I barely ate anything all day. The meet was disappointing for the most part - Cullen ran a really good 1000 and Tumnus had a nice kick in the mile, but nobody else on the distance squad ran outstanding.
Ran Bryce Wandrey to Woodley before I left to drive back to Appleton. Pretty uneventful run, didn't really want to do it but glad I did.
It was a great day for a run - 35 degrees. I ran to Jefferson school then to College Ave and came back on East South River. Felt good. Got honked at by some girls that I didn't recognize.

I woke up feeling sick so I decided to scrap my plan for the day and just did an easy run on the treadmill this evening. I'd rather lose one day now and shake this thing than have it slow me down for over a week as has happened to me several times before. Pretty pathetic past seven days of training, hopefully I can kick it up a notch.

Did a 20 min tempo, 3 min rest, 9 min tempo. The sidewalks were full of snow and ice and the roads were full of cars, so wherever I ran was a big clusterf*ck. Plus it was about 5 degrees out and really windy. I went through the first mile just over 5:40, then didn't have any other splits. I'd like to think I maintained pace but I probably slowed down a little. It was a good effort though and that's the real point of these. Felt alright, the elements bothered me but aerobically I was fine. The first minute of the second segment was a little rough. Finished with 5 long strides and a short cool down.
Easy shakeout run on the treadmill.

Did an extended Xavier. I got into a really nice rhythm until the last mile when I was almost brought to my knees by a tremendous urge to poop. I somehow managed to make it home just in time. I'm also still a little sick, hopefully tomorrow I'll be closer to 100%.

Felt pretty bad today so I took it easy. I ran Memorial to Seymour to Walden. This afternoon I saw Wicked at the PAC - it was really good. By 6 PM I had barely had anything to eat all day so I started pounding everything I could find.

***INTERVAL***
Warm-up: 
Set...Reps...Distance/Time...Goal...Actual...Rep rest...Set rest
1.........5.....3 Minutes....5K effort....Good....2:00....____
Cool-down: 

I had been planning on doing a morning run, but that didn't happen. Ran this workout on a section of the Newberry trail. It was a little hilly so my pace was probably a little slow but the effort felt like a 5K. Felt strong and could have done a few more repeats if I had needed to. Finished off with 6 100 meter strides and a cool down. Then I went to Madison for the night.

After a late night and early morning in Madison I didn't think I would be up to doing a long run, but I ended up feeling really good. I met up with Adrian (coincidentally) and he ran with me for about 6 miles, then I finished up alone. Ran to Xavier and back with several add ons. Had to stop at the Y to clean out my system. It was 40 degrees out and running in shorts felt amazing. We got honked at more times than I ever have before in one run.

Ran Cornhole to Woodley after I got back to Olaf. Felt awesome again and was probably running around 6:10 pace for a lot of this. The weather was awesome once again. The warm temperatures melted most of the snow on the dirt roads which was really nice. Trying to walk up the hill by Old Main I started sliding backwards because of the ice - this was the first time I've ever had that happen. Did abs afterward with Burseth on the indoor track.
Easy morning run on the upstairs track. Wasn't very excited to get out of bed but I felt fine when I started running. First day of second semester.

Ran Lando's Mom with a big group. I wasn't planning on going more than 8 but I missed the turn off so I ended up running the whole thing. We were going slow so I'm fine with it. This route includes the biggest freaking hill I've ever run up and right after we did that we had to run into the wind for a mile. It was warm enough again for shorts. Did four strides after the run and then Pillar and pushups. I need to figure out my eating on MWF because going with no lunch all semester won't go well.

***INTERVAL***
Warm-up: 
Set...Reps...Distance/Time...Goal...Actual...Rep rest...Set rest
1.........1.....1000 Meters....____....3:07....400m jog....____
2.........2.....800 Meters....____....2:27, 2:26....300m jog....____
3.........6.....400 Meters....____....71, 71, 72, 71, 70, 69....200m jog....____
Cool-down: 

This was a pretty good workout. My legs were tired (not surprisingly considering my last few days) but aerobically I felt strong. When I put spikes on and get in a race situation I'll be fine. I would have liked to be faster on the 1000 but the 3:07 felt really easy. The 400s weren't aerobically taxing at all but my legs would get tired in the last 100. Just need to add a few extra gears. Schwock and I ran together the whole way. He is really fit right now. The 3K this weekend will be fun.

Easy shakeout run on the upstairs track. I did my second run at night instead of in the morning so I could be more fresh for the workout, especially after 16 miles yesterday. I was a bit tight when I started but after about a mile I felt fine. Did four easy barefoot strides at the end.

Ran the Jefferson Loop with Rivers. Letich and Debbie were with us until Woodley. My legs were really tired from my past few days, but we had a good conversation going the whole way. After several 'warm' days in a row the sidewalks are all clear. Too tired to do much general strength today.
After lying in bed for awhile finally got two feet on the floor and got this done. Felt alright.

This was a pretty fun workout.  Griff drove me, Nussbaum, Rivers, and Adrian seven miles away from campus and had us run back so we could run on dirt roads with the wind.  Aerobically I felt really good during the intervals but my legs were very tired.  We got a good effort in.  During our first interval a dog came after us and tried to kill us, but we luckily managed to escape.  Then on the cooldown we were running through a spot on the course that Griff said was fine, but Chris slipped on some ice and went airborne before falling.  I almost stepped right on his face.  Did a couple laps inside to finish it off.  Hopefully my legs will come around before Saturday - there are 23 people in my race but not many that are terribly fast.  The meet is going to take all day which will suck.

Did cross campus with a big group then Joe, Pez, and I did a neighborhood extension.  The cross campus was fun because everyone kept making fun of each other mercilessly.  Schwock was especially riled up.  After the three of us turned off Joe and Pez had like a 10 minute argument about whether Darwin or Lincoln contributed more to humanity.  I had to stop at the retirement community a half mile from campus to poop, and have since gone three more times in the past two hours.  After the run I did some strides on the upstairs track since tennis and baseball were using both field houses.  I'm looking forward to tomorrow - don't really have any expectations but it should be fun.
Easy shakeout run on the upstairs track.  Legs felt great.

Long run with Pez and Adrian.  We did Bryce Wandrey past Jefferson to 246 then added cross campus.  I started screaming by the library but the other two guys didn't back me up.  Adrian then had a really good sign hit that scared the crap out of some old people.  It was a great day outside, not cold and almost no wind.  I thought I wouldn't feel very good after last night's consumption but once we got going I actually felt great.  This was a good week of training, now time to focus on next weekend's 5K.
Upstairs track morning run.  Got into a really good rhythm and didn't want to stop.  Unfortunately I had to get to class.

Did Bryce Wandrey to Woodley then a few laps inside with a couple other guys.  Schwock wanted to run to the windmill but I wasn't feeling that today.  My legs felt more tired than this morning but not terrible.  Afterward I had planned to do strides but I instead sat on the bleachers and talked to Thunder for about 20 minutes.  The mid d guys did 'Grinder Day' today and had some ridiculous outfits on for their workouts.

I had a pretty rough 24 hours between practice yesterday and practice today (due to something that will not be discussed on here), so I decided that I needed to go run by myself instead of doing intervals with the other guys.  I went out on the dirt roads for a while and was able to think some things over and start feeling a little better.  I got going pretty good in the middle: 5:58, 5:57, 5:40, 5:45, 5:50, 5:50 = 35:00 for one six mile stretch.  Stopped with about two miles to go and did a few strides.  Tomorrow will be a better day.

Ran this workout solo since the other guys did it yesterday.  The first mile felt really smooth; I clicked off even 37s.  On the second mile I went out in 35/72, but ended up slipping to 5:00.  On both 800s I fell off pace a little on the second and third laps but still finished only a second off my goal time.  The 400s were easy to just gut out.  My pulse at the end was 165 and I was definitely tired.  Considering the miles I've logged the past few days I'm happy with this - now I'll recover a little for Saturday and hopefully be able to throw down a PR.  Today was much better than yesterday, and tomorrow will be even better still.
Easy morning run.  Legs were sore when I got up, got better as the run went on.

Did Snipe outside with Letich, Debbie, Varley, and Ben.  It was coldest it's been in quite a while.  I felt pretty good and was surprised when the others complained about the pace since I thought we were running slow.  I guess not though.  Finished with two more miles inside.  Talked with the coaches about recruits for next year - sounds like we've got a couple commitments but not from the real studs.

Ran on the upstairs track since I wasn't in the mood to run outside today.  Krahulec ran with me for a little while.  This was a pretty slow run and I didn't feel very good doing it.  Did strides after and felt better during those.  There are three people in the 5K tomorrow - me, Nussbaum, and Adrian.  Then we went up to the U of M to watch Snowshoe.  Gleason ran a sick last 400 to win the mile in 4:11, and the 3K had a ton of impressive performances.

Ran at 12:30 by myself so I could watch the Wisconsin at Michigan State basketball game.  I did the same route Adrian, Schwock, and I ran four weeks ago (Cornhole to Jefferson) and then added cross campus.  The first 20 minutes I didn't feel that great since I ate lunch right before running, but for about the last hour I felt really good.  It was colder than it has been but it certainly could be worse.  Really good run overall.

Bryce Wandrey to Woodley with Rivers, Nussbaum, Joe, Adrian, Pez, and Anders.  I was not motivated at all to run today and probably would have been fine with taking the day off, my legs were very tired from the race and long run over the weekend.  We spent the entire run making fun of each other, mostly Pez, and just about everyone got really riled up at least once.  Took a walk break in the middle while Pez peed.  Hopefully I'll feel better tomorrow.
Didn't feel very good this morning so I cut my run short.  Wanted to get the legs going before the workout this afternoon.

The planned workout was 1 mile @ 4:50, 1 800 @ 2:25, and 2 400s @ sub 70.  Griff had us run by ourselves.  I started the mile and came through in 76, tried to pick it up but hit the half in 2:32, and stopped.  At this point I knew I was going to have to do something different, so I did 2 more 800s.  These were decent, but I was working hard to hit times that weren't very fast.  I did 300s at the end instead of 400s because I thought they would be easier.  I felt sick all day, but I thought I would be able to get through the workout ok - I guess I was wrong.  Kind of discouraging.  As I type this my temperature is over 100 and I don't feel well at all, so I'll try to get to bed early tonight and hopefully tomorrow I'll be better.

Ran Snipe then a half mile inside by myself.  I feel a lot better than yesterday and my fever is gone, but I wanted to take it easy today to make sure I get rid of this thing.  It's supposed to snow quite a bit tonight so tomorrow I'll probably be stuck inside.  If I wake up feeling good I'm going to double.
