Ran 6 miles on the upstairs track then did 4 200s in 35 then another mile and a half.  I took a step backwards with my cold today, didn't feel good at all.  Easy running feels fine but when I try to pick it up at all I'm gasping for air.  I want to race this weekend but I don't know if I'll be up to it.  Hopefully I can get a decent night's sleep tonight.

Did a short run on the upstairs track and then a few strides.  My mileage this week has taken a nosedive thanks to this sickness, I can't seem to shake this thing.  The 3K tomorrow has a really good field so I really want to run...hopefully I'll feel great tomorrow morning and be able to give it a go.  Also, we got our gold t shirts today - Rivers and I set ours in the corner of the bleachers before we went to run, and when we got done the shirts were gone.  I'm kind of pissed about it.

I woke up this morning still feeling sick and after feeling absolutely awful on my shakeout run I was fairly certain I wouldn't race.  I went back to my room after lunch and took a nap for an hour...after waking up from this I decided I might as well at least try it.

Long run by myself.  I did the extended Jefferson loop to 246th, with several random add ons.  I felt kind of weird for most of the run, just wasn't really into it I guess.  My hands got cold during the last half hour as well.  I was surprised at how clear most of the sidewalks were after getting a foot of snow three days ago.  Usually people don't shovel.

Last little workout before conference this weekend.  Felt smooth on all the intervals, and the last 200 especially felt really good.  The 800 felt much easier than the 3 of them I ran in slower times last Tuesday.  I think I've got a big 5K in me, just have to put it together on Friday.

Ran on the road by the hospital with Krahulec, Paille, Anders, and Adrian.  It was nice to do something different for a change since we almost always do Bryce Wandrey.  This road has a really wide dirt shoulder that was great for running.  The way back was into the wind, but on a calm day this would be nearly perfect.  I felt great.  The entry lists came out today.  The 5K is loaded and almost everyone is pretty evenly matched, so it's going to be fun.  The top 5 guys from my 3K last weekend all made the fast section for this weekend so it will be a rematch of sorts.  We're projected to finish 6th with 52 points, but I think we can definitely do better.

Did a little night run as a study break from accounting.  This will be the only time I double this week other than my short shakeouts this weekend.  Legs feeling great, I'm really excited for conference.

Ran Bryce Wandrey to Woodley by myself, then a 400 (73) and 2 200s (35), then a mile and a half inside.  The nice weather made for a good run.  I feel really good right now and can't wait to race...trying not to think about it too much.  Busted out the Matumbos today, they feel a lot lighter than my Rivals.

Did Short Ostrich by myself in the morning.  This run is a little longer than I remembered it being.  When I went down to the locker room the power was out, so I had to use the light from my cell phone to get my locker open and find my clothes.  Did a bunch of strides afterward, legs felt great.

The team had a great first day.  Doyle got us started in the pent (on Thursday) with a second place finish, then came back and tied for fourth in the high jump.  Zeke had a big weight throw for third, Dobuol and Green got points in a strange mile, and Cullen and Prez went 2, 4 in the 800.  The race of the day though was the DMR as Burseth held off Gleason in the 800 leg and BTW ran a 58.9 last 400 to get the win.

On Day 2 we picked up right where we left off on Day 1.  Schantzen pulled the upset to win the shot put, we got some big points in the 1000, and Dan got fifth out of the slowest heat of the 200.  The biggest surprise was the 4x200, where we were hoping to get a point or two.  They ran out of their minds and with the help of a disqualification got third.  After going into the meet projected to finish 6th we were all really happy to come out with 4th.
Ran the Jefferson loop by myself.  I kept it really easy since my legs were tired from my double this weekend.  Weather was nice, good run overall.

Ran an out and back 10 on the dirt roads with Krahulec, Dobuol, and Paille.  Some others started out with us but turned around early.  I was really tired all day from lack of sleep but the run didn't feel too bad.  We finished in about 66 minutes so it was a pretty good pace.  Before the run Griff showed us some jackets that we might order for next cross country season.  Thunder was hanging around after practice, and it was nice to see him after that scare last week.  45 days til the Drake Relays 10K...

Snipe to Jefferson with Dobuol, Perk, and Paille.  Fairly relaxed pace but the weather wasn't real nice.  It was cold, there were puddles all over the place and it was pretty windy.  Dobuol told me he could bench 135 pounds 5 times - I didn't believe this for a second, but he ended up proving me wrong by putting it up 7 times when we got back.  My laundry loop has been missing for almost three weeks now so I'm starting to think it's not going to show up.  This ticks me off since my newest pair of shorts was on there.  I've had some decently easy days now after conference so I'm thinking tomorrow I'll get back to piling on the miles.
Morning run on the upstairs track.  Time to get back to doing these on a regular basis.  I only slept 5 hours last night.

It was 0 degrees with a -10 windchill so everyone ran inside.  After running in those conditions through January I don't have any tolerance for them anymore in March.  Tumnus has mono so Pez is freaking out that he will get it too since they live together.  We spent a while making fun of how paranoid he is.  This run was fairly boring otherwise.  Finished the day with ballistics, waterloo, pillar, and pushups.
Ran at 11 AM on the upstairs track with Burseth.  Did the morning run pretty late because I had a meeting at 10 and didn't wake up in time to run beforehand.

Ran on the dirt roads with Nuss, Lambert, Paille, and Anders.  Schwock and Lambert had a somewhat heated debate about evolution v. religion that lasted the entire run.  We got chased by three different dogs.  My legs felt dead from my lack of sleep, increased mileage, and not having enough to eat today.  Did a few strides after the run.  It's supposed to warm up tomorrow and then stay warm, so I'm hoping this was my last run for the year in my jacket.

Cross campus and neighborhood by myself.  I was late getting down to practice because of the Wisconsin game.  Legs felt better than yesterday but I wasn't too motivated to run.  I need to get more sleep.  Threw in a few surges in the last 15 minutes.

I missed practice this morning because I overslept.  Oops.  Watched the D3 indoor meet for a while in the afternoon then went for a long run around 4.  I did an extended Cornhole to Canada, then went down Wandrey and connected it to 246.  For the first 11 miles I felt awesome, then I started getting tired and by mile 14 I was in trouble.  I struggled through another mile but a mile from Olaf I was barely moving so I just stopped and walked back.  Oh well, I've bonked before and it's not that big of a deal.

After a late night of festivities I was woken up by Rivers upon which I ate two cookies, drank some water, and headed out the door.  Ran a somewhat extended Lando's Mom with Phil Richert, Corey Towle, Dan Greeno, and Chris biking alongside.  It was a good group and we had a conversation going the entire way.  The weather was amazing, 50 degrees and sunny.  Radar Hill was a little rough as always, but other than that I felt alright.  We made it back just in time to get to the caf before it closed.

My macro class was canceled so I used that time to go for a run.  I felt good so I ended up doing the full Ostrich instead of the short version.  The weather was awesome.  After the run I was in the locker room stretching and listening to Dobuol's new CD when two professors walked in.  Less than a minute later the CD switched to 'My Dick.'  I quickly rushed over to skip to the next song.

Ran short Ostrich with Cullen and some other mid d guys.  It was 65 degrees out so I ran without a shirt for the first time (outside) in probably 5 months.  Finished up with a few strides on the indoor track.  My legs are feeling good after some heavy mileage the past few days.  In other news, I have probably eaten around 20 cookies in the past two days.  Big workout tomorrow.

First workout on the outdoor track of the year.  10 x 800 at a strong aerobic pace is one of my favorite workouts and I always make sure I get this in during March.  I did it on Carleton's track since ours has a huge puddle in lane 1 on the home stretch.  It was really windy which wasn't fun, but this is still preferable to running inside.  My legs felt a little tired but aerobically I felt pretty strong.  I ended up doing 11 intervals since the first one was pretty slow.  Would have liked a faster average, but I figure the wind was worth 2-3 seconds and I was alone.  Did 3 150s at the end to simulate the finish of a race.
Went for a 9 PM shakeout run on the upstairs track.  Legs felt alright after the workout earlier today.  Afterward I refueled my body with chocolate cake and beer.

Today was a good recovery run.  A group of us ran in the upper arb for a while which was a really nice change of scenery.  Pez and I added cross campus at the end.  Weather was nice again; it was a little windy but in the arb it wasn't real noticeable.

Ran the Jefferson loop in the morning by myself.  I felt really good so I ended up running pretty quick.  I under dressed since I didn't look at the weather before I left and assumed it was the same temperature it had been all week.  I intended to run again later but didn't get around to it.

2 mile warmup, 2.5 mile cooldown

Did a 23 minute tempo at 5:30 pace.  It felt incredibly easy and I was tempted to keep going for another mile or so but decided I had already accomplished the goal of the workout so there was no reason to.  Then I went to the cities to get on the plane for Arizona.  We landed just as the Wisconsin game started, but unfortunately our bags took a long time to show up and then it took forever to find our hotel, so I only got to see the last two minutes and the overtime.  It was worth it since we ended up winning.
Ran a quick five on a treadmill at our hotel in downtown Phoenix.  Felt alright, pretty uneventful.

We left our hotel from last night, went to a mall for a while, and then arrived at our villa where we will be spending the week.  My mom does not like the place so that will make things a bit awkward.  Just before halftime of the Texas v Duke game I headed out for a short run.  Ran on some hilly trails for a little while, then headed out on the highway for a few minutes, then back on the trails to finish up.  We are at higher altitude so the hills felt tougher than in Northfield.  So far it doesn't look like there are many great places to run around here, but I'll make do.

Today was a bit of a strange day.  I woke up at 9 AM, turned on the TV, and the NCAA Tournament was starting thanks to the time zone difference.  I watched bits and pieces of the first game, then streamed the Wisconsin game through my computer.  We lost in the same fashion we've lost most of our games this season - get a lead towards the beginning of the second half, let the other team back in it, and then go cold shooting at the end.  Then I decided I should go for a run.  I found out last night that the area we were in is not very safe, so that plus the 30+ mph winds convinced me to run on a treadmill.  My plan was to run until I got bored, which happened after about 30 minutes.  This wouldn't cut it though, so I convinced myself to go 10 more minutes, and kept doing that until I hit 12 miles.  We ended up moving to a new place tonight - the original place just wouldn't have worked for the entire week (there was some drama last night after I went to bed).  Our new place is much nicer and in a much better area as well.  No more treadmill running thankfully.
Easy morning run

Ran along Scottsdale Blvd.  The temperature didn't really bother me and on the way back there was a nice cooling wind.  I felt strong so I went a few minutes further than I planned.  Did a couple strides after the run.

This afternoon my mom and I went to see the Angels play the Dodgers in a spring training game.  The traffic going to the stadium was so bad that it took us 90 minutes to drive the 30 miles from our place.  This was seriously the worst traffic I've ever seen going to a sporting event.  It was fun to see baseball again, but the game was uneventful for the most part.  The Angels won 10-4 thanks to three home runs.
Same morning run as yesterday

This was my main workout for the week and I felt like it went pretty well.  I found a secluded road behind a golf course to use for the intervals - this was nice because I wouldn't have to keep stopping at lights.  For the most part I felt smooth and relaxed, the only interval that really got tough was the last 3:00 one.  If I had to guess I'd say I was right around 5:00 pace for the first set, a bit faster on the second set, and 67-68 second 400 pace for the last set.

Ran an out and back down Scottsdale Blvd to Bell Rd.  Did a 30 second pickup at the turn around.  Fairly uneventful run otherwise.  This afternoon we went to the Brewers v Dodgers baseball game.  The Brewers hit 5 HRs en route to a 12-8 win.  Prince Fielder hit a ball out of the stadium.

Ran the same route as yesterday but turned around a little bit earlier.  I was pressed for time so I pounded it, probably was around 6:00 pace for the majority of the run.  Saw the Brewers play the Rangers today - the Rangers started off the game by going up 7-0 but the Brewers came all the way back and won 11-10 on a walk off wild pitch in the bottom of the ninth.

This was a good workout.  The tempo felt really smooth; either I'm getting really fit or I'm not running these fast enough.  I'll hope it's the first one.  Between the tempo and the last intervals I had to poop so I found a small clump of woods and took care of it in there.  Kind of sketchy but it had to be done.  The 1500 pace intervals were a little fast but they were short so not too challenging.  My pulse at the end of the workout was 183, less than three minutes later it was 114.
Easy run at 6:45 AM before we left for the airport.  It was only 55 degrees, so a bit cooler than it had been all week.  Finished with seven strides.

This was a great run.  Did Cornhole to Jefferson to Cross Campus then finished up inside.  I ran at about 6:45 PM because I watched both basketball games this afternoon.  Go UNC!  Once I started running I got into a great rhythm and felt effortless the entire way.  The weather was great - 40 degrees and no wind.  It got dark about an hour in but the street lights provided enough visibility.  Assuming I started off at close to 7 minute pace as I usually do I probably ran the last 10 miles in under 62 minutes, and I felt awesome doing it.  At one point I considered continuing on to make it a 20 miler but decided that would be counter productive.  Hopefully I feel this good on the day of my 10K.

Did our campus hill loop three times.  Legs were a bit sore from my run yesterday, but I was able to get through this ok.  The hill on the fourth mile of the old course was tough all three times.  The mid d guys only did two loops, so I did the third one with Pez, Tumnus, Paille, and Anders.  It looks like we're going to have a tough week of training, I'm excited for it.

Did this with Pez on the outdoor track.  All of the intervals were right on except the second one when he got us out too slow.  I felt relaxed during the workout, but on the cool down my legs were wrecked from my past three days.  It didn't help that our cool down was fairly long.  I think I'll take tomorrow pretty easy.  It's still up in the air where I'm going to run the 10K - I've started campaigning to go to Augustana and Griff agreed to it yesterday but now is backing off of that.  We'll see what happens.
Easy shakeout run before class.  Legs felt like logs.  After class I went and got two eggs and toast from the cage for breakfast.

Ran in the lower arb for the first time since November.  We kept it really relaxed since everyone was tired from Monday and Tuesday.  It was snowing while we were running - seriously, it's April 1st.  Did a few laps upstairs when we got back.  Hopefully my legs will feel better tomorrow, I'll try to get a lot of sleep tonight.

We did this workout on the trails in the arb.  My legs felt tired at the start but that got better as the workout went on.  I ran with Pez and Tumnus and the paces during the intervals felt pretty relaxed...we probably ran a little slow but I'm fine with it.  It looks like I'll have a nice pack of guys to race with in the 1500 on Saturday, it should be fun.
Went for another one of my 10 PM runs on the upstairs track.  Legs felt alright, kept the pace really relaxed, and felt great when I finished.

Ran the short arb loop with a big group.  Dobuol was really riled up about every little thing today so we spent basically the entire run arguing with him.  Stopped at the outdoor track on the way back to do strides.  Did my usual stuff then did 2 200s in 32 in spikes.  Legs feel alright, hopefully the weather's not too crappy tomorrow.

Ran through the Arb with Pez, Paille, Chris, and Letich.  Pez and I added on on Tony Hoff's highway before turning around.  I cut the long run down this week since our race is on Thursday instead of Saturday and we're doing a tough workout tomorrow.  Pez and I talked about all the fast times people in the MIAC ran this past weekend.  It's time to join in on that.

Long workout on the track with Pez and Dobuol.  Dobuol decided to do this instead of the 1500 workout since it was his first workout in a while.  Him and I took turns leading and Pez just sat behind.  I felt pretty smooth the entire time, but with the wind it was definitely a hard workout.  I wasn't 100% spent at the end but I would not have wanted to do any more.  On the first mile I had to run one of the curves in lane 4 because the women's team was all over the place - they didn't understand the concept of getting out of lane 1 when you finish your interval.  Every time Dobuol led he would start off a little fast, but it was ok.  I'm looking forward to the 5K on Thursday - hopefully some fast guys from UST and SJU run it.

Iron Bridge and then took the extended route back.  Dobuol and I were the only ones that went all the way to the bridge, the others stopped right before the muddy section at the back of the arb.  My legs were tired from the workout yesterday, I expected that though.

Easy pre meet run and strides.  We finally moved down to Tom Porter Hall today (a week and a half later than usual), so now it actually feels like outdoor track season.  5K tomorrow, I'm feeling a little tired but I'll be fine.

We had a pretty good meet as a team.  The highlight was Schantzen's 16.55 shot put, currently ranked #2 in the nation.  Isaac had a great 400, demolishing James Ewer and running 49.66, and Cullen ran 1:53.16 for 3rd in an 800 that was essentially a conference preview.  The biggest surprise was Paul Ranum splitting a 51.x on the 4x400, once we get Doyle back this relay will be strong.
Easy morning run to the Lawrence gym and back.  My legs were a bit tired from the race and the 4.5 hour drive home, but nothing too bad.
Ran my seven mile Memorial route.  Felt good, weather was nice, and the run went by quickly.

Did an out and back on the CE trail to Henry St in Kaukauna.  Had an interesting battle with a biker for a while on the way out - we kept hitting red lights and every time the light turned green I would accelerate faster than he would, then he'd come blowing by me only to have me catch him while he was waiting at the next light.  I had the wind at my back on the way home which was really nice.

I ended up having too much to drink last night for my 21st and woke up brutally hung over.  During church I had to go to the bathroom for a few minutes to dry heave, and when we got home I went back to bed instead of going running.  I got some more sleep on the way back to school and my hangover finally broke around 5 PM.  I ran the Jefferson loop in the dark - once I got out there I felt great and running at night made it more fun.  Did four strides afterward.

Felt tired all day and then didn't feel good on the warmup, so going into the workout I was little worried, but once we started I was fine.  I didn't feel fantastic or anything but I was able to click these off without any problems.  I led all of the intervals except the second 400.  Griff had us scheduled for more intervals than this but I cut it down because I want to make sure I'm fully rested for Friday.  I found out there are 10 or 11 sub 15:00 5kers in the Augie 10K, so it will definitely be fast.  Also, apparently the last 200 of my 5K last Thursday was 28.9.  I didn't start sprinting until 150 to go so I must have really gotten going.
Easy morning run on the course.  Got a little bit of a late start but other than that I felt fine.

Ran by myself in the arb.  I was late getting down to practice so everyone was gone when I showed up.  Legs felt really good, I was cruising along effortlessly.  I have a busy next few days academically so hopefully I can stay on top of things and still get my needed rest.

Ran Iron Bridge and took the extended route back.  About halfway through I started getting really light headed and dizzy and ended up having to stop and take a break for a while.  I'm guessing I was dehydrated.  When I started back up I still didn't feel very good but it would have taken way too long to walk all the way back to school so I just toughed it out.  Did three barefoot strides on the grass when I got back, then stood around and talked with Griff and Dobuol for a while.

Easy cross campus with Cullen, Paul, and Pez, then added on a little bit on the course with Pez.  Did the usual pre meet strides, and my legs felt good.  The weather's going to be great tomorrow night.  It's time to roll.

After driving back from Augustana I sat around for an hour before motivating myself to go out for a run.  My legs didn't feel all that great but I decided to go long today so that I wouldn't have to tomorrow.  Did the same run I did two Sundays ago except this time I ran out a bit further on the highway.  The last 20 minutes I was getting pretty tired, that 10K took a lot out of me.  I'm not looking forward to trying to run the conference 5K the day after my next one.

Easy run in the arb with a couple other guys.  We talked about everyone's activities of this weekend, including the antics of Carleton JV Soccer.  My legs felt trashed so I decided to take a very easy day.  Griff wants me to run a 1500 on Wednesday, that is going to feel really strange compared to the 10K.

This workout wasn't supposed to be hard, but my legs are still dead from the 10K and a weekend of horrible sleep.  The intervals weren't long enough to be real challenging aerobically, but my legs got tired very quickly.  It didn't help that the weather was crappy and there was a pretty strong wind on the homestretch.  Also, I basically ran this by myself.  I'm not going to race on Wednesday, there wouldn't be any point.  Chalk this one up as a bad day and forget about it.

Ran cross campus with the guys racing tomorrow then headed into the arb by myself to add on.  My entire body felt lethargic all day.  I've got a paper to write for tomorrow that I'm behind on so I won't get much sleep tonight.  After this I'll be able to catch up.

Did a 20 minute tempo run in the arb.  Felt ok, I only slept 5 hours last night so I was tired before I started but I got through it.  Talked about the conference lineup afterward - Griff doesn't seem too interested in maximizing points and wants to have as many people as possible only run one event, but I'm sure Lundin will want to do it differently.
Easy shakeout at like 11 PM.  After I finished I ate a bowl of cereal, two granola bars, and two peanut butter sandwiches.  I guess I was hungry.

This was my first longer workout in a while, and it felt good to get one in again.  I did it by myself in the Arb (Griff wanted to get away from the track for a bit).  Felt good and strong.  The first six minutes felt easy and afterward I thought I might have run it too slow, but then I realized that running six minutes at a pace that I can maintain for a half hour should feel easy.  The 5 minute interval at the end was a nice challenge - it forced me to push through being tired and keep going.  It felt good to open up a bit on the last two intervals.  It was hot and windy but I could stay out of a lot of it.  Only two guys broke 31 at Drake because of the weather, so I'm definitely glad I went to Augustana last weekend.

Ran by myself in the arb once again.  At first I was running right behind the guys that were doing the intervals that I did yesterday and then I'd catch them during the rest, but I decided I didn't want that to go on for the entire run so I turned off and took a different route.  Ran kind of a hodge podge of trails to get it to be the correct amount of time.  My legs didn't feel very good, probably had something to do with the 85 degree temperatures.  During the last 10 minutes I got very dehydrated and was very glad to get back to the track.
Ran with Zombo Joe and Ben Bayer.  Everyone else turned off early.  Talked about conference, I hope those guys can make it in.
Ran by myself on the CC course.  Felt really good and was moving along at a good clip.  I definitely ran more than 5.5 miles but this balances out this morning's run since that wasn't quite 7.

Ran Snipe, then did 2 400s (69, 67) and 2 200s (32, 32) on the track, then a 1.5 mile cool down.  I'm running the 1500 on Tuesday so I wanted to try to get my legs turning over a bit before that.  The first 400 felt awful because I didn't do any strides before it.  The other stuff felt a little better but still not very good.  Considering my night last night that should have been expected though.  No more of that until after conference.

Easy pre meet run.  I did cross campus with the team then added about 15 minutes by myself before doing strides and 2 150s.  Felt alright, still a little tired but I'll get a lot of sleep tonight and be good to go tomorrow.  This morning I woke up at 7:30 without an alarm so that was a good sign.  I'm running the 1500 tomorrow and maybe the 5K as well, we'll see about that.

1.5 AM shakeout
3 warmup before 1500
1500 race
1.5 cooldown after 1500
1.5 warmup for 5K
5K race
2.5 cooldown after 5K

After seeing the heat sheets I decided to enter the 5K as well since there were only two Carls in it and they had slow seed times.  After my 1500 I jogged 6 laps, sat down for about 10 minutes, then briefly warmed up again.  During the 5K I just clicked off even 76s and won with no problem in 15:52.  Even though it was 40 minutes after the 1500 it was still not hard at all.  Running it turned out to be a good decision because that was the event drawn to decide the winner of the meet.  Boom.

Recovery run in the Arb with Pez, Paille, Nuss, and Adrian.  My legs actually felt ok today, I expected to be sore after 6500m in spikes yesterday but I wasn't.  Pez and Schwock had a heated debate about agnostics and fundamentalism for about the last 20 minutes.  It came out this morning that Rashid Ramzi tested positive for EPO at the Olympics.  I was already suspicious of the guy after he came out of nowhere to win double gold at the 2005 World Championships.  He's now officially a loser and needs to go away.  Decathlon tomorrow, good luck Doyle!
Easy morning run.  Felt fine, nothing exciting to report.

I spent the entire afternoon at Carleton watching the decathlon.  Between the shot put and high jump I went and ran in the arb, then did a few strides on the track.  The run felt ok, I felt a little tired on the hills though.  Doyle is up by 115 points, in a great spot going into tomorrow which is by far his weaker day.  It's going to come down to the wire.  Matt is holding his own as well.

This was a bit different.  I did it at Carleton during the end of the decathlon pole vault.  I did the warmup and the first two intervals in the arb, then finished on the track.  I felt really strong on the first two intervals, then took too long of a break before the 800 because I started talking with someone and lost track of time and the 800 didn't feel very good.  I put it together for the 400s though and they were fairly easy.  On the 150s at the end it felt good to run fast.  Doyle ended up PRing with 6207 points, he got third behind two unreal performances.  It wasn't what he wanted, but he still did really well.  Matt beat his score from earlier this season so he was happy.  I had a sore throat all day.

Yesterday I thought I was starting to get sick; that feeling was confirmed correct today when I woke up with an extremely sore throat and lots of congestion.  Frick, I'm six days out from conference and I feel like shit.  Didn't do much all day, just sat in my room drinking a ton of water and doing some homework.  I was going to take the day off from running but eventually decided to do an easy 3 so that I could keep my streak of not missing a day in 2009 going.  I hope I get better quickly.  Schantzen broke the school record in the shot put with a 17.17!

After sleeping 11 hours last night I felt much better today.  Not quite 100%, but night and day different from yesterday.  I went out to run thinking I'd go anywhere from 10-13, and 12.5 was where I ended up.  Did the Jefferson loop plus the baby arb loop connected to cross campus.  No problems with breathing, my nose was still a little stuffed up but I'll be good to go in a few days.

Last workout before conference.  Did it by myself, the other guys did less.  Unfortunately it didn't feel as easy as it should have; I could feel some effects of my sickness.  No worries though, I'll get my rest and be ready to go on Friday.  The 1200 was worth at least 3:42 because the women's team had steeple barriers set up that I had to keep running around.  It felt good to open it up on the last 200.  Maybe I'll close that fast in my 10K - yeah right.
Last double of the season.  I decided to do my longer run in the morning so that I could just screw around at practice.  Ran on the course by myself.  Felt ok, not great but better than yesterday.

This run was a joke.  I did cross campus with some other guys.  We took two walk breaks (the usual one behind the stadium and then we walked up a hill on the Carleton campus).  Tumnus hit the sign right in front of a Carleton campus officer, and the officer thought he was actually hurt.  He came over and put his hand on Adrian's shoulder while repeatedly asking, 'Sir, are you ok?'  After a few seconds of this someone yelled, 'They should put up a sign for that sign!' and we all ran away laughing hysterically.  Did a few laps on the track afterward and also some hurdles just for the heck of it.  It was nice to just have fun at practice rather than having to worry about getting a quality run in.  Also, Griff has developed an annoying habit of looking at my eyes daily to determine whether I'm getting enough sleep.  Today he told me I looked tired, and I was thinking, 'yeah, either that or I'm squinting because I've been sitting inside all day and it's really bright out here.'  He wants me to do next to nothing the rest of the week.  I'm going to stick to my usual routine.

Ran Iron Bridge by myself.  Some people were cutting a tree down in the Arb so I had to take a slight detour but it ended up being roughly the same distance.  Griff yelled at me afterward for going this far, but this is what I've done before every big race for the past two years and it's almost always worked well.  I'll stick with it.  The run felt good, I think I'm just about back to normal after this sickness.  Two nights of good sleep and an easy day tomorrow and I'll really be ready.

Day before conference.  Did the same thing I've done all year - cross campus with an add on and then strides.  Ben Bayer won Skildum in 10:59.  As always the race was hilarious and fun to watch.  It's supposed to thunderstrom tomorrow, here's hoping it holds off until after the 10K.  Not feeling amazing, but it's time to do it.

Day 1 of conference went ok for the team.  We didn't qualify anyone for finals that we didn't expect to (although Burseth almost slipped through in the 800), but we didn't have anyone that was expected to make it not get through.  The 4x800 guys ran well - none of them had broken 2:00 outdoors and they all did tonight to run 7:52 and finish 3rd.  We're going to need some big performances tomorrow to finish well in the standings.

We ended up fifth as a team which was once again better than we were projected to do.  We couldn't have placed higher but could have gotten closer to the top 4 if Tut hadn't been disqualified in the 400 and Cullen hadn't been been nosed out by two guys in the 800.  The 4x400 was one of the best races I've ever seen - 5 teams provo'ed and we got fourth with a 3:15.73.  Dan 49.0, Cullen 49.7, Tut 47.7, Doyle 49.1.  Everyone except Tut basically PRed by a full second.  Schantzen won the shot put so we had two event champions.

Easy run with Cullen and Chris.  We ran a short loop in the arb then I added about 10 minutes by myself.  Good conversation the whole way.  My legs were tired but not real sore.  I'm not sure what I'm going to do about racing this week.  I really want to do the 5K at La Crosse and try to break 15, but finals are Friday and Saturday and my parents have expressed their strong preference that I not race.  I might do it anyway, but if I do and then finals don't go well I don't want to hear about it all summer.  I'll figure it out by Tuesday.
Easy workout just to get the legs moving again.  Legs felt fine but I definitely could feel the lack of sleep from the past two nights.  Need to catch up on that before Thursday.

Ran in the arb with an add on on the highway.  I felt good and had a strong pace going.  It was really windy out.  I'm not going to race on Thursday because of finals - it's just too much to try to race Thursday night then take four tests on Friday and Saturday.  I'll keep running this week in case by some miracle I slip into nationals and then take my time off after I go home.

Didn't want to run very far today, so I didn't.  Ran Burner with Cullen then Pez and I added on on the course to get to 35 minutes.  Mooched some ice cream from the women's team ice cream social afterward.

Probably my last interval workout of the season.  I was all by myself at practice since everyone else either is taking time off or was competing at La Crosse so that was a little depressing.  The workout went fine - I hit all my splits without too much effort.  Did Baby Burner for the first time all year for a cool down.  I'm barely sleeping right now, my average bedtime between now and next Tuesday will probably be 3 AM.  I hate finals with a passion, especially since I had to miss the La Crosse meet because of them.  I checked the forecast this afternoon and saw that it was going to be perfect weather and immediately started cursing my decision to not go.

Took the day off.  Had two finals, it was raining when my second one finished, and I have two more tomorrow.  I got knocked down on the national list after last night so I'm not going to make it to nats.  I'll probably do a short run tomorrow and then do the triathlon relay for fun on Sunday.
Squeezed in a short shake out run after my Money & Banking final.  Felt tired as I expected.  Triathlon relay tomorrow morning, it'll be fun.

Failed beer mile attempt.  The gun went off at 10 - all day I had not been planning on running but as it got closer I started getting the urge to try it and at 9:30 I flipped a coin to decide.  Ran a two mile warmup and then started.  The first beer and lap went fine, then I really struggled with the second beer, then on the homestretch of the second lap I puked on the infield.  I didn't want to take another 15 minutes and puke 5 more times so I just quit.  Gotta train a bit for the next one I guess :)

Ran on the winning relay team of the St Olaf Sprint Triathlon.  Brock was the first person out of the pool, Ben kept a good sized lead on the bike, and I ended up bringing us home for about an eight minute win with a 17:02 5K on the course.  It was a decent effort but by no means anywhere near all out.  I've slept maybe 16 hours in the past three nights including four last night and I ran in trainers.  No cool down, season's over.  Cullen made nationals!
Day off.  Studied for the actuarial exam.  Ate build your own nachos in the caf for both lunch and dinner and also had three desserts.
Another day off.  Failed my actuarial exam.  I'll try again in July.

ABR.  It was 85 degrees and windy as hell which made things interesting.  I didn't attempt to finish, but it was an awesome day.  Never felt terribly drunk, just had a solid buzz going for several hours.  The actual distance is about 10 miles, but 7 seems appropriate given our pace was close to a crawl on several of the runs and they are all spaced out.  Props to Jake, Doyle, and Krahulec for finishing.

Starting today I'm going to take one solid week off and then start up again next Thursday.  Spent the day relaxing and packing to go home.  I probably only slept three hours last night so I took a three hour nap in the late morning/early afternoon.
Six hour drive from Northfield to Door County
Was really lazy today, just sat around the house.  Probably watched six hours of TV.  What a life.

Pretty much the same as yesterday, although I did move a little bit because I took the dogs for a walk.  I got the urge to do some sort of exercise so I did Pedestal 1x10.  First general strength circuit since we moved out of Tostrud in early April, it felt weird.
Drove home to Appleton from Door County so that I can start work tomorrow morning.  Ate a gross amount of food throughout the day.  The Brewers won an epic 10 inning game against St Louis.

First day of work.  I was supposed to be there at 8:00, but somehow I unconsciously turned my alarm off and woke up at 8:02.  Shit.  Fortunately my boss wasn't mad when I showed up at 8:25.  It was a decent first day though and it sounds like the summer will be good.  I also had my first night of umpiring and that kind of sucked because it was raining.  Second to last day of rest before I start running again on Thursday.

Last day off.  It rained all day so I was somewhat glad that I didn't have to run.  I did Pedestal last night at midnight and also did it tonight at halftime of the Lakers game, so that's three times in four days.  Hopefully my motivation to do general strength will continue past this week.

First run of the summer.  Did an easy out and back to the Lawrence Gym before work.  It was lightly raining.  As always my legs felt a little weird coming back from a break, but that will go away within a few days.  Did Pedestal at night again.

East South River loop.  My legs felt a little better than yesterday but still a little strange.  I didn't wear a watch but had a decent pace going.  At the run's end I was reminded why I like winter training more than summer training when I couldn't stop sweating.  It was only 75 degrees out, Lord help me when the temperature hits 90+.  Did Pedestal right after the run because I went to the Brewers game and wouldn't have been able to do it at night.

Adrian was in town visiting a friend at Lawrence so I met him at 10 AM to run.  I had a late night at the Brewers game (including quite a few beverages on the bus ride down there) and didn't wake up until about 9:40.  We did a loop from Lawrence to Wisconsin Ave to Badger, around Pierce Park and Lutz Park, then back down College Ave to the start.  Good conversation the entire way.  The loop was exactly 8 miles so the pace is accurate.  We probably ran the last two miles in just over 12 minutes.  Did Pedestal when I got home.

Ran the first bit by myself then Marie ran the last 4.5 with me.  Pace with her was probably about 7:20s, it was really easy.  It was fine though after pounding for a bit yesterday.  We did Memorial to Seymour to Fremont.  Afterward we played two games of P-I-G and I somehow managed to lose the first one.  I redeemed myself in the second.

This was my first really good run of the summer.  Ran to Xavier and skipped my usual extension on the way back so it came out to exactly 10 miles.  I went out hard without trying to and hit the turnaround in just over 31 flat, then slowed down on purpose on the way home because there is no reason to pound a 10 miler right now.  Felt really relaxed the entire time.  It was only 65 degrees out; doesn't feel like summer yet but I'm not complaining.

GS: Waterloo 1x10, Pedestal 1x10

Did another 10 miler out and back on Memorial to Wisconsin Ave.  I need to get on some soft surfaces.  I was tired and a bit sore on the run, most likely because I haven't done back to back 10 milers in quite a while.  My right leg has had a bunch of weird aches and pains all day.  Didn't eat or drink enough during the day so that didn't help.  I ran past a softball game just in time to see a girl hit a foul ball and crack a windshield, then later saw Nate Lynch standing in a random yard talking on his cell phone.

GS: Pedestal 1x10

Ran an extended route to Telulah Park, ran around there for a while, then ran home.  It felt good to get on the grass for a good portion of the run, even if I was just running large loops around a not very exciting park.  My legs felt better than yesterday but were still a little sore.  By next week this should be second nature.

I was really tired today from lack of sleep so I took it easy.  Ran a six mile loop, then six strides, then two miles on the treadmill during the pregame for Game 1 of the NBA Finals.  Highlights of the run included a little girl telling me to put a shirt on, some 'Run Forrest Run' catcalls from some punk kids hanging out by Hoover Park, and seeing Mr Marx in his driveway.  He congratulated me on my conference championship; that was cool that he even knew about it.

Ran my usual Xavier loop with the extension.  Felt alright, didn't eat a big enough breakfast so I started getting hungry about the last 15 minutes.  After the run the second toe on my left foot felt like it was broken and I couldn't walk normally for about two hours.  After sitting the car for three hours driving to La Crosse it felt fine.  Weird.  

The state 3200 was awesome with six guys 9:15 or faster.  Storkel went out in 62, the three leaders went through the mile in 4:32, and Brill dropped about a 2:06 last 800 to win.  The East 4x800 ran terrible.  I saw Dave Ricks at the meet - he tried to introduce me to Chas Karch not realizing that Chas and I ran together for a year in high school.  Massey finished 2nd in MN in 9:19...awesome.

Did a short run around La Crosse in the rain before going to the meet.  Brian biked with me.  We went on some path down by the river.  Nothing special happened.  Taylor led the first 1300 of the mile but then Ross, Brill, and Storkel all blew by and he finished 4th in 4:16.  Disappointing, but he'll get it next year.  He came back and finished 2nd in the 800 in 1:54 which was exciting.  It was under 50 degrees and poured all day at the meet - not very comfortable for spectating.  I was warmer than some other people though ;)

Also, my eating today consisted of this:
Breakfast - 2 eggs, bacon, hash browns, toast
5:45 PM - 3 pieces of cold pizza and 1/4 big bag of M&Ms
9 PM - Cousins sub and medium Coke
Not exactly the diet of champions.

Ran a loop that went around Pierce and Lutz parks.  Felt good and was probably hitting sub 6:30 pace for most of the run.  Finished with four strides.

GS: Random assortment of various exercises

Ran a couple loops through downtown.  I was really tired all day and started off quite slow but about 3 miles into the run I started feeling really good and strong.  There are two decent size uphills on this route and I pushed it up both.  In the last mile I got the urge to crank it so I kept speeding up and probably got down to 5:00 pace for a minute or so before slowing it down as I finished.  My time today was 2 1/2 minutes faster than I ran this loop at the end of July last summer and it was probably about the same effort.
Did another short run at around 11:30 PM.  Night running is fun.  Went to bed less than 15 minutes after I finished.

Ran a 10.5 mile loop through downtown Kimberly to Telulah Park then tacked on an extension to make it 12.  The first four miles weren't very fun because I ate Taco Bell an hour before running, but after that I felt really good.  I'm not sure what's up with this weather; I've only run shirtless two or three times all summer because it's always 60 degrees or cooler.  Seeing as I struggle with the heat though I'm not complaining.  Went to the Brewers game at night where I saw a crew playing Survivor Man in the parking lot...didn't know anyone besides Oles and Hamdogs played that.  We moved down to some better seats, and when the usher came and asked to see our tickets my dad BSed with him for a minute and he finally decided to just let us stay.  Even though the Brewers lost it was fun.

GS: Pedestal 1x10, Pushups 3x12

Ran the same loop through Pierce and Lutz that I did on Sunday but tacked on a little bit in the middle to make it 10.  My legs were very tired today.  Did four strides at the end of the run to try to shake out some of the fatigue.  During the run I almost collided with multiple people walking their pets that were oblivious to their surroundings.  People need to be more alert.  Also got really hungry in the last mile or so since I didn't have a snack between work and running.  I ate dinner immediately upon finishing and then got roped into mowing the lawn.  Too tired to do general strength after that.

Ran over the Telulah bridge to Midway then down Oneida to East South River.  Pretty boring loop.  My dad drove past me on his way home from work.  My legs were tired once again but the last two miles they started feeling a little better.

Did another night run after the NBA Finals game ended.  This isn't really a habit I want to get into this summer so next week I'm going to force myself to get up and get my doubles done in the morning.  My legs felt a lot better than this afternoon but I had a pounding headache probably due to dehydration.

Ran around the Horseshoe Bay property in Door County.  I was very unmotivated to run today but managed to get out the door eventually.  Felt ok but the route was boring.  Did six strides afterward.

GS: Miscellaneous exercises for about 10 minutes

Went to Peninsula State Park to do a long run.  It was great being able to do this on trails, and to be in the shade since it was decently hot out.  The trails were mostly flat with some rolling parts.  I ran an out and back with mile markers but I only checked my splits a couple times.  Saw a lot of people biking, mostly families with little kids.  At the end some guys came up to me in the parking lot and asked why I would run so far, what pace I run, what my fastest marathon was, etc.  I tried to explain all of this to them but I don't think they 'got it.'  Conversations with non-runners are always amusing.

Went back to Peninsula and did a 9.6 mile loop (I don't do .6 so I'll just round it down).  My legs were a little tired starting out but by the half mile I had warmed up.  Kept the pace relaxed and felt good.  Running on trails is much more enjoyable than running on sidewalks.
First actual 'morning run' of the summer.  Getting up for it sucked, but I'll get in the routine soon enough.  Felt good once I started running.

Went to Telulah Park and ran around there for a while.  In the middle I did 8 35 second strides at what felt like 5K pace with a jog back to the start that probably took 50-60 seconds.  Legs were dead for the first part of the run but then loosened up and the strides felt great.  The hot temperatures make it actually feel like summer now.  I have to remember to keep drinking water during the day even though I work in an air conditioned building and don't feel the heat until I leave.

GS: Waterloo 1x10, Pedestal 1x10

Xavier loop.  I ate Chipotle for lunch and about halfway through the run I had to crap really bad.  I was over by Xavier in an area that was basically all houses, and when I went to the Kwik Trip I couldn't go in because I wasn't wearing a shirt.  So I ended up going in some bushes by the school.  I don't think anyone saw me.  After this I felt fine for the rest of the run.
Started out and realized quickly that my legs needed an easy day.  Did a Memorial loop and then came home.  It was hot.
Stayed in bed a little too long so I had to cut the run a mile short.  Legs felt better than yesterday and the weather was nice and cool.

Ran out the CE trail and came back through downtown Kimberly.  The first two miles were a little rough but eventually I got into it.  Felt much better when I got off of CE at the 4 mile mark.  It was 80-85 degrees and I sweated like crazy.  Did four strides afterward and then mowed the lawn.  For the second week in a row the combination of a 10 miler and then doing the lawn really took it out of my legs.

We got a huge thunderstorm at about 4:00 that lasted for about 20 minutes.  When it started I was done with my work but I stayed there because I didn't want to drive home in that weather.  Then when I got home I started watching the US Open and kept putting off the run.  Finally at 6:00 I forced myself out the door.  My legs felt the best they have in several days.  Finished with six strides at a solid clip.

GS: Pedestal 1x10

Went out to High Cliff to run on trails.  There was a triathlon going on out there so it was very crowded.  I tried to stay off their course as much as possible, which meant I got to explore parts of the park that I had never seen before.  For the first part of the run I just kept running out and turning wherever I felt like it, and then I tried to find my way back.  I definitely took a different route back than I took going out since it took about half the time, so I turned around and added on some more.  It was very hot and humid and when I was running on unshaded paths I got very warm.  Was planning on going 15 but the heat had me ready to quit at 12 and I could only force myself to add on two more.

Ran on the treadmill so that I could keep watching the US Open.  Kept the pace really slow and felt good the whole time.  By tomorrow I should be all recovered from yesterday's struggle and ready to lay down a good week.

GS: Pedestal 1x10, Pushups 3x12

Getting up for this run wasn't too difficult, and I felt good doing it, but then around 9 AM I started feeling really tired.  I only slept about 5 1/2 hours last night.  I've decided to try to log my sleep on here, at least for a little while, because based on the past few months I clearly need to monitor it more closely.

Ran a loop around Neenah with Brent Young.  We started at Rogans Shoes, went out through some neighborhoods, then came back on CB.  Stopped briefly at a gas station so he could get some water.  It was great to run with somebody else and we had a good conversation the entire way which made the time fly by.  It was pretty hot once again, and I must be dehydrated because I have quite the headache right now.  It's supposed to be over 90 tomorrow...probably going to eat dinner right after work and then run at like 7:30.

First threshold workout of the summer.  Did 21 minutes, took a 3:15 interval, then did 7 more minutes.  I waited until 8 PM to run because it was 95 degrees with a heat index of over 100 this afternoon.  I felt mediocre on the warmup but then when I started running fast I felt great.  By the time I ran the weather was somewhat nice since it had cooled off about 10 degrees and there was no wind.  Finished with five strides (four short, one long) and a 10 minute cooldown.

GS: 2x16 Pushups, Miscellaneous abs
Ran 11 miles on a treadmill since it was 95 once again.  Not real fun, but I got it in.
Felt like going for a run when I got home from umpiring at 10:00, so I did.  Only went 4 - sorry Chris, it won't happen again.
Short run before a long day of driving around the state.  I was very tired and my legs felt like crap so I didn't go very far.
Felt a lot better than yesterday morning.  Weather was nice and cool.

Ran around Telulah Park before we left for Door County.  Legs felt alright.  Some kids playing disc golf tried to hit me with their frisbees...I laughed to myself as every time I'd easily move out of the way.  Damn kids.  Did strides afterward.  Tonight was the US national 5K and the Wisconsin guys dominated with a 1-2-3 sweep.  

GS: Pedestal 1x10

Did an easy workout on the trails at Peninsula State Park.  After a three mile warmup I did 13 one minute surges at about cross country race pace with one minute intervals.  This wasn't really taxing at all, just trying to stay in touch with running faster than my normal running pace.  There were a lot of bikers and walkers on the trails this morning and several of them felt the need to make comments regarding my pace as they either passed or got passed.

Took a break from my uneventful afternoon to squeeze in a double.  Ran my five mile loop around the Horseshoe Bay area and tried to stay in the grass as much as possible.  When I finished I thought we would be eating dinner shortly but my dad and brother decided to golf 18 holes instead of 9 so we didn't eat until around 8:15.  By this point I was extremely hungry.

First 15 miler of the summer.  Did it at Peninsula so that I could keep up my practice of doing my long runs on trails.  I woke up later than I intended so I didn't eat much before I left.  About four miles into the run I got hungry and started wondering whether I would be able to finish, but I just told myself not to think about it and after a little while the hunger went away.  I felt strong pretty much the whole way and was able to pick it up pretty well the last two miles.  Good week.

After the run I watched the USA v Brazil soccer match, the second half of which felt like a huge punch in the stomach.  At least we beat Spain, but it would have been awesome to finish off Brazil as well.  Then I watched the last day of the US track nationals which was disappointing because none of the races were exciting.  Webb didn't even show up for the 1500m and it ended up going out in 2:03.  Gotta give Ulrey credit for showing up and getting top 3, but he's at best the 10th or 11th best 1500m guy in the US right now.

Ran the usual morning loop.  I didn't time it but I was pounding basically from the start.  My legs felt good but for some reason I kept audibly scraping my feet on the ground and couldn't stop doing it.

Ran the extended Xavier after work.  The wind was in my face on the way out which slowed me down but when I turned around I started feeling really good.  On Fremont St I ran down David Saucerman and talked to him for a few minutes.  Finished with four strides.  Dinner was ready when I got in so I skipped general strength again.  Probably won't do much of that this week but starting next week I need to get back on it.

Ran through downtown.  It was cool and windy again.  My whole body was tired and I didn't really feel great at any point in the run.  Finished June with 335.5 miles (361.5 total for the summer), which is significantly more than I ran last June.  Two more months until camp, it seems so long.

Wasn't a good day.  I was scheduled for a 20 minute tempo and then a few faster intervals, but on the warmup my calves were incredibly tight and it hurt to run.  I stretched out before starting the tempo but that didn't do much.  By the 14 minute mark the burning in my calves was really slowing me down and my left foot was starting to go somewhat numb so I stopped and walked before jogging slowly back to my house (I was about a mile away).  Hopefully this was just a one day thing.

Ran a mile inside and stretched to try to get my calves loosened up, then did a six mile loop, 8 strides, then 10 more minutes.  I could still feel the tightness in my calves but it wasn't nearly as bad as yesterday.  I'm going to try to just run through it and hopefully it will go away.  After the run I drove up north.  I had a tire blow out near Stevens Point which added about an hour and a half to my trip, but I made it eventually.  We went to KD's to celebrate Kelly's birthday and Chris called me on the bar's land line after finding out I was there.  My cousins were confused.

Did a shorter long run this week.  I did an out and back on the route that we did our 16 miler on during camp last year (Hwy C south toward St Germaine) and turned around just past the Whitetail.  This gave me 12 and then I added on a mile at the start.  My calves felt fine at the start but tightened up about 20 minutes in.  Around 45 minutes it felt like my feet were falling asleep which was uncomfortable, but that only lasted like 10 minutes.  Finally when I got back on gravel the calves loosened up.  Spent the rest of the day out on the lake and was very tired when I went to bed at 11 PM.

Did an easy out and back from the cabin.  Randomly ran into Dr Hagen as he was out doing an 'easy' 50 mile bike ride.  This route was mostly uphill on the way out which meant the way back was really easy.  Calves still felt tight.  Against my better judgment I did the swim across the lake.  Thankfully my calves didn't lock up during it but it was not real comfortable.  When I finished my pulse felt like at the end of a race.  Swimming is tough.

Out and back to the North Star Lodge.  Just like yesterday the first part of the run was mostly uphill then I got to turn around and run back down.  Near the turnaround there was a hill that reminded me of Radar Hill.  Nothing exciting happened other than stopping twice to crap in the woods.  The pancakes I ate for lunch must not have agreed with me.  My calves felt much better - still noticeable but significantly improved.  I did five strides after the run.

Ran from the cabin to the Wolf Pack Cafe for breakfast.  Uncle Mark biked with me which was nice.  My legs felt awesome and I didn't feel anything in my calves!  The weather was great for running, about 60 degrees, and I had a solid pace going the entire way.  Great run.
Did a short stretch out run when I got home from the cabin.  Felt fine, once again didn't feel anything in my calves.  Hopefully this means the issue is behind me.

Ran my nine mile loop through downtown.  I felt some really slight discomfort in my calves a few times but it was nothing.  Other than that my legs felt good.  Saw Litsheim and Angela riding mopeds on Fremont St.

AT workout at High Cliff.  I ran 10 min, 10 min, 7 min segments with 2 minutes in between each.  I started too fast and I don't like to slow down on these workouts once I start so I had to adjust the plan to make sure the workout didn't get too difficult.  Wasn't feeling all that great since I sat around all day.  Finished up with two one minute runs at about 5K pace, it's easy to fake those.
Easy morning run.  Only went 4 because my mom wanted to go out for an early lunch and I didn't have much time.

Was planning on going 10 but when I reached the turn around I was feeling great so I continued out an extra mile.  Did an out and back on the CE Trail to Fieldcrest Drive.  I ran at like 8 PM and it was nice and cool.  My legs felt great and I ran sub 6:30 pace the entire way.  When I got home I was craving a Coke, but there weren't any in the fridge so I settled for a Miller High Life.

Ran at night again on the CE Trail into Kaukauna.  I didn't sleep much last night and was really tired all day but I decided to just get the long run over with tonight rather than potentially being tired from it on Monday when I take my exam.  I felt alright, just got a little worn out the last 3 or 4 miles.  I was still able to break it down though.  Got a lot of things yelled at me during the run, the ones worth remembering are below.

'I wish I had shorts like yours.'
'I want you!'
'Run Forrest Run!'  (said by a guy in his 20s driving a red convertible with a girl in the front seat)
'Why are you running so fast?'
'Put some clothes on, f@g!'
Easy run around town.  Did seven strides at the end.  Legs felt surprisingly good and my high stress levels contributed to a quick pace.

Not a very good run.  Went out to High Cliff, but I had barely anything to eat all day and got really hungry after about two miles.  I was planning on going 10 but as fate would have it I could see my car through the trees at about 7 and decided to just call it a day.  Didn't hit the volume I wanted to this week, but I'm decently happy with what I did get in.
Went for a morning run to relax before I left for Brookfield for the actuarial exam.  I didn't sleep well last night and was tired when I woke up.  After the run I felt better.

Did the Pierce/Lutz Parks loop.  I passed the exam!  Huge relief to have that over with, now hopefully my parents will loosen the reins for the second half of the summer.  Felt good on the run.  Then I drank beers and watched Prince Fielder win the Home Run Derby.

First intervals in two months.  This workout wasn't hard at all, I just wanted to get something quicker in before I race next weekend.  I did it on the Newberry Trail just like during interim break.  Felt relaxed the whole way and I definitely could have done more if I had wanted to.  Always a good sign.  While I was warming up a car pulled up next to me, slowed down to my speed, and started blasting some rap music.  I looked over and saw two high school kids rocking out and staring at me.  I gave them a thumbs up, and the driver said 'See you later!' and proceeded to stomp on the accelerator of his piece of junk and speed away.  I laughed about the immaturity of kids these days.  Did a shorter cool down so I could get home for the All Star Game.

Ran the Xavier loop at around 11 AM.  I woke up and did some work at home for a few hours then went for a run before going to the dealership for a  meeting.  I felt good for about the first nine miles then the last two were a bit of a struggle since I got hungry.  It was really warm out but not too humid so I was fine.
Morning run with a slight add on.  59 year old Tom Watson is leading the British Open...incredible.

Did a short warmup then did a 7 mile threshold run similar to what we used to do with Thunder.  I tried to go out slow but I still hit 11:57 at 2 miles, then was 23:41 at 4 (fourth mile is very hilly), then 5:30, 5:16, 5:15 for 39:42 total.  My legs felt tired warming up and didn't feel great during the workout but aerobically I felt relaxed.  It didn't get hard at all until the last 2-3 minutes.  Finished with strides and a cool down.  I'll probably do another one of these in a month or so.
Same morning run as yesterday

Did an eight mile Memorial loop in a light rain.  It felt good.  Legs were a little sore from last night's workout when I started but quickly loosened up.  I made a conscious effort to keep the pace slow.

Ran to the Neenah-Menasha YMCA and back.  It was only about 65 degrees which I liked since I have trouble doing long runs in the heat.  Felt great on the way out, then around 10 miles I got a little hungry, but then I got a second wind and carried it in with no problems.  The Telulah bridge hill at the 15 mile mark was 'fun.'  While running through Menasha I saw a bunch of places my grandparents used to talk about but I hadn't known where they actually were.

Easy run on the trails at High Cliff.  Mike Brice was out there so I ran with him for 15-20 minutes in the middle as he was finishing up.  Felt good, not too tired after the run yesterday.  Did six easy strides at the end.  Good week, now time for a down one to get ready for Shithouse.

Ran 10 through downtown Kimberly then changed into my flats for the last mile to start breaking them in.  The first four miles were awful because of tired legs and running straight into the wind.  Once I turned around I felt a little better.
Got going a little late so I had to cut the run a little short

Did a 20 minute tempo then 2 x 2 minutes fast.  It started raining right as I started the tempo but I kept going and felt really good the whole way.  Crossed the mile at 5:20 for my only split.  The 2 minute intervals at the end went well also, I was planning to run 5K pace but ended up doing them faster.  I hope I feel this good on Saturday.
Ran to Telulah Park, did a couple loops there, then came home.  Probably actually a little more than 7.  Felt good.
Easy run on the treadmill at like 11:00.  Watched an old Badger football game.  Felt good.

Did a nine mile loop through downtown then added a mile in my flats.  Legs felt a little tired today.  No big deal.  I was really sweaty when I finished.  I also managed to motivate myself to do abs and pushups.

Ran with Litsheim.  Our loop ended up being a little longer than intended but no big deal.  I felt alright.  Did the usual pre-race strides afterward.  Tomorrow's going to be a good one...especially after the race.

Ran up the bluff with most of the guys.  I was still really tired when Phil woke me up but after a granola bar and some water I came to.  The first 10 minutes of the run felt bad; after that I felt alright.  The climb to the top was tough as always.  I was surprised to see Varley and Prez come all the way up.  On the way down Chris and I were ahead of everyone else, I turned around to look at the other guys for a second and the next thing I knew I was headed off the road.  I basically ran right into a bunch of trees but didn't get hurt at all.  We took a few breaks on the way back to Pettibone which was nice.  The post-run shower was much better than last year's.
Easy morning run after a long night of sleep.  Legs were a little sore from running up the bluff yesterday.

Ran out and back down Memorial to Wisconsin.  I felt awful for about the first seven miles but then started feeling good.  Stopped at a gas station to poop.  In hindsight I shouldn't have worn a shirt.
Had my head set on doing 12 this afternoon and I didn't want more than 16 on the day so I cut this one short.  Felt awful so it ended up working out well.

As bad as I felt this morning I felt the exact opposite this afternoon.  Went to High Cliff straight from work.  When I got there Brice, Reader, and some others were hanging around in the parking lot after finishing runs so I talked with them for a few minutes.  Pace was fast in the second half, probably got down around 6:10 pace.  I need to stop doing that.  Also found out today that Favre is going to stay retired rather than play for the Vikings.  Good decision Brett.

Ran a loop down by the Fox River with Boyd.  He seemed to be doing ok through the halfway point but then as we came up to the six mile mark he said that he had to stop and I should continue on without him.  I took an extended route back to his house and then he got back about a minute after me.  He told me he's getting his ears pierced tomorrow.  Legs felt mediocre today.

Did a long run on the Wiouwash Trail in Oshkosh.  It was fun to go to a new place.  The trail was out in the middle of nowhere, crushed gravel surface, and pretty much completely flat.  I only saw three or four other people the whole time I was running.  All the miles are marked which was nice.  Felt great the entire way, and I picked it up quite a bit on the way back for a 2+ minute negative split (52:45/50:30).  The last couple miles felt like a 10K in the sense that I just kept grinding it out.  Before I left for work I set the oven on timed bake to have my dinner done at 7:00, but my afternoon meeting went an hour later than it was supposed to and I finished running at 6:40 and was over 25 miles away.  I raced home as fast as possible and got home at 7:01.
Tough to get out of bed this morning

Ran a loop down Memorial then did strides and finished with some barefoot jogging on the grass.  Saw a post about me on Letsrun right before I started that got me going for about the first mile.  Legs were a bit tired from yesterday but not terrible, and the strides felt good.  11 mile throwdown tomorrow night with Taylor and Brice.

Ran with Taylor, Brice, and Thomas at High Cliff.  After getting Brice's text message that just said '7 mile tempo at High Cliff' I was expecting some sort of monster workout and felt sort of let down when I found out we would only be running 5:45 pace.  I felt pretty good for most of it...my stomach had a few rough minutes in the middle thanks to the banana I ate right before but my legs felt fine throughout.  Thomas dropped out at 20 minutes, then Brice stopped at about 36:30 to take a shit, and Taylor and I finished the 7 in 40:25.  We did a two mile warmup and cooldown.  After the run we went to Brice's house and jumped in the lake.  I have a giant blood blister under one of my toenails on my left foot.  It doesn't bother me while running but looks disgusting and hurts when touched.  Not sure what I'm going to do about it.

Ran the Pierce & Lutz parks loop with an add on.  Felt pretty dead for the second half of the run, and while I was running I realized that I had eaten barely anything between last night's run and this one.  Got it in though and set a new PR for weekly mileage.

I'm pretty sure I had the most fucked up dream I've ever had last night and when I woke up I was in a fog that I couldn't shake for a really long time so the first half of my day sucked.  Went out to High Cliff after work to escape the heat and pavement.  Felt alright, nothing exciting happened.  Thinking about running a two mile race on Saturday, it will probably be a game time decision.
Usual morning loop.  For the first time in a few days I felt rested when I woke up.  Less than five minutes after I finished it started raining really hard.

Got the idea for this workout from Craig Macpherson's log.  I did a warmup then 3 x 3 min @ race effort with a 2 minute jog in between, 8 x 15 seconds all out with 45 second jog, then another 3 x 3 min.  It was pretty easy aerobically.  I felt awkward during the sprints after not going all out since May.  Only did like an 8 minute cool down because I didn't want any more volume today.
Legs were a little sore, probably from sprinting yesterday.  Spent about half the run thinking about what the results would look like if all the good guys in the Appleton area raced a 5K.

I was supposed to run with Boyd at 5:30...when I got to his house the only person there was his sister.  Turns out he forgot.  So I came home and ran alone.  Did a Telulah Park run and felt pretty good.  I think I'm adjusting well to the mileage, just have to stay on top of my sleeping.
Felt great this morning, much better than yesterday

Did not feel real 'chipper' as Pez would say but the workout went ok.  Did a 24 minute tempo run where I split my first mile in 5:30 and then probably ran about the same pace the rest of the way.  Maybe picked it up a little bit in the second half.  This wasn't real hard, just felt a little flat.  Afterward I did barefoot strides on the field behind Horizons.  Two girls that were probably about 12 came up and asked if they could run with me.  I said sure...one of them fell over after less than ten steps and the other started laughing so hard she soon stopped.  I tried not to laugh myself and simply walked over to my shoes, put them on, and left.

Ran at High Cliff in the rain.  There was nobody else out there, I guess a downpour isn't the choice time of very many people to go for a walk/run.  Legs felt alright but I was really hungry for almost the entire run.  This was weird because I ate a pretty big lunch.  Did strides at the end.

I was going to race a two mile this morning but it was raining very hard when I woke up and I ended up not going.  Bad decision.  Around 4 PM I went out just intending to go 'long.'  I started out towards Neenah and since I felt good I decided I might as well try to make it to Riverside Park.  Made it there and then took a longer route home since one of the roads I ran on to get there wasn't very safe.  It was a 17 mile loop and after about 85 minutes the hot temps and high humidity got to me.  I felt fine at 13 miles, was struggling a little bit at 14, struggling a lot at 15, and toast at 16.  At this point I stopped and made the walk of shame home.  I also took a 5 Hour Energy shot this morning.  An hour after taking it I fell asleep for about 90 minutes...guess it didn't do anything for me.
Easy day.  Way too hot to run outside so I did a short run on the treadmill and then a couple general strength circuits.  Felt fine.
Easy morning shakeout.  Not really sure why I didn't go 5, too lazy I guess.

Ran out at High Cliff and did the same route I've done the past couple weeks when I've done 12 milers out there.  Felt good almost the whole time despite the Chinese food I ate for lunch.  Ran into Brice with about 15 minutes left so we finished up together.

I was really tired all afternoon and almost fell asleep about 15 minutes before heading out.  Once I started running though I felt fine.  Went to the Banta Bowl Hill and did 11 repeats.  There's a bunch of construction going on by the hill right now so I probably wasn't supposed to be running there, but this is the only decent hill around so since there was nobody there I just did it anyway.  Ran the hills hard but not all out.  I was breathing hard at the end of each repeat but recovered quickly.  Felt pretty good throughout.  Excited for camp and the season.
Ran in Appleton before leaving for Door County.  Despite eating a cream filled doughnut for breakfast I felt good.  Pretty humind this morning.

Did an out and back on Bay Shore Drive.  It was nice having the breeze come off the bay.  Didn't eat much for lunch so I was a little hungry but nothing terrible.  Did a 20 second change of pace at the turn around and then four strides @ 8K pace at the end.  Might go for 100 this week.
Ran to downtown Egg Harbor and back.  I got a really good night's sleep last night so I felt good even with all the mileage.  The big hill by the beach club kicked my ass as usual.

Did my five mile tour of the Horseshoe Bay property.  Stopped a half mile from the house and did barefoot strides and some jogging on grass.  The first 100 meters of the run was pretty rough but I quickly got into it.  Nice win by the Brew Crew this afternoon.

Terrible, terrible run.  Went to Peninsula planning to go long, but my stomach was unsettled and had me feeling awful by the two mile mark.  For most of the run I felt like I had to puke and I had to stop a couple times for a minute or so.  Ended up calling it a day at 10.

Ran around Horseshoe Bay before driving back to Appleton.  It was really hot but the heat didn't bother me too badly.  My stomach felt much better than yesterday.  Legs were a little tired but ok.  Went to the first Packers exhibition game tonight...it was great to start off with a shutout win, even in a meaningless game.

Ran at High Cliff.  Felt a lot better than the past couple days, almost back to normal I think.  Once I get through the GRE tomorrow I'll be able to catch back up on sleep.  It was really humid but for once it didn't phase me.  When I got done my shorts were as wet as if I'd gone swimming - it was gross.  Watched the 100m final from Worlds right before running and I think Bolt's 9.58 pumped me up because I started off very quick.  The guy is inhuman...blew Tyson Gay out of the water even though Gay ran the third fastest time ever.  I unintentionally scared an old lady walking by herself while coming up from behind and almost felt bad about it for a second but then decided she should be paying more attention to her surroundings.  Did two 20 second pickups toward the end of the run.
Down week this week so I'm cutting the distance of my morning runs.  Snuck this one in before leaving to take the GRE.
Downtown loop.  Felt good, just got a little hungry toward the end since I didn't eat much all day.  Legs are coming back.  Four strides afterward.

Back up in Door County.  Did a 20 minute tempo on the lower part of Highway G, walked up the hill for a rest, and then did two more miles.  I felt strong on the first segment, and it was nice to run faster again after several days of just regular runs.  There was a headwind on the way out and a tailwind on the way back so that helped me get about 20 seconds past the starting point.  On the second part I went out in 5:30 then turned around and came back in 5:09.  Didn't feel hard at all.  Short cool down so I could get home in time for Brett Favre's press conference with the Vikings.  I hope the Packers' new 3-4 defense knocks his ass out on October 5th.
Easy shakeout.  Ate a huge dinner so I felt a little bloated but no problems.  Nice race Sanya :)

Last solo long run of the summer, and the longest one I'll do.  Did it at Peninsula - two laps of an 8.5 mile loop.  The first lap I didn't feel all that good but as the run went on I gradually started feeling better.  Ironically the last mile of the whole thing felt the best and I picked it up a bit.  Had the song Fireflies by Owl City stuck in my head for a long time.  The 1500m final was anticlimactic as Lagat and Kiprop both ran with horrible tactics.  I was impressed with the South African woman (or maybe not?) that destroyed everyone with a 1:55.
Short day #1.  Waited until 5:15 to run, just kept putting it off.  Felt alright, it was weird to run over 70 minutes less than yesterday.  Bolt 19.19!!!
Did an out and back on Highway B.  It was borderline cold this morning, only like 60 degrees.  Legs felt pretty good and I even ran all the way up the giant hill by the beach club.
Easy run right before dinner.  The US guys screwed up in the 4x100 again...pathetic.  Did strides afterward and felt sort of fast haha.

This was an easy workout.  I was trying to run 5:00 pace on the intervals and think I did a good job of that, but with 2:00 rest I was always fully recovered by the start of the next one.  I underestimated the distance I would cover during the actual workout so I ended up running 11 miles instead of 10 since I wanted to do more than a 3 minute cool down.  1000 miles for the summer!

Short day #2 to finish off the down week.  Still got in more miles than I intended this week, but I feel like I recovered a good bit.  Ran after watching the Worlds 5K, which was awesome.  Bekele is definitely the greatest of all time, and Lagat ran exceptionally well too.  Last day in Appleton for the summer...I'm excited for the year but at the same time a little sad to be leaving.
Last run in Appleton.  Felt good despite it being the earliest I had gone for a run in quite some time.  Did a few strides at the end.

Ran at Olaf with some of the new freshmen, Rivers, and Varley.  The other guys had gone 10-12 miles this morning so they stopped after 4 or 5 and I continued on by myself.  Ran on the course the entire time.  Feels good to be back.  Camp tomorrow!
