Ran a slightly extended cross campus by myself.  Started in a downpour but it stopped raining when I got behind the stadium.  Saw some people from the women's team out running.
Did an out and back from the cabin after unloading the van.  We went through downtown Sayner.  I did two extra miles at the end after stopping to crap.

Went 12 with Pez, BTW, Tumnus, and Ben Bayer.  We ran from the old Junction 155 past the Crystal Lake campground.  Felt great the entire time and we probably had a sub 6:30 pace going for a couple miles.  Lots of different conversations that made the time pass really quickly.
Easy shakeout run with everyone.  Did strides and about five extra minutes at the end.  Karaoke night at KD's!

Started from the same place as yesterday but ran the opposite direction toward St Germaine.  The workout was really easy and I felt great the entire time.  BTW, Dobuol, and I finished together and the others weren't far behind.  The path we did this on had a lot of rolling hills which were nice except for a few steep downhills.
Afternoon shakeout run from the cabin.  Only run of the week where I felt a bit tired.  Afterward we had a classy dinner of spaghetti, garlic bread, salad, and wine outside on the picnic table.

It was raining when we woke up so it took a little extra motivation to go run but we got it done.  After the first 10 minutes I stopped noticing the rain and felt good.  Talked about making a team calendar - we've talked about this every year I've been on the team but never actually done it.

Tumnus and Pez went out to run during a thunderstorm and I stayed inside to finish watching Apollo 13.  An hour later the rain had stopped so I went out by myself.  Felt good so I went a little longer.  I think I was inspired by Ritz's 12:56.  I also broke my cell phone this afternoon by dropping it on some bricks.

Ran in the arb with some guys after the drive back to Northfield.  Didn't feel that great, but not terrible either.  Also had a team meeting with Lundin where he told us to 'Be prudent, use discretion, and not do anything stupid caused by getting shitfaced.'

Pez and I ran 5 miles on the course before practice, then met up with most of the team and ran Lando's Mom.  The team as a whole looks really fit.  I felt good the entire time but after the run ended I got really tired.  Radar Hill put the hurt on some people.

Thus concludes summer training.  Stats are below.
1,117 total miles (895.5 at this time last year)
95 days, 129 runs (0 days off)
Average miles per day: 11.8
Average miles per week: 82.3
Weeks over 80: 9  Over 90: 4  Over 100: 1
Runs of 15 miles of longer: 7
This summer was definitely the best base period I've ever had, so now it's time to make it translate into a strong season.  Last year I got injured in September and my season was shot.  If I can do everything possible to keep myself healthy my other goals should fall into place.  83 days til Nationals, let's go get it!

As dictated by Griff we ran on 'the gravel roads NW of campus.'  Started off with everyone and people turned around at various points.  I think 7 guys went 10.  We ran pretty quick on the way back, sub 6:30s for a while.  Pretty uneventful run and my legs feel really tired.

Two miles with the team, then we separated and did 8 x 60 seconds and 8 x 30 seconds with equal recovery.  Dobuol and I ran together.  We covered just about 4 miles in the 23:30 so our average pace was fast.  I felt strong throughout and it was nice to run faster than regular running pace.  8 minute cooldown, we were ready to be done.

Did an out and back on the old threshold course.  I went 12 Rivers, Pez, Dobuol, and Tumnus.  A group of us separated from the pack early on.  Felt good the entire time.  Saw Paul Nichol pumping iron when we got back.
Did cross campus with the team.  It was a fun run, nice to relax a bit after the past couple days of pounding.  We saw Dave Ricks by the library and he was amused by our yelling.

Ran the short arb loop with just about everybody.  We decided to go shorter because of the workout this afternoon.  Felt good, got a good night of sleep last night after team 2010's win in the bowling tournament.

3 mile warmup, 2+ mile cooldown

Ran a 20 minute tempo on the course by myself then 3 x 1 minute at 5K pace.  The other guys did something else but Griff and I decided it would be best for me to do this since my last couple workouts have all been shorter intervals.  I split an 81 for the first 400 and then didn't take any other splits.  Since I definitely didn't feel like I slowed down I'd say I averaged 5:25s.  Felt alright, the last couple minutes my legs were getting tired (as would be expected) but my breathing was never a problem.  Pez and I saw three deer on the back section of the course while cooling down.  After the cooldown I went inside and collapsed on the mat.  After tomorrow I'll be cutting mileage back to something more reasonable.

Went out to Nerstrand.  Green came to run with us so I did most of the run with him and Chris.  Didn't sleep very well last night so I was tired at the start but by the end I was fine.  Kept the pace easy the entire time.

Easy run on the course.  Talked about baseball with Steve Krouse for about the first half hour, then everyone but Dobuol and I went in and we continued for 10 more minutes.  I took a 90 minute nap this afternoon and felt great on the run.  Not looking forward to 6:30 AM practice tomorrow.
Easy run at 6:30 AM on the course.  It was foggy out and we saw the sun rise.  Felt ok.  Ate a big breakfast in the caf afterward.

After about a two hour nap I went for another easy run.  I decided to do a little experiment and am going to see how I feel racing the day after doing some faster stuff.  I did 3 30 second surges and 1 60 second surge at 5K pace with equal recovery.  Drank Endurox after.  Tomorrow should be fun.
Awesome performance by the team overall...last year we only had 2 guys break 17 and today we had 9 or 10 even with BTW and Pez not running.  I'd say we're looking pretty good.

Did an arb run with Dobuol, Schwock, and Massey.  Pez and Ben Bayer started with us but went back a little early.  I felt fine for about the first hour then my legs felt tired the last couple miles.  Time to start cutting mileage.

First long workout in several months.  We did it on the gravel roads SW of campus.  I felt alright and made it through the workout fine but afterward I was really tired.  We ran the first two miles of the tempo in a big group, spread out a bit during the next 15 minutes, and then Adrian, Nuss, Massey, and I packed up for the shorter stuff.  Took a three hour nap this afternoon.  This workout brought back flashbacks to a year ago today when after a workout on these same roads I was put on the shelf with stress fractures.
Ran the extended Iron Bridge loop with a group of six.  We ran fairly slow after a night of festivities.  Nothing exciting happened.

Ran Short Ostrich with Reid.  We ran pretty quick.  It was really humid out.  Did five barefoot strides on the indoor track after.  Feeling pretty tired, don't think I'll be doing any more three day benders any time soon.

Another interval workout on the course.  Ran with Dobuol and Jean Claude Pez Pierre Van Damme Lambert.  Dobuol dropped out about halfway with some breathing issues so Pez and I finished together.  I felt strong the entire way and actually felt better at the end than at the beginning.  The last couple intervals I wanted to open it up a bit but I resisted the urge.  Good confidence booster after Saturday and Monday.  This was our first practice with the entire team - looks like we have 35 guys including about 16 freshmen...I don't know how I'll ever remember all of their names.
First 'late night' shakeout of the school year.  Felt great.
Easy run on the course.  Saw Paul Nichol out running.

It was very hot and humid but instead of letting us run in the arb in the shade Phil and Griff made us run on the dirt roads NW of campus.  It was dumb; this isn't high school, we should be able to pick our own routes.  Nuss, Varley, Paille and I turned around early for eight.  Felt fine, pace was really relaxed.

Long run in the arb(s) with an extension out to the radio tower in the middle.  Ran with Pez, Tumnus, and Rivers for most of the run and then finished with Pez.  Felt alright, good to get a long one in.  Very hot and humid.  After I finished I drank about 50 ounces of water in the next 20 minutes.

Easy run to the Iron Bridge with some of the guys that didn't go to the meet.  Felt pretty tired, didn't sleep very well last night.  Saw John Davis running ahead of us.  The guys that raced did pretty well, I'm excited for when we put the whole team together next weekend.

Ran Cornhole to Canada with Tumnus at around 4:45.  I remembered how much I love this route in the fall and spring when we can run back through the arb.  Good conversation the entire way and my legs felt pretty good despite waking up at 5:15 AM.  Finished up with a few strides on the indoor track.  Another 90 mile week in the books, now it's time to race!
Easy shakeout run on the NW roads.  Felt pretty good despite a lack of sleep.

Did some 1000s on the prairie loop with a few timed intervals in the middle.  I ran with Pez, BTW, Schwock, and Tumnus (Dobuol didn't do the workout).  The first one was really slow because we couldn't get the pacing down but after that they were right on and I felt strong.  I had the urge to run the last one really fast but Griff told me not to.  The only annoying thing about this workout was Daymont driving a gator around and blowing dust in our faces.

Ran 50 minutes slow on the course.  Had a sore throat and stuffy nose all day and felt pretty bad on the run.  Before practice 3 time Olympian Jim Spivey gave a 50 minute presentation that I really liked.

I was pretty sick today so I didn't do the prescribed workout and instead went to the Arb by myself and did something significantly easier.  I did 2 x 6 min @ tempo effort, 1 x 5 min @ tempo effort, 1 x 2 min @ race effort, 2 x 1 min @ race effort.  I think it was 90 seconds between everything except for the last two intervals, but I don't remember for sure.  Pace was probably slow because I felt really tired.
Ran Ostrich plus an extension on the course.  Didn't feel that great at the start of the run but gradually got better and felt strong at the end.  I slept over 10 hours last night so that was nice.

Had a somewhat epic cross campus run with the entire team.  There was a crowd gathered around the library that witnessed our screaming and then Tumnus hit the sign in front of many witnesses.  Phil and Griff were waiting for us behind the stadium once again to prevent urination.  After the short run we did the 'Last Beer' in the basement of Lincoln Manor.  Despite our team of 35 people we were only able to finish half of a 30 rack of Schmidt because so many people chose to drink lemonade...disappointing.  Feeling better than yesterday but still don't have much energy.  Hopefully tomorrow will be better.

'Day before race' run on the course with the entire team.  I felt alright the first 15 minutes then felt awful the rest of the time.  I was light headed and my stomach felt weird.  Did the usual strides and didn't feel good on those either.  I have no idea what to expect tomorrow.
Had another shitty workout, this is really getting old.  I don't feel sick anymore but my body is devoid of all energy.  Don't know what to do about it.

Ran on the NW dirt roads.  The weather was nice and cool, I wore a shirt on a run for the first time in forever.  Felt pretty good until the last five minutes when my lack of breakfast caught up to me.

Ran to the radio tower and back with Tumnus and Brian Tomlinson.  Finally felt good!  The entire team (including a random kid training for a marathon) started together and then people turned off at various points.  We rolled the whole way back at about 6 minute pace but I was fine with it.  Weather was nice again, maybe it's finally fall.  Did a med ball circuit afterward with Lundin and it was a laugh a minute.
Same route as yesterday.  Stayed up until all hours of the night having a family meeting with my podmates so I was a little tired starting off but I made it just fine.

Pretty easy workout on the course.  Ran with BTW, Nuss, and Massey and felt relaxed the whole time.  We wore spikes for the 30 second intervals and got going pretty fast.  I'm getting my confidence back and starting to feel like I did a few weeks ago again.
Cornhole to Canada with the entire team.  We ran fairly slow.  Legs weren't feeling so hot today, nothing to be concerned about though.

Did Snipe by myself in the rain after my first class.  I felt progressively better as the run went on which was nice.  They put in a sidewalk on Woodley so this winter we won't almost get killed every day.  Finished with strides on the indoor track.  The rest of the day I didn't feel all that good.

I went out on Ostrich and connected it to the arb where I ran a couple loops to get the required amount of time.  This was a somewhat intense long run in 40-50 mph wind gusts and rain.  A couple times I thought I was going to get blown off the road.  My legs were tired from the race yesterday but I got through the run without any problems.

We did a six mile out and back progressive tempo on the dirt roads northwest of campus.  The first mile was supposed to be in 6:30 but Dobuol and I f-ed it up big time and ran a 5:37 instead which kind of screwed up the workout, but whatever.  The third mile was straight into a headwind which was horrible.  Course was somewhat hilly.  I went 5:37, 5:55, 5:40, 5:20, 5:18, 5:10 for a total time of 33:00.  Dobuol and I were together at the turn around but then he ran his last two in 5:05, 4:50.  Felt pretty good during the workout but then on the cooldown my knee locked up.  I iced it afterward and it feels fine now so hopefully tomorrow I won't notice anything.
Ran on the course.  Felt great but it was not warm.
Ran in the Arb with everyone then turned back early with Perk and Tomlinson.  Spent most of the run talking about the Todd.  Weather feels like fall now.  Feeling good.
Out and back on the NW roads.  I wore tights.  Up too late doing math homework last night.

This workout in and of itself wasn't too hard but I could feel the cumulative fatigue of everything I've done since Saturday.  It would have helped a lot to have someone to run with.  The 1000s were a little slower than I wanted but the effort was definitely there, so when I'm more rested I'll have no problem hitting what I want.  Relaxed a little bit on the timed intervals but still was moving well.  Overall I'll take this.

Weather was horrible so decided to make today my easy day.  We ran Burner as a team and it sucked because of a driving rain and lightning.  When we got back to Tostrud I did another half hour on the upstairs track, which also wasn't very fun but at least I stayed dry.  The course in Eau Claire is going to be sloppy tomorrow, glad I'm not running.

Ran at the Eau Claire meet.  I felt good after about an hour so I decided I might as well just get my long run in rather than waiting until tomorrow.  I liked watching the race, and the guys that ran did pretty well.  I'm excited for when we put the entire team together in two weeks, it should be good.  It was kind of a 'trip from hell' because Griff missed the exit to the course and then someone locked the keys inside one of the vans so a bunch of people had to run in their trainers (and with other people's chips) on a wet course.

Ran at Big Woods.  I ran with Rivers, Massey, Schwock, and Ben Bayer.  Weather wasn't very nice once again but we were protected from the rain by the trees.  I almost fell going down some wooden stairs which would have been pretty bad.  Felt tired the first half, not too bad the second.
Ran at like 9 PM.  The weather wasn't very nice but my legs felt good and I had fun.  Did a few pickups toward the end.

Ran the Jefferson loop by myself because one Christopher Rivers stood me up after his night of festivities.  My legs felt good and I ran pretty fast for most of the run.  Did strides on the Ytterboe lawn afterward.  Looking forward to a tough week of practice.
Easy morning shakeout.  Just getting loosened up before the workout this afternoon.

We did 5 x mile on the dirt roads northwest of campus.  Started off with Dobuol for the first two, then he gapped me on the third one so I ran the last two by myself.  Felt really strong and it was great to put down a hard workout since we really haven't done that many.  The miles all had some sort of hill but none were too bad.  I kind of died the last minute of the fifth one...it would have been nice to break 5 twice, but oh well.  After finishing the 30 second intervals I was very tired and glad to be done.  The last half of the workout was done in a steady rain.  Pretty much everyone ran well today, a good confidence booster for Jim Drews next weekend.

Ran Bryce Wandrey to Woodley with Rivers and Dr Steve Krouse.  It was raining and my hands froze.  We talked about baseball for a lot of the run.  Picked it up the last mile or so in order to get back inside the warm building.  I felt pretty good after an evening of unhealthy food and Miller Lite.

Ran with Chris on the upstairs track after the Twins game (one of the top 6 or 7 baseball games I've ever seen).  There were some strange characters working out, which I suppose would be expected at 9:30 PM.  First run ever in Asics shoes, so far I like them.  Finished off the night with a shower beverage and then eating a hunk of summer sausage in the pod.

Very difficult workout.  We did it on the first pond loop.  The hill on the backside made things interesting since it came in the last 200 of every 800 and every other 400.  I ran the 800s with Dobuol and in hindsight that probably wasn't a very good idea because I ran them too fast and wasn't able to finish the workout (was supposed to do 2 more 400s and 4 more 200s).  The 8s felt good but by the time we finished them I was already tired and on the 4s I had to work harder than I should have.  The 200s were easy.  Glad this is done, now I get to pull a super late night doing a take home test and getting ready for another in class test.
8 mile arb loop with a big group then 4 miles on the course by myself.  Nothing really exciting happened.  Legs felt good and it was finally sunny.
Usual out and back NW roads run.  25 degrees out this morning, needed to wear tights, under armour turtleneck, and a hat.  Too early for this.

Ran to the Iron Bridge with a detour on the way out to sing to the football team.  After the first 20 minutes we did 8 40 second surges randomly spread out over the course of the middle 20 minutes, then had about a 22 minute cool down.  I felt alright, it was nice to take a 2 hour nap this afternoon.  After the workout we went back inside Tostrud and picked up Bro and Gary and took them out to the pond where they got to jump in as punishment for skipping the Press Box Breakfast.  The women's team stole all of our clothes before practice and wore them, but since I didn't turn in any laundry yesterday they didn't get anything of mine.

Long run in the Arbs/to the radio tower.  Tumnus, Rivers, and I went 15, and Josh Wold and Brian Tomlinson ran with us for about the first 65 minutes before heading back.  There was a covering of snow when I woke up and it was cold.  It felt like December.  I felt good for the first 85 minutes and then the last 15 I was ready to be done.  Had a nice long hot shower afterward.

Ran Arb 8 with Rivers after the soccer game.  We ran kind of fast but I felt alright.  Chris had to poop in the Carleton gymnasium so I did strides on the soccer practice field during that.  I stayed up until 4:30 AM last night watching the World Championships Half Marathon, which was a sweet race but probably not the best decision.

Because of snow we couldn't run on the course, so we did this on dirt roads, starting at the turnoff for the old 5.5 mile tempo.  Dobuol took off without me so I ran by myself, which was probably a good thing so that I didn't strain.  At the end of the 6 minute interval we encountered an angry dog that attacked just about all of us.  I panicked and sprinted away...it was one of the most terrifying experiences of my running career.  Bro was not so lucky and got bit on the thigh.  Luckily he's not really hurt, but now we have to hope the dog isn't rabid.  After this incident we decided to change the plan and not run an out and back so that we wouldn't have to go past the dog again.  Instead we turned on 19 and shortly after turned north on Holyoke.  Because of this we were 30 minutes away from school when the workout ended so we got to enjoy a nice long cooldown.  The roads were pretty muddy and we were all quite dirty when we finished.  Overall I felt really strong today and the workout went well...I hope I feel this good on Saturday because if I do it will be a good one.
Ran cross campus with Rivers at 10 AM.  We went out pretty fast for the first mile and a half and then slowed down a little but not very much.  Felt alright.

Relaxed short arb loop.  Started off with everybody then ran back with Nuss, Varley, Perk, Debbie, and Klein.  Frankie didn't realize we were going shorter so he ran back with us and then decided he wanted to add on more.  Really pumped to race on Saturday, just got to get my sleep between now and then.
Ran after my econometrics test.  I rolled my ankle pretty bad about halfway through and it still kind of hurts.

Did this workout on the prairie loop.  I didn't feel that great all day and the workout felt harder than it should have.  Dobuol and I ran the mile and the 800s together then instead of doing a 3rd 8 I decided to just do 2 faster 400s.  Ankle was really sore when I got done, I really hope this is just a one day thing.  After the workout we harassed the hell out of Chris Massey and got him really riled up.  I'm still excited for Saturday, not going to let this get me down at all.
Jefferson Loop by myself.  Nobody was really in the mood to run today so when most of the team turned off for cross campus I just continued on solo.  Felt really good the last half of the run.

Easy pre meet run by myself at 10 AM.  Ran on the course and did strides off the starting line.  I got a good night's sleep last night and my legs felt good on the run.  Time to race like I'm capable of.

Ran Lando's Mom with Rivers, Massey, BTW, Pez, and Adrian, then added cross campus with a couple of them, then Massey and I finished up with 20 minutes on the course for 15.  Legs felt kind of tired from the race yesterday but the weather was awesome.  Finally a break from dreariness and rain.  This was my last 15 miler of the season, now I'll cut my long runs back a little bit.  I did a projection of the regional meet based on various results from yesterday - I ended up 11th individually and our team was 7th.  Need to work to change both of those over the course of the next month.

Legs didn't feel very good after the race and long run over the weekend.  Aerobically I never struggled during the workout so I guess that's a good sign.  The first half mile of the first interval was uphill then we went down for a good portion of the rest of it.  By far the easiest sub 5:00 I've ever run, and since I started late I got to chase down most of the team.  The next mile wasn't very fun.  We were supposed to do a 1200 after the mile but I didn't think I had that in me so I cut it out.  During the first 800 I had a really negative attitude and just wanted to stop, and then on the 2nd one I decided to see how fast I could run while keeping it relaxed.  On the way back there was a car in the ditch - Griff saw it happen and said that the guy was driving down the hill way too fast.  The driver also doesn't have a driver's license and tried to flee the scene before Griff convinced him to stay.  I wonder what's going to happen next Monday...
Ran some neighborhood loops with Krouse.  Talked about sports the entire run.  I slept really hard last night.

Iron Bridge with Rivers, Pez, BTW, Reid, Massey, and Debbie.  Legs felt sluggish.  We were instructed to do an 8 minute pickup in the middle but all of us were too tired to do it.  Skipped general strength.

Because it rained all day we switched today's workout to Friday and moved Friday's hill workout to today.  I was happy for the switch as I'm still feeling tired and didn't know how I'd do in the workout.  Ran 2 campus hill loops with the team - BTW, Massey, and I were in front on most of the hills.  Felt alright, the hills got me working hard, but they always do.  Finished with six 100 meter strides, 2 prairie loops, and an indoor mile.

Phil and Griff went to watch some high school meet this afternoon so we didn't have organized practice.  I went down at 3:45 and a couple other guys were there.  Did the same run as Tuesday - Iron Bridge out and back.  Felt alright, still a little tired.

Well, I got sucked into going to the bar last night and also woke up with a sore throat, so I was a little worried about the workout, but I ended up feeling good.  Did it on the upstairs track because I couldn't motivate myself to run in 30 degrees, wind, and rain/snow.  Changed the plan a little bit but still accomplished about the same thing.  My pace on the last two intervals was around 4:35/mile and it felt really smooth and easy, so I hope I'm finally coming around.
Ran a quick 4 at like 11 PM on the treadmill at home.  Not really sure why I did this, but I felt alright.  The weather on my drive home was terrible and it took 6 1/2 hours when it usually takes 5.

Did an out and back on the CE trail to Kaukauna.  It was finally a nice day - about 50 degrees and sunny.  Still have a sore throat but I don't have any other symptoms and it's no worse than yesterday.  I'm going to take tomorrow really easy so that and some good sleep should knock out whatever it is.  Felt pretty good on the run, I've gotten used to doing long runs with other people though so it got kind of boring.

Nice easy run, didn't get out until 5:00 and did the 7 mile Memorial loop.  Felt fine.  Good Sunday...Packers won, Vikings lost, Bears lost.  Now I just need to make some progress on my take home test.

Ran along the Fox River and then through downtown and added a mile at the end.  Ate a large meal at Applebees about 90 minutes before running so my stomach was a little uncomfortable but nothing too bad.  Did strides at the end and my legs felt really good.  It was raining again...
Short shakeout run before driving back.  Just wanted to loosen up since we have a workout this afternoon.

Last workout before conference.  I was a little stiff after driving 5 hours so I added a few minutes onto the warmup and did ballistics and strides before starting.  Wanted to run the mile hard, which I did.  It was downwind with two uphills and two downhills (probably a slight net drop), but I'll take 4:48 in trainers all by myself in a workout.  A dog ran after me for a good portion of the 800 but unlike the pitbulls from a few weeks ago I could tell this one was harmless.  Feeling good, excited to race.
Easy morning run on the course.  I had an absolutely terrible headache last night and still didn't feel that good this morning.

Short arb loop with basically the entire team.  Was light headed and my stomach was uncomfortable for the entire run.  My back is also a little sore.  Hopefully all this stuff goes away by Saturday.  Toward the end of the run we saw Thunder walking Lucy - it was good to see him again.

Jefferson loop with Rivers in a light rain.  Felt really good and the run went by fast since we were talking the entire time.  We almost got hit by a lady that rolled well into an intersection before stopping at a stop sign.  Did three barefoot strides on the indoor track.

Cross campus with the team, then Rivers and I added on a little on the course, then strides and some light jogging on the indoor track.  Had multiple encounters with the Carleton team.  Felt really good, I'm ready to run this thing!

After a horrible conference party I was woken up by a text message at 7 AM and decided that I might as well get up and run since I had a full day of activities.  Did Cornhole to Jefferson with an extension to get to 90 minutes.  Felt alright, a little sore from the race but that's expected.  For a lot of the run I kept flashing back to Bauer and Sathre pulling away from me in the last 600 and also seeing the numbers 61 and 66.

We ran 4.5 miles northwest of campus, turned around and did a 3 mile tempo with the wind, and then finished the run for a cool down.  I was the last person to start and ended up chasing everyone down.  5:13, 5:11, 5:19 for 15:43 total.  The times seem kind of fast but when you consider that the first two miles were downwind and also had some nice downhills it was the right effort.  Felt relaxed the entire time.  Starting to get over the race.
Ran in the arb by myself.  Added some on our course before I went over there.  It was great weather this morning, good run.

Between when I got down to the locker room and when we started running it started raining.  A minute after we got outside someone suggested running inside, and nobody objected so that's what we did.  Did 5 on the upstairs track - Massey, BTW, and I ran about 10 steps ahead of everyone else to avoid the traffic.  After the run we had an epic green monster competition that ended in a tie at 13-13.  I hit one HR to finish my college career with a total of 2.

Last long workout of the season.  We did it in the Carleton Arb since our course is all roped off for the state meet on Saturday.  Ran solo but BTW, Massey, and Pez were pretty close behind.  Legs didn't feel all that great but I still finished everything no problem.  Tried to run the 1 minute intervals hard since that should simulate the end of the race which was where I struggled on Saturday.  It's all downhill from here pretty much...

Ran around the course before and during Karhu.  Felt a little run down so I didn't do as much as I had been planning on.  The guys looked solid winning with 22 points.  To hold out 12 of our top 14 and still go 2-3-4-6-7 says a lot about the depth of our team.  We had a campus wide power outage for about 9 hours today, it kind of sucked.
Same out and back on the northwest roads I've been doing all season.  It was pretty warm but also windy.  Good run.

2 campus hill loops with the guys running regionals minus Dobuol and Pez.  Felt pretty good, once I catch up on sleep I'm going to feel amazing.  BTW and I did barefoot strides on the starting line afterward with all the kids getting ready for state tomorrow.  It was 65 degrees this afternoon, too bad we can't have a day like this for a race.

Early long run before watching the state meet.  Started with Nuss, BTW, Tumnus, and a kid from Duluth.  They all turned back after 30 minutes so I ran the rest by myself.  Went a little past the radio tower before turning around and taking the extended route back.  Weather was awesome for November, too bad we can't have a race on a day like this.  Felt ok.

Easy run in the arb with Adrian, BTW, Massey, and Pat Boland.  I actually felt good despite going to bed at 4:45 AM last night after piloting a rescue mission to Mankato that involved leaving St Olaf at 12:30, getting pulled over for not turning off my brights when a cop passed me in the oncoming lane, hanging out in a shady gas station for about 45 minutes, and having an unlucky tow truck driver tow Frankie's car back to Northfield.  Basically Chris Rivers is forever indebted to me.  Six days until regionals...

Ran about a 20 minute warmup with the team then did another 7 miles by myself while they did their workout.  I'll do it tomorrow in order to stick to my usual routine.  I did a loop on the roads southwest of campus and felt pretty good.  Did six strides on the indoor track and then pedestal afterward.

Did the workout that the team did yesterday, but I took a little more rest between intervals.  Felt alright, tried to simulate Grinnell's course a little bit.  Going to catch up on sleep the next few nights and be ready to rock on Saturday.
Easy out and back on the course.  Still a little tired waking up but my legs felt awesome.
Short arb loop with about 10 guys.  Felt really good again, wish I could bottle this up for Saturday.  BTW convinced me to do 20 situps and 10 pushups afterward.

Ran in the morning since I figured nobody would want to run as far as me at practice.  Went out Cornhole and as I was coming back through the arb I ran into Rivers and Havey so I turned around and finished the short arb loop with them.  Good conversation the last 25 minutes.  Afterward I did a few barefoot strides on the indoor track.  Feeling great, I slept 9.5 hours last night!
Ran the course at Grinnell, then added on a few more minutes and did strides.  I was a little stiff from the 4 hour van ride, but felt good for the most part.  Ready to go!

Ran Ostrich by myself and then added about 15 more minutes on the course.  My legs were tired from the race and I was a little hungover so it wasn't a very enjoyable run.  Found out both our team and the women's team qualified for nats, this is going to be awesome!

Ran Iron Bridge with Varley, Paille, Debbie, and Pat.  I felt really on edge all day.  I was planning on running 10 or 11 by myself and getting a chance to clear my head.  Griff wanted me to just do 6 or 7 on the course with the rest of the nats team.  He said I could go no more than 9 and that I had to go with these guys.  This is going to be really annoying if I have to argue with people every day this week about how far I'm going to run.  I guess my legs felt ok.

Last workout of the season.  It wasn't that hard but the whole thing felt like a chore.  Something hasn't been right since Saturday, I've been really on edge mentally and irritable.  I feel like I'm sick of running and don't have my head on straight for the race this weekend...I need to just forget about what happened last Saturday and move on.  Might take tomorrow off in order to get away from it for a day and just relax.
Took the day off, first one since May 27th (174 consecutive days of running).  Figured it would help both physically and mentally.

Ran on the course after traveling to Cleveland.  The course isn't very challenging but it is absolutely soaked and will be very sloppy and slow on Saturday.  Felt good, had a little spring in my step after the day off yesterday.  Did a few short pickups during the last 10 minutes.  We went to Outback Steakhouse for dinner...thanks NCAA.

Ran on the course again.  It was a little drier than yesterday but there are still a lot of bad spots.  We'll see how much it improves by tomorrow, but it looks like it will be a mud pit.  Just got to make the best of it and enjoy my last college cross country race.
Rest.  Woke up after a crazy night and flew back from Cleveland.

Rest.

Season Summary

Training

927 miles in 83 days (109 runs, 1 day off)
Average miles per day: 11.2
Average miles per week: 78.2
Weeks over 70: 9 Over 80: 5 Over 90: 2

Races

St Olaf Invitational: 27:10, 20th place
Probably shouldn't have even run, I was too sick to compete well and it showed. (C-)

Roy Griak Invitational: 26:38, 22nd place
I put myself in good position but didn't run tough enough in the middle of the race and missed out on the podium by 2 places.  Nonetheless it was a pretty good effort for the first real race. (B-)

Jim Drews Invitational: 25:42, 28th place
Ran tough and was able to run a strong last mile for a pretty big PR on a course that didn't run terribly fast due to conditions. (B+)

MIAC Championships: 25:56, 4th place
Took a chance and competed really well except for a small struggle late.  This was the one race where I really felt I showed what I was capable of...would be an A if we would have won the team title. (A-)

NCAA Regionals: 25:47, 19th place
Let my nerves get to me and I lost my head at the beginning.  Finished at least 12 places lower than I should have but my teammates bailed me out. (C-)

NCAA Nationals: 26:48, 110th place
Not at all what I was hoping for, and not what I was capable of.  Just didn't have it.  The one positive is that I never gave up. (C)

Overall I'd rate my season at about a C+/B-.  The two goals I had coming in were for the team to defend our MIAC title and to be an All American.  Neither one of these was accomplished.  At conference we ran a good race but got beat by a great Hamline performance - we'll 'what if' that race for quite some time I think.  I feel like the training I did through regionals was correct; it was very similar to what I did last spring when I ran really well and going into regions I was feeling really good.  My volume was the most sustained volume I've ever done, and I ran some good workouts.  The last eight days of the season showed how much of an effect your mentality has on racing.  My poor regions race killed my confidence and I never felt the same heading into nationals.  I stopped enjoying running and everything felt harder.  Combine that with having a ton of trouble sleeping for a week and my chances of being All American were virtually 0 before the race even started.  I know that I was capable of it since I was right with Bauer and Sathre at conference and they both made it.  In the future I'm going to need to work on staying relaxed and enjoying the sport for what it is, and on not letting a bad race affect me so much.  This fall gave me more of an appreciation for how good my track season last year was.  Last spring I ran well in every race that I geared up for, and this season despite a summer and fall of great training I was regularly beaten by guys like Haglund and Eckstrom that I never lost to last spring.  For now I'm going to take a little break to recharge my emotional batteries and then start building up for track in hopes of accomplishing my goals there.
Rest
Rest
Thanksgiving.  My workout consisted of walking from the dining room to the kitchen multiple times for more plates of food.
Rest

Starting back up.  Thought about running in the morning, but I didn't.  At around 7 PM I was bored so I decided to do a short run before setting up the Christmas tree and then going out for the night.  However, setting up the tree turned into a multiple hour ordeal and I didn't make it downtown.

Ran on the upstairs track after driving back to Olaf.  I accidentally locked my roommate out of the room when I went to run because I didn't realize he was showering.  Oops.  Felt pretty good, sleeping 9-10 hours a night for the past 5 nights has been nice.

Started off with a big group then came back with Schwock, Massey, Josh Wold, and Joe Paille.  We started off pretty fast and never really slowed down.  Felt good the entire time.  Did some general strength afterward.

Cornhole to Canada with Tumnus.  We came back through the Arb and the route we did took us 68 minutes so it was definitely 10 miles.  Weather was nice and I felt pretty good although I got really hungry about halfway through.

Ran for about 25 minutes on the upstairs track before practice, then we went to look for Ole Rolvaag's grave.  I didn't find it.  On the way back I called stairs from about 600 meters out but BTW took the challenge and outkicked me.  Felt pretty good, soreness is going away.
Woke up and saw that the ground was covered in snow so I decided to run inside.  I had planned on going further, but I got too late of a start.  Whatever, it's my first week back.  Felt pretty good.

Did cross campus and then finished with a couple laps inside.  For some reason Prez and I kept running a couple steps ahead of the group of freshmen that we were with.  Felt awesome, probably because I only ran 5 miles though.

Ran all the way down Hall Ave to 110th St (past Jefferson) then looped back through downtown and added cross campus.  Felt really good.  I got down to Highway 3 in 8:45, usually we're around 9:20, and never slowed down.  Finished with 3 laps inside with Reid and Dobuol.  I really wish I could have felt this good two weeks ago instead of now...

I was headed down to Tostrud after lunch but at the last minute turned and went back to the pod to watch TV instead.  Before the Florida/Alabama game started I decided I'd probably just take the day off but then Rivers came back toward the end of the first quarter and convinced me to go run with him.  We did Ostrich at a pretty quick pace, then I did a good set of strides on the indoor track.  Felt good, glad I got it in.

After quite possibly the worst night of sleep I've ever gotten (in terms of both quantity and quality, and I didn't drink a drop of alcohol last night) I fell asleep on the couch in the common room while watching football.  Woke up just before 3:30 and shortly thereafter went for a run with Rivers.  We did Bryce to Woodley and then finished inside.  Our split at the Highway 3 stoplight was 8:28...close to a minute faster than usual and it didn't feel like we were even running that fast.  Felt pretty good, then did general strength for the sixth time this week.  Pretty sure that's my record.  Afterward I went back to the pod and fell asleep again.
Ran an easy out and back by myself on the northwest roads.  Weather was as nice as it's going to be all week and I felt pretty good.  The goal was to relax a bit before going to my exam.

Spent the afternoon in Woodbury taking the second actuarial exam.  Felt like I was doing ok while I was taking it and had hopes of a passing score, but I failed.  Pretty disappointing after all the hours I put in for it.  When I got back to campus I needed to blow off some steam and clear my head so I went for an inside run.  Didn't really pay attention to how I felt.

First real snowy run of the year.  It started snowing before 9 AM and continued all day.  Started off with a group of about 10, then finished the Jefferson loop with Adrian, Reid, and Stretch.  One person from each class.  Did a mile upstairs, six strides, and general strength when we got back.  Felt a little tired today.  At 11 PM nine of us took advantage of the snow and had a Productive Tuesday.

Ran inside because there was over a foot of snow on the roads and it was freezing.  I ran 3.5 miles for a warmup, then did 2 sets of 8 200s with a 200m jog in between and an extra minute of standing in between sets.  Most of the 200s were in 35.x, with a couple 34s and 36s thrown in.  It was easy, just trying to keep the legs somewhat acquainted with race pace.  Ran two more miles upstairs for a cooldown.  I slept less than 5 hours last night, but took a nap right before the run and felt fine.
Ran inside since I didn't feel like going out in the cold twice.  Felt fine, but stopped a mile early because I got bored.

Bryce Wandrey to Woodley with Tumnus, Stretch, and Tim.  It was 4 degrees with a windchill of about -10.  My face got pretty cold but the rest of my body was fine.  Legs felt good.  Ran three laps on the upstairs track when we got back (last one pretty fast) and then did both med ball circuits.

Started with a huge group and I had hope that we'd have a bunch of people go the whole way, but only Chris, Adrian, and I did 14.  Did the usual winter route - Cornhole to Wandrey to Jefferson with an add on through downtown.  Other than my face getting cold I felt pretty good.  It was hard to talk the last half hour, I was definitely slurring my words.  We did three laps upstairs at the end and the last one was really fast.  After the run Phil without prompting told me that on days like this I need to make sure to avoid penile frostbite.  Ha.  Felt pretty tired when I got to dinner, it's been a while since my last long run.

Winter ABR.  I hadn't planned on trying to finish, but with three stops to go the pride kicked in and I went for it.  It was a really fun day and I'm glad I succeeded, but after a pretty rough night I think I'm going to give up drinking for awhile.

Jefferson loop with Massey.  Rivers and Adrian started with us but turned off on Woodley.  I felt ok.  I slept 13 hours last night and actually didn't feel too bad when I got up this morning.  It turns out that when you're really drunk at 6:00 you get your hangover done with around 2 AM.

After my econometrics test I went down and ran 5 on the upstairs track.  I don't really like going outside twice in a day when it's cold like this.  Felt great, got down to around 6:00 pace for a little while then I reined it in.

Ran the shortest Bryce Wandrey loop with Josh Wold and Bryan Hulse.  Felt ok, not quite as good as this morning but no problems.  Did strides and some indoor jogging afterward to bring the total up to 7, then got drawn into a 4 on 4 basketball game.  The last time I played was when I was a freshman and my skills haven't improved too much in my three years away from the court.  After the game we had quite the team argument about tomorrow night's banquet (if you can even call it that).  Fun day.

I was going to run this morning but ended up working on my abstract algebra final instead.  The next 48 hours might kill me.

Finals is kicking my ass right now, so I didn't get down to run until 5:00.  I thought briefly about taking the day off but decided I could use a break from my work.  I had no interest in running over an hour upstairs so I fought the cold and darkness outside instead and ran Cornhole to Woodley.  Crossing the iron bridge was a bit treacherous in the dark since it wasn't plowed, but I made it.  Other than being run off the road by cars twice and having a small scare on some ice it was a pretty good run.

Ran inside after turning in my abstract algebra final.  I think I spent about 16 hours on that test and am grateful to be done with that horrid class.  Unfortunately I still have three other classes to finish.  Felt pretty tired on the run after going to bed at 4 and getting up at 8:30.

Did Snipe to Jefferson with Tumnus and then a couple laps inside to make it a full 9.  Felt pretty good, much better than this morning at least.  The run went by pretty fast.  I can't quite see the light at the end of the tunnel yet, but tomorrow at this time I should be able to.

Once again I missed practice, this time because of my econometrics poster session.  Ran the Jefferson loop by myself then did a bunch of strides.  Felt ok, three straight nights of going to bed at 3:30 or later wears on you though.

Skipped the run with the guys at 1:00 so that I could watch the UNC-Texas basketball game.  The Heels have arguably the most talent in college basketball, but forgot that defense is an important part of basketball, so they got beat pretty good.  Afterward my motivation to run was quite low but I forced myself out there.  Did the Jefferson loop again then a little over a mile and a half inside.  Felt great when I was outside, then felt dead on the upstairs track.  So close to being home...

This might be the first time I've ever done a workout on a Sunday.  I wanted to get one in before I go home.  The warmup felt like it took a really long time, then I stood around for about 10 minutes talking to Karin before finally starting.  Did the tempo on the upstairs track and felt good even though I kept having to go around people.  The intervals were pretty easy and I felt smooth.  I tried to keep a decent pace going on the recovery jog rather than just shuffling.  Going for a big mileage week next week.

After a pretty short night I ran before driving home.  Did the Jefferson loop one last time with extensions at the beginning and end to make it longer.  The roads were slushy and my legs were pretty tired.
Ran on the treadmill during Monday Night Football.  The Giants looked good, but they probably won't make the playoffs.  Run felt good, legs were better than this morning.  Did abs afterward.

I got up too late to do a morning run so I switched my plan and did the long run I had scheduled for tomorrow today.  There's supposed to be a big snow storm on the way so it might end up working out for the best.  I ran to the Neenah/Menasha Y and back.  Felt good the entire time and finished feeling really strong.  Then did general strength afterward; my goal is to do that at least 10 of the 14 days of break.  So far I'm 2 for 2.

Ran to Xavier and came back through downtown.  First run over the new College Avenue bridge.  Legs felt really good after yesterday's long run, it's nice to be able to get as much sleep as I want.  Did strides afterward and then general strength.

We got some freezing rain last night and the sidewalks were not really clear at all.  The 'ice' sapped my energy, which wasn't that high to begin with since I ran at 12:30 after barely eating anything.  Still felt ok, glad I toughed it out rather than running inside.

After walking down my driveway and almost falling on my ass about 4 times I decided running outside today was not going to happen.  Got on the treadmill as the second quarter of the Heat @ Knicks game started and watched the NBA get set back a couple years.  Hopefully the games later today make up for it.  Felt good the entire run, kept the pace easy.  Pushups and abs afterward.

After spending the afternoon at my grandma's house I went to Slider's to watch the Chargers @ Titans game with my dad and my uncle and we ended up having several rounds of drinks.  Came home and still wanted to get my second run in so I hopped on the treadmill (going outside was out of the question with the darkness and ice).  The run wasn't that much fun, I felt really weird.  Stopped a mile early because I just wasn't feeling it.  Probably didn't get much out of this one, but I did the miles so I'm counting them.

Had no interest in running on the treadmill again today so I braved the elements.  Once I got going it actually wasn't that bad.  I did an out and back down Memorial to Wisconsin Ave.  Had to keep the pace a little slower, but I'm sure I was still below 7:00.  Felt alright the first half then pretty good after the turn around.  Did 7 or 8 pickups of varying distance on the way back.

Ran at 7 AM on the treadmill before going to the Packer game.  Run was awful, hated my life for most of it.  That'll happen when you wake up early to do a run where you don't go anywhere and there's nothing good on TV to watch.

Ran again after the game so I could meet my goal of hitting 95 for the week (Sunday is the last day of the week, not the first).  Did an out and back past the Lawrence Gym and felt pretty good.  The Packers are going to the playoffs!!!

Ran to Xavier and took a different route back to make it a little longer.  Felt a little bloated from eating a doughnut, a Chipotle burrito, and several cookies today but didn't have any real problems.  Legs felt ok, got kind of worn out from constantly running on snow and ice.  Strides and general strength afterward.  Workout at Kolf tomorrow.

Drove down to Oshkosh with Litsheim and Taylor only to find out that we couldn't work out there because there was a wrestling meet.  So after considering our options we went to the Heart of the Valley YMCA in Kimberly.  I don't have a Y membership, but nobody ever asked to see my card so I didn't have to pay.  Lits and I warmed up outside then came back in and changed; Taylor decided to just run on a treadmill.  We did our workouts on a three lane 11 or 12 lap to the mile track with really tight corners.  There were quite a few other people up there as well including a kid in a wheelchair.  I decided not to worry about actual distance covered and just tried to make the intervals feel like a 5K.  Felt alright, it was hard to get into any sort of rhythm but I wasn't dying or anything.  Cooled down on a treadmill, did some abs, and then the three of us went and got some delicious Quiznos.
Fell back asleep after I woke up, so when I woke up again I got up, dressed, and ran.  Felt ok.

2.5 hours after my morning run I ran 10 with Thomas Reader.  We started off quick and never slowed down.  On the snow and ice this was a really solid effort.  Talked about CC nationals and indoor track among other things.  Felt good during the run but the rest of the afternoon my legs felt trashed.
Same morning run as yesterday except this time I finished out the whole 5

It was pretty icy and after my brother badly sprained his ankle doing something stupid my dad said I couldn't run outside.  I chose not to fight this battle and just resigned myself to the treadmill.  Being able to watch bowl games made it ok but I would have rather run outside.  Did GS afterward.  That's a wrap on 2009 running.  Had a pretty good year: stayed healthy, set some big PRs in track, won a conference title, and helped lead my team in cross.  Better things to come in 2010.
Just after midnight the 10 of us decided to bring in the new year by running a lap around the block we used for mile repeats in high school. Count it!

Ran an out and back to Victoria's then added a little over a mile and a half on the treadmill. Wasn't that great of a run; I was cold, tired, and hungry. Motivation is slipping a little bit, it'll pick up again when I get back to school.
Did some easy miles while watching The Tim Tebow Show (also known as the Florida-Cincinnati game)

Freezing cold long run. It was 0 degrees with a -10 windchill. Did my 12.5 mile loop that goes all through downtown then finished with a mile and a half inside. Felt pretty good, best I've felt on a run this week.

I wanted a really easy day to finish off break so I did a short run on the treadmill before driving back (it was -10 outside without windchill and I saw no point in bundling up for a short run). I was really sore before I went to bed last night, but when I woke up less than six hours later I wasn't too bad. It's going to be cold all week...
Upstairs track morning run. Didn't eat enough for breakfast but got through it ok.

In a change from previous years we actually had eight or nine people run outside in zero degree temperatures. I did Jefferson with Adrian and Tim, the others turned back on Woodley. My legs felt really good, my face froze. Did strides and pedestal afterward.

Last night I started the process of going to bed at 11:30 but didn't actually get to sleep until 2:00. Nonetheless the run felt good. Afterward I met with Griff to talk about plans for the first part of the season and it looks like my race schedule for the first few weeks will be this:

1/16 Bethel Open - Mile
1/23 Triangular v Carleton, Hamline - 3K
2/6 Stevens Point Invite - 5K

***INTERVAL***
Warm-up: 
Set...Reps...Distance/Time...Goal...Actual...Rep rest...Set rest
1.........8.....400 Meters....70....69-70....1:00....2:00
2.........5.....200 Meters....Fast + Relaxed....33.5, 32.2, 32.3, 32.2, 31.6....1:00....____
Cool-down: 

Felt good doing this workout. The 400s were smooth and I tried to just lock into pace. On the 200s I tried to stride out while staying relaxed and within myself. During the rests I would jog 100m then stand until it was time to go again. Griff and Phil both said at different points that I was looking pretty efficient. Feeling pretty good about my fitness right now, although I reminded myself afterward that it's not that hard to do 400s and 200s.
Whoops, overslept a little bit and had to be at a group meeting at 9. Legs were pretty tight when I started so it was nice to at least loosen up.

Cornhole to Canada with Adrian and Massey then finished inside. The roads and sidewalks continue to be terrible. Unfortunately it doesn't look like that will change anytime soon. We had a good talk about dating and the run went by pretty quick.
Ran upstairs with Tumnus and Massey. 5 hours of sleep last night.

Weather was crappy so I ran inside again. Alumnus Marc 'Steve' Ellingson came and ran with us so him, Tumnus, Massey, and myself had a good time retelling old stories from the Big O's past. The run went by really quick which almost never happens when running inside. Did some med ball afterward. I might be able to hit 100 this week if I stay motivated.

3+ mile warmup, 2.5 mile cooldown

21 min tempo, 3 min rest, 8 min tempo. Felt nice and strong. I feel like I'm in good base shape, not sure how well it would translate to a race but we'll see soon enough.
Snipe with Adrian then a half mile worth of strides and jogging inside. Legs were tired when I started but got better as the run went on.
It was -20 when I got up so I ran inside with a pretty big group. Felt fine. Going to do 15 tomorrow to get 100.

10 AM long run with Adrian, Massey, and Tim. I was a little out of it the first couple miles but then started feeling really good. The wind was rough in some spots but it was warmer than it has been. Got to hear some great stories from last night.
Slept in a little bit this morning. Legs were a little tired and I could tell that I didn't really eat dinner last night.

To do something different we went out on the northwest roads. The first couple miles were terrible but closer to the turnaround it was fine. Did a 10 mile out and back and then when we got back there was a box of free chips sitting out so we each grabbed a bag and added a few more laps. Finished with a few strides and general strength. I felt fine on the run but pretty bad during strides and core.
Ran with Tumnus, Stretch, and Massey. Didn't feel that great.

***INTERVAL***
Warm-up: 
Set...Reps...Distance/Time...Goal...Actual...Rep rest...Set rest
1.........10.....400 Meters....70....Good....1:10, 100m jog....2:00
2.........2.....400 Meters....65-66....65.3, 66.5....1:30, 200m jog....____
3.........4.....200 Meters....32-33....33, 33, 33, 32....1:00, 100m jog....____
Cool-down: 

The 5K pace 400s felt really smooth and easy. Next week I'm going to try something longer. The mile pace 400s were harder so I need to make sure I don't go out too fast on Saturday. The 200s were easy enough. Overall my legs felt a bit tired from running 100 mpw but aerobically I felt strong. Good workout.

Ran this afternoon with a decent sized group, we did cross campus to Snipe. The weather was really nice for January. Pez and Massey argued for about the first half of the run. I felt alright, it was nice to have a recovery day. At the end I jogged around campus for a few minutes to finish it out rather than running inside.
Not real motivated this morning for some reason. Felt ok though. Looking forward to the tempo this afternoon.

3+ mile warmup, 3+ mile cooldown

20 minute tempo on the southwest roads with Adrian. The only split I took was the last mile in about 5:23; the effort for the previous miles was the same but the splits were almost certainly slower because of icier roads. A husky chased us for about a minute pretty close to the spot where Bro got bit this fall which was a bit frightening. The January heat wave continued and I wore shorts (it was 30), but in hindsight I should have worn tights.
Easy morning run. BTW ran the first 3 miles with me.

Started out with a group of about 10 then BTW and I turned off on the six mile Wandrey loop. Finished with a few laps upstairs and strides. Did 2 150s at the end and felt alright. We'll see what tomorrow brings.

***RACE***
Race Name: Bethel Open
Terrain: Track (Indoor)
Warm Up: 4
Race Splits: 67, 2:16, 3:25
Cool Down: 5
Overall Place: 3rd

Started off slower than I had planned and then when Hinrichs sped things up on lap 5 I didn't respond. Afterward I recovered really quickly as if I had just finished a hard interval rather than a race. Legs and stomach didn't hurt at all on the cool down. This is kind of an embarrassing time but for a season opener at the end of a 90+ mile week I guess I'll take it. I want to try to run a fast one before the end of the season though.

Long run with Massey and Adrian. Pez, Stretch, and Pat started with us but turned early. We went out backwards on Jefferson then went across highway 3 on Canada for a little while before looping back. I felt pretty good the entire time. No effects from yesterday's 'race.'
Pretty sore and tired this morning, need to sleep more

Ran on the northwest roads. Started off with a big group but after about 10 minutes I picked it up a little bit and pulled away from everyone except Massey and Tim. Set the cruise control at about 6:15 pace until the last 2 miles when I backed off. Finished with strides and some general strength. Felt pretty good.
Ran with Kellen, Stretch, Tumnus, Block, Hulse, and Tim. Started off nice and slow and felt good.

***INTERVAL***
Warm-up: 
Set...Reps...Distance/Time...Goal...Actual...Rep rest...Set rest
1.........2.....800 Meters....2:20....2:18, 2:18....2:30....____
2.........1.....600 Meters....1:45....1:44....1:30....____
3.........5.....400 Meters....69 - 70....68, 69, 70, 70, 69....1:00....____
4.........3.....200 Meters....Fast & Relaxed....32.5, 32.3, 31.5....1:00....____
Cool-down: 

Another good workout. I was really pleased with how smooth the 800s were. By the end of the 4s I was definitely getting tired but I wasn't terribly exhausted and I held my form just fine. The 200s were smooth and easy. Looking forward to the 3K this weekend, hopefully it's fast.
Jefferson. Started with a group then finished with Tumnus. Run went by pretty quick, legs a bit tired but nothing terrible.
2 x 5 min, 2 x 3 min, 2 x 1 min. 1:30 rest after the first 4, 1:00 between the last two. Felt kind of flat, not that big of a deal though.
Ran at 9 PM. Still felt pretty tired, going to sleep a lot tonight and hopefully feel better tomorrow.

So much for sleeping a lot, I woke up at 5:30 and couldn't get back to sleep. Waited until Tostrud opened at 6:30 and then went down and did an easy 4 miles, gas, and pedestal. Actually felt much better than yesterday. Chris Daymont gave me some weird/disapproving looks.

Cross campus with a Burner extension, then pre meet strides. The run was a lot of fun, we kept throwing snowballs at each other and everyone was in a good mood. Legs didn't feel that great during strides, but I'm ready to race the Hamdogs. I'll take a sub 8:45, but the real goal is to be under 8:40.

***RACE***
Race Name: St Olaf Triangular
Terrain: Track (Indoor)
Warm Up: 5 (1.5 AM, 3.5 before race)
Race Splits: 2:56, 4:41, 5:55, 8:20
Cool Down: 3.5
Overall Place: 3rd

Before the race Bauer and I talked about alternating the lead and trying to run 69s for the first 2K. We went out and were slow right away and never got out of the rhythm of running 35s, then after the mile we ran a 2:26 800 which let Campbell back into it. I took the lead from 600 out since I knew I couldn't outsprint Campbell, then both Ians went around with 300 left and I couldn't match it. Pretty disappointed with this one, I was hoping for much faster. Mile again next week, time to start changing things.

Ran at 9:30 with Tumnus and Tim. Shorter long run this week, we went past Jefferson to Hall then swung through downtown and added cross campus. Roads were really icy so the pace was slow, but that's fine. For the third straight Saturday night I slept awful but didn't feel too bad on the run. Now time for a full day of football, go Jets and Saints!

I told myself several weeks ago that I was going to take a rest day today, so I just ran 7 on the upstairs track. Felt decent. Strides after, then stood around talking to various people and was the last person to leave practice.
Stayed up late last night watching the Australian Open. Ran from my room right after rolling out of bed at 9:45.

***INTERVAL***
Warm-up: 
Set...Reps...Distance/Time...Goal...Actual...Rep rest...Set rest
1.........1.....1600 Meters....____....4:42....3:30 jog....____
2.........8.....200 Meters....____....33, 33, 31, 32, 31, 33, 32, 30....100m jog, 1:00....____
Cool-down: 

Felt pretty smooth on the mile, I went 71-71-70-70. Griff said I didn't look like I was working very hard. The 200s were easy as always. My legs had some spring after yesterday's easy day. I've noticed that for some reason I always feel much better on Tuesdays than on race day. Hopefully I can change that.
I don't know if I've ever felt so tired waking up. Run was fine once I finally got going.
Jefferson loop with Massey, we were the only ones that went outside. It was really windy and coming back was brutal. Pretty good pace and I felt fairly good. Still want to just go to sleep though.

Ran the shortest Wandrey loop with Massey and Tim. Then I decided to try the Towle/Richert pre meet routine of 1 400 and 2 200s. Went 69.9, 32.2, 32.5 feeling pretty good. My legs felt great afterward. Tomorrow I'm going to get out well, be mentally tough, and run a race that I can be proud of.

***RACE***
Race Name: End of Interim Meet
Terrain: Track (Indoor)
Warm Up: 3 AM, 4 before race
Race Splits: 64, 2:10, 3:18
Cool Down: 2
Overall Place: 2nd

A River Falls guy took the lead right away and I tucked in in second. Usually when I run the mile I start hurting really badly by halfway, but today the real pain never came so I just kept on going. With 400 to go I was laboring a little bit but I knew I would be fast, and I took the lead and hammered. Reid and Massey followed me and when we moved into the top three spots Tostrud got pretty loud. Reid passed at the bell; I gave everything I had and stayed with him until 75 meters left before locking up a bit and fading in the homestretch. The is a major confidence boost and I'm now really looking forward to the 5K in two weeks.
Ran before driving home. Didn't sleep very well last night so I was a little tired. Not too bad of a run though.

Treadmill run while watching the first half of the Kansas at Kansas State game. The game was good so the run went pretty fast. Got a little worn out the last 10 minutes, but for the most part my legs felt good.

I mapped out a route that went out to Butte des Morts and then looped all over the west side of Appleton. This was one of the easiest long runs I've ever done, I never got tired despite finishing in around 1:37 (didn't wear a watch so I don't know the exact time, but I looked at the clock before I left). The sidewalks and roads in Appleton are much clearer than those in Northfield. Feeling really good about running right now, it's great how all it takes to change your attitude is a good race.
Ran on the treadmill right after getting out of bed. Legs a little tired but they loosened up.
Out and back to West for 9 then did strides and some extra jogging to bring it to 10. Felt a bit tired the last couple miles, probably because I always run faster when I'm by myself.

***INTERVAL***
Warm-up: 
Set...Reps...Distance/Time...Goal...Actual...Rep rest...Set rest
1.........1.....5 Minutes....5K Effort....____....3:00 jog....____
2.........1.....3 Minutes....5K Effort....____....2:00 jog....____
3.........2.....2.5 Minutes....5K Effort....____....2:00 jog....____
4.........4.....1 Minute....Fast....____....1:00 jog....____
Cool-down: 

I found out yesterday that I couldn't use the track at the Kolf Center and it snowed last night and all morning, but I was going to do this workout today come hell or high water. Conditions certainly slowed me down but the effort was hopefully equivalent to a 5K. I felt pretty good for most of it but was tired when I finished. Glad I got it in.
Easy shakeout run after watching Wisconsin's beatdown of Michigan State. Felt fine, legs a little tight from the workout.

My parents had to run some errands in Menasha so I had them drop me off at the Neenah/Menasha Y and I ran home. I felt great the entire time and it felt like the run took about 15 minutes. I feel like I'm coming into pretty good form.

2 x 15 minutes tempo with 4 minutes in between. My legs were tired on the warmup but once I started the workout I felt ok. I was 27:30 for the distance I covered in 28 minutes when I did a similar workout in June so that is a good sign of improvement. Did 4 long strides at the end before cooling down.
Late morning run on the treadmill. Felt kind of out of it.
Ran the 7 mile Memorial loop backwards.  It was windy, the sidewalks were snowy, and my legs felt sluggish.  Not that great of a run.  Tomorrow will be better.
Ugh, legs were dead, stomach was messed up, just wasn't in the mood.  Still got it in though.
Starting out my legs felt like shit again so I decided to just take an easy day.  Ran Snipe then some extra to round it out to 7 and finished with some strides.
Easy shakeout inside.  Felt crappy when I woke up but the run was fine.

Legs felt better on the warmup than the past few days but the workout still was harder than I thought it should have been.  The 800s were kind of difficult, not sure if I'll be able to hold that pace for 5K but I'll try.  The 400s were 10 times easier.  The next couple days will be easy and my legs will feel good by Friday.
Felt a little better this morning
Ran inside.  Started with Schwock then ran with Reid and Bro for a little while and then finished with Krouse.  Legs feeling better than yesterday.

Jefferson with Massey, Pez, and Adrian.  Rivers and Tim were with us until Woodley.  Legs felt much better than earlier in the week, and with an easy day tomorrow I'll be ready to rock on Friday.  The run went by pretty quick with good conversation.  Then I sat in the caf socializing for almost an hour and a half.  Good day.
Ran on the upstairs track by myself.  Run seemed to drag on but my legs felt decent enough.  Strides felt pretty good.  Ready to see what I've got tomorrow.

Ran around River Falls.  I started about 50 minutes before the meet started and finished just in time to watch the 5K.  Started off going west and ran out and back on a really hilly road for about 50 minutes, then met up with Massey and Josh for a bit as they were warming up, then ran east from the stadium through the city.  Legs were fatigued from the race and I was happy when the run was over.  Glad I did it today though so now I don't have to run long tomorrow.  There were a few good performances at the meet but nothing too special.
Ran this morning with Rivers, Massey, Adrian, and Tim.  We went out Cornhole and then I came back on the first turn off Wandrey since I went long yesterday.  Felt ok.
Ran upstairs with Rivers and Prez.  Bro and Pez were also there for a little while.  Legs felt good.

Started with a huge group and then did Jefferson with Adrian, Massey, and Pat.  Tumnus and I sang some songs from the early 00s and I felt great the entire time.  After the run I was supposed to do strides but stood around talking for over 20 minutes.  When I actually got around to doing the strides my legs felt really weird.  Then watched the mid d workouts, BT Dubs and Tim look ready for a fast mile this Friday.
Shakeout before the workout this afternoon.  Last harder workout of the indoor season tonight.

This was kind of a strange workout for me.  I wasn't very psyched up when it started and on everything until the 400s I was consistently about 2 seconds slow.  I wasn't really feeling bad, just kind of 'blah.'  Did med ball afterward and now I have a really sore back.  Hopefully it's just a spasm that goes away tomorrow.
Ran with Rivers and Prez upstairs.  Nothing exciting happened.

Ostrich with a big group.  It was really nice outside. I pushed Massey in a snowbank on St Olaf Ave and then noticed at the end of the run that the ice had made him bleed so I felt kind of bad.  Stopped at Bethel Lutheran Church about 10 minutes from the finish to clear out my system.  Found out the 3K this Friday is loaded: Hassan Mead, Chris Erichsen, Justin Gruenwald, Willy Kaul, Paul Zdroik, Derek Storkel, a couple other U of M guys, myself, and Bauer.  It's a good opportunity, hopefully I don't get lapped.
Late to practice because of class so I ran an easy out and back on the northwest roads by myself.  Then did strides and 2 200s in 33.8 and 32.1.  Ready to rock tomorrow.

The team had a pretty good night.  Reid ran awesome in the mile and just missed provo, BTW, Tim, and Tomlinson all PRed, and Schantzen had the #5 shot put in the nation.  Mead scratched from the 3K and some of the other fast guys that were entered didn't show up, but it was still pretty loaded.  With 8:36, 8:42, and 8:51 it was the first time in quite a while that 3 Oles have broken 9:00 on the same day.

Ran before the meet.  When I started running I saw people carrying around cases of beer and already starting to pregame for the 100 days march.  I did the usual winter long run route and finished inside.  Felt pretty good the whole time, didn't really feel the race at all.  The meet was ok - Dobuol won the mile but only ran 4:27, we had a couple guys break 2 in the 800, and Perk threw down on the last two laps of the 3K to beat some Carls.  The highlight was probably Will Totimuh running a 6.54 55m in his second track meet ever.
Ran Cornhole with Bryan Hulse and Pat Boland.  Pace was relaxed and I felt pretty good.  Did 4 100 meter strides and some jogging to round it out.
Woke up and had a bit of a sore throat but felt great on the run.  Before I knew it I had run for 38 minutes.
Ran the Jefferson loop with Massey.  Felt ok, my throat is still sore and I really hope it doesn't turn into anything worse.  Spent a lot of time discussing the conference lineup with Phil and Griff.

Felt sick most of the day and was really tired after my classes ended so instead of going to practice I went back to my room and took a nap.  Felt a little better at about 7:00 so I decided to try the workout.  Had to do it on the upstairs track since the golfers were doing something weird downstairs.  I figured out that I needed to run about 52 seconds per lap for it to be 4:40 pace so I did that.  The first two repeats were easy but the last two were pretty hard.  The '200s' were easy as always.  Hopefully the sickness is better tomorrow.
Still felt pretty crappy this morning
Shortest Wandrey loop.  Terrible run, it was really hard to breathe.  Hope this goes away soon...
Sickness keeps getting worse.  The nurse at Health Services said I probably just have a virus but it could be H1N1.  Didn't do anything all day, just laid around.

Ran for 20 minutes after lunch.  Wanted to do something but knew that I couldn't go for too long.  Felt better than yesterday but I'm definitely still sick.  Went back down later to watch the meet.  Several guys took the meaning of 'The Qualifier' to heart and stepped up and got their marks for conference next weekend, it was fun to watch.

Ran on the upstairs track in the morning.  Felt pretty decent, I'm starting to get healthier.  My legs felt really rested (as they should have) and my breathing didn't bother me.  I still have a little bit of a cough but it is significantly better.  Spent the afternoon at Big 10s.  The Badgers won the DMR but other than that didn't have that great of a day and the Gophers had about as close to a perfect day as possible.

Ran with Chris in the morning.  We ran past Jefferson and came back on 246th then I jogged around campus to add on.  Felt alright, didn't feel like my breathing was too hindered.  I still have a cough but otherwise I'm almost back to normal.  Big Tens was cool, in the 5K the top guys went 4:39, 4:34, 4:31 and it didn't look like it was that hard for them.  The Gophers absolutely dominated, congrats to them.

Jefferson with Pez and Adrian.  We started behind everyone since we waited for Chris Massey after he showed up late.  The weather was nice and I felt really good the entire time.  Did strides in the Tostrud parking lot since the baseball team was using the track then did a few laps with some guys warming up for a track workout.  During the day I spent an hour and a half with Phil and Griff finalizing the conference lineup.  Hopefully it's the right one.
Fell back asleep after my alarm went off so I had to cut the run a mile short to get to class.  I'm fine with it.

First workout since I got sick.  It was easy and I felt great the entire time.  Really consistent with the pacing, hopefully I can be that dialed in on Friday.  Entry lists came out...it'll be a good meet.
Easy run upstairs.  Felt decent enough.
Snipe with Chris and Adrian then finished it inside.  Felt the same as this morning, decent but not great.  Weather continues to be nice.

Cross campus with a group then added Burner by myself.  At Carleton a prospie ran with us from the Rec Center to the Library.  It was weird.  Strides and 2 x 200 in 34.5, 32.6.  Feeling pretty good, going to give it all I've got tomorrow and try to earn a ticket to Indiana.

Ran the Carlson Hill loop with Rivers.  Prez was with us for the first 25 minutes.  We stopped at the Wellness Center on Jefferson to take a crap and it was about 100 degrees in there.  I started sweating immediately upon walking in.  The weather outside was great.  Thought I might go longer but my legs were pretty tired.
I still have a cough and my whole body felt tired so I took the day off.  Slept for 2.5 hours during practice time.

Bryce Wandrey with a decent group.  Felt pretty good, I'm still disappointed about my conference performances but I think I've almost put it behind me.  Just have to use it as motivation for outdoor.  Did Tank afterward.

This evening was the annual 'phonathon' where we call a bunch of track alumni and ask them to give donations to the school.  I ended up talking to a Dr from Michigan who said that next fall he wants to talk to Phil about paying for the team apparel order.  Awesome!
Usual inside morning run.  Maybe someday soon I'll start doing these outside.

Ran out and back on the NW roads.  I turned around with Reid and Stretch, then added just over 15 minutes solo at the end.  It was really foggy out, on the road by the hospital when you looked to the right you couldn't see anything.  I felt pretty good on the run but now my legs are pretty tired.  Did pedestal and 40 pushups afterward.

Jefferson Loop with Rivers, Pez, and Reid.  Everyone else turned on Woodley.  We cruised the last half of the run.  Felt pretty good despite my extremely poor sleep last night.  Strides and gas afterward.

First outside morning run of 2010 (I think).  Did the shortest Wandrey loop by myself.  I started kind of late so I ran pretty fast in order to get it in (got behind the stadium in under 12 minutes).  Felt good.

Didn't go to practice so that I could watch the end of the Wisconsin game.  We played like shit for 35 minutes, closed a 16 point deficit to 3 and had a shot to tie, but ended up losing.  Right when the game ended I went and ran.  Did Ostrich with an add on in order to get 9.  In the middle I did 10 1 minute pickups with a minute recovery.  Pace was nothing spectacular but it was good to do a little something.  When I got back I opened my computer and Litsheim's race was on the line, so I timed it perfectly.  Then I watched the DMR.  Phil Richert is awesome.

Lando's Mom with Rivers, Pez, Tumnus, and Massey.  I was pretty tired and thought about just going back to sleep but I'm glad I got up and ran.  Legs were tired the last 15-20 minutes.  Time to watch basketball and track for the rest of the day.

Watching the national meets got me all pumped up and wanting to put in some more miles.  Schantzen is the national champ in the shot put!  He threw 17.37 and won by over half a meter.  Unbelievable.  Litsheim got 3rd in the 800, can't be too disappointed about that.  Hopefully outdoors I can join in the excitement of the meet.

Ran after lunch so that I could watch the Minnesota game.  Did reverse Jefferson to Canada to 315th then came back.  The weather was awesome and I felt pretty good.  Put the hammer down a little bit the last four or five minutes.
