Got back in time for the last 10 seconds of regulation of the Kentucky v Mississippi State game and then enjoyed a Schmidt during the overtime.
Pretty tired this morning, felt decent when I started running though

Cornhole to Canada with a huge group.  It was almost 60 degrees which was amazing.  Ran shirtless for the second half of the run.  I took a nap right before practice so I felt a little sluggish at first but about 3 miles in I got into it.  Added on with Tumnus and Pez for 10, then did strides and general strength.

Last night I went to bed just after midnight but didn't fall asleep until about 2.  I was very tired when I woke up and didn't really want to run.  Also it was raining out so I decided to run inside.  The first 15 minutes I was kind of sleep walking but I ended up feeling decent the last 20.

Bryce to Woodley.  It was in the low 40s and lightly misting which I found really nice.  Turned off with Massey, Dobuol, and some other people.  Felt great this afternoon after taking a 10 minute nap after class.  100 mile week!

First workout of the year on the outdoor track.  It was 55 degrees and about 10 mph winds and despite some puddles on the track it was great to be outside.  My legs were tired but my lungs felt fine so I think I'm just about better from my sickness.  Heart rate at the end was 160 so I know there's more in the tank.  Happy St Patrick's Day!

Watched basketball until 4 and then went and ran the Carlson Hill loop.  Looped back through downtown to add an extra half mile.  It was 63 degrees and beautiful.  Stomach felt a little messed up, most likely from having a few too many brews last night.  East won their quarterfinal this afternoon...taking on the defending champs (Madison Memorial) tomorrow night.
It was 30 degrees colder than yesterday.  Didn't have the appropriate attire in my locker so I ran inside.  Felt pretty good, finally got a good night's sleep last night.

Did a Thunder style threshold run with Chris, Lambert, and Massey.  We started off faster than we had planned but I was effortless through 4 miles.  When we turned onto the dirt roads the wind was right in our faces and the sixth mile up the hill was brutal.  Never really opened it up on the last mile but I finished decently.  Definitely could have gone much faster.

Last 3 miles: 5:30, 5:40, 5:23

Watched basketball all afternoon and didn't go run until 5:00.  Decided to go long today since the Badgers play in the middle of the day tomorrow and I won't want to run then.  I did Chris' loop from last Sunday.  Started out intending to run easier than last week but I finished at about the same pace.  It felt really easy though.  Maybe I should add another mile to my long runs.  Ended the run at the caf because if I showered first I probably would have missed dinner.  After I ate I went and checked the basketball scores and found out I missed the best game of the day in Northern Iowa's upset of Kansas.  Dang it.

Edit: When I was running by the VFW Club downtown an old drunk guy yelled, 'Run bitch, the police are coming!'

Hopped out of bed at 9 and was running 5 minutes later with Chris, Tim, and Schwock.  We went out on the loop I did last Sunday then I turned off on Woodley.  Felt pretty good, did six strides afterward.  Might run again after the Wisconsin game.
Went for a short run after Wisconsin's loss.  We were never in the game, although I kind of saw it coming so I'm not real disappointed.  I was tired on the run, need to get some sleep tonight.

Annual 10 x 800 at a good aerobic effort.  I decided to do it at 2:00 because that way the track would be less crowded.  It was 50 degrees and fairly windy which slowed me down a little bit, but that's part of track.  I felt strong through the first 7 intervals, then it was getting pretty hard towards the end.  I really wanted to finish though so I kept at it.  I would have liked to run the last couple a little faster, but overall I averaged about five seconds faster than last year so I'm pleased.  3 x 150 at the end to practice kicking.  Afterward I stayed at practice for over an hour socializing with various people and enjoying the weather.
Ran at 9:30 on the upstairs track.  The first couple of laps were pretty slow but after that I loosened up and felt great.  Good shakeout after the workout earlier today.

First run in the arbs this year.  Ran for a bit in the lower arb with Schwock, Gary, Ben, and Swenson, then added a couple loops in the upper arb by myself.  I felt decent while I was running but now my legs are definitely trashed.  Just got to make it to the end of the week.
Still pretty sore, took a little while to get going

Ran in the arb with Pez, BTW, and Stretch.  Felt better but we were running slow.  Sang songs for the second half of the run, it was kind of ridiculous.  I added a mile by myself at the end.  During the day I talked to Lundin about the Augustana 10K and it sounds like I should be able to go.

No morning run, way too tired.  We ran about a 5 mile warmup, then turned around and did a short tempo.  Ran for 15:30, only split was a 5:20 last mile.  I felt good until about 500 meters left when my shoulders suddenly locked up and I crashed.  Should have been able to finish in 5:07 with Dobuol and Adrian, but oh well.  Just need to make it to break and then I can rest up and I'll feel better.  After the run we had an intense discussion about this fall's Alumni 5K.  Griff predicted another perfect score by the team...we'll see about that.

Did reverse Jefferson out to 313th.  I actually felt pretty good the entire time despite being really tired when I got out of bed.  Don't know the exact time but it was roughly 6:20 pace once again because I left the locker room at 8:20 and was back in it before 10:00.
Woke up at 5:15 to run before we left for Florida.  I did the East South River loop in the dark.  Actually felt pretty good the whole time despite the hour.

Ran an out and back from our hotel in downtown West Palm Beach.  I slept a lot last night and felt more rested which was great.  It was nice to be in 70+ degree weather, although it's going to be almost that warm in Northfield this week.

The original plan was to go 10 this morning but for some reason when I woke up 8 sounded much better so that's what I did.  Felt good after about the first 5 minutes, saw lots of 'vacation warriors' out exercising, and when I finished I was covered in sweat.  General strength afterward.

Did an out and back 5 after I got back from the Mets v Marlins game.  It was an error filled, not that exciting spring game.  I was really hungry but ate a half a sandwich before I went out and then was fine.  Finished with strides, a short cooldown, and pushups.
Late morning shakeout

Good hard workout.  I felt strong through the first three intervals, then I started a little fast on the 3 minuter which made them kind of difficult, then by the 1 minuters I was tired but I finished.  Breathing felt under control the whole way, legs were getting fatigued towards the end.

Ran another out and back on the roads.  On the way out I kept thinking about how heavy my legs felt but then at the turn around I realized that I didn't actually feel all that bad.  Weird mind games.  I also realized that I haven't felt good waking up in about two weeks.  I'm going to start taking iron pills again.

22 min tempo, 4 min rest, 8 min tempo, 3 min rest, 3 x 30 seconds at 1500 pace.  My breathing felt in control the entire time but for the most part my legs felt like anchors.  If this continues into next week I'll start getting worried, otherwise I'm just going to run through it.
Went 92 minutes, might be a little more than 14 but it's ok.  Actually felt better than I've been feeling on my 9-10 milers this week.  Last day in Florida, got to soak up some more UV rays...
Ran around the hotel property at 6 AM.  It was dark out and the area wasn't terribly safe so I didn't go exploring.  Felt terrible.
Ran again when I got home after a very long day of travel.  Didn't eat or drink much all day but I still felt better than this morning.

Ran the seven mile Memorial loop first thing in the morning.  After about a 20 minute warmup I did 3 x 60 seconds fast and then 8 x 30 seconds fast with equal recovery.  Felt good, but it's an easy workout.  Then I drove to Milwaukee to go to the Brewers home opener.  It was a great day - 68 degrees and sunny, roof wide open, raucous crowd.  The Brewers lost 5-3 but it doesn't really even matter.  Sped back to Olaf after and made it back in time for the last 10 minutes of Duke v Butler.

Ran on the course in a light rain.  Felt pretty tired from my two full days of travel when I woke up, but my legs felt good on the run.  A dog ran after me for a little while on the pond loop but he only wanted to play.

Ran the Jefferson loop with Chris.  Bro and Evan Olson were with us until Woodley.  It was pouring rain when we started, then after we got behind the stadium it let up a little bit.  My nipples got chafed.  Body as a whole felt a little tired, need to get a good night's sleep tonight.

This was really hard.  I was hoping to be around 4:52 pace but just couldn't do it by myself in 20 mph winds (not to mention all the excursions out to lane 2 or 3).  Griff said that the wind was worth 1 1/2 to 2 seconds per lap, so if that's true then my times look much better, but I don't know.  I was somewhat encouraged by the 400s, but if I had tried to run that pace for another lap I wouldn't have been able to.  Got to take it easy the next two days before I race.
Ran on the course again.  It was a bit cold, and my legs didn't feel very good.

Started off in the arb with about 12 guys and then turned back early.  My legs felt better as the run went on which was nice.  When I got back to the track I did a couple laps in my new spikes to start breaking them in.  This evening I have a headache, my body aches, and I have a fever, so I'm going to try to sleep it off and hopefully wake up tomorrow feeling ok.  Also, Dave Ricks caught two guys peeing on the stadium and sent Phil and Griff an e-mail saying that we are no longer welcome to run on any part of Carleton's campus.  Fuck.

Last night my throat suddenly started getting extremely sore and I spiked a fever.  I was diagnosed with strep throat this morning.  I laid in bed all day because I felt so terrible and it hurts to even open my mouth.  Won't be able to race tomorrow, so I'll have to go into the Augustana 10K next Friday without a tuneup race (assuming I'm healthy enough to run it).
Strep throat day #2.  Nothing that spectacular happened at River Falls, but I still wish I could have raced.

Strep throat day #3.  I felt terrible when I woke up.  This afternoon I started feeling quite a bit better but decided to just take the day off and make sure I totally kick this thing.  I'll get back on it tomorrow.

Turns out I can still do this running thing.  Ran out and back on the northwest roads like I would do during cross.  Legs felt a little weird the first 10 minutes but then I felt great the rest of the time.  Throat is barely noticeable today.  Boom!
Ran Ostrich with a little add on to get 7, then did 4 strides and a lap jog when I got back to the track.  Felt a bit uncoordinated for most of the run but that will pass.  The strides felt good.

To put it honestly, this was discouraging.  The times aren't terrible, but I had to work hard to get them, and it sort of makes me doubt that I am capable of running a national qualifying time in three days.  My throat is still sore; I can't say it really bothered me while running but it is a drain during the rest of the day.  I'm going to get plenty of sleep and gargle plenty of salt water and hopefully by Thursday I can have this knocked out.

Started off with the team, then ran with Schwock for about 10 more minutes before continuing on my own for the remainder.  I went out to 313th, hooked up to Canada, and then came back.  It poured for about five minutes towards the beginning but other than that I thought the weather was nice.  Sickness is better than it has been, legs are a little tired but will be fine.  I'm cautiously optimistic.
Neighborhood loop plus a couple laps on the track, then pre race strides.  My legs don't feel fantastic, but they'll be good tomorrow.  Time to go get what I've been training for.

1.5 mile AM shakeout
3.5 mile warmup
4600m of 10K (4:50, 9:21 @ 3K, 5:23ish next mile)

I didn't feel very good on my shakeout or on the warmup, but I told myself that I was fine.  When the race started I was struggling by lap 3, and fell off the pack right after the mile.  The second pack rolled up on me sometime around 3K and I didn't really stick with them at all.  Stepped off at 4600m, disgusted with myself and embarrassed.  Not sure where to go from here in terms of trying to salvage some sort of final collegiate season.
Felt like shit so I took the day off.  I slept maybe 3 hours last night, and my throat is back to being just as sore as it was last Friday and Saturday.

Ran Snipe plus a little extra at 8 PM.  Went back and forth all day on whether or not I was going to run, then decided I wanted to do at least something.  I had a pretty decent side ache for the first half of the run and my throat is still sore, but my legs felt good.
Ran in the upper arb with Pez then came back by myself after he stopped with some gastrointestinal distress.  Felt ok.  Nice day out.

Went down after my class ended and started early...did the Carlson Hill loop by myself.  I think I'm starting to get a little better.  Still not going to race this week though.  Felt fine the entire run.  The roads were really dry and dusty today.
Easy morning run.  Felt pretty dang good.

Decided to try a workout.  I did it on the roads instead of on the track so I'm not sure what my actual paces were.  Seeing as I never felt terribly exhausted I'm guessing they weren't that fast.  Overall I felt pretty flat this afternoon and not really in a mentality to really lay down some solid work.  Oh well.  My throat soreness is almost totally gone but I still have a little bit of fatigue.  I might run the 5K at Gustavus on Saturday - not as an all out race, just to get a time in since we're running out of meets.  We'll see.

Decided to run after my first class rather than waiting until practice.  I did the loop that I did a couple times during March (reverse Jefferson out to 313th) but it's a little shorter leaving from the track.  Felt ok.  I think I might be starting to spend too much time thinking about running.
Northwest roads morning run.  Didn't sleep all that well last night so waking up was a little rocky, but 5 minutes into the run I felt good.
Did a beach run then continued on the course and finished with six strides.  My legs feel really sore just sitting around but don't feel that bad while running.  Weird.
Slept all day.  Totally wiped out.

Still exhausted.  Slept for another three hours this afternoon.  I went and talked with Phil and Griff and we decided it's too early to totally call it a season, but I'm going to take off until Friday and then see how I'm doing.  At this point I don't even know if I'm capable of running a conference qualifying time, much less of doing anything of note in the meet, but I guess we'll see what five days off does.
Rest Day #3.  My general disposition was better today but I'm still tired.
I had intentions of getting a good amount of work done during practice time, but instead I spent most of it surfing the internet.  My motivation for school right now is 0.
Last day of this little break.  I don't feel anywhere near fully recovered, but probably can't afford any more time off if I'm going to race this season.

Attempting to come out of retirement.  I did the neighborhood loop with Rivers, Massey, and Hulse.  Didn't have any problems, but I'm not going to get too excited about finishing a five mile run after taking five days off.  It rained for about the last 15 minutes.

I woke up at 6:00 AM, but I went to bed at 10:30 so I still got a decent amount of sleep.  Ran at 6:45 on the course.  It was a very enjoyable run - nice and peaceful, cool weather, and I felt pretty good.  Thought about what exactly I'm going to train for after I graduate.  So many options...  Then I decided to go watch the meet at GAC.  It was way too windy for anyone to run a good time.

Short arb loop by myself.  I took a nap this afternoon and had a hard time getting myself to put two feet on the floor and get outside, but I finally did.  Pushed the pace today and felt pretty good doing it.  I spent most of the run thinking about Solinsky's 26:59...races like that really motivate me to keep training and improving.

This was nothing too special, but it went better than the last few workouts I attempted.  On the first 1000 I went through 200 in 38 and then picked it up, and it felt pretty easy.  On the second one and on the 800 I had to work a bit, and I was breathing pretty hard by the time I finished.  The 200s were ok.  I'm encouraged by the fact that I finished and hit somewhat decent times...not sure what will happen when I race on Friday, but I'm going to try.

Went for a run in the arb before Rolex started.  I was a little tired when I started but I still kept a decent pace and my level of fatigue never really got any worse.  Ended up going a little further than I had planned.  We won the vast majority of the events, but the Carls won the meet thanks to a victory in the 400 hurdles.

Basically the same run as yesterday.  I got a little tired the last 15 minutes, but then did 3 barefoot strides on the grass and they felt good.  Hamline decided to postpone Friday's meet to Saturday, so now I'm headed to Buena Vista University on Sunday to race.  Not ideal, but I'll make the best of it.

Short workout in order to get a little something in.  I did everything about a second faster than I was supposed to, but when the workout ended I was more tired than I thought I should be.  Going to take the next two days really easy so that I don't waste my time going to Iowa on Sunday.
Ran the shortest Wandrey loop by myself at 10 AM.  It was only like 40 degrees and raining, just kind of gross.  My entire body didn't feel good and I ran really slow.

Nothing.  I've decided to pull the plug on this outdoor season.  I feel like I could most likely get a qualifying time if I went to Iowa tomorrow, but I can't say for sure that I would and even if I did I don't really think that I can be competitive at conference.  I can do short easy runs ok, but when I try to do workouts or any sort of longer run there is nothing in the tank.  In addition the concept of trying to race has been really stressing me out and I can't get excited about it.  Running is supposed to be fun, but it isn't when you don't feel strong at all or are out on a run counting down the number of days until you get to take a break.  I'm going to take a few weeks off to get over whatever this virus is that I've been carrying around, and then with a fresh start I'll be able to begin training for my post collegiate career.

I had the urge to go for a run so I figured 'why not?'.  The temperature was over 90 degrees with a heat index of about 97.  I ran on the course and felt pretty good for about the first 20 minutes, then I started feeling light headed.  Stopped after 4.5 (couldn't quite make it to 5) and was pretty delirious.

ABR.  It was really hot when we started, then when we got to the Tavern it started absolutely pouring.  For some reason I couldn't really get into the drinking so I stopped after the bowling alley and was sober for the last few hours.  Fun day.
I did the same run on the course as I did on Monday, only this time I finished the entire thing.  80 degrees feels much better than 90+.  Felt good.
Ran at about noon on the northwest roads.  Felt good the first half then got a little tired.  My pulse was almost 180 when I finished.

Today is June 1, and I think my body is healed enough to try to get back to some consistent training.  I did my 5 mile neighborhood loop in Appleton and felt pretty good.  My allergies have been really bad the past few days so hopefully that will go away soon.

National Running Day!  I did the East South River loop at about 2:45.  It was the most enjoyable run I've done in probably about two months.  Had to stop and take a deuce at the BP on Oneida St.  Finished with three easy strides (felt really awkward) and pedestal.

Did a Xavier loop for my longest run in quite some time.  Had to stop twice because of some gastrointestinal distress.  There was a mom and two little kids trying to get into Xavier and they came up and tried to get me to help them, but there wasn't really anything I could do.  I felt great for the first 8+ miles then felt a little out of shape for the last 10 - 15 minutes.  Stomach hurt too much to do abs afterward.

Spent the first part of the day watching various track meets online.  Taylor won the state mile in 4:10 and then got 2nd in the 800 in 1:52.  Great double, and Perez finally has another state champ.  Then watched the Oslo meet and saw Rudisha go 1:42.06 before Lagat and Solinsky ran 12:54 and 12:56 respectively.  American distance running has really made a surge over the past year!  When I finally got around to doing my own run I started way too fast because I was so pumped up, which led to a pretty ugly and slow last two miles.  My breathing wasn't really labored but my legs were definitely giving out.  I felt great until then though.

Went out and ran on the horse trails at High Cliff.  Made sure to start slow in hopes that I wouldn't die like yesterday.  I ended up feeling great the entire time.  Finished with six strides.  The Patriots had another good day at state - 2nd in the 4x800 with a 7:49 (6th fastest time in state history) and 7th and 9th in the 3200.

I'm having a battery of lab tests done tomorrow and apparently exercise can throw off the results, so I was only allowed to do an easy 4 today.  Felt great.  My motivation is really high right now so hopefully these tests come out ok and I can get into some miles next week.

I went to have blood drawn this afternoon and after three attempts the nurse couldn't get any out.  She told me I was dehydrated (I don't think I was since I drink water regularly, but whatever) and sent me downstairs to drink a ton of water.  50 minutes and 10 glasses of water later she tried again and still couldn't do it.  Another nurse came in and figured it out right away.  Overall I got stuck with needles 5 times...not real fun.  I should have the results tomorrow or the next day.

After going home and waiting for most of the water I drank to empty from my stomach I went and ran around Pierce and Lutz Parks.  I felt really good the entire time.  Had to stop twice to pee - once in a port a potty at Reid and once in the pavilion at Pierce.

Ran a loop through Kimberly and took the long way home.  It was lightly raining the entire time and then it picked up the last 5 minutes.  Six strides afterward.  My streak of feeling good continued.  Off to Miller Park to cheer on the Crew!
First morning run of the summer.  Felt awful waking up, need to start going to bed earlier.
Ran to Telulah Park, did a few laps there, then ran home.  I was hungry so that made the run kind of unenjoyable, but it was fine.

I was going to go to High Cliff to run but I ended up needing to do something else so those plans changed.  Ran to Xavier with a double loop through downtown on the return.  It rained for most of the last 10 miles.  Didn't feel outstanding but I wasn't struggling either.  Pedestal afterward.

Ran on the treadmill during the first half of the Mexico v South Africa match.  Wanted a really easy day in order to recover a bit and I accomplished that objective.  At halftime I went outside and did six strides, then came back in and did pedestal.

Didn't manage my time all that well this morning so this was all I got to do.  I didn't feel all that great when I woke up and ended up falling back asleep.  Once I got out running I felt pretty good.  It's ok to have two light days toward the end of my first full week back.

Out and back on the CE trail.  Felt pretty solid the entire time.  At the turn around I was a little intimidated about having six miles still to go...I'll get over that as I get back into shape.  Held off both a wave of the shits and a rainstorm in the last mile.  Finally got the last of my blood tests back and it turns out I had an EBV this spring...pretty much what we thought but now it's confirmed.
Shakeout.  Felt like 10 pounds of shit in a 5 pound bag so I stopped early.

Ran out at High Cliff.  Felt a ton better than this morning and was definitely cruising by the end.  The trails were a little muddy from all the rain but nothing too bad.  Didn't see another person between 5 minutes and 65 minutes.

Seven mile Memorial loop in the rain.  I had planned on doing a good bit more than this today but it thunder stormed all afternoon, I was pretty tired all day, and I had other stuff to get done.  Basically today is packed full of excuses.  I'll really get it together starting next week.
Morning run during the second half of Spain v Switzerland.  Very exciting match.  Legs felt pretty good.

Ran at High Cliff.  About 10 minutes in I approached a mom and daughter that were horseback riding.  I announced that I was coming, but they must not have heard me because they didn't react.  One of the horses freaked out when it saw/heard me and took off.  The girl riding jumped off because she was scared, and the mom (still on her horse) chased after the now rider-less horse.  When she caught it (about 15 seconds later) she turned and looked at me and screamed, 'YOU WANT TO STOP RUNNING?'  I stopped and braced myself for a confrontation and she continued to ream me out for 'deliberately scaring her horses' and 'injuring her daughter'.  I let her go for a few sentences before telling her, 'It's a state park, I have just as much right to be here as you.  I didn't do anything to your horse and it's not my fault your daughter jumped off.'  She continued to fume and stomped off in the other direction muttering about how she was going to complain to the ranger, and I continued on my way.  The entire thing was totally ridiculous.  After the run I did six strides.

Headed out around 11:15 and ran to Pierce Park and then along the Fox River.  It was really humid.  I felt good for the most part, didn't have any extra spring to charge up the hills but that'll come as I get in better shape.

Did another run before dinner to shake out the longer run this morning.  Started really slow and worked into it.  Felt pretty good by the end.  I'm headed to Northfield tomorrow for the weekend - not sure how many miles I'll get in but I'm going to try to run every day.

Ran at 7:30 so I could watch the US play soccer at 9.  Did a route I hadn't done in a while - ran to Victoria's and then added the Drew St loop.  Started off feeling decent but I bonked badly the last mile or mile and a half due to a severe lack of calories.  The US got hosed...damn foreign referees.

Ran in the Arb in Northfield.  It was nice to be back in there.  The new bridge on the other side is done so I ran across that for the first time.  It felt kind of weird.  It was really humid again, I hate finishing runs drenched in sweat.

Ran around some neighborhoods by Aleta's house.  Despite the fact that I had eaten essentially nothing in the 15 hours before this run I felt fine...granted I only ran 6 miles.  Had some delicious eggs afterward.
Easy morning run.  Stayed up stupidly late again last night, I really need to stop doing that.
High Cliff.  Felt really good and didn't encounter any horseback riders today.  Last 20 minutes were in a real light rain.  Six strides afterward.
Was hoping to go a mile or two longer, didn't manage my time well enough to allow that to happen.  Felt ok.

Took a serendipitous route to the Banta Bowl hill where I did 6 10 second hill sprints.  The first half hour of the run I felt terrible - light headed and my stomach felt weird.  After standing in the shade for a while before starting the sprints I felt better.  The sprints felt awkward but I'll get used to them.  I'm going to work up to doing 10 sprints once a week over the course of the summer.

First 15 miler in several months.  I ran at High Cliff so that I could be in the shade.  Felt pretty good for the most part.  It was definitely getting tough by the end though.  When I finished my shorts were as wet as if I had jumped in the lake.  Mixed up some Endurox in the parking lot before driving home...Pez would have been proud.

The USA is in the knockout round at the World Cup!!!  Landon Donovan with the goal in the 92nd minute!!!
Easy run to shake out yesterday's long run.  Watched some of the marathon tennis match.
Loop through downtown Kimberly.  It was a lot less humid than yesterday which was really nice.  I could tell that I had run long yesterday but I still felt fine.
Ran some loops around Telulah Park.  Feeling kind of tired from this week's miles.  Just got to keep clicking them off.
Easy run before dinner.  Nothing exciting.

Out and back 6.  I ran at 5 after being on my feet all day volunteering at the Badger State Games and having nothing but a 7 1/2 inch sub to eat.  Not a real fun run.  I successfully avoided the score of the US match until I finally got to watch it this evening.  It was a heartbreaker.

Ran on the Wiouwash Trail after another day in Oshkosh.  Both times I've run here I've liked it.  Felt much better than yesterday, and since most of the trail is shaded the heat didn't bother me.  My blue shorts have ripped at the crotch so I guess I'll have to retire them.

Edit: I'm on the top 20 for the first time since March.  Probably for only like the next 15 minutes though.
Ran through downtown.  It was cooler than it has been and my legs felt good.
Ran to the Banta Bowl, did 8 10 second sprints, and ran home.  Last week when I did these I felt awkward and clumsy, today I felt really fast and powerful.  Great running weather.
Took a little motivation to get going but felt pretty good once I started out

Out at High Cliff.  I was intending on just doing a normal run, but over the course of the first 4 miles I kept cranking the pace down without thinking about it, then I'd slow down on purpose and before I knew it I'd be cruising again.  Eventually I decided that if I was feeling that good I might as well put in a solid effort so I went straight into a 22 minute tempo run.  Felt really strong throughout.  Used the rest of the run as a cooldown.

Decided to go long today.  I did the loop I made up in January that goes out to Butte Des Morts and then winds around the west side of town.  Felt really good for the first 14 miles then my legs got quite tired during the last one.  I guess I can handle feeling tired for one mile.  Finished June with only two less miles than June of 2009, which I'm really happy with considering where I started this month.

Ran at High Cliff.  About halfway through I heard an extremely loud explosion that sounded like someone had detonated a bomb nearby.  I later figured out that it was probably somebody testing a firework.

After driving up to the cabin I did the run that we always did on the first day of camp - from the cabin through downtown Sayner and back.  Felt surprisingly great.  Afterward as I made dinner and watched TV I was reminded of camp - only I was by myself instead of with 8-10 teammates.

Woke up and ran an out and back 10 from the cabin.  Felt really good once again despite a lack of breakfast.  Strides afterward.  Aleta woke up right when I got back (she got here around 9 last night).
Short, easy run after the Germany v Argentina match.  Nice to have a down day.  Followed it up with an afternoon of tubing.

I was going to run before the lake swim, but the motivation was running pretty low and there was a hot breakfast on the table when I got up so I chose to eat instead.  The swim wasn't as hard as I remembered it being the last couple of years.  Later in the afternoon it was raining but I decided I wanted to get a run in so I headed out.  About halfway through it started raining harder and never really let up.  Legs felt ok.

Unmotivated, no energy, very warm, hilly run.  Went to the North Star Lodge and back.  The entire time it seemed like I was going up and down and up and down.  The full weekend of activities caught up to me.

My original plan was to do a set of hill sprints after driving home from the cabin, but instead of 3 hours the trip ended up taking 4 1/4.  I was way too hungry to run when I finally made it home so I ate an entire pizza instead.  After letting that sit for a couple hours I did an easy 4.  I was tired.

Eight 10 second hill sprints.  A cop watched me do the first three before deciding to move on.  Didn't feel as invincible as when I did these last week but I can't expect that every time.  Little big longer warmup, little bit shorter cooldown.  It was extremely humid.

Ran through downtown Kimberly.  It was really hot and humid so I didn't push the pace.  On the way back there was also a pretty decent headwind.  Something in my lower abdomen has been bothering me for a while, usually just during abs but today it was noticeable while running.

Woke up early so that I could buy Badgers football tickets then fell back asleep for another two hours or so.  When I finally woke up it took some motivating to get going on the run.  Ended up feeling pretty good.

Ran at High Cliff after Spain v Germany.  It was oppressively humid once again but the shade was nice.  Ran into Mike Brice and ran with him for about 10 minutes before he turned to go home.  Felt good and had a solid pace going until the last mile when I kind of died a bit.  Six strides afterward.  When I finished I looked like I had just come out of the pool.
Usual.  Still humid.  Legs felt heavy/sluggish.

Memorial to CE.  At Seymour St I stopped and stretched for a minute then did 10 x 30 seconds with 1 minute jog in between.  The pace on the pickups was probably 5K - 3K pace.  Felt pretty good doing them then I was a little tired finishing up the run.  It was a 'lack of sleep' tired though so I'm not concerned.

Long run at High Cliff.  I wanted 16 but the oppressive heat and humidity continued into today and I headed back to the car a mile early because I could tell that I was pretty dehydrated.  Didn't feel terrible but I never really felt awesome either.  It'd be nice if this heat would break sometime soon.
Usual morning run

I was going to run at High Cliff this afternoon but decided to wait because it was 90 degrees.  That turned out to be a good decision because if I had gone when I planned I would have been about halfway through my run when a major thunderstorm/hailstorm started.  Instead I did an extended Xavier loop at about 7:30.  Felt great the entire time.  While running down College Avenue a drunk guy yelled out, 'You should find something better to do than RUN on a F*CKING Saturday night!'.  Ha.  Did seven strides afterward then came inside and watched the Brewers wrap up their win while enjoying some post run pizza and beer.

It started thunderstorming when the World Cup Final ended, so I had to run on the treadmill.  I put in an old college football game and it actually didn't end up being too terrible.  Kept the pace real easy.  I'm kind of surprised I hit 100 this early in the summer.  Going to Boston on Thursday so I'll frontload this week a little bit.

Woke up late after staying up until 2 again.  I ran to Victoria's then looped down by the Fox River and came back through downtown.  Wore a new pair of shoes.  Felt solid, the humidity has finally gone down a little bit.
9 short hill sprints this week.  Did a little extra warmup to bring the total up to 7.  Felt solid once again.  Have to decide between the Lambeau Field race and Shithouse for July 31st.
Slept like a rock last night

Double out and back at High Cliff.  Took the legs a little while to get into it but by the second half I was feeling good and picked the pace up substantially for a little while.  Saw Brice and Reed Connor but only got to run with them for about 5 minutes because it was at the end of my run.

Early morning run before volunteering at church.  Did the loop through downtown Kimberly.  Felt pretty good for 9 miles, then I died a little bit.  This always seems to happen when I do my main run in the morning.
Massive thunderstorm that started at 3:00 and is still going on right now (midnight), so I was stuck doing my second run on the treadmill.  Legs were tired and it kind of sucked.  Oh well.

Morning long run before the day of travel.  It was still thunderstorming when I got up so I ran the first 5 inside then headed out and did an extended Xavier loop.  Felt strong the entire way.  Off to Boston now, it's going to be a fun weekend.

Ran around Charlestown (the area on the north side of Boston where our hotel is).  We're staying about a mile away from the Boston Garden so I also looped over there and checked things out.  Felt pretty good.  During the afternoon we walked about 5 miles in 90 degree heat while touring.

Did a 25 minute warmup, then 8 x 1 minute and 8 x 30 second pickups with 1 minute in between everything, then used the rest of the run as a cooldown.  Felt good to open it up a little bit.  Saw lots of other people out running.  In the afternoon we went to the Bunker Hill Monument and climbed the 294 steps up to the top.  This evening we went to Fenway Park and saw a great game - Red Sox 3 Rangers 2 in 11 innings.
Got up a little later and took a planned easy day.  Felt good, it's nice to step out the door knowing you only have to run for 50 minutes and then you're done for the day.

Last run around Boston.  Went down some roads I hadn't seen yet, then finished around Charlestown.  Towards the end I did a 2 minute pickup, took 2 minutes rest, then did 8 15 second sprints with 45 seconds recovery.  Felt nice and smooth for the most part.  Planning on doubling when we get home.
Ran again after flying home and then waiting a couple of hours after eating.  Blah.
Did the East South River loop after I got up, which unfortunately was at 10:15.  Couldn't sleep last night after taking a long nap on the plane.  Felt pretty good on the run though.

The usual 12 mile route out at High Cliff.  Felt good the entire time.  About two miles in there was a lady walking down the center of the trail oblivious to her surroundings.  I called out 'Passing on your left' and she jumped and mumbled something that I couldn't understand.  A few minutes later I saw her again and she gave me a really dirty look.  Whatever.  This evening we had an extremely intense storm that only lasted about 15 minutes but covered the front yard in hail and put the back yard under water.  I think we've had more rain this summer than in the past 10 combined.
Usual.  Legs a little tired.

10 min, 8 min, 6 min tempos with 2 minutes in between.  I felt like a bag of shit on the warmup and thought about canceling the workout but decided to go ahead with it.  Pace was nothing spectacular.  I did the last segment on the Madison Middle School track and split 5:23 through the mile.  Oppressive heat, dehydration, and fatigue from the past couple days contributed to me not feeling real good.  Long run tomorrow morning, hopefully I feel better.
It was raining.  I ran inside.
Still raining, but I went outside.  Felt tired so I cut it a little short.

Early morning long run.  I went out the CE trail to Kaukauna, looped through Combined Locks down by the Appleton Coated plant, came back through Kimberly, and went all the way down to John St.  I felt great through 13 miles.  The last couple I was running out of fuel but I made it.  Didn't realize there were so many hills in Combined Locks.  It was also really humid for 7 AM...I was soaked at the end.

Xavier out and back with a loop down to Lutz Park on the way out.  Aleta biked with me so for the first time this summer I had a companion on a run.  Felt good - the best effect of a long run is that it makes the next day's run seem so much shorter.  8 strides afterward.

Ran out to Kimberly and then added another mile at the end.  My body was really tired from sleep deprivation all afternoon (stayed up til 3 last night) but my legs felt light and springy on the run.  Finished the week one morning run short of my goal of 105, but that's ok.
Downtown loops.  Nothing special to report.
8 10 second hill sprints.  Felt pretty good.  My legs seem to be pretty used to running 90-100 miles per week.  Starting to look forward to Saturday's race.

Didn't feel very good all day - not sick but I was really tired and had a headache.  It was also oppressively humid, so I decided to postpone my scheduled workout to tomorrow.  Did an easy East South River loop at about 7:15 then added two more miles at the end.
I slept like shit last night.  Woke up at 5 AM, fell back asleep at like 8, and got up for good at 9:30. I didn't really want to run but made myself do it anyway.

Small workout.  I felt lethargic on the warmup but after doing a few strides once I started the faster stuff I felt really good.  The first interval was over before I knew it.  During the tempo I felt like I was running kind of slow but my last mile was around 5:15 and my pace was even so I must have just been feeling good.  The last interval was great, I covered about 1000 meters and felt strong.  This wasn't designed to be super hard but it was the best I've felt during a workout since probably February.  Saw Litsheim heading out for his run as I was bringing in the tempo.
Usual + a little bit

Ended up going out for an early dinner with some relatives so I ran to West and back at 7:45.  Made a real effort to keep the reins in even though I felt good.  On the way out I had to stop at Lawrence to take a massive deuce, then on the way back I saw Kelly Bogard and Whitney Schumacher downtown so I stopped and talked to them for a few minutes.
Easy out and back at like 5 PM.  Did strides after.  Legs felt a little sluggish but that's normal for a short run like this.  Race tomorrow, it should be fun.
Easy post race shakeout.  Legs felt a lot better afterward.

Went out around noon and did the Kimberly loop.  Legs didn't feel great but weren't terrible either.  Glad I got it in earlier in the day rather than waiting until late afternoon.  Heading up to Door County later today for a week, and I'm going to try to do 105+ each of the next two weeks.
Ran an out and back at Horseshoe Bay.  Don't remember too much about this run, must have been pretty uneventful.

Decided to switch it up a little bit and instead of doing the usual 10 second hill sprints I did 6 x 1 minute charges up the hill by the beach club.  Long warmup beforehand.  I underestimated the difficulty of this by quite a bit - the last two I was really hurting.  Haven't had that much lactic acid in a long time.

Ran to downtown Egg Harbor and back.  Legs were sore from the hills yesterday but once I got going it was better.  Towards the end of the run a car full of high schoolers drove by me and I was greeted with 'F@ggot!' and 'Nice headband c*nt!'.  They probably thought they were real cool.
90 degrees with a heat index a couple degrees higher so I kept this one really short
Drove to Peninsula State Park to do a long run.  I did two laps of an 8.5 mile loop just like last summer.  Pretty hilly route but I felt good and strong the entire way.
Morning run around the Horseshoe Bay property before we went out for breakfast at Al Johnson's.  Tough to get going this morning, I was really tired and sore.
Ran an out and back on Highway B.  Felt a lot better than this morning.  Must have been the hour nap I took this afternoon.
Easy morning shakeout.  I slept in a little bit and was much less sore than yesterday.

35 minute tempo run on Highway B.  I was extremely pissed off heading out the door and ended up pounding the warmup.  Got myself cooled down before the workout and it went really well.  Felt like I was in the zone for the majority of it, legs didn't start really fatiguing until the last 4 or 5 minutes.  Six strides afterward and then a short cooldown.  I've got a pretty good week going.
Easy morning out and back.  Didn't get going until about 10:30 but I felt good once I finally did.

Ran at Peninsula State Park.  Only had a couple hours rest in between runs and for about the first 7 miles of this one I just wasn't feeling it.  Lots of people in the park today.  When I was driving home I randomly saw Aron Block walking down the sidewalk so I pulled over and ended up going to his house and talking to him and Tomlinson for 10 or 15 minutes.  Really random, but it's almost always cool to see people you know.
Ran to downtown Egg Harbor and back at around noon.  Never felt real good on this run and the last 2 miles the heat started getting to me.  Going back to Appleton later today.

Woke up, ate some cereal and a granola bar, and headed out.  I went to Pierce Park and then did a double loop through downtown.  Seven strides incorporated into the last two miles.  Really hot again but I did much better than yesterday.
Heat index was about 100 so I did my second run on the treadmill.  Didn't feel like passing out or waiting until 8:00.  Legs felt real good.

Wasn't feeling it today.  Sleep hasn't been good the past couple nights, my allergies were terrible, and the heat continued.  I had planned on doing a track workout in the morning but canceled that and instead just did a fartlek around my usual morning loop.  Had intended on running another 5 in the afternoon but had no desire to do that when the time came.  Today was a wasted day training wise, but I guess you can't have a great day every day.
Easy run before driving to Minnesota

Ran the Como Park Relays (2x5x1K) with Rivers.  The combination of a pretty challenging loop and 100 degree heat made it pretty tough.  Felt decent enough on my first two intervals, then started to struggle.  The last one I just ran to finish.  Not a great performance, but I know I'm fit so I'm not terribly worried.

Ran an out and back through a sketchy area in downtown Minneapolis.  Turns out if I had gone the other direction I would have been able to run around the lakes.  Maybe next time.  It was hot and I felt pretty crappy for the most part.

Tried to do a long run around Northfield but couldn't finish it.  Turns out it's really hard to run very far the day after only eating one meal.  About 30 minutes in I started feeling really shaky.  Made it a few more miles but ended up deciding I didn't want to shuffle through any more.  I've kind of fallen off the train this week, need to get back on it.

Attempt #2 at the long run and this one went a little bit better.  Did a different loop so that I wouldn't have a turnoff like yesterday.  Stopped at Dairy Queen with about 2 miles to go to get a glass of water.  Felt ok, I think I've mostly made up my calorie deficiency.
Ran to the radio tower and back from Aleta's house.  It was 71 degrees with a slight breeze which was awesome.  Felt great and rolled pretty well for a lot of the run.  Also did six strides.

Short run after driving home from Northfield.  Not real happy with this week, I let about 20 miles drop because of poor eating and sleeping habits and hot weather.  I'll get it back together next week.
Ran after I woke up, which was at 10:45.  Through Kimberly.  Felt good, weather was pretty similar to yesterday.

8 Banta Bowl hill sprints.  Form felt off for the first couple but I think it got better as I went on. Otherwise I felt fine.  On the cooldown a lady pulled over in her van and asked for directions to Johnston school.  I knew where it was but didn't know the names of any of the streets, so the directions she got were kind of confusing.
Last night I said I was going to bed at 11.  I actually went to bed at 2.  Dang it.  Run was ok though.

The plan was 8 x 1000 at 5:00 pace on the Lawrence track but when I got over there their football team was all over the place and I could tell that I probably wouldn't be real welcome.  So, I did the first two intervals as timed runs on the road and went over to Madison Middle School.  The track there is a concrete piece of junk, but it served the purpose.  On the first 1000 I started off way too slow, then starting with the second one I was able to find the pace.  Felt like I could keep running this pace for a long time but I didn't feel sharp at all.  I know that in a couple of weeks I'll have more sharpness and the times will easily be several seconds faster.  Overall a confidence boosting workout because I felt very strong.
Went to bed at 3 last night.  I guess I'll just catch up on sleep after the move is over.  Quite tired this morning but I got it in.
12 miles around the west side of town.  Was cruising for about the first 8 then probably slowed down a good bit.  Stomach cramped up toward the end.  Moving day tomorrow.
Xavier loop early before driving down to Madison.  Getting up sucked but the run was fine.  Move in day was long, real tired at the end of it.

Found the trail by Lake Mendota that I ran on during Camp of Champs 5 years ago.  After 40 minutes I did 4 x 30 seconds, 4 x 60 seconds, 4 x 30 seconds, 4 x 15 seconds.  I felt pretty crappy on the surges.  Short cool down afterward.  I kind of died on it.  Humidity is back.
Easy shakeout.  Had to wait for the cable guy to come before I could run and then I ended up turning back because of some lightning.

Ran on the trails by the lakeshore.  I went down so many different paths that I wouldn't be able to reproduce this run if I tried.  It was pretty fun, lots of scenery.  Felt good for the first 80 minutes or so then by the end I was dead.  100 minutes is about my limit I think.  Got chafed pretty bad on my thighs.
Out and back morning run.  Ran through a residential area that was decently hilly.  Felt pretty good but my chafing is really bad.  Might go get some vaseline before I run again.  Rudisha 1:41.09!
Easy run along the lakeshore.  Felt really good the entire time.  Saw Carl Gladitsch at one point.  I stopped five minutes from the end and did eight strides - each one felt great.

22 minute tempo run.  Started from a park and ran through a residential area.  It wasn't my best tempo run ever but I accomplished the objective and felt good for the most part.  4 x 30 seconds afterward.  Exam time...
Same afternoon run as yesterday to Picnic Point and back.  Felt solid.  Passed exam FM this afternoon.
Tough to get out of bed this morning.  Felt pretty good on the run though...ran through another residential part of Madison.
I had planned on doing more than this but I was really tired after spending the day at Noah's Ark.  Good shakeout though.

Pretty great run.  Ran over towards the UW arb, ran a little bit in there, then ran home.  I'd like to run here more often - unfortunately it's like 4 miles away from my apartment.  66 degrees this morning.

Picnic Point.  Ran the first two miles as a warmup, fartleked over the next 3+, then cooled down from the end of the trail back to my apartment (about 5 minutes).  I was moving pretty well on my pickups and felt a lot better than I have been feeling at the faster paces.  Pushed it up just about all of the inclines and threw in a few 10-15 second sprints toward the end.

Last night I couldn't get to sleep because something in the apartment next to mine kept beeping, and then I woke up late so this was a late morning run.  I went to the arb again.  I found a slightly shorter route over there but I think I'll have to drive over to do runs of significant length.  Didn't feel bad but I could tell my legs were a little tired.  I'll run again when I get back to Appleton.

Squeezed in a run on the regular loop when I got home.  The drive took 3 hours because of heavy traffic and construction and I didn't get home until just after 6 so I had to hustle since the Packers started at 7.  Legs were tired but didn't bother me.

Fail.  I went to the track intending to do a 2 mile somewhere between 9:50 and 10:00 and then 4-6 x 400.  I slept like crap again last night and there were 18 mph winds, but breaking 10:00 shouldn't be too difficult.  Crossed the mile at 5:02, then my next 200 into the wind was a 39 and I stopped and just jogged home.  The entire time my legs felt like they were spinning close to as fast as they could.  I'm starting to think that I've screwed something up with my training since the majority of the sub tempo pace workouts I've attempted recently haven't gone well.  Either that or I've lost all my toughness.  I'll figure it out eventually.

Did a double out and back at High Cliff for a long run.  My aerobic system was never stressed at all and I felt like I had a good pace going.  Definitely was down around 6:30 for the majority of it.  Legs fatigued a bit the last 3 miles but my form stayed together the entire way and I never started dying.  During the second half of the run I thought about my training this summer and how where I'm at now is fairly comparable to where I was a year and a half ago when I was coming back from the stress fracture (aerobically strong but the legs don't have very many gears) - seeing as I haven't done consistent speed work since February I really shouldn't be that surprised by this.  It didn't take long in spring 2009 to get my legs used to running fast again so I'm confident I'll be able to get back into good racing shape...don't have enough time to really change anything before next weekend's 5K but by my races in October I'll be ready to go.
Usually I'm not one to really care about the numbers but the only purpose of this run was so that I could get 100 miles for the week.  Dumb.

To avoid 'death by heat' I ran 30 minutes on the treadmill then ran the last six outside.  Ended up working out well...by the time the heat started to sap me I only had like a mile left.  Legs were tired but that's expected after a long run yesterday.

Ouch, really hot and humid.  Ran an out and back to Xavier.  Started at 1:30 in the afternoon because I'm an idiot.  The entire time I didn't really want to be out running, which made the run not very fun.  4 sluggish strides afterward.

Decided to do a night run when I got back to Madison.  Ran out and back in the residential area that I ran in a few times last week.  Felt a ton better than my first run today, I think the temperature cooling off a bit and eating a large dinner helped me.

After waiting for a thunderstorm to finish passing through the area I did this workout on the trails by the lakeshore.  Once I got going I felt pretty good.  Tried to keep squeezing the pace down as I went on and I think that I did.  Good workout.

6/1/10 - 8/31/10: 1184 miles (average 12.9/day, 90.1/week)
For these same three months last year I did 1108 miles.  Especially considering where I started June I'm really pleased with this.  My tentative plan is to hover around 90 for the next few weeks, then take it down a little bit to race.  Then I'll probably go back to putting down base, just have to figure out what exactly it will be for.
Slept horrible again last night, what else is new.  Actually felt pretty good on the run though.
Picnic Point before dinner.  Felt good but had to hold in a deuce for the last mile.  The fraternities on Langdon were bumping this evening.

First day of grad school.  Since my first class wasn't until 11:00 I was able to do my workout in the morning.  Did the same thing as last Monday basically - 22 minute tempo and then 4 x 30 seconds hard.  Felt pretty good.  Legs were a little tired, probably partly due to training and partly because I took an Ambien last night.  Also, I'm pretty sure I saw a drug deal going down while I was walking to class.

I had to run some errands so I decided to drive over to the arb and do my afternoon run there.  It started raining lightly when I was about halfway, then about 10 minutes after I finished it picked up quite a bit.  Good run.

Picnic Point plus an extra mile.  Some guy stuck about 10 yards behind me for about a mile in the middle, finally I put in a surge and got rid of him.  Did six strides and two '200s' at the end.  It was in the 60s and really windy...felt like cross country season.  The legs felt pretty good.

Started with about 10 guys from the team and ran out to the Iron Bridge.  About half of the group turned back and I kept going with Reid, Massey, Hulse, and Pat.  We went out to the radio tower then did a loop through the upper arb.  I added a mile on the course after the four of them went in.  Stomach was bothering me for most of the run.
Ran on the course.  Legs were feeling pretty tired...form was kind of falling apart towards the end.
Did a night run after getting back to Madison.  Legs felt better than this morning.  Hopefully I can catch up on sleep a little bit tonight.

Ran on the lakeshore trails.  The weather was cool and it was pretty windy.  I felt good the entire time.  At about the 55 minute mark I was approaching some guy from behind...he heard me coming and started picking up his pace and looking back every 15-20 seconds to make sure that he was still ahead of me.  After a few minutes of this I got tired of it and just went by him.  I could hear him breathing heavily behind me for another minute or so and then I'm pretty sure he stopped and started walking.  Finished with six strides.

Great tempo today.  I started from the same park I've started my past couple of these from and did three loops plus an extra minute to make it 35 minutes total.  Went 11:37, 11:19, 11:08 for the loops.  I'd guess I started around 5:30 pace and worked down to 5:15ish, but I don't know for sure (didn't measure the loop).  Did the usual 4 x 30 seconds afterward.  The entire workout I felt really strong and under control.  Now (2 hours later) my legs are dead.  I also went to the Wisconsin Track Club season kickoff meeting and met several people that know people from the Olaf team (Chris, Adrian, Mittelsteadt).
Didn't really want to run this morning and at first decided I would just do a longer run this afternoon but at the last minute I put my stuff on and went out.  Went over to the hospital and back.

Picnic Point and Raymer's Cove plus a little bit extra at the end.  Legs felt a little tired but nothing too bad.  Weather continues to be in the 60s.  I don't doubt there will be one more hot spell though.

Did this workout on the lakeshore trails.  Lots of back and forth running on the same paths since a lot of the other paths are too narrow to run fast on.  I did two strides before starting and felt terrible on both of them, but when I started the intervals I felt pretty good.  I definitely was running a strong pace the entire time.  The last two I was getting a little tired but I never tied up.  Might run again later, might not.
Easy shakeout.  Only wanted to go a half hour.
Early morning run before the Badger game.  It was lightly raining.  Nobody was on the streets yet.

After the Badger game I went back to my apartment and sat on the couch for about an hour and a half before finally getting out the door for run #2.  Ran on the lakeshore paths.  Legs were a little tired from being on my feet for about 5 hours earlier today.

Went over to the arb and back for a long run.  I knew I wasn't going to have a great run when I started feeling shaky about 20 minutes in.  Ended up turning around a little early because I was hungry and wasn't really feeling the run, but on the way back I ran past the course for the Madison Ironman and seeing those people busting their asses motivated me to let the sand out and do the entire planned 100 minutes.  Around 75 I ended up getting a second wind and feeling good the rest of the way.

Ran with the WTC guys.  I had planned on doing 10 but their loop ended up being a little bit longer.  We went past Raymer's Cove and and around a part of Madison I hadn't seen before, including running up a hill that was comparable to Radar Hill.  Pace was relaxed.  Most of the guys seem pretty cool, I'll probably try to run with them on distance runs every once in a while but will more than likely continue to do my own workouts.  Four strides at the end.
Blah, wasn't feeling it at all this morning.  I really need to get on a better and more consistent sleep schedule.

Had another pretty good workout, it seems like I'm starting to actually get fit.  The last two 3:00 intervals it was starting to get tough but I just kept focus and finished without too much trouble.  Doing these workouts on the hilly trails should help prepare me for racing.  Not sure what I'll do for a second workout this week.
Out and back.  My right leg had some weird pains this morning, didn't feel like it was functioning properly.  Nice morning.

Ran a little bit past Raymer's Cove and turned around when I hit 30 minutes.  I didn't start until 7 PM so it got dark about halfway.  Running through the woods on the way back was a little harrowing at times...had to slow down because there were points where I couldn't see the path.  Felt pretty good for the most part.  I still have some strange discomfort around my right knee so I'll have to keep a close eye on that.

Almost had myself talked into a day off after a busy afternoon, but at 6:30 I got out the door.  After a 3 mile warmup I did a 20 minute tempo run and felt really strong.  Expanded the post tempo strides to 4 x 45 seconds and they felt great.  The knee is still noticeable but it's not getting worse so I'm not real concerned about it.  Once again it was getting dark as I finished.  My internal clock is extremely messed up right now, need to get it back to normal.

Late morning run.  Went over to Grainger to turn in some homework, then headed to the lakeshore paths.  My right leg pain is now dispersed throughout my thigh and was rather uncomfortable.  Not sure what to do about it...keep running and hope it goes away is going to be my strategy for now.
Evening run in Appleton.  Nothing to report.  Best of luck to the Oles tomorrow.

Didn't get up to do a long run in the morning like I had intended, so I had to miss the middle two quarters of the Badger game.  I went out to Kaukauna and looped back through Combined Locks and Kimberly.  Felt real strong the entire time.  I noticed my thigh acting up during the first four miles but then it didn't bother me the rest of the run.  Got back in time to see the Badgers barely squeak out a victory.
Stayed up late watching college football and then got up early to run before going to the Packer game.  It was below 50 degrees out which felt a bit cold.

Ran again after the game.  Did the seven mile Memorial loop.  Whatever is going on in my leg bothered me on both of my runs today and I'm pretty sure it was affecting my stride.  As much as I don't want to I might take tomorrow off to rest it.

I hate taking days off, but I had a long day of class and meetings and wasn't able to run until it was dark.  Figured my leg could use a little rest.

Edit (12/1/10): On this day I actually did start out on a run but a half mile in I decided I was being stupid so I turned around.  Originally I wasn't going to count a 1 mile run, but after some deliberation I've decided that I can count it for the purposes of my streak.
Easy shakeout.  I would have rather been sleeping.

Another Tuesday workout on the lakeshore trails.  I pushed the pace and was working really hard by the last two intervals.  Definitely stressed the VO2 today.  Overall my aerobic system felt good.  Need to get a new right leg though, the one I have isn't working very well.  By the time I got done my knee was very stiff and my hamstring felt like it was gong to explode.
Ran after my first class so that I could sleep in a little bit
Not liking this 'days getting shorter' thing.  I started an 11 mile run at 6:00 and it was dark at the end.  Went over to the arb.  Except for the usual aches and pains I felt great.

Oh man my legs were tired today.  Not sure why I was so tired but I absolutely had nothing.  Ran on the lakeshore trails.  At the end I was going to do strides but after doing two that probably weren't faster than six minute pace I called it a day.  Hopefully I'll feel better for a workout tomorrow.
Legs still feeling sluggish

Race simulation of sorts.  I had originally planned to do this on the track but because of the 25 mph winds I scrapped that idea and instead went to the trails.  I felt fine the entire time but never seemed to be fully engaged in the workout.  Got out hard on the first interval like I wanted to, then it took a little while to find the right pace during the tempo.  Opening it up at the end was fun.  I just have to get a little more sleep and then I should be feeling real good.
Very early morning run after going to bed at like 1:30.  Did an out and back down Sherman Ave.  Leg was painful for the first 10 minutes or so then when I warmed up it felt a little better.

Went out at 5 intending to go 15 but I got lost in the arb and ended up getting an extra mile out of it.  After about 40 minutes I felt great the rest of the way.  I got a great night of sleep last night, now just need to string a couple of them together.

Lakeshore trails run, and added on a little bit by the Eagle Heights apartments.  Felt great the entire time.  Saw Hooley and Sepe...they quacked at me so I squished them back.  Did strides afterward and after my fifth one my right achilles wasn't feeling quite right so I just stopped.

I was scheduled to do a workout this afternoon...it didn't happen because I got caught up doing other things.  At 5:30 I was really hungry so instead of going for a run I made dinner.  Finally at around 9 I decided I wanted to go for a run to get rid of some stress so I went and pounded 10 miles.  Had some achilles pain.  At this point it isn't really bothering me but I know it's there.  Might have to take some time off after Saturday's race to heal up.

I wasn't planning on tapering this week but due to everything going on in my life outside of running I haven't had the time or energy to do doubles.  The workout this afternoon was ok...not as great as my past couple interval workouts but not even close to a death struggle or anything.  Could feel my achilles the first few steps of every interval and then it would be fine.  Hopefully I can get some sleep tonight and tomorrow night.
Ran a 50 minute out and back and added a 16-17 minute loop in the middle.  Felt ok.  Nice weather.

I was hoping to sleep in but woke up at 6:15 and couldn't fall back asleep...not how I wanted to start the day.  I ran at 8, out and back on the lakeshore paths then did strides and 2 x '200'.  Didn't feel that great on the run but the strides felt pretty smooth.  Mental toughness tomorrow, control the demons.

Ran 90 minutes to and through the arb.  Every step was a mental struggle.  I stopped two different times for about 5 minutes just because I needed a break.  Kind of falling apart right now, I'll figure it out.

Went out at about 10:45 and did an out and back on the lakeshore path and through Eagle Heights.  This run went better than yesterday.  Started getting really hungry the last mile or two.  The weather was awesome - 47 degrees and zero wind.
Picnic Point.  Kept it really relaxed and felt fine.  Beautiful afternoon for a run.
Easy shakeout
Ran with Jack Delehanty in the arb.  Great to have somebody to run with (even if it was a former Carl).  Conversation makes the run pass much more quickly.  Felt good the entire time.

My main goal for this workout was to get some confidence back.  I wanted to do something quantifiable, so I did six repeats on the Picnic Point trail, which is around 1270 meters and fairly hilly.  I went 3:59, 3:57, 4:00, 3:59, 4:01, 4:01 (averages out to around 5:02 pace).  The way out is a net uphill and the way back is a net drop, but both ways have both ups and downs.  I didn't feel unstoppable but I was able to be mentally tough and run all the repeats in fairly similar times.  Tired at the end but not completely spent.
Nice morning run on the trails.  I was a little sore from yesterday when I first got up but everything loosened up after about 10 minutes.  Weather continues to be great.
Easy out and back at about 6 PM.  Started real easy and came back about a minute faster.  Feeling pretty good.

Was hoping to do a 20 minute tempo, I ended up stopping at 15 because I wasn't feeling good and was starting to go over my threshold.  At first I was fairly discouraged, by the end of my short cooldown I was ok with it.  Can't afford another hit to the confidence.
Easy evening run.  I ended up taking a nap for about an hour, then having a pretty large snack before going.  Legs felt ok.

Same long run route I've done the past several weeks.  I felt sluggish the first couple miles, then started feeling pretty good, and then was dead at the end.  A year ago on this Saturday there was frost on the ground and I ran in tights.  Today it was 85.  Badgers keep the axe for the 7th straight year!

Easy run after the Packer game.  Did the 8 mile loop through downtown Appleton.  For the most part I felt pretty good but I had a wave of the shits with a mile to go.  After stopping to take care of that I finished up and then did strides.

Very busy day so I got up at 7 to get a run in.  Since I was up until 1:30 doing homework I was pretty tired, but the run felt pretty good.  Another great morning weather wise.  Hopefully I'll be able to squeeze in another 4 or 5 miles later.
Did another half hour before going to my 'day before interview' dinner with the Ameriprise recruiters and other candidates.  Felt a bit tired, Mondays are long days.
For some reason I really wanted to do a shakeout run, so I did one.

Short workout to get to get one last bit of hard running in before Jim Drews.  I felt really good, much better than I have been feeling.  Loving this warm weather that has been going on for the past week plus.  I had my interview with Ameriprise this afternoon and the recruiter didn't seem that impressed when he asked what my proudest accomplishment was and I answered winning conference.
Ran after my first class and decided to do my longer run first.  Legs felt pretty good, just had a little gastrointestinal distress about 2 miles in.
Took a 2 hour nap this afternoon, then did my second run.  Nothing special.
Lakeshore trails run.  Legs felt quite good for most of it.  Did a few pickups in the middle.
Pre race run shortly after getting up (which was at around 10:30).  Legs felt good.  Haven't had a good race since February...hopefully tomorrow's the day.

Well I didn't have a great race, but I was at least able to snap my streak of having really bad ones.  I ran 3 seconds faster than last year but conditions were a lot better this year.  It was great to see everyone from St Olaf and the morning as a whole was fun.  Not sure when my next race will be...might do something around Thanksgiving otherwise not until indoor track.
Ran after watching the Packers lose in overtime for the second week in a row.  I think I'm going to take this next week pretty easy and then get back to more regular training.

Easy out and back to the hospital.  I love days where I only have to run 5 miles and don't have the stress of a race the next day.  Pretty soon after I turned around two guys passed me on a bike...one was pedaling and the other was riding on the pegs.  As they came by the pedaler was saying, 'This really hurts my asshole.'  I laughed.
Waited until after Aleta left to run so I ended up going out at 8 PM.  Easy out and back just past Citgo.  Meh.
After my class got done I went home and did a run on the lakeshore trails.  Felt good despite not getting much sleep last night.  Go Rangers!
Didn't run until 6:15.  Did out and back 8 to the church and added 2 more in the middle.  Legs felt real good (not surprising considering my low mileage week) but my hands froze.
Extended Picnic Point.  I felt pretty crappy on this run, glad it wasn't very long.  Drove home right after.
Ran on the treadmill during the fourth quarter of Wisconsin at Iowa.  WHAT A GAME!  Felt real good the entire time.  The down week has been great.

8 mile Memorial loop.  It was a light rain for the first 7.5 miles then the last couple minutes I got poured on.  Before the rain picked up I had planned on doing strides at the end, but I scrapped them and just went inside.  Good run.

Lakeshore trails to Eagle Heights at 11:00.  I got 4 hours of sleep last night so I decided to get the run over with early since I'll definitely be tired later.  Weather was nice and unseasonably warm.  I'll probably do 75ish this week.
Out and back to the church.  It was insanely windy this morning, Lake Mendota was nothing but whitecaps.  Little hungry from lack of breakfast but felt good for the most part.

Easy double in more hurricane force winds.  The glass of the main door of my apartment building shattered this afternoon because the door was blown shut so forcefully.  After the run I did pedestal and pushups...first general strength in a long time.

Arb.  Winds were gusting up to 50 miles per hour and at some points I thought I was going to get lifted up and blown away.  Despite feeling like I was running in a tornado my legs felt good.  Started a new pair of shoes.

Was planning on nine but some workers were cleaning up debris from the wind of the past several days and had the trail blocked off so I turned and did an eight mile route instead.  First real run of the fall in tights.  It took me about 3 miles to get going but for the second half of the run I felt decent.  Did 5 pickups during the last 2 miles with the wind at my back.  Off to Northfield this afternoon.
Ran in the arb in Northfield.  It was cool to be back in there but I didn't feel all that good.  Never really got going.  Oh well.
Ran the pre meet cross campus with the team.  It was fun to see all of the guys.  Had a great caf dinner afterward courtesy of Adrian.  Hopefully the guys can bust one out tomorrow.

Ran Cornhole with an extra loop in the arb in the morning.  Felt about the same as yesterday morning...not very good.  Went to the MIAC meet in the afternoon which went about as well as it could have.  Hamline crushed everyone in the men's race with Monson winning and 4 in the top 6.  The Big O had a good performance and beat St Johns for 2nd...Adrian and Massey made all conference with 3 more as honorable mention.  Everyone definitely put it all out there.  In the women's race Maren and Emma went right after Simone and she looked really uncomfortable having two people right on her shoulder as opposed to running all by herself.  Going up the big hill the three of them were all together, then 2 minutes later on the back straightaway Maren and Emma came around the corner together with Simone nowhere in sight.  Awesome.  They ended up going 1-2 and the team won by a good margin.  All the sprinting I did around the course was definitely worth an extra mile.
Didn't run until about 10 PM.  I slept lousy and felt crappy when I got up then just never got around to running before I left Northfield.  When I got back to Madison I did a little shakeout.

Went to bed late last night so instead of getting up to run before my first class I ran at 11:15.  Felt really good when I got out there and hammered a good portion of the run below 6 minute pace.  Hadn't had that feeling on a run in a little while.  Ended up being 5 minutes late to my second class since I decided to eat lunch rather than just going straight there.
Out and back six at 6:00.  Legs felt pretty good again.  It gets dark too early...and in a week it will be dark an hour earlier.
Getting back into the habit of regular doubles.  I was tired this morning but I still got it in and made it to class on time.

Back to back 15+ mile days for the first time since September.  I stopped at the track in the middle of this run and did 12 150 meter strides with a 250m jog recovery.  Didn't feel fast at all, definitely have some work to do in that area.  I didn't have enough to eat today which combined with my lack of sleep had me feeling pretty weak at the end of the run.
I was sleeping by 11:15 last night, thus I felt a lot better this morning.

Same Arb loop as last Wednesday, only this time there weren't 50 mile an hour winds.  It was a beautiful 57 degree afternoon.  Legs were a bit tired, as I would expect them to be.  Ran into Mike Brice about 10 minutes from the end and I ended up talking to him for about 20 minutes.
Usual out and back 5 plus strides.  It was windy but I felt pretty good.

Eagle Heights.  The winds have returned...not as strong as last week but they are gusting and the lake is going crazy.  My legs actually felt great on this run but my stomach was bothering me.  Something's been messed up down there for months...I haven't been able to do a sit up pain free since March.  At least it rarely affects me while running and even then it's never really more than just a nuisance.

Ran over to Grainger to turn in an assignment then headed to the lakeshore trails.  I ended up being really zoned out and took a digger about halfway through.  Didn't hurt anything, just got pretty dirty.  It was 33 degrees this morning with a windchill of 25.  The warm weather was fun while it lasted.
Ran again when I got back to Appleton.  Kept it really easy.  Legs were feeling a little flat, probably because my runs were kind of close together and I ran right after a 2 hour drive.

My original plan was 15 but when I finished my loop I felt so strong that I figured I'd be cheating myself if I didn't tack on a few more.  Did a loop out to Kaukauna and down by Appleton Coated, then looped back to the CE trail and followed that back home, then added my loop over by McKinley that I do before tempo runs in the summer.  Felt great the entire time, honestly one of the easiest runs I've ever done.  It's so much easier to do a long run in 40 degree weather than in 90 degree weather.  Badgers are 8-1...keeping the fingers crossed for a Rose Bowl trip.

Xavier.  Starting out my legs were dead, first two miles probably took around 15 minutes.  After that I loosened up and the pace gradually decreased.  Six strides afterward.  I watched the New York Marathon this morning and it got me excited to run one.  Maybe in 2011.

Lakeshore trails run in some beautiful 62 degree weather.  I didn't have enough to eat this morning so the last 15 minutes I felt a little weak.  I also feel like I might be getting a cold.  Still not that bad of a run.
Didn't get to do my second run until 6:45.  Just an easy out and back.  As tired as I felt before starting I actually felt quite good while running.
Ran over to MGE to pay my electric bill then looped back to Tenney Park and ran around there.  Still not feeling 100%, but the 60 degree weather is great.

Over the course of the day I started developing a pretty nasty cough, so I cut my second run from 10 miles to 7.  Had to stop at a gas station to poop.  The run actually felt good and I didn't cough at all during it...once I stopped it started back up though.  10 strides afterward.

Lakeshore trails out and back.  My cough is a little better today but my face is pretty congested.  Run was fine other than having to stop halfway through to hack up some mucous.  I saw Joe Sepe on the trails and he gave me a really weird look when I said squish.  67 degrees on November 10th.
