Chopped a couple miles off the afternoon run again today because of my cold.  Legs are feeling good with all the miles, just have to get back to 100% health.  I should be fine in a couple days.

Arb 12.  On the way back I did 4 x 30 seconds, 6 x 1 minute, 4 x 30 seconds with 1 minute in between everything.  Really easy fartlek, just wanted to do something to get the legs moving a little faster.  Over by the Arb I saw Zach Mellon sprinting up a massive hill.  My sickness is better today.  Not a big fan of daylight savings time...I finished this run at 4:50 and it was dark.
Late morning Eagle Heights.  Didn't sleep very well last night but I felt really good.  Thought about potential racing schedules for this coming winter and spring.
Had an exam from 4 to 6 this afternoon.  After I got home from that I went for another run.  Felt great so I did an extra mile.  Wish I was racing down at Wartburg tomorrow.  Go Big O!

Watched Wisconsin kick the crap out of Indiana 83-20, then shortly after I headed out for a long run.  The path I had wanted to do an out and back on ended up only being about 5 miles long, so I came back and then added Picnic Point.  Felt pretty good other than my hands freezing.

First run of the day at 12:30 (got up at 11:30 after going to bed at 3).  My only calories after my long run yesterday came from a frozen pizza and some beers so I expected to feel like crap on this run but I surprised myself and felt pretty good.  8 strides afterward.

Did my second run during the third quarter of the Giants/Cowboys game (actually didn't end up missing too much since there was some sort of power outage in the stadium).  It had been raining but stopped shortly before I went out.  Felt a little shaky for the second and third miles but then I came around for the last couple.  Happy with this week, going to try to get 110 next week.
Same 11 AM Eagle Heights run that I've done the past several Mondays.  I overdressed a bit and my legs were a little tired.  Not too bad of a run though.
6:30 PM out and back.  Felt much better than on my first run today.

I couldn't fall asleep last night because I was stressing about grades.  My legs were tired this morning when I ran Picnic Point.  Got it in though.  Nice morning; 40 degrees, sunny, no wind.  Saw a guy trying to put his fishing boat on a trailer and pull it out of the water by himself.  He was struggling.

Time to start working on some speed.  When I got to the track the Badgers CC team was working out so I stretched and did ballistics in a nearby parking lot and waited for them to finish before I went in.  These 200s weren't real taxing...didn't feel like I could go too much faster, but it'll come.  During the rest I'd jog a 200 and then stand for the rest of the time.  Happy with this.
Getting up this morning was rough, almost didn't run.

Wanted a new route today so I ran over to the Capital City Bike Path and did an out and back.  It was a pretty nice route and I was able to run on grass for a decent amount of it.  It looks like the path goes on for quite a ways so I'll have to check it out sometime for a long run.  The first 15-20 minutes my legs felt sluggish but then I felt good the rest of the time.  It's getting colder.

Didn't run this morning because I felt horrible when I got up...really tired and lethargic.  Ran Eagle Heights after I got done with class for the day.  Started off sluggish but ended up feeling good the second half.  Six strides afterward.  Maybe run again later tonight, maybe not.

Long run in the arb.  Stopped at Grainger on the way over to drop off my assignment.  For about the first hour of the run I felt pretty bad, like I was going to either pass out or puke.  Then for whatever reason I started feeling good and finished up at a pretty solid pace.  Some punk kids were skateboarding down the big hill on Edgewood St and one of them bit the dust pretty bad.
Easy out and back first thing in the morning.  It was cold, had to break out my under armour jacket.  Didn't feel great but it was ok.
Spent the day in La Crosse watching swimming.  Decided to do a short shakeout when I got home.  Felt a little tired the first mile but then got into it.

I had hoped to do my longer run in the morning but that idea went off the table when I didn't wake up until 10:30.  Did Picnic Point plus strides.  As I was doing my strides a guy that looked like he was about 50 came up to me.  He smelled like booze and was drinking a Budweiser.

Him: 'How fast you running that 100 meter dash?'
Me: 'Not sure, just doing them a little bit under my max speed.'
Him: 'Well you look pretty fast, I'd say about 9.26 seconds.'
Me: 'Yeah, probably.  That'd be a world record though.'
Him: 'You know in sprinting the key is your arms.  You have to move them back and forth and let them carry your body forward.'
Me: 'Right, thanks for the advice.'

After watching the Packers dismantle the hapless Vikings I went out for run #2.  For the first 3 miles I had the same light headed feeling that I had on Friday's long run, but at the 4 mile mark I stopped to pee and the run got a lot better after that.  109 for the week and 3 straight 100s, now I'm going to take somewhat of a down week and do around 90.

Usual Monday routine.  I went out with the idea in the back of my mind that I was going to do this as a progression run, but when I started out I didn't feel that good so I ran easy for the first couple miles.  After that I started squeezing the pace down and after a couple minutes I got into a good rhythm.  Picked it up a little more shortly after the turn around, then at about 6.5 I started feeling it a bit so I backed off for a half mile or so before running another mile and a half hard and then cooling down back to my apartment.  Total time was about 62 minutes, don't know how fast I got going but it felt like a good effort.  Got back in time to see the last couple minutes of NCAAs; Chelanga is a beast.
Before the run I didn't really want to go out...would have rather just sat on the couch and watched basketball.  Once I got out there my legs felt surprisingly good and the run was great.

Did the run that I did last Wednesday on the Capitol City trail.  It was real cold (wind chills in the single digits).  Felt fine but I wasn't running very fast.  Glad I don't have to run again today.

Ran some loops through downtown Appleton.  On the College Avenue bridge a guy driving a suburban rolled down his window and called my a faggot.  The second half of the run I got moving pretty good.  During the last mile it started lightly snowing which was kind of cool.  Six strides afterward.

Did a long warmup and then did 10 repeats on the Banta Bowl hill.  Didn't feel real great today, not really sure why.  I didn't really want to be there at all but I told myself to get through it, and the last three repeats or so I actually somewhat enjoyed it.  The best I felt all day was on the cool down.  Shakeout later after letting Thanksgiving dinner settle.
Post Thanksgiving dinner run.  Felt good, not too bloated.

Woke up this morning and thought about what I wanted to do today running wise.  The recurring sentiment was 'not much,' so since I had a short day scheduled for this weekend I decided to use it today.  Ran on the treadmill while watching the first half of the Badger basketball game.  Legs were good.

This afternoon I saw a doctor to get my stomach checked out since something's been bothering me for quite a while.  He determined that I don't have a traditional inguinal hernia but said it was probable that I have a sports hernia (a torn muscle in the lower abdomen which results in muscle pulling away from the bone).  I was sent to get an MRI...the radiologist wasn't 100% sure since this is apparently a pretty rare injury but it looks like this is what I have.  These things don't heal on their own, but are different from inguinal hernias in the sense that there's no real danger in not operating immediately.  Eventually I'll have to get it fixed, but the problem is that after surgery I won't be able to run at all for about a month and then I'd have to really gradually ease back into it, so it would be 2+ months before I'd be back to any decent training.  My inclination, seeing as I've probably had this for 3/4 of a year already and it hasn't really affected my running, only my ability to do abs, is to put off surgery and run the series of races I'm planning on in the first part of 2011 (culminating in Grandma's) and then go under the knife in the summmer.  The earliest I could have the operation is in January, so I have a while to decide what to do.

Today was kind of a strange day running wise.  I ran 4 miles right when I got up and then just over 2 hours later did another 6.  The first run I felt fine and probably should have gone longer but I just wasn't in the mood so instead I came home and ate a doughnut.

I wasn't planning on running again so soon after my first run but I had to do an errand before the Badger game and I decided I'd rather be able to just enjoy the game and not have to run during it so at 12:15 I headed out and did East South River.  I was running fast from the start and by about mile 3 I was for all intents and purposes doing a tempo run.  Felt good so I just kept going.  Used the last 5 minutes as a cooldown.
Easy six.  Slept crappy, not the most enjoyable run.

Ran at 4 after watching the Packers lose.  Felt better than on my first run but I need to get better sleep tonight.  When I was heading home on John St some asshole wanted to turn right onto Telulah and laid on his horn because I was in the intersection even though I was there first and didn't have a stop sign.  It scared the crap out of me and I was tempted to curse him out but then I decided that probably wouldn't be a great idea since I was wearing a shirt that had my name on it.

Started off on my usual 11 AM Monday run but 5 minutes in I felt light headed and wanted to stop.  When things hadn't smoothed out by 2.5 miles I decided I'd just turn around at 3.  The antibiotics I just started taking for my cough are probably messing with my system.  I'll try again later.

Decided to do a shorter evening run...I'd like to get rid of this sickness that I've had for 3 weeks now.  Ended up feeling pretty good, no coughing the first four miles.  It started raining the second half.  Did eight strides afterward.
Usual 5 mile morning route.  Felt good.

Didn't run until 5:30.  Decided to see if the arb is runnable at night so I went and did Arb 12.  It actually wasn't that bad; wouldn't want to do it if there was ice and snow (granted I wouldn't be able to anyway) but for today I could see just fine.  Felt like I was cruising, but it could have been because of the darkness.  Had some gourmet peanut butter sandwiches for dinner - I was lazy.  436 miles for November, missing my August total by one.
Easy 5.  Don't like this cold.

First indoor workout at the Shell.  I was a bit slow in getting out the door and on the warmup I was cold so I wasn't real confident going into the workout.  Once I got past the first 200 though my legs felt great and I was hitting 31-32 with no problems at all.  Rest was the same as last time, jog a lap (in lane 5) and then wait for the last 30-35 seconds to pass.  For the last one I decided to do a 400 and I didn't tie up at all.  200s are pretty easy to fake, but as easy as this felt I think I might be close to PR shape for the mile.

Long run on the Capitol City trail.  I made it to a sign that said 'Public Hunting Ground' and turned around.  Negative split by a minute on the way back and felt like I was going fairly fast so the run might have been a touch over 17.  I saw about 15 deer at various points.  It was also nice to do my entire run while it was light out.
I went to bed at 3:30 last night.  Got up this morning and was really tired.  Once I started running I woke up a bit.  Did Picnic Point.  Squished some Carls.
Eagle Heights + 6 strides.  Rounded up, figure I had a little extra from yesterday.  Legs felt decent but I was really hungry.  Hit the snacks hard right when I got back to my apartment.

Up at 5:30 to run 8 miles in the snow before leaving for Kenosha for the day.  Once I got used to the conditions after about a mile it was an enjoyable run.  There were 2-3 inches on the ground everywhere.  Saw a couple other people out running which I didn't expect due to the time.  Also, since I'm logging before 7 AM I'm #1 on this website for the first time ever.  Boom!

I decided to do a fartlek in order to get some quality running in during a decent length run.  After 40 minutes I did 2 sets of 5 min, 3 min, 1 min with 3 min, 2 min, 2 min recoveries.  It would have been a really easy workout except for that snowy and slushy paths.  Most of the trails I've been running on all fall aren't runnable any more so I need to find some new routes.  Felt good after finally getting a good night's sleep last night.
Ran again after the football games ended.  Felt good.
Easy out and back.  Instead of turning onto Picnic Point I just continued straight on the bike path.  Felt ok, went to bed at 3:30 again last night.
5:30 PM 10 miler.  Legs felt really good; the rest of my body didn't but I made it through just fine.  I'm not adjusted to this cold weather yet, my face was really red when I got back.
I was really tired this morning.

Ran over to the Arb and instead of turning into the trails I kept going straight on the road and did an out and back.  Felt solid.  I started a little earlier and was able to get most of the run in before it got pitch dark.  Stopped about 10 minutes from the end and did strides so that I could do them on a clear path.
Picnic Point at 11:00.  They plowed the trail, I wonder if they're going to keep it clear all winter.

My plan was 3 x 800 @ goal 5K pace then 8 x 200 @ 32.  I felt great warming up but when I started the intervals my legs felt like absolute crap.  On the first 800 I hit the 400 in 73 and tried to shift but nothing happened, then on the second one I was out in 70 but slowed down to a 76.  Decided to skip the 3rd one and go to the 200s...when those weren't going too much better after 3 I decided to call it a day.  I'm not going to worry about this, just going to stay the course and try to do a better job with sleeping and eating.

Didn't run this morning because I woke up and decided I really wanted an extra hour of sleep.  When I got done with class for the day it had started snowing so I went out right away.  There was only an inch or so on the ground but it was enough to make things slippery and slow.  On the way back the snow was blowing into my face and it felt like needles.  Didn't feel too bad when I was out there but I was glad when the run was done.  I was originally thinking about doubling back with an evening run but I'll just double tomorrow instead.
Slept in really late, sat around for a bit after I got up, and then ran the usual 5 at about 11:45.  Didn't feel that great, I was hungry.
Easy out and back at 5:30.  Did some strides during the last two miles.  Legs are feeling better, should be feeling good tomorrow.  Weather's supposed to be nasty the next couple days.
Ran a mile time trial, goal was sub 4:30.  I was out in about 2:12 but then I locked up and shuffled home in 4:42.  Ouch.  I guess I should do some speed work.

After watching the Packers' horrible performance I suited up and headed out onto the frozen, snow covered sidewalks.  My plan was to run outside for as long as I could reasonably manage and then head to the shell to run a bunch of laps.  I made it 46 minutes outside, then did 55 minutes in the shell, then ran back to my apartment.  Physically I felt good the whole way, the conditions outside and the monotony inside made the run a bit challenging mentally.  Most of my running inside was at around 6:10 pace and at 80 minutes I threw in an 80 second 400 just for the heck of it.  Glad to have this one over with.  Going to do two short runs tomorrow.  After this run I have 0.5 more miles for 2010 than I had for my 2009 total.  Strangely it took the same number of log entries to get to that number both years.
Below 0 this morning so I ran inside

Got back from class at 4:30, put my stuff on right away, and headed out.  It was cold (6 degrees, feels like -4) but with minimal wind it didn't really feel that bad.  The sidewalks were pretty crappy and probably won't be getting better anytime soon.  Threw in eight strides shortly after the turn around; these basically consisted of doing a stride wherever the sidewalk was somewhat clear then jogging through some snow until the next decent spot.
Stayed up a little late last night so I was tried when I woke up, but I got through the run just fine.

Did a tempo workout at the shell.  I did 2.5 miles @ 5:20 pace, took a 2 minute break, then did another 2 miles.  My lungs never felt stressed but towards the end of each segment my legs were tiring.  My pulse at the end was 175-180; less than a minute later it was under 150, and less than two minutes later it was under 120.  Running clockwise on the track was a bit strange.  After the tempo I took a short break and then did 4 x 200 in 32, 33, 32, 32.  DIdn't feel like I could go much faster.  I just have to have faith that the speed will come.

I was hoping to go 7 this morning but my lack of hustle in getting out of bed and getting ready limited me to 5.  The lakeshore path is clear of snow but there is a layer of ice pretty much everywhere.  I'm really tired.

Ran at like 9:15 PM.  Finals is already stressing me out and I don't finish for another week.  I need to relax a little bit.  The first eight miles I was having a pretty good run, then the last little bit I felt like I was at the end of a long night of drinking and liable to fall asleep/pass out at any moment.  Kind of stumbled the last couple minutes.  Study day tomorrow.

Today is one of my two study days before my finals start.  It's currently 1 PM and I haven't done any studying.  Ran an out and back along Mendota and then over by the campus greenhouses.  The sidewalks are still horrible.  It's ridiculous.  Felt a lot better than on my run last night.
Did an easy 7 at about 4:30.  Felt decent.  Inserted some strides in the middle.
Easy shakeout at 11:00.  Legs weren't feeling so hot getting out of bed but the run helped them loosen up.

I did another workout at the shell.  Goal was to hit all 12 right around 70 and that's what happened...the only one that was over 70 was the fourth one when I had to run about 100 meters in lane 2.  Cardiovascularly this wasn't very hard and I feel like I could run a ton faster if my legs had any speed whatsoever.  Finished with 3 x 100m accelerations which felt kind of awkward.  Just have to keep working.

Woke up and studied for a bit then did 10 miles at 12:30.  Took the legs a couple miles to wake up but the second half I felt pretty good.  It seems like the sidewalks are getting worse instead of better which doesn't make sense.
Had my first final (finally) this evening.  After I got done I decided I wanted to do a little shakeout run.  Did an easy 4 and my legs felt solid.

I was all set to leave for my long run at about 2:45 but then the Eagles started making a comeback so I stuck around to watch the end.  I was definitely glad that I made that decision.  After the game ended I did the Capital City Trail out and back that I did about 2 and a half weeks ago.  For the most part the footing was good, definitely a lot better than on the sidewalks in the city.  The first 45 minutes my stomach felt awful, it was like I hadn't digested any of my lunch.  Legs felt good the whole time, didn't really feel like breaking it down so I just stayed around normal running pace the entire time.  Good week of training.

I didn't get up until 11:00 for the third straight day.  Time to straighten out the sleep cycle.  Ran 10 at 12:30 and felt good the whole time.  Almost got smoked by a mailman that rolled through a stop sign.
Ran again before going to my evening final.  It was starting to snow.  Legs felt ok, didn't eat all that much between my runs so that didn't help any.

This barely qualifies as a morning run but since it started before noon I'm counting it as one.  I had hoped on doing an outdoor tempo but the snow we got changed those plans so I had to go to the shell.  On my warmup a disabled guy flagged me down because he needed someone to get his wheelchair out of his trunk for him and then he also needed help carrying some things into an office, so I helped him out.  He commented that I looked really fit and asked if I ran for the Badgers.  I did a 30 minute tempo run running clockwise in lane 5 on the indoor track.  Didn't take any splits because running laps around a 200m track is boring enough without looking at your watch every minute or so and being reminded of how much you have left.  I felt pretty strong, didn't really start fatiguing until the last 5 minutes.  3 x 200 with 1 minute recovery afterward in 32.6, 31.6, 31.6.  I honestly have no idea how I used to close races in 28-29, I feel like I'd have to put out basically max effort just to break 30 right now.

Out and back six after my final ended.  I expected to feel terrible on this run which I think ended up helping me because when I didn't it was a pleasant surprise and made for an enjoyable run.  I like the slightly warmer weather, but not all the slush.

Got up at 11 again...thankfully now the semester is over and I won't be staying up until 3 studying any more.  I ran an out and back, picking up the Wingra Bike Trail over by the entrance to the arb and following it to where it connects to the Capitol City Trail.  Legs were tired but after a couple miles I loosened up and felt a little better.  I had bad luck with the stoplights and hit a couple long ones, thus I had to hustle when I got back in order to make it to my last final.  Four week break now, it's going to be great...Christmas, Packers v Giants, Pasadena, couple days at home, then Minnesota for a week or so.

When I got up the last thing I wanted to do was a workout, and this attitude continued pretty much throughout the run.  I was tired from finals week and eager to get back to Appleton, but decided I'd be glad later if I got something in before I left.  My goal on the 600s was 1:42-43 (8:30-35 3K pace) and I made it for the first two (working kind of hard) before falling off on the third.  The 400s felt 50 times easier and the 200s felt better than Tuesday's post tempo 200s.  The shell's policy is to run clockwise on Tuesday, Thursday, and Saturday, but since there were only like 7 people there and everyone else was jogging slowly in the outside lanes I decided to just run counter clockwise in lane 1 so that it would feel more natural.
Clipped off a quick 5 when I got home.  This run went by really quickly, it was nice to have a change of scenery and see different people's Christmas lights designs.

Shorter long run for this week since I'm going to do another one next Wednesday and I don't think I need three 17 milers in 11 days.  I did my route that goes out to Butte des Morts and then loops down around Lutz Park and then back to College Ave.  It was a really easy run, never got tired or hungry.  Low 6:00 pace pretty much the whole way.
I did my usual five mile loop and then did 4 x 200ish strides on my street with jog back in between.  Felt pretty good.

Ran again 3 hours after my first run so that I could get it over with.  I wanted to run on the CE trail but I guess they don't plow it during the winter so I did some creative routing our to Kimberly High School and then came back the same way I usually do in the summer.  Had to poop behind an office building; no places are open on Christmas so this was my only option.  Other than that I felt good the whole time.

Ran 12 this morning before going to the Packer game.  I went to Pierce Park then looped through downtown and then did two random add ons to get the extra distance.  Saw the Giants boarding their buses to head up to Lambeau.  It took my legs about 8 miles to get going this morning, but the last couple miles I felt real good.  The game was sweet, a nice 45-17 ass kicking.  Now we just have to beat the Bears next week and we're in the playoffs.  I was originally thinking I might do another 4 or 5 tonight but that's not going to happen.

Started this run just before noon.  I ran to Victoria's then looped down by the river and again through downtown.  Legs felt good but it was a bit windy and my face was freezing at times.  8 strides after, each one felt better than the one before it.

Ran on the treadmill since it was dark when I started and my mom always gets nervous about me running in the dark in the winter.  I put in my DVD of the 2008 Olympic Marathon which made this run pass really quickly.  Those guys were absolute machines that day.  Felt pretty good.
Easy shakeout.  Not much to say about it.

I did this workout on a section of the Newberry Trail that I've used for workouts a couple times in the past.  Goal was to simulate 1000 meter repeats at around 5K pace...with wearing several layers and the rolling path my pace was a bit slower but the effort was hopefully about the same.  I feel like I'm starting to get to the point where I could run a respectable race.

I ran a mile to Marie's house, did 5 with her, then did 11 more solo.  The five with Marie were probably at 7:20-7:30 pace while the last 11 were at least a minute per mile faster.  The temperature rose about 15 degrees between the start and finish of the run; by the end I was sweating my ass off and I ended up running the last four miles with my jacket tied around my waist.  Legs were feeling it the last couple miles which isn't unexpected after doing 51 miles including a workout in less than 48 hours.  Leaving this afternoon for California!  Go Badgers!

First run in California.  Found a bike path pretty close to our hotel that goes right along the beach so that was pretty cool.  Running next to the ocean in shorts and a t shirt felt like spring break, which made me feel like track season is supposed to be starting soon.  My legs felt good the entire time.  A section of the path had quarter miles marked off and both times I took a split on the way out I was running six minute pace.  When I turned around I had to head back into a headwind but I didn't end up slowing down all that much.  This afternoon we went to the pep rally with about 35,000 other Badger fans.  It was pretty cool - they showed a highlight video of the season, a bunch of guys from the previous Rose Bowl teams spoke to the crowd, the band played for a while, and then the current team showed up and basically guaranteed victory.  We'll see what happens, hopefully they can back it up.

Ran the opposite way this morning.  The path ended before I was ready to turn around so I had to do some random add ons on the way back to get the full distance.  After 30 minutes I did 8 x 40 seconds with 1:20 jogging in between, then I did 2 10 second sprints where I really tried to get to my top gear.  Haven't sprinted in a long time.  Good run.

Ran an out and back to the end of the path going the same way I went this morning.  Wasn't sure if I was going to double today or not but I ended up being able to squeeze this one in.  We went downtown this afternoon and walked around the area where USC is and my dad was able to BS some security guy into letting us go into the Coliseum to take a picture (supposedly it's never open to the public and today there was all sorts of extra security around because they're having a New Years Eve rave there tonight).  Also went to the California Science Museum.

2010 Stats
Total miles: 4138
Average miles per day: 11.34
Average miles per week: 79.38
Days off: 31
100 mile weeks: 15
PRs: 3 (mile, 3K, 5K)

Performance wise in 2010 I didn't have a good year.  I set some PRs during the first part of indoors but then tanked at the conference meet before losing my outdoor season to sickness.  I did two real races this fall and one went horribly while the other was extremely mediocre.  It's disappointing to look back on my races this year because I had big goals and none of them were even close to achieved.  That said, there's nothing that can be done about the past.  Training wise I've done well the past 7 months, and especially the past 2.  Hopefully I've laid the foundation for a return to successful racing in 2011.

Kicked off 2011 with a 6:45 AM easy run. It was nice to have a really easy day. We left for the Rose Bowl at 8:30. It was awesome being there and the game was really exciting...it was too bad the Badgers came up short but the memories will last a lifetime.

Last run in California. I did an out and back 7 going one direction from the hotel and then an out and back 5 the other way. Doing it this way made the run go by pretty fast. Legs felt great after yesterday's easy day. Had a couple GI problems that I had to stop for. Spent the afternoon at a sports bar down the street watching football before catching our 7 PM flight back to Wisconsin.

We ended up deciding to drive home last night rather than going to my apartment in Madison and spending the night there. We ended up getting back to Appleton at 3 AM. The travel absolutely kicked my ass; I ate basically nothing after 3 PM yesterday, felt dead the entire plane ride but couldn't sleep, and had a splitting headache by the time we landed. When I got up this morning my headache was gone but I felt really weak from not eating or drinking in so long. After getting some nutrients in my body I started my first run at around 12:30. Actually ended up feeling great which was really surprising. I did the same route as last Monday and then did 8 strides.
Easy run on the treadmill. I watched the pregame show for the Orange Bowl. Legs felt really good once again, it seems like that seven mile day really refreshed them.
Shakeout before the workout this afternoon, couldn't go 5 because of poor time management

***INTERVAL***
Warm-up: 
Set...Reps...Distance/Time...Goal...Actual...Rep rest...Set rest
1.........1.....5 Minutes....5K Effort....____....2:00 jog....____
2.........1.....2 Minutes....3K Effort....____....2:00 jog....____
3.........7.....300 (Hills) Meters....Hard....____....Jog Down....2:00
4.........1.....90 Seconds....3K Effort....____....____....____
Cool-down: 

I did the timed runs on the Newberry Trail and the hill repeats on the Banta Bowl hill. My streak of feeling really good on runs continued and I never felt like I was going anywhere near the edge. It would be awesome if I could sustain this feeling until Saturday.

Memorial to CE. Legs again felt like I was running on air. Plan was to do another 6 in the evening but at around 2 PM we got the call that my grandpa is on his last legs so I was out with him from then until 10:00 and was too emotionally drained to do another run. He's going to pass away at some point this weekend, and after suffering from dementia for about four years it's time but it's still really sad. I was looking forward to running at the U on Saturday but being with family is more important. I can run a race some other time.
Xavier. Bad night of sleep last night, halfway through the run I wanted to be done but the only way that could happen was to finish the loop. Need to eat more.
Stress relief run inside at 9:30 after a long day at St Paul

Downtown loops. I only slept six hours last night but for those hours I was absolutely passed out. Legs felt ok. It was pretty cold and some of the sidewalks hadn't been shoveled yet. Not really trying to 'train' right now, just running to keep myself sane and because it's therapeutic.
Just like yesterday I did a stress relief run when we came home for the night
Ran 10 on the treadmill first thing in the morning. It was too cold to run outside. Afi passed away this afternoon. He went very peacefully and I know that he is now in a better place. Very hard day.

Went out at around 12:30 and ran Xavier then did some strides. Felt pretty lifeless and sad for most of the run. I'm just going to run as much or as little as I want for a little while, actual training can wait.

Did a 4 mile warmup, tempoed the next 6 miles, then a 2 mile cooldown. I didn't wear a watch so I don't know what the pace was. Probably a little slower than usual but it felt like a tempo run usually does. Felt decent.

Ran an hour on the treadmill since it was snowing outside. Aleta came down and kept me company for a little while so between that and ESPN the run went by pretty quickly. The visitation this afternoon/evening went well.
I got up early and ran 5 before Afi's funeral because I knew that doing so would help me. The service was really nice. He really impacted a lot of people.

Despite being really tired (the adrenaline I've been functioning on for the past week is starting to wear off) I decided to do another run on the treadmill. Watched the second half of Duke v Florida State which was a great game. Thought about lots of different memories.
Easy morning run. Going to try to get back to normal training.

***INTERVAL***
Warm-up: 
Set...Reps...Distance/Time...Goal...Actual...Rep rest...Set rest
1.........1.....3 Minutes....____....____....2:00 jog....____
2.........2.....2.5 Minutes....____....____....2:00 jog....____
3.........6.....1 Minute....____....____....1:00 jog....____
Cool-down: 

I did another workout on the Newberry Trail paths. This was effectively the same as the 1 x 1000m, 2 x 800m, 6 x 400m that I've done the past two winters. Next week I'll be back on the track in Madison. Felt pretty crappy but the feeling didn't get really get any worse from the start of the workout to the end. Still depressed.
Treadmill while watching Sportscenter. Kind of sore starting out.
Ran through downtown. Legs felt pretty crappy most of the way. Did a few strides afterward.

First long run in 2.5 weeks. I did 16 (to the Neenah/Menasha Y and back) but with the snow and wind the effort felt like 19-20. Legs were getting really tired towards the end from running through unshoveled sidewalks and having to hurdle snowbanks at the end of most blocks. Also felt like I was running into the wind almost the whole time. I'm still fairly depressed.

The Bears game was getting to be a blowout so I took off for my run early in order to be back for the second game. Ran Xavier. My legs felt like cinder blocks the entire time from yesterday's long run. Did four slow strides afterward to try to loosen up. Hopefully I'll be feeling better tomorrow.
Ran on the treadmill because it was snowing once again. Watched Sportscenter. I'm already jacked for next Sunday.
Drove back to Madison this afternoon through the snow. Did another inside run.
Shakeout. First day of second semester today.

***INTERVAL***
Warm-up: 
Set...Reps...Distance/Time...Goal...Actual...Rep rest...Set rest
1.........4.....800 Meters....____....2:24, 23, 24, 24....2:00 jog....3:00 jog
2.........4.....300 Meters....____....49, 49, 49, 49....200m jog....____
Cool-down: 

Weird workout. I can't explain the 800s. I was shooting for 2:19-20, and I felt like I was running around 10K pace it felt so easy up top but I couldn't get my legs out of the 72 second rhythm. On the 300s I tried to snap myself out of it and did a little better. Even though the times were slow I'm not real discouraged about it because I wasn't struggling. If I felt like I was dying running 2:24 it'd be different. Maybe my thinking is messed up though. Who knows.

Started off on my planned 6 mile run and right away I noticed shooting pain in my left hip every time I pushed off. It was sore last night on my cool down but I didn't think anything of it. After a few minutes the pain wasn't going away and it was affecting my ability to get into a normal stride so I turned around at the mile and walked back. Great.

Tried running again at about 8:30 PM. At some points I could feel a dull ache in my hip but it was nothing like this morning. I'll only run once instead of twice tomorrow as a precaution but I'm hoping that I'm fine.

Squeezed this one in between my classes. I did the first 3.5 miles easy, ran the next 2+ uptempo, jogged a few minutes, then did 5 surges of varying lengths over the course of the next mile and a half. The idea was a low key workout just to turn over the legs a little but not tax the body. Felt pretty good except I can still feel some soreness in my hip and lower back.
Nice easy run on the upstairs track in Tostrud. Legs felt amazing, if I feel like this tomorrow it will be a great day. 2 x 200 in 34.1, 32.2.

***RACE***
Race Name: Jack Johnson Classic
Terrain: Track (Indoor)
Warm Up: 6.5 (3 AM, 3.5 before race)
Race Splits: 68, 2:51, 4:33
Cool Down: 3.5
Overall Place: 8th

First race in quite a while, and while I was shooting for better I'm taking positive things away from this. I decided beforehand that I wanted to go out fast enough to give myself a chance to PR, and I felt really good the first six or seven laps running 34s. After the mile the wheels started to come off and when I got into oxygen debt I didn't respond well, but I think that's a result of just not being calloused to racing. Overall I really enjoyed being in a race and competing again and I'm looking forward to doing another one. I think if I do another 3K I'd be able to come real close to my PR.

I decided to push the long run back a day so that I could do it in 20 degree weather rather than 0. Ran Jefferson with a little bit added at both the beginning and end. Felt pretty good for the post part, face got a little cold running into the wind back by the cemetery and golf course. Intersected with Adrian on Jefferson. Had thoughts during the day about doing another run when I got back to Madison but I ended up not getting back until midnight so that didn't happen. The Packers are on their way to the Super Bowl! BOOM!
Stomach issues, had to shut things down early
Got up and decided to see if Picnic Point was runnable. It was, which made for a nice morning run. Did strides and a short add on at the end. Felt good, much better than yesterday.

Ran at 4 PM. It was nice to be able to start a run at that time and have it not be pitch dark when I finished. Legs felt ok on the run but now this evening they are tired. Still waiting to hear back from Nuttycombe on whether I can run in the UW meet this weekend.

***INTERVAL***
Warm-up:

2.........1.....1000 Meters....2:55....2:57....4:00 jog....____

8.........1.....200 Meters....32....31....____....____
Cool-down: 

Pretty low key workout this week since I'm racing again on Saturday. The 1000s weren't quite as fast as I would have liked but they were better than last week's 800s. Feeling strong, so hopefully my legs can get used to that faster rhythm. The tempo was so easy it felt like I was jogging...I ended up going an extra 400 just because I felt like it. The 400 hurt since it was so much faster than I had just been running, and then the 200s at the end were easy. Cooled down a mile in the shell with Jeremy Berg and then ran back to my apartment.
It was snowing this morning. Did an easy out and back, didn't feel all that great.
Easy second run. Legs felt kind of sluggish. People should shovel their sidewalks.

I drove over to the shell and ran from there. Did an out and back on the bike path. It was 30 degrees out, almost 50 warmer than last Friday. Then I went inside and did strides and 2 x 200 in 33.8 and 31.6. My legs felt a little tired on the run by the strides felt great and I felt great afterward. Hopefully I'll get it done tomorrow.

1.5 AM shakeout
3.5+ warmup
2500m of 3K
9 cooldown

Not happy with myself. Long story short there was a rabbit in the field that took everyone out super hard, I went straight to the back and tried to just hang on but ended up getting gapped after 800. Soon after that I slowed down considerably. Brill lapped me with around 700 left, then a lap later I could tell a couple other guys were coming and I just stepped off the track because I was embarrassed. Not proud of it, but I have to live with what I did. I just didn't belong in this race...I was trying to run low to mid 8:30s and everyone else was shooting for low 8:20s or faster. The slow heat went out in 4:44 so that wouldn't have been any better. Hopefully I get a shot at redemption at Platteville in two weeks, I won't find out whether I can run until the week of the meet though.
Ran out and back on the Capitol City trail. Felt ok, nothing special. Did some fartlek on the way back and ended up negative splitting by about a minute even though the way back was into the wind.
Picnic Point plus some extra on the lakeshore path. It was snowing but nothing was really accumulating by this point. Felt fine.

I tried to run outside this morning but about 3 miles in I realized that I wasn't getting very much out of the run because the sidewalks were in such bad shape, so I just turned around and went back. Didn't feel all that great either which made it an easy decision. We're supposed to get quite a bit more snow.

After this morning's shitshow (and the fact that the weather had gotten much worse since then) I ran inside. The run felt like it took a long time but it was a better effort than I could have gotten outside. Classes have already been canceled for tomorrow. First snow day in 5 years!
Ran inside since we got over a foot of snow from the Blizzard of 2011. Snow day!

***INTERVAL***
Warm-up: 
Set...Reps...Distance/Time...Goal...Actual...Rep rest...Set rest
1.........1.....1200 Meters....____....3:31....2:45 jog....____
2.........1.....1200 Meters....____....3:32....2:45 jog....____

8.........3.....100 Meters....____....Fast....Walk Back....____
Cool-down: 

I'm pretty pleased with this one. The pace felt easier than the past two weeks and while I was tired at the end I had a little bit left in the tank. The first 1200 I would have been under 3:30 except that on the last lap a kid chasing a basketball ran out in front of me and I basically came to a stop. On the second 400 I forgot to start my watch. These splits are fairly comparable to a workout I did last year right around the time I ran 14:53, so I should be able to run pretty close to that if I race next weekend. Jack Delehanty was at the shell so I cooled down a bit with him before jogging home.

I stayed up really late last night doing homework so I wasn't feeling all that motivated to run when I got up. The sidewalks were still in pretty terrible conditions, and a half mile from my turn around the route became impassable so I turned around. I had originally planned on making up for it at the end but by the time I got back I had had enough of the snow and was ready to stop.
Easy afternoon run. Ran a serendipitous route over to and around Camp Randall and back. Stopped at the UW business office to pay my tuition for the semester. Leaving for Dallas tomorrow!

Ran 90 minutes on the treadmill at our hotel in Milwaukee, Not a real great long run for the week but I didn't want to go any farther on that thing. Afterward we flew down to Austin where we're staying tonight before driving up to Dallas tomorrow. There is some snow on the ground here...doesn't seem right.

There wasn't any place to run outside around our hotel in Austin so I ran on the treadmill again while watching Sportscenter. Did a fartlek for the middle 25 minutes which broke up the monotony. Finally made it to Dallas this afternoon. Our hotel has a sweet water park so we hit that up for a couple hours.

Started Super Bowl Sunday off with an early morning 10 miler. I ran an out and back through a residential area and felt pretty good the whole time. It was nice to run in shorts. The game was absolutely awesome...Packers are world champions!

Really long day of traveling...woke up at 5 AM and didn't get back to my apartment until 7 PM. It was cold and snowing and I was tired so I didn't really want to run but I did a little something in order to keep my streak going. Felt good to stretch out at least.
Easy out and back six. Really cold, hands froze. Sidewalks are better than last week but still not clear.

Whoops, turns out it's not that great of an idea to attempt a track workout after eating basically nothing all day. I didn't have a watch so I don't know what my times were...probably a good thing. Just going to pretend that this didn't happen.

I was slow getting out of bed this morning but from the start of the run I was moving pretty fast. My face was frozen at the turn around; the second half with the wind at my back was more comfortable.

For the second straight evening I didn't start my run until about 6:30. Did a really easy 8, I deliberately kept the pace slow the whole way after pounding this morning. It was cold once again. The Platteville coach e-mailed me today and said I can't run in the fast heat on Saturday because apparently people still in college trying to run 15:20 can add more to the race than post collegiates that have broken 15. He said I could come and run in the slow heat if I want...screw that, I'll go to the UW/OSU basketball game rather than drive over an hour to run a time trial where I'd have to run half of it in lane 2.

Same thing I did three weeks ago on Thursday...10 miles with a 2+ mile tempo and some short surges in the middle.  Legs were feeling really good but my hands froze bad with two miles to go which made the last bit of the run painful.  Supposedly it's going to warm up a bit tomorrow and then get into the high 30s over the weekend.  I'm really unmotivated academically right now...have to get it together.  Too bad I'm not good enough at running to have that be a full time job.

Ran an out and back at like 2:15.  Wasn't feeling the greatest so I cut it a little shorter than usual.  There's a giant snow pile over by the band's practice field...it's seriously just as tall as a four story parking garage across the street.  I did a few strides afterward on the sidewalk on Langdon since there were all sorts of cars in my usual alley.  The Platteville coach e-mailed me and said I can run in the fast heat...hopefully I'm ready for it.

My streak of sub par racing continues...with the training I've been doing I don't know why I can't run a good race.  My last PR was almost a year ago.  Either I'm not actually in that good of shape, my body has totally forgotten how to race, or I'm a wuss mentally.  It's most likely a combination of the first and third, as my workouts probably haven't been quite up to what I need to be doing and I definitely can be more tough.  I can't really say I was ever really feeling terrible today...it was hard, but it's supposed to be and I need to be able to deal with that.  I guess I can take a positive in that I competed and passed two guys late rather than just coasting in, but I feel like I am capable of running at least 30 seconds faster.

I finally got it together and did a 17 miler for the first time in 2011.  The weather was awesome, it was in the 40s so I wore shorts.  My legs felt as good as I could expect for the day after a 5K but my stomach was pretty uncomfortable for most of the run.  I stopped to crap 3 times.
Feel like I'm starting to get sick.  Nice weather though.

Usual 10 mile route.  Still feeling a little sick, hopefully it doesn't turn into anything.  Lots of puddles from snow melting.  About the only noteworthy thing that happened was I passed a guy carrying a vodka bottle who looked at me and said, 'Hey guess what?  Fuck you.'  Six strides afterward.

I skipped my first class this morning because I was too tired.  At 11 AM I did a 9 mile out and back past Camp Randall and onto the bike path.  After a 20 minute warmup I went right into 3 sets of 2 minutes, 1 minutes, 30 seconds with 1 minute in between intervals and 2 minutes in between sets, then one final 2 minute interval.  Legs didn't feel that great.

Felt a little better this afternoon.  I've been thinking about a racing schedule for the spring and I decided that I'm going to focus on trying to get a PR in the 10K rather than building up for a marathon.  I want to stick to shorter stuff for a few more months and then I can use the summer to train for a fall marathon.

Great run on the Wingra and Capitol City bike paths in 45 degree weather.  I'm trying not to get too used to this because I know that winter isn't over yet but the past couple days have been great.  Watched Arsenal v Barcelona afterward.  Great match!
Easy shakeout.  Didn't feel all that great.
3 mile tempo in the middle.  54 degrees today.
Ran again after class before setting off for Minnesota.  Tired.

I ran Ostrich then jogged around campus a bit to get the full 8.  It was pretty windy and the temperature is back to what one would expect for February.  Didn't feel that great, but oh well.  Saw Andrew Carlson and Hassan Mead run 8:03 and 8:05 in the 3K tonight.

Alumni 3K today.  All morning I was kind of in a fog and felt really weird.  When the race started I wasn't feeling it and fell off my planned pace after about 800.  After about halfway I was really struggling and felt like I was going to fall over at any moment, it was comparable to the 5K I ran at Gustavus last April.  Chris passed me at 2200 and I pretty much just cruised it in...I think my time was like 9:15.  I don't know why I felt so terrible, at least it was only the Alumni 3K and not something that actually matters.  Back to training for a while, next race will be in April.

Massive winter storm that started early this morning.  The drive from Northfield to Madison took six hours (it usually takes four) and included one near death experience.  I wasn't motivated to run when I first got back but I eventually talked myself into it.  Ran inside because of the weather.  Ended up feeling alright.

We've gotten a good bit of freezing rain over the course of the past 24 hours so there was a layer of ice/slush on most of the sidewalks but I just went out and grinded through the run.  Did it as a double out and back so that I could stay in an area that was relatively clean.  Felt pretty good almost the entire time, but when I finished my back and hamstrings were pretty sore.  My jacket was covered in ice at the end.
Ran out on the Wingra bike path.  Legs felt good and I enjoyed it.  At one point I passed two ladies and then could hear them commenting on my efficient form.
Night run inside.  I was really hungry when I finished.
Wanted to sleep more when my alarm went off so I waited until after my class to run.  Had to change the route because of icy sidewalks.  Felt ok.

Went to the shell during the Badger basketball game to do a tempo run since doing one outside isn't possible right now.  I did 25 minutes in lane 5 and was on 5:20-25 pace the entire time.  Felt surprisingly good for how little sleep I've been getting and my pulse was about 156 when I finished so there was definitely more in the tank.  3 x 200 after in 31.5, 32.5, 31.1.  Towards the end of the workout I took my shirt off because I was getting hot...about one lap later some worker came over and told me I needed to put it back on because 'people running on the track need to be wearing shirts'.  Inside the track there are four basketball courts and people play shirtless all the time.  I pointed this out and he said that he didn't make the rules, he just enforced them.  I wasn't really mad and wasn't going to make a huge deal about it but it was dumb.
Ran in between my classes.  I went down the lakeshore path and then past the greenhouses.  I was pretty tired and hadn't eaten much breakfast but after about 20 minutes I got going just fine.

I did a 3 mile warmup, then 20 100 meter strides at about 95% effort on a one minute sendoff, then a 3 mile cooldown.  Got the idea for this workout from Nate Jenkins' blog...he does a set of 30 but that's a little bit much for me.  Legs feel like they've been through the meat grinder...if I'm going to run this much I need to get more than 6 hours of sleep per night.

Only one run today, thank God.  Legs were definitely tired when I got up.  After about two miles I loosened up and ended up feeling decent for the last two thirds of the run which was nice.  I went out the Wingra bike path to just past the Sheraton.

Ran around La Crosse.  I did the Shithouse 5K course then ran over to the university and around that area, then headed back to the car.  It was lightly snowing the entire time but the snow wasn't making things slippery.  With about 15 minutes to go my bowels exploded.
Decided to do a short shakeout when I got back to Madison
Long run, usual route.  I didn't get going until 4:45 so it was dark for about the last 5 miles.  Legs felt pretty good and I was rolling pretty well.  Hips were screaming the last 3 miles or so.
I just wanted to do a short run to shake out the soreness from yesterday's long run before doing hills this afternoon.  Mission accomplished.

30 minute warmup, 10 x 45 second hills with jog down recovery, 2 x 15 second sprints on the flat, 20 minute cooldown.  After how tired I was this morning I wasn't sure how this workout was going to go so I went into it with no expectations and ended up feeling about as good as possible considering what I was doing.  I suppose it's always good to work on your weaknesses.  My wish for a week from now: that the snow would melt off of the outdoor track.
I couldn't fall asleep last night because I was stressing about my two tests today.  Got the run in and didn't feel too bad.  Nice sunny morning, maybe soon it will actually be spring!

Nice easy recovery day.  It was 40 degrees out so I wore shorts, but the paths were a little sloppy from melting.  Legs felt a little tired but I knew it was only a 7 mile run which always makes it pretty easy.
Had a phone interview with American Family this morning and ran after that.  For as tired as I was when I got up I felt ok on the run.  It's really cold outside.

As Thunder would say this was a 'high volume low intensity' workout.  It was pretty easy for the most part; on the last interval I started off a little slow so I picked it up in order to hit the time but that was the only part of the workout that felt a little pressed.  5:05s is 67 minute half marathon pace...is that doable in three months?  Farewell to the indoor track, barring a storm that makes running outside impossible I won't be back until December.
Ran between classes.  It was 34 degrees but fairly windy.  Felt decent.

Took an early evening nap and then ate dinner so I didn't do my second run until 9:00.  It had warmed up a few more degrees and the wind had died down so I wore shorts.  Legs were feeling pretty good, I think the nap helped.  Good luck at MIACs boys.

Easy run on the lakeshore path and then over by the greenhouses.  The path was a bit sloppy from melting.  Felt a little tired but thought about some future races which pumped me up a bit.  When I was finishing there was a guy standing on the roof of a fraternity house wearing only a speedo and screaming.  I didn't know what to think.

I spent pretty much the entire day studying for my Life Contingencies exam and following the live twitter of the MIAC meet.  Couldn't get myself motivated to go for a run before 6 PM.  When I finally got out there I started off fast from the get go and after a mile decided to just run as fast as I could while staying in control.  Hammered for eight miles then did the last two miles easy as a cooldown.  Felt great the whole time.  My weekly mileage will end up being a little lower after sputtering these past two days but that's ok.
Ran the Wingra trail to the Sheraton.  Felt fine, not much to report.
Easy shakeout + 10 strides.  Stopped at Chipotle at the end and got my dinner.
Very tired this morning from lack of sleep, just need to make it to spring break

I started a homework assignment at 4:30 thinking that it would take an hour and that I'd run when I was done with it.  I didn't finish it until just before 8:00.  Ran my usual 10 mile route in the dark with a light snow falling.  Felt pretty good, just could tell that I'm a bit tired.  One more short night tonight then I can catch up on some rest.
I was slow out of the gates this morning, almost didn't run.

I did this workout on the Southwest Bike Path.  I was pretty tired coming out of my test this afternoon and thought about waiting until tomorrow to do the workout but decided to get it over with today and ended up feeling good.  The last 2 minute interval got a little screwed up because somehow my watch stopped after 15 seconds so I had to guess on when I was done.  Good effort.

I went out intending to do a 9 mile run and then run again later tonight, but about 5 miles in I decided that since I was feeling pretty good it would be nice to get the long run over with rather than doing it tomorrow.  I felt good pretty much the whole way...started tiring a bit with about 5 minutes left but I knew that the run was just about over.  It snowed last night, but only like an inch so for the most part things weren't too bad.  Left hip and groin were feeling it by the end.

I was going to do a morning run but I didn't fall asleep until close to 4 last night so that didn't happen.  In the afternoon I ran to MGE to pay my electric bill and then hopped on the Capital City Trail.  Felt pretty crappy for the most part but I ran nice and slow so that I would recover.  Spring break is here!
Ran the shortest Bryce Wandrey loop and then did 10 strides.  Felt great the whole time.

Ran Jefferson with the team.  Started with a huge group and finished with about 5 other guys.  It felt like we were cruising but it wasn't actually anything ridiculous.  It was fun to run with the guys again since the last time I ran with people was a really long time ago.

I ran 8 miles outside with the last one at tempo, then did 3 more tempo miles inside Tostrud, then a 10 minute cooldown.  Had to change the plan because it was really cold and windy outside.  The outside portion of this run wasn't very fun...I was cold and didn't feel that great.  I kind of wanted to just call it a day when I got back to campus but gave myself a pep talk that doing some quality when I was feeling flat would be good for me.  Glad I got it in and now tomorrow is a really easy day.

Waited around all afternoon and didn't start the run until 4:30.  I did Bryce Wandrey to Woodley.  This was a planned down day and it was nice.  Griff drove by me and honked...it took me a minute to figure out who it was.  Still cold but not as bad as yesterday.

Drove back to Appleton last night.  I didn't wake up until about 11:30 (whoops) and then shortly after that one of our dogs ran away so I spent about a half hour looking for her and didn't get to start the run until 1:00.  There's tons more snow in Appleton than in Madison or Northfield.  My legs felt alright, I hadn't had much to eat since dinner yesterday so I didn't expect to feel great.  Strides afterward, for some reason I couldn't get going on the first couple because my stomach muscles were all messed up.
Ran again inside after my parents had gone to bed.  Felt solid.

I had two phone interviews this morning so I didn't run until after they were over.  Did a workout that I made up last night...started with a 3 minute interval at 10K effort, then 3 x 45 seconds fast on the flat, then 8 repeats on the Banta Bowl hill, then 2 15 second sprints.  Today was one of those days where I think I was running alright but I didn't feel very good.  My legs felt sluggish.  Had to stop after the sixth hill to crap.

Out and back to West.  Once again I didn't feel real good, my legs are starting to feel similar to how I felt last year at this time.  I'm going to keep going through the rest of this week but if I don't start feeling better I'll have to take some rest next week.
Ran my 5 mile loop around the neighborhood.  I thought about taking the afternoon off but it was 50 degrees out, so way too nice to not run.  Legs felt better than this morning but it's only 5 miles.

I had job interviews at American Family all morning so I did a 2:30/9:30 double.  It was 60 degrees for my first run which felt amazing.  Legs were still a little sluggish but they're improving.  The outdoor track is clear, going to try to hop the fence and do a workout tomorrow.

I did my second run after the Badger basketball game.  It was a nice night for running, 50 degrees with a little bit of a breeze.  For some reason I spent most of the run thinking about the 2009 MIAC CC meet.  Saw lots of drunk people celebrating St Patrick's Day.  My legs felt pretty good.

I jumped the fence to get onto the UW track and attempted to do my annual 10x800 workout but I had to call it a day after 4.  From the start of the warmup my legs felt awful and I wasn't able to get anything out of it.  Hit the first two how I wanted, fell off on the third one, and said that if I couldn't get back on it on the 4th I was going to stop.  Time to adjust my plan and try to get out of this funk...not sure how I'll do that yet but I'll figure it out.

I e-mailed Griff to ask for some advice on what to do and he said to take 2 or 3 really easy days, so that's what I'm doing.  I've worked too hard the past several months to not have a good spring and I won't have one if I don't get myself back to feeling normal.  Just have to remind myself that I'm super fit and a couple down days won't do anything to change that.  I ran Picnic Point and felt ok.  Took a nap in the afternoon.
Easy day #2.  I actually felt quite good on this run, after some rest and extra iron I'm coming around.  It was lightly raining but not too cold.

Ran 10 this afternoon and felt good the whole time.  Strides afterward felt good as well.  It seems like I'm just about back to normal...tomorrow I'll do a workout that will be a somewhat scaled back version of what I originally had planned and that will give me more of an idea.

It rained all day but as I was heading out it seemed to be letting up and I thought that I might catch a break.  It was still pretty windy though.  My legs felt really solid through all of the intervals, then as I was doing the 1 minuteres the skies opened up again and I got poured on for about the last half hour.  It was only about 35 degrees out so it wasn't comfortable.  When I got back to my apartment I was frozen.  Even more frustrating was that I couldn't get any hot water when I was showering.  Glad I got the workout in though, I'm happy with the effort.
Easy morning run.  I was asleep pretty early last night so I felt pretty rested.  It's still raining, but I heard Appleton got 7 inches of snow so it could be worse.
Regular 10 mile route.  It had stopped raining but it was 20 degrees and really windy.  Ugh.  Felt ok, much better the last four miles when the wind was at my back.

3 mile warmup, 25 minute tempo run, 2+ mile cooldown.

Ran on the Southwest Bike Path.  The first 5 or 6 minutes of the tempo I couldn't quite catch my breath but I eventually got it under control and felt good the rest of the way.  Negative split by about 30 seconds on the way back.  At about 16 minutes I had to stop for about a minute at an intersection, that was the only real negative about the route.
I woke up at 10, sat around for an hour, and then ran at 11.  I stopped at Walgreens to return a redbox movie and stopped at Grainger to turn in my assignment.  Nice way to start the day.
Easy out and back.  I felt a little bad about running twice while Aleta is here but she didn't seem to mind.  Felt decent enough.

8 45 second hills.  It was below 20 degrees and going up the hill I was running into a 20 mile per hour wind so this was fairly hard.  I was sucking wind at the end, which I guess is a good thing since I wanted to suffer a bit this morning.  2 sprints afterward.  My legs were pretty tired when I got back to my apartment.
Nice easy run to shake out the hill workout.  Accomplished the goal.

I didn't fall asleep until 4 last night so I had trouble getting up and going today.  Finally got out the door just after 1.  Ended up feeling great through about 13.5 miles, then the last 10 minutes I wasn't really getting tired but my hips were getting sore.  Taking it easy and watching basketball for the rest of the day.
I woke up, ran 5 miles, showered, ate a bowl of cereal, and walked 3/4 of a mile to class all in just over an hour.  Run was pretty good for just getting going.

Ran the usual 10 mile loop at like 6:30.  It's nice to be able to do an evening run and have it not be dark.  The first mile was a little shaky but I felt great the last 9.  At the end I had to go inside and take a crap before coming back out to do strides.
Just a little morning shakeout...kept it short both because I woke up late and because I knew I was doing a long workout in the afternoon.

20 400s...looking back through my logs the last time I did this was on 2/11/08.  I wanted to run 10K goal pace, and other than 74s on the 1st and 19th ones and a 71 on #11 they were all in the 72-73 range.  The rests were what made this hard...I did it as a continuous run and most of the recovery intervals were right around 50 seconds.  Threw in the longer break halfway to ensure that I could finish at the pace I wanted.  It would have been real nice to have someone running this with me.  Breathing was never a problem, legs got real tired.  Based off of this I should be able to break 15 on Saturday but I'll have to have my head on straight.
Just didn't feel like running before class even though I could have, so I waited until after.  Felt good, not as sore as I thought I would be from yesterday.
Ran a big loop around Camp Randall.  I don't think I had enough to eat in between runs but I still felt fine.  Getting excited for Saturday.

20 minute tempo, 3 x 30 seconds fast.  I felt good on this short workout...the tempo was really smooth and my breathing felt under control the whole way.  My hip must not have liked changing speeds because it was a bit sore during the strides.  Nice weather, I was sweating pretty good when I finished.  Brewers start off the season with back to back jacks!
Easy shakeout after the Brewers game ended before driving to Northfield.  The Brewers gave up 4 runs in the bottom of the ninth and lost.  The run felt good.
Pre race run with the team.  Did cross campus with a huge group then added a neighborhood loop with Pez, Massey, and Pat.  Legs felt good.  Strides afterward felt good also...200 in 33.2.

Big loop around Northfield.  Never felt terribly good after some sub par sleep last night and not a lot to eat throughout the course of the weekend.  With about 3 miles to go my left leg started feeling really weird, I wouldn't say it was painful but it was like my muscles weren't firing properly.  Pretty much limped the last 20 minutes.

Woke up this morning and decided right away that I wasn't going to do a morning run.  Not a big deal since I'm going to try to cut my mileage a little bit.  In the afternoon I ran on the lakeshore paths...tried to run the back section towards Raymer's Cove and Eagle Heights but it's still too muddy.  It was really windy, on the way out I almost got stopped in my tracks by a couple gusts.
Easy morning run...I've gotten into a bad habit of skipping my first class on Tuesdays to sleep in.  Need to toughen up and get up earlier.

Did a shorter, faster workout this evening.  Kind of a variation of a workout we did 2 years ago.  It felt kind of weird since I'm about as sharp as a butter knife.  My sense of pacing wasn't very good and at times my form felt a little awkward, but I finished everything.  Even broke 30 on a 200 for the first time in quite a while.  There were some other people at the track practicing javelin so I didn't have to jump the fence.

Picnic Point.  Legs felt ok but I was having hunger pains from hardly eating any dinner last night.  Got back and found out that I didn't get one of the two internships I was in the final running for.  Hopefully the other one works out, otherwise I'll have to scramble to find some form of summer employment.
Pounded most of this run around 6:00 pace.  Found out shortly before I headed out that I didn't get the other internship.  No idea what I'll do this summer...I fail at life.

This was all I had time for since I had class all day and have an exam tomorrow to study for.  I was feeling good so in the middle I decided to pick it up for 2 miles.  Ended up running 9:52 (5:10, 4:42).  I was consciously speeding up the last part of the second mile but it still felt really relaxed.  I'll do a more substantial workout on Saturday.

Edit: In hindsight that '2 mile' pickup was almost definitely short.  I was running fast and there was a slight downhill for part of the second mile, but I don't believe that I actually rolled a 4:42 just on a whim.
Sat around all day, then after the Masters I headed out.  15 minutes in I didn't want to be running so I turned around and went home.  The motivation's not there right now.

Had to force myself out for this one, I wasn't really in the mood.  Once I finally got going and got some endorphins the run felt pretty good.  I did Picnic Point for 6 and then did another out and back 6 the other direction.  The last 4 miles there was a lot of lightning but I made it back to my apartment before the rain and hail started.  80 degrees and muggy today, felt like June.

Ran the lakeshore trails to Eagle Heights for the first time since early December.  Stomach was really bothering me for a lot of the run.  Stopped with about a half mile left because I wouldn't have made it home before my bowels exploded.  It was kind of windy but it was nice to do this route again.
Easy shakeout.  Happy Birthday to me.
Usual 5 mile morning route.  Felt good.
Arb 12.  Amazing weather this evening, it would be a pretty much perfect night to race a 10K.  Legs were feeling good, just need to get a bit more sleep.

Had an unexpected visit from a friend at around 4 PM so I ended up not getting out to do the workout until 7.  Throughout the workout I focused on trying to be tough and push through discomfort.  Felt like I accomplished some good work.
I was up until 4 last night studying for a test.  After I took it this morning I went back to my apartment and ran my usual 5 mile route.  Actually felt pretty good.  It was windy.

Ran with Sepe, Delehanty, and Hooley in the arb.  Nice to run with other people, just felt a little tired from lack of sleep.  I decided I'm going to do Crazylegs instead of going to Hillsdale.  Sounds like it's going to be a pretty stacked race, should be fun!
Had a tempo scheduled for tonight but couldn't motivate myself to do it with the weather so I just ran easy.  Not real happy about it, but it's not that big of a deal.
Eagle Heights.  Bumped into Sepe near the Picnic Point entry and ran with him for about 10 minutes.  For the first 45 minutes or so I was tired but I finished up feeling pretty good.

Combined a long run and a tempo since I wanted to get both of those in.  Ran the first six miles normal, then did 2 x 15 minutes @ tempo with 5 minutes jogging in between, then finished up.  The last few minutes of the second tempo segment my legs were tiring out but I made it.  Hips were really tight at the end of the run.  That's happened on all of my long runs recently, not sure why.  Nice job to the Olaf guys on a blazing 5K today.
Picnic Point.  Legs were hurting, took this run pretty slow.

Ran the Crazylegs course and then ran home from Camp Randall.  The first two miles of the course is like Griak on pavement...constantly up and down with a couple fairly big climbs.  After that it's not too bad, just some more hills in the last 3/4 of a mile.  Legs felt less tired than earlier today.  Got an internship for the summer!
Inside morning run because the weather is garbage.  I'll go outside this afternoon but I'm not running in sleet twice in a day in April.
I lied when I said I was going to run outside this evening.  Ran inside again.  Hopefully the last time I have to do that.  Legs felt ok, body as a whole is kind of tired.

3 mile warmup, 2 mile cooldown.  Fartlek was 5-4-3-2-1-2-3-2-1, with the rest being half of the previous hard segment.  Started off feeling kind of calorie deficient and after the first 3 minuter I kind of wanted to stop but I told myself to toughen up and get it done.  Felt the best on the last two intervals which I suppose is a good sign.  Only 34 degrees outside, it definitely does not feel like spring.

Ouch.  I've been having some soreness in my left hip and lower back for a little while but it hasn't been a major concern until today.  Starting off this morning I didn't feel quite right but I figured I'd loosen up as I got into the run.  For a little while I did, but then the pain starting coming back.  At about the halfway point of my 8 miler my upper left leg, hip, and lower back pretty much seized up and I couldn't run normally.  Since I was scheduled to give a 5 minute presentation in my class on a project I've been working on I tried to push through it and make it back, but with 2 miles to go each step was excruciating and I had to stop and walk home.  I wasn't able to make it to class so hopefully the prof will let me present next week.  Still can't walk without feeling it, so at this point it's looking like I'll be taking tomorrow off.

My consecutive days streak died at 325...my back kills just walking around the house so running is out of the question for at least a few days.  My dad tried to treat me but it didn't do anything.  Not sure what's wrong.

Another day off...my pain hasn't gotten any better since Thursday so it's looking like this could take a little while.  I'm still hanging on to some hope of Crazylegs next weekend, but it's getting more doubtful by the day.

Still limping.  It's looking like I have a stress fracture in my sacrum...

Edit: Wasn't a stress fracture.  I'll never know for sure what exactly this was since I never got an MRI, but I would've been out longer than 5 weeks in that case.  The fact that I had the same issue (to a lesser degree) on the other side of my back later in the summer also almost certainly means that it was something else.

Back feels better but I still have a bit of a limp.  The past two days I wanted to do something so I did some general strength.  I'll probably start doing some biking next week.  Between Hillsdale, Drake, Get in Gear, Crazylegs, and the Olaf meets this week 90+ percent of my running friends had great races...I'm happy for them but wish that I could be a part of it.

30 minutes bike, 30 minutes elliptical

I used the past 3.5 weeks to take a bit of a break and get away from the grind of training every day.  I did some light biking when I had to urge to do something but I took about 2/3 of the days completely off and focused on finishing off the semester.  After catching up on some rest and watching an awesome performance by the Oles at MIACs this past weekend I'm motivated to start getting back in shape.  Worked out in Tostrud and then went down to practice to socialize with the team.  Felt good to get a solid workout in again.

60 minutes elliptical

Back in Appleton.  Ellipticalled in the basement during the Mavericks v Thunder game.

70 minutes elliptical

Working out with the NBA playoffs on one TV and the Brewers on the other makes the time pass much more quickly.

60 minutes elliptical

One of the dogs came downstairs and pooped when I had 5 minutes left...
65 minutes elliptical
Took the day off.  I had a late night at the Brewers game (Fielder with a walkoff homer in the bottom of the 14th!) and spent the whole afternoon and evening at a wedding.

75 minutes elliptical

After yesterday's day off I was feeling pretty good today.

43 minutes bike

Stupid...I went to the shell at 6:45 thinking I could get an hour of biking in before it closed at 8.  When the worker swiped my card I was informed that since I'm not taking classes this summer I need to pay $20 for a summer pass.  This wasn't posted anywhere in the building or on the shell's website.  I asked if I could just pay tomorrow but she said no, so I had to drive back to my apartment to get money and then go back.  Got in as much as I could before I got kicked out.

75 minutes bike

Wasn't real motivated tonight

Came home from work and passed out for 3 1/2 hours...by the time I woke up the shell was closed.  Kind of disappointing that I didn't get anything in today as now I'll end up with three days off this week (Friday I work all day and then drive to Minnesota, Sunday is graduation so nothing will be open), but if I was that tired I guess I needed the sleep more than I needed a workout.

Yeah!  First run in 5 weeks.  My back didn't hurt at all and I didn't get tired, but my legs felt really strange the entire time.  It was like I had forgotten how to run.  I realized that this is the longest continuous block of time I've taken off in over eight years.  Going to build up slow and try to do this smart.
Day off.  Did some general strength but nothing aerobic.
Ran on the course at Olaf.  Felt more natural than on Thursday but still rusty.  Nice to be back on the trails.
Aleta's graduation.  No time or place to work out.

I had planned on running today but I spent all day helping Aleta move out of her dorm and into her apartment in oppressive heat and humidity and was way too drained afterward.  I suppose I should have gotten up and done it in the morning, but I'll just run tomorrow instead.

Ran my usual 5 mile morning route.  It was kind of hot and pretty windy, but I was only going 5 miles so it wasn't too bad.  Wrote out my training plan for the next month...I'm excited about it so hopefully I won't have any setbacks and will be able to follow it.

Same route as yesterday.  I'm starting to feel a little more smooth so hopefully by next week I'll feel like an actual runner again.  Had to take a pit stop at about 3.5 to avoid crapping my pants.  I didn't get out until about 8:15 and it was a nice, windless evening.
Picnic Point.  Legs felt dead from only four hours of sleep.  Seems like napping for even 30 minutes in the evening makes it impossible to fall asleep at night.  I need to adjust to my schedule soon.

Since it was going to be deathly hot by the time I got off work I took my lunch break at 11:15 and ran then.  Ran around the American Family campus on their trails.  It was decent but I wouldn't want to do more than about six miles out there.  Legs felt ok, still not sleeping much.  Big time 10K tonight!

Watched the Pre Classic (which was a bit of a disappointment, as it seems most pro track meets recently have been) and then went for a run.  Did Picnic Point.  My legs are starting to come around.  Did six strides at the end.  They probably were only at around 5K pace but it felt good to run a little faster.
Out and back 8 St Paul Lutheran Church.  Same run I did the day that my back seized up in April.  Felt ok, just a little bit drained from the heat.

95 degrees outside when I got off work so I waited until 8:30 to run.  It was still 90 when I headed out.  This was probably the best my legs felt on a run yet, although the heat is really messing with my body.  I'm not hungry at all, only thirsty.

Ran in the arb with Adrian.  It was 95 degrees when we started at 7 PM.  I felt like the fat, slow kid on this one...never really felt very good.  Running with Tumnus made the time pass quickly though.  Good conversation about the team.
Bad Storm + Bad Headache = No Run

Eagle Heights.  This was my first 10 miler in 7 weeks.  Didn't get tired but my hips were getting sore the last couple miles.  It was only about 55 degrees...about 40 less than two days ago.  Also did six strides.
