Ran at work during lunch just like last Friday.  Felt pretty good.
Short night run in Appleton.  Kind of tired but I convinced myself to do it.

Last summer when I was building up I neglected quality and just put in miles; when I tried to start doing workouts I didn't feel comfortable running fast and I never fully came around.  So, this year I'm going to do workouts throughout the summer.  At first they won't be anything intense or impressive, but I think keeping some quality running present will help me.  This afternoon I did 5 x 1000 @ 3:20 with 1:00 rest on the Lawrence track.  It was a little tougher than I thought it was going to be, but not overly difficult.  6 fast 100m strides afterward.  It was only about 60 degrees, which was nice for running but almost feels cold after it being 100 earlier this week.

After the Brewers won (first place baby!) I went out and ran Memorial to CE.  From about miles 1 to 4 I felt like I was going to puke, then after stopping to poop I felt better for the rest of the run.  Got 50 this week, hopefully 60-65 now this next one.

Ran Eagle Heights with an add on to the top of Picnic Point.  This was probably the best I've felt since I started back up.  Nice evening weather wise.  I was pretty tired all day from only getting 4.5 hours of sleep last night (I drove back to Madison after the NBA game and then was too wound up to fall asleep until about 2:30).

Tonight's workout was 12 x 30 seconds with 1 minute jog rest.  I didn't get going until 8:15...I need to start getting in the habit of coming home from work and running right away rather than sitting around.  First mile after I started the fartlek was 5:45.  My legs felt great tonight, I'm getting back into the swing of things.
Ran during lunch.  At around 10 AM it was raining pretty hard and didn't look like I was going to be able to get this one in, but it let up.  Legs were pretty tired starting off.

Ran a loop around the Monona Bay with Marie.  Kind of awkward to exchange summaries of the past few month's activities with someone I used to talk to every day.  Pace was nice and easy which felt good on the legs.  Lots of bugs.

Easy hour on the lakeshore paths.  Legs are tired from readjusting to doing decent mileage so I kept the pace nice and easy.  Towards the Picnic Point exit I bumped into a guy that looked like an actual runner who started talking to me...turns out he lives pretty close to my apartment and runs for UW Parkside.  I think we're going to try to run together sometime.  After I finished I quickly showered and drove back to the UW track to watch Finnerty and Rucks attempt to qualify for USAs in the 1500.  Finnerty ran 3:42.9 so he didn't improve his position on the list, but it was still pretty impressive to see him run basically a 4:00 mile in such a low key meet with pretty much nobody watching.  Rucks struggled the last lap and I think was close to 3:50.

3 mile warmup, 16:30 tempo, strides, cooldown

Did this tempo on the bike path.  No splits but based on feel I'd say I certainly got 3 miles, maybe a little bit more.  Legs actually felt pretty good, breathing was the limiter.  It was warm and I didn't eat or drink much all day so on the cooldown I was feeling a bit depleted.  Just have to keep improving bit by bit.

Ran in the arb in Northfield.  It was raining and some of the paths were a bit muddy.  Energy wise I was fine and could have done quite a bit more, but muscle and bone wise I need to build back up.  I'll add one mile per week, so in a few weeks I'll be back up to a good long run.
Short arb loop from Aleta's house.  Didn't have enough to eat today, so thankfully the run wasn't any longer.  Gotta make up for missed calories before tomorrow's run.
10 x 1:00 with 2:00 jog.  The paces of both the intervals and the jogs increased as the workout went on.  Didn't start until 8:30 though, which is too late.

Ran with Phil Simac.  He runs for UW Parkside and is living in Madison this summer; we ran into each other on the lakeshore path last week and decided to run.  We pounded this at low six minute pace, it was the fastest regular run I've done in quite a while.  Apparently Parkside is big on high mileage at fast paces in singles.  I could keep talking alright the entire time, but when he turned off to add on a little bit more I slowed down to run home.
Nice run during lunch.  It rained the first 5 minutes, then let up for the rest of my run, then by the time I had finished showering it was raining again.

Legs felt absolutely shot so I ran pretty slow this evening.  I'm not surprised that I was tired after a late night workout Monday, pounding a run yesterday, and doubling today.  Did Eagle Heights.  There were a ton of bugs; I kept swallowing them.

Tempo on the bike path like last week except this time I went 20 minutes.  Legs weren't feeling too great so I started off a little conservative and picked it up as I went on.  Ran smooth the entire way and then did two 30 second and six 15 second strides.  Legs felt significantly better on the cool down than they did on the warmup, so the workout must have flushed them out.

Long run in the arb.  Felt great the entire time after taking a 3 hour nap this afternoon, but towards the end I started feeling some soreness in the back.  Stayed up for the USAs 5K and watched Lagat and Solinsky run a 3:57/58 last mile.

I originally had an easy 4 mile run scheduled for tomorrow but after having some back discomfort last night I decided to switch it to today.  Ended up stopping about halfway and walking back because it didn't feel good.  It's a muscle on the opposite side of where my issue earlier this spring was.  I'm worried about it.  Probably no run tomorrow.

Took the day off.  Iced and stretched several times and I'm feeling better, but I'll probably take tomorrow off as well because I am still a little sore.  Better to take an extra day now than a month later.  I've got plenty of time.

Another day off.  I thought about going to the shell to bike but decided to take a nap instead.  Iced and stretched in the evening.  I would like to run tomorrow but it doesn't look likely.  This is demoralizing.
Short run to test things out.  I can run normally but my glutes and piriformis muscles were pretty tight and sore.  Just take it day by day.

Tried to run, made it about 10 steps before I couldn't run with a normal stride, after two and a half minutes I turned around and walked home.  This sucks.  I'm probably going to shut it down through the long weekend; if I can't get back next week and have to take another month off I might be done trying to run competitively.

45 minutes biking at the shell.  Didn't decide to do this until about 6:40 so this was all I had time for.  It was nice to get a solid workout in, but crappy that it was on a bike.  It was 95 degrees outside, so pretty stuffy inside the non air conditioned shell (they had some fans going, but fans can only do so much...).

I took four days off this weekend to try to get healed up, and what ended up happening instead was I developed a really stiff right hamstring.  Last night I rolled it out and stretched well before bed and it felt better this morning.  Repeated this when I got home from work and thought it felt good enough that I could run.  My plan was to run out 10 minutes, stretch briefly, then run home.  On the way out I didn't feel totally normal, but I don't think I was limping.  When I stopped my leg totally locked up and I had to walk home.  I'm at a loss for how to handle this...I've had pain in several different spots in my upper leg and hip and nothing I've tried works with any sort of lasting effect.  I guess I'll just stick to the bike for the next couple days and hopefully I can get looked at when I go home this weekend.

I went to the Brewers game today for work and didn't get home until after 7, and at that point I decided I'd rather make dinner than go bike for 30 minutes at the shell (that's all I would have been able to do since it closes at 8).  I stretched and did core so at least I did a little something.  No more days off this week.

53 min biking.  Felt great while doing this, afterward my injury area was a bit sore.  Not nearly as much as the other day when I tried to run though.  Full Moon and the Lambeau 5K are out of the picture...hopefully I can get past this somewhat soon or I'm going to get my ass kicked at Alumni.

So much for no more days off this week...I got a last minute offer to go to the Brewers game on a party bus so I decided to drink beers and watch baseball rather than ride a stationary bike.  It was a sweet game, 3 runs in the bottom of the 9th for the win!
In Appleton...50 minutes elliptical in the basement.  Went pretty fast since I could watch TV.
60 minutes elliptical.  Leg has been feeling better so I think I'll run tomorrow.

Made it through six miles without limping or having my leg lock up.  My stride doesn't feel very powerful, I felt a little out of shape, and it was 90 degrees and humid, but at least I was able to run.  Hopefully I can do it again tomorrow.
Easy run...felt alright but didn't go until after the All Star Game so it was late and I didn't want to do very much.
Seven mile lakeshore path run.  Leg feels stronger than Monday but still not totally normal.  Maybe go an hour tomorrow?

Thought about going an hour, but when I started out I felt pretty crappy (from being tired, not from any injury) so I decided to just do 7.  Better to rein in the enthusiasm for now and just shoot for consistency.  Went and watched Full Moon afterward.
Worked until noon and then drove up to Sayner for a long weekend.  When I got there I did an out and back six.  Legs were a little stiff from driving but it was a pretty good run.

Oof, three things were working against me on this run.  I'm out of shape, I've been tired all week, and it was really hot and humid.  Ran an out and back to the end of downtown Sayner like we always did on the first day of camp and my legs were dying the last couple miles.

Aleta decided to go back to bed after breakfast so I headed out for my run.  Once again it was really hot; my shorts were gross when I got back to the cabin.  I wasn't really hungry at all after these runs in the heat, just thirsty.
After a full day on the lake I slipped out for a run while dinner was being made.  Ran the same route as Saturday.  Legs felt really weird from tubing.

Waited until 9 PM to run because of the heat...it was still about 90 degrees with a heat index of around 96 when I went out.  The heat just drains my legs...it's supposed to be terrible again tomorrow but then hopefully it will break.

Not quite ready to increase the length of my singles yet, especially when it's 100 degrees out, so in order to get some more miles in I'm going to do short morning runs today and tomorrow.  Felt pretty good this morning.

Went at 9:15 when the heat index finally went below 100.  There was a little bit of a breeze tonight so I felt a bit better than last night.  Pushed the 5th mile a little bit...nothing too fast but it was maybe a 5:30.  Strides afterward for the first time in 3 weeks.  They felt weird.
Kind of funny that I only had 8.5 hours in between last night's run and this morning's, but will have 13 or 14 hours of rest before the run that I'm going to do tonight.

Night run along the lake and then to the greenhouses.  Wasn't going very fast; I didn't wear a watch but I wouldn't be surprised if it took 65-66 minutes to do this.  Oh well, no need to force a pace.  Mo Ahmed blew by me when I was about a mile in.  Also saw a bunch of high schoolers walking around the lakeshore...Camp of Champs must be in session.
Woke up and waited for a thunderstorm to calm down, then did Picnic Point before driving up to Ely.  I tried to pick it up in the middle but didn't feel very good.

Ran from the Choquette's place down Bear Head State Park Road and on some trails in the state park.  It was a pretty hilly route but the weather was much nicer for running than it has been (mid 60s and cloudy).  Could tell that I'm not in very good shape.

While I was starting breakfast Rivers came down dressed in his running stuff.  I thought briefly about going with him but decided I'd rather eat.  That was pretty much the end of any realistic chance of getting in a run.  Oh well.

Ran with Phil Simac.  He's really strong right now and had a half step on me for most of the last 40 minutes.  I don't like being out of shape...it's one of the cruelties of running that fitness disappears much more quickly than it accrues.
Felt great to get up early and do a morning run, but I was quite sore from yesterday's pound.  I didn't wear a watch but I think this run took about 37 minutes.

After how stiff I was this morning and then feeling tired all day at work I wasn't sure about doing tonight's run but I ended up feeling much better than earlier.  Ran out and back on the southwest bike path.  Did a set of strides afterward.
Shaking out the legs, good way to start the day.

Did 1-2-3-2-1-2-3-2-1 on the lakeshore trails with 1 minute rest after the 1 minute intervals and 2 minutes after the others.  Effort wise I only put out about a 5/10...probably should have pushed a little harder but I still felt like I accomplished something and since I'm sleep deprived it was probably best not to try to kill it.  There was some pretty intense lightning towards the end of the workout and on the cooldown.  Also, my dinner tonight consisted of a bowl of rice because the chicken breasts I was going to make were spoiled and I have no other food.  Need to fix that.

6:30 AM run with Marie in a light rain.  We did an out and back on Park St.  I slept terrible last night, probably got less than 5 hours because I kept waking up.  Didn't feel too bad on the run but I will be exhausted later today.

Ran with Phil.  We went out the lakeshore path and then looped through campus and around the Monona Bay.  I felt ok starting out but the last 20 minutes I was definitely stuggling; not sure how much of that was due to being out of shape and how much was due to doing a 16 mile day after basically not eating dinner last night and getting less than 5 hours of sleep.  Can't believe that this is what I did basically every day this winter.

Easy day today to recover a bit.  I did Picnic Point (all the way to the top of the trail) before going to work.  Thought I was going to feel pretty rough but I actually felt pretty good.  Brewers game #6 tonight!

In Appleton for the weekend.  Did my usual 10.5 mile Xavier loop.  When I started out it was pretty warm, then when I got to College Ave the temp dropped about 15 degrees, the wind picked up, and the skies got dark.  It started raining a little bit the last 10 minutes I was out, then just after I got back inside the storm really came down.  Inserted some strides into the last 5 minutes.  Felt real good.

I had a long run planned for today but the day got away from me.  Slipped in a short night run when I got back to Madison.  It was a good training week except for today; next week I'll do my best to get in everything.
Ran from work during lunch.  It's been about six weeks since I've done that.  Felt good except it was hot and humid and even after showering I couldn't stop sweating.

This run wasn't much fun.  The heat just kicked my butt...I already wasn't feeling good at the mile and ended up taking short breaks at four and six because I was getting light headed.  Then with about two miles left I swallowed some bugs and spent the next half mile coughing them up.  Finished with a few strides and at least those felt pretty good.
Short morning run...felt really tired and might have been better off just getting some extra sleep

Heat index of 100 again today.  I hydrated well though and other than sweating a ton it didn't bother me.  I did 8 45 second hills with two 30 second strides both before and after.  It was a hard workout but I felt alright the whole time.  Finished feeling good about it.  The downside to this heat is that I don't do any supplementals when I get back because I'm disgusting and uncomfortable and just want to get in the shower.  At least it's supposed to cool off tomorrow.

Ran two miles by myself then met up with Phil to run 10.  He kept cranking the pace down to sub 6:00/mile.  My legs aren't ready to do training runs that fast so at an hour I finally told him to go on without me.  Once I slowed down I finished up feeling just fine.  Kind of demoralizing since I don't think I've been dropped from a run in about three and a half years, but it's not necessary to pound it that fast.

2 x 13 minutes @ tempo with 3 minutes rest, then 3 x 30 seconds strides.  I think I ran this workout pretty much perfectly...found the tempo rhythm and once my breathing settled down after a minute or two I ran pretty smooth the whole time.  Legs didn't struggle until the final minute of the second segment.  The only annoying thing was that I kept heel striking.
Lakeshore run before going into work.  It took me a while to get out the door, but I felt decent once I started.  Saw a fat guy walking on the trail wearing vibrams.
Ran from work before setting off for Minnesota.  Thought I wasn't going to feel good since it was warm, but since this was a short run I ended up being fine.

Slept in this morning and didn't start the run until noon.  I ran on the Root River Trail in Lanesboro...this is the only running option in this city so thankfully it's about 40 miles long.  Aleta biked with me.  My legs felt kind of flat and I felt depleted of energy so I was glad it was only a 7 mile run.  It was also getting kind of warm...need to get up earlier for the long run tomorrow.  Had 4 scrambled eggs with tomatoes and spinach afterward.

Longest run since April.  I went the same way as yesterday on the Root River Trail.  Energy wise I was fine and my legs held up pretty well throughout as well.  I got up at 8 and got going around 8:30 and the weather was a little cooler this morning which was great.  Best week of training in a long time, hopefully I can keep it going.

Got up early for a 6:30 run with Marie.  I felt great from the first step so I decided to get my longer run for the day out of the way.  We ran around Monona Bay, then I ran back to her place with her and took a very serendipitous route home.  Continued to feel good the whole time.  The weather is so much nicer in the morning; I should do this more often.

Set the record for time in between runs today as I ran at 6:30 AM and 9:30 PM.  My body felt kind of weird this evening and I think I was running kind of slow.  Six strides afterward; those felt good.

My planned workout tonight was 4 x mile on the track during the WTC's scheduled time slot, but when I showed up to the track there was a women's soccer game going on so we couldn't run there.  Some of the other guys decided to just go run easy and I decided that I would just do 4 x 5 minutes on the trails.  At the end of my first interval I ran into a group doing 1000s on a loop in the woods and I decided to join them, figuring that I would get a better workout.  They were doing 5 repeats so I hopped in for the last 4.  The loop was tough; I'd say comparable in difficulty to the last 1000 of the 4th mile on the old course at St Olaf.  I ended up hitting about the same pace that I had hoped to do the miles in and I figure that doing the the repeats on hilly trails instead of the track cancels out the fact that they were shorter.  My legs didn't have a lot of zip but I felt alright and was able to recover in between intervals.  To do this with 31 miles in my legs from the past 2 days tells me that I'm doing alright.

Started this run at 8:40.  I ran so late because I did some errands after work and forgot a bag of stuff at the checkout at Target so I had to go back to the store.  For the first six miles it seemed like the run was taking forever and I thought a couple of times about just taking a shortcut back to my place, but around halfway I got into a good rhythm and ended the run feeling good.  It was about 61 degrees out this evening with zero wind and a full moon...absolutely amazing weather.  Ran on the Wingra trail.
Ran during lunch.  Legs felt fine.  I was hungry.

After work I played kickball with a bunch of co workers for about an hour and a half.  I was only planning on staying for a little while but I was having fun so I just stayed the whole time.  Then I went home, had a light snack, and set off on the run.  As usual I tempoed on the southwest bike path.  Did 24 minutes and felt great the entire time.  Not sure what the pace was but it felt like I was cruising.  Last mile might have been close to 5:10.  Finished with 8 strides.

Easy run, same lakeshore route that I did last Friday.  Felt kind of tired starting off but I was fine by the end.  It rained two different times during the run; reminded me of in Martinique when it would rain for 10-15 minutes every day but the sun would still be shining.

8 x 1 min on/1 min off in the middle.  The pickups were fast (or at least they felt fast).  The warmup and cooldown were both kind of slow.  Got rained on the last 2 miles.  I felt alright...didn't eat breakfast beforehand but it didn't seem to really affect me.

I had hoped for a morning long run like last Sunday but I was way too tired when 8 AM came so I went back to bed and ran at 3 PM instead.  Capitol City Trail out and back.  It was about 75 degrees which was great, felt a little warmer because of the sun though.  On the way back I had a decent headwind pretty much the whole way.  There were a ton of bikers out.  I felt fine the whole run minus the usual feeling of 'man I still have 5 more miles to go' when I was 10 miles in.

Lunch run at work.  Probably the last time I'll do that this summer since this is my last week.  I felt very tired when I woke up so I thought about skipping this run but decided that I would cut the evening run shorter rather than not doubling.

When I came home from work I was really hungry and ended up scarfing down a bunch of leftover pizza so I had to let that sit for a little while and ran at around 7:45.  Started off going to Walgreens to return a Redbox movie and then headed to Picnic Point and the lakeshore.  My stomach felt terrible from the pizza for the first 3 miles or so.  On my way back towards the end of the lakeshore path a cop car was blocking the trail and three or four cops were searching the woods for something.  Finally rolled over 2000 miles for the year...only took 150 days from when I got over 1000.  Hopefully no more injuries for the rest of the year.
Easy shakeout.  I was a little late to work today because I was slow getting out of bed.  Oh well, I don't think anyone noticed.

Tested out the VO2 tonight with my first workout on a track since April.  I didn't run very fast, but seeing as I've only been running for a little over a month I'm doing alright.  After the first interval I think I split all of the others something like 75/73; it was weird.  This should indicate sub 16:00 shape.
6:30 run with Marie.  Ran around Monona Bay in the opposite direction of usual.  Left leg was gimpy for the first 100 meters but then it was fine.  Pretty much no soreness from yesterday.

I was supposed to run with Phil this evening but I waited at the Union until 6:10 and he didn't show so I just went and did Eagle Heights by myself.  Probably for the better that it worked out this way since I don't think any part of this run was under 7:00 pace.  My pace on my non workout days is the thing that's really lagging in my return to fitness.  It'll come around eventually.

Usual Thursday night threshold workout on the bike path.  On the way out Stadium Sports Bar was blasting 'I Just Had Sex.'  This week I did 4 x 6:30 cruise intervals with 75 seconds recovery...I split it up like this since I'm running a race in less than 36 hours and I want to give myself at least a chance of feeling decent.  The workout was pretty easy; didn't feel real pressed and I was recovering really quickly in between reps.  Finished with four 30 second strides.

Easy run, did Picnic Point extended.  Legs were feeling pretty heavy so hopefully I'll feel better in the morning.  I finally got some new shoes and the extra support pretty much took care of my gimpy left knee.  Today was my last day of work for the summer...feels good to be done but also pretty strange.  Gonna be criss crossing Wisconsin and Minnesota for the next 2+ weeks.

5K at the Madison Mini Marathon.  The race was supposed to start at 7:00 but at 6:55 as I was finishing my strides they made an announcement that the start would be delayed because of incoming weather.  I was frustrated for a minute but it ended up being a good decision because by 7:15 it was storming pretty bad and they would have had to blow the horn.  Finally at 8:15 they told us the race would start at 8:30.  Since it was a meaningless race and warming up in 15 minutes isn't possible I jogged a mile and decided that I would just run it as a harder tempo run.  Ended up finishing in 17:31 for 3.3-3.4 miles, not sure what the exact distance was (I clicked it out online yesterday and got 3.4, the guy behind me ran with a GPS and got like 3.32).  So something like a 16:10-16:15 5K.  Another guy went out ahead of me at the start but I passed him in less than 5 minutes and ran the rest solo.  It was raining pretty hard for most of the time I was running and then about 5 minutes after I finished the rain let up.  It's always fun to win a race and have people cheering for you.  Felt like I was tempo running the entire time, so that's a sign that I'm in halfway decent shape.  After I finished I went back to my apartment and showered and then went back down to get my free post race beer and watch the end of the half marathon.  Should be ready to put the hammer down in 2 weeks.
Easy 4 once I got back to Appleton.  Maybe a pointless run, but at least I enjoyed it.

After the Brewers game I ran out past Xavier to Carriage Road and then looped back through downtown.  I was a little tired from being awake for 19 hours yesterday and then getting up for church this morning but got through the run feeling fine.  68 degrees and windy so it kind of felt like fall.  Going to go for 90 this week.
Late morning run after sleeping in.  I went out my CE Trail to Kimberly loop.  Ran out of fuel with about 3 miles left.  I'll get some food in me before my second run.

10/7 double...this was a regular thing last winter but today was my first one since then.  I did East South River then added a mile at the end.  Legs were a little tired but I should be alright for a workout tomorrow.  I got back from the run just in time to see the Brewers extend their 2-0 lead to 6-0.
I decided to do a little shakeout run.  Nice and easy.

Decent workout today, but shows that I still have a ways to go.  On the warmup I did not feel good and did not want to do this.  The first mile was fine.  Pacing on the tempo was kind of sloppy and probably a little bit slow...seems like I always have that problem when I try to do tempo stuff after starting with hard intervals.  I got it together by the second half.  On the last mile I was really hoping to see a sub 5...I was on pace at halfway and then felt like I was pushing hard coming in but I ended up at 5:02.  The humidity has returned; I was drenched at the end.  Short cool down since we were going out for dinner for my grandma's birthday.  I was cashed anyways.
Woke up with dead legs so I decided to keep the morning run short and easy in order to ensure a good run this afternoon.  It was so humid that I looked like I had run for an hour when I got back.

Went out to High Cliff.  After the morning shakeout and some lunch my legs felt better, and out there by the water and in the woods the humidity wasn't nearly as bad.  Felt good the whole time and picked it up a little bit the second half.

Long warmup then 10 Banta Bowl hills.  Usually hills are fairly tough for me but today I didn't struggle at all.  My legs felt like I was running on air and my breathing would always get back to normal pretty quickly after each repeat.  A Lawrence campus safety vehicle drove down the hill and sat in the parking lot for a few minutes; at one point I was a little worried that he was going to try to tell me I couldn't run there (it's a public road so he doesn't have that authority), but then he left.

Later first run of the day with Aleta next to me on the bike.  Since I hadn't run in over 24 hours my legs felt pretty fresh so the run was pretty easy.  It also makes the time pass a lot faster to have someone to talk to.

I went the same direction on the trail as earlier today and just turned around a little earlier.  Felt good once again.  Six fast strides afterward.  Aleta was working all evening so I followed up the run with a viewing of the Rose Bowl...first time I had seen it since January 1.

Went the same direction as I did for my long run 3 weeks ago in Lanesboro.  This run took place just over an hour after eating lunch at Das Wurst Haus (huge brats that were really good, the only beer they had on tap was La Crosse Lager but I didn't have one) so I didn't know how my stomach would feel but I didn't have any problems.  Felt great the whole time and ending up picking up the pace significantly on the way back and negative splitting by 2 minutes.  I'm always amazed by the number of people that are biking on this trail; I don't think I've ever seen another runner though.  The last 10 minutes I started getting pretty thirsty and when I finished I chugged a 32 oz Gatorade.

Easy hour long run in a light rain to finish off a good week.  Not much to say about it, spent a lot of the run reliving past races.  Felt good.  First week back in the 90s since April; now next week and possibly the week after will be back to the mid 80s and then I'll get after some mileage in mid September.
Squeezed in a morning run before driving home.  I was a little tired so I ran pretty slow.

This run didn't feel real good, although I'm not terribly surprised after a bad night of sleep last night, eating Burger King for lunch, and a four hour drive with no stops.  Six strides afterward to attempt to prime the legs for a workout tomorrow morning.  My grandma came over for dinner and arrived as I was doing my strides.  She didn't really understand the concept.

Fartlek workout out at High Cliff.  Same workout I did last year the week of alumni.  I tried to keep picking it up throughout and felt great the whole time.  It was nice to do this on a loop rather than back and forth on the same paths.  Went to the Brewers game tonight; they lost so my record on the year drops to 7-2.
Tired today...stayed up until 3 last night and haven't done that for a while.  Hopefully won't do it again anytime soon.

Drove back to Madison this afternoon because of the first football game tomorrow night.  When I started this run I was pissed off (conflict with the P.U.) but I realized that pounding the run wouldn't help anything and would just make me feel worse for tomorrow's tempo and Saturday's race so I refrained.  Legs were feeling good by the end.  I stopped and took a really acidic shit at the six mile mark.

Had a tempo run on the schedule...I switched the location from the bike path to the lakeshore trails because the heat index was 99, and when I started out I knew that I probably wasn't sufficiently fueled up for a workout but I thought I could get through it (I barely ate any dinner last night and all I had eaten today was a bowl of cereal and a half sandwich).  After about a mile and a half my body just wasn't having it any more; I had major hunger pains and felt like I was going to faint.  Jogged slowly home.  This isn't a good time for my first bad workout in a while but I'm going to try to just shake it off.  A couple good meals should fix things.
After getting some food in me I wanted to get out for another run tonight just to get things moving again after feeling so bad this afternoon.  I felt much better on this one.  Go Badgers!

Late morning run to the top of Picnic Point and back.  I stopped and did strides at the start of the trail on my way back.  Didn't feel great, but better than my first run yesterday.  Hopefully I'll have a good showing tomorrow.

Alumni 5K - holy shit I'm not even counting this as a race, and I can't say it was a tempo either because I felt like I was dying the entire time.  My body was doing weird things, it felt like I started shutting down right when the gun went off.  I don't think I'll be doing any more races anytime soon, pretty much every time I've tried to race in the past year + it's been a terrible experience.

Another long run in Lanesboro.  I forgot my watch this weekend so I tried to remember where I had turned around last weekend.  Ended up turning a little early so I had to add on when I got back to town.  Legs felt fine, mentally I wasn't really in the mood.

Ran at about 12:30 and Aleta biked with me.  Felt good.  It was only like 60 degrees out which I suppose is kind of appropriate for the last day of summer.  The last 20 minutes an older guy was biking about 100 meters behind us...he never passed but instead just sat there.  By the end of the run it was kind of starting to creep me out.
After driving back to Madison (which took 45 minutes longer than usual because of traffic) I slipped out for another run.  Felt awesome and probably ran low 6 minute pace.

4 mile tempo in 21:23.  After Saturday's debacle I wanted to get a time on one of these to make sure that I actually am in decent shape and not just fooling myself.  Splits were 5:17, 5:23, 5:23, 5:20.  Felt real smooth the first 3 miles, the last one I was starting to get a little tired but even that wasn't too bad.  4 x 150 fast afterward.
I started this run at the last possible moment I could.  Had to pound it a bit in order to get to class on time.  Pretty tired this morning.
Felt pretty much like garbage for most of this run.  The one nice thing was the 70 degree weather.  I got made fun of by a fat chick that was eating a bag of chips.

Late morning Eagle Heights + strides.  Felt a little tired starting out but the second half of the run I felt great.  The great running weather continues.  No afternoon run today because I'm going to the Packer game tonight!

I did the workout at High Cliff.  Wasn't sure going in how tough it would be...I'd say the difficulty ended up being about a 7 or 8 out of 10.  I was pretty aggressive on the one minute intervals and then I'd like to think that I ran about a 5 minute mile finishing up.  I'm still not sure if I'm going to do any more races this fall but either way doing some workouts now will have benefits in the winter and spring.

I was going to do a second run yesterday when I got back to Madison but I couldn't motivate myself to do it, then I had a two a day planned for today and couldn't get going on that either.  Not sure why my motivation was so lacking, other than that I was just generally tired.  Finally at 6:30 I suited up and headed out to at least get something in.  Pretty quickly I decided that I would just do tomorrow's long run tonight.  It was a pretty cool run doing the first half as the sun was setting and the second half under the moon light.  The temperature also dropped from 80 degrees at the start to 66 degrees at the end.  Saw a few deer, one of which was no more than six feet away from me at one point.  From about miles 4 to 14 I felt invincible and like I could run forever.  The last little bit my legs were alright but my core was getting tired.  This was my longest run in six months...I'm making progress.

Ran a new route called Arb 10.  The turn around is the same point as Arb 12; the difference is that this route gets to the entrance of the arb in two miles rather than three.  Legs were a little tired from last night when I started out.  Lots of people out for the Ironman.

Run #2 at about 8:00.  I wanted to watch the pregame ceremony for the Sunday Night Football game so I got going kind of late.  I stashed a t shirt so that at the end of the run I could go into the Madison Market to buy a frozen pizza.  Spent the run thinking about what happened 10 years ago...it doesn't seem like it happened yesterday but it doesn't seem like it's been 10 years either.  God Bless America.
Easy Picnic Point.  Cut it close with making it to class on time but I wanted to do the full 6.

I felt like crap, pretty sure I was dehydrated.  Was getting pretty light headed and stopped twice to try to feel better.  I threw in a few pickups the last mile and my legs felt good during those so I should be ok for a workout tomorrow.
Easy morning run.  I could not fall asleep last night, it sucked.

While I was doing this workout I wasn't terribly happy with how it was going but then on the cooldown I realized that compared to my last 800s workout four weeks ago and considering what all I've done the past 5 days this was actually pretty decent.  I still have a ways to go to get back to tip top shape, but today I felt fairly controlled for the most part.  My goal was somewhere between 8 and 10 repeats...the last 150 of the 7th one I hit a little bit of a wall but I convinced myself to do another, then after feeling alright on the 8th I figured I'd keep going.  When I started hitting it with 300 to go on #9 I decided to push that one in and call it a day.

Got up early and ran with Marie.  She was an hour and a half into a 20 miler when we met at 7:15.  Ran through a bunch of different neighborhoods with her for about 70 minutes then added about 15 more on my way home.  I'm pretty sure I'm taking tonight off so all of the day's running was done by 8:45.  Great 50 degree morning, great way to start the day.

20 minute tempo, 3 min jog, 5 min hard

Late morning workout.  For a change of venue I decided to do this in the arb rather than on the bike path.  The tempo felt pretty good; the arb is pretty rolling so it kind of felt like cross country.  For the last 5 minute interval I was back on the road and I honestly would be surprised if I ran much slower than a 4:50 mile because I felt like I was really cruising.  Started out fast and tried to just maintain it.  Another good workout in the bank.

Busy schedule today...I was originally going to run again 3 hours after finishing my workout but before I got to the end of the block I realized that I felt atrocious and decided to run later.  Ended up getting out at 9:30.  My legs felt great but the Chipotle that I ate for dinner didn't feel real good in my stomach.  It was a pretty brisk night so I wore gloves...earliest in the fall that I've ever needed them.
Easy Picnic Point + 6 strides at noon.  Legs felt good, weather was cool once again.  I finally got a great night of sleep last night.  Running again with Adrian in about 3 and a half hours.

Ran with Adrian and Matt Mixdorf.  Great conversations and it was a lot of fun.  We met at the phallus by Camp Randall and then ran the lakeshore trails and looped around the west side of town.  I felt great.  Biggest day in six months and 109 in the past 7.  Boom!
Easy shakeout.  I felt fine but I need to start going to bed earlier and getting up earlier.

Did a short session this evening to get the legs turning over at the end of a big week.  I jumped the fence to get onto the track, and in doing so I ended up with a small cut on my thigh that will probably leave a scar when it heals.  The 400s were done as a continuous run...I wasn't tired at the end but they felt fast.  I don't know if it's the 109 miles in the past week or what but I don't think I could have run a relaxed 4:40 mile tonight.  Oh well, it'll come.  The 150s felt good.  Ended up doing a long cool down because I bumped into Mike Brice and Alex Hatz and turned around and ran with them for a bit.  Once I hit 35 minutes I walked the last half mile home because I figured I had run for long enough.
Easy day today to recover a bit and let my body absorb the past 10 days.  It started lightly raining the last two miles.  I'll do another run later.
Another easy run in some more rain.  Didn't feel that great, not enough food today.

I didn't fall asleep until about 3 AM last night because I was stressing about the future so when my alarm went off at 7:45 I wasn't in the mood to pound out a long run and I went back to sleep.  Instead I did the run during the afternoon in some absolutely beautiful weather.  It was 65 degrees and sunny with a light breeze...just warm enough for no shirt but not hot at all.  I took the long way over to the arb, ran around in there on various trails, then took the short way home.  105 minutes total.  Felt good the whole time...never amazing but never struggling.
Another poor night of sleep last night.  I got the run in but after I got back to my apartment I felt like CRAP.
Lakeshore trails, felt good.  Pitch dark when I finished just after 7:30.  Six strides afterward.

I did this workout on the Picnic Point trails.  Each of the first four intervals had some sort of hill involved.  The first one felt a little rough but then I felt pretty strong for the rest of the workout.  It was pretty windy but on the trails I wasn't really affected.  I feel like I've actually got some fitness.  Good day.
Eagle Heights after classes.  Legs were kind of dead, probably from yesterday's workout, so I ran pretty easy the whole way.  It was a little windy.

15 minute tempo
4 minutes rest
8 x 50 seconds hard (jog back rest)

Skipped the morning run.  I kind of wish I hadn't, but if I was tired enough to sleep two more hours I suppose I needed the extra sleep more than the miles.  The workout this afternoon was good.  Pacing on the tempo was pretty much dead even and on the intervals I got the hard effort that I was looking for.  The intervals alternated between flat and uphill...they all started from the same point and the rest was a jog back (I tried to keep this jog close to a normal run pace rather than a shuffle).  On the warmup I stopped at the UW Business Office to pay my tuition for the semester, so now I'm poor.

Long run in the arb.  It was cold when I started out so I wore a long sleeve and gloves, but by the second half I was overdressed.  Lots of people out and about around Camp Randall drinking and getting ready for the football game even though it didn't start for another 5 hours.  Legs didn't feel terrific.

Out and back 8 to St Paul Lutheran Church.  It was a bit windy so the way out was kind of tough, but the way back felt great.  Legs were pretty good, and this is my only run for the day so tomorrow I should be feeling great.

I took Aleta to the airport at 7:30 and my original plan was to run when I got home from that, but I decided I didn't want to go in the cold rain so I waited.  When I went out around 9:45 the rain had let up so it was a nice run.  Picnic point.  Saw Alex Brill running in tights and a jacket even though it was 60 degrees out.

Easy 10.  Felt great after taking a two hour nap this afternoon.  It definitely gets dark earlier now...started the run at 6:30 and by the last 3 miles night had fallen.  Six strides afterward, they felt real good.

2 mile morning shakeout...I only got 5 hours of sleep last night so with a workout later I didn't want to do too much but I wanted to loosen up the legs.  I did the workout at dusk in the arb. The 8 minute interval was kind of hard and then the rest of them felt really good, so either I wasn't running fast enough or I was just feeling good.  I'll go with the second one.  No walking in between intervals, it was all continuous.
Ran with Marie at 6:30.  It was dark when we started.  Pace was really slow but she's tapering for Twin Cities on Sunday so it's fine.  Need to fix my sleeping; I only got 4 hours last night.

Ran with Adrian.  We started at Camp Randall, went all the way through Arboretum Drive to Nakoma, hooked up to the bike path, then added on a bit when we got back to make it 10.  The first mile I was tired since I woke up shortly before we started and was still a little delirious but then I felt great the rest of the way.
Easy morning run followed up be watching Sportscenter and reliving the craziest night of regular season baseball that I've ever seen.

Original plan was to do hills this afternoon but it was insanely windy so doing them wouldn't have been very productive or enjoyable so I did 12 x 35 seconds instead.  Didn't feel real great on the first 4 but then when I started focusing on trying to be smooth it got better.  Terrible weather with 30 mile per hour winds and rain.
Today's first run took place at about 1 PM.  It was still really windy, but unlike yesterday it wasn't raining so it wasn't too bad.  Felt ok.

I wasn't real pumped to run tonight but after seeing the Eau Claire results I decided to man up and get it done.  Legs felt solid.  Nice evening, 45 degrees and the wind had died down.  Prediction: Brian Saksa will be an All American this November.

Long run/tempo workout that didn't go real well.  The plan was to run 5 miles then do 2 x 15 minutes at tempo with a 5 minute recovery jog, then take 3 minutes rest and do 3-5 minutes at race pace (I was going to decide based on how I was feeling).  I ended up cutting the second tempo section at 12 minutes because I felt terrible, then did a 3 minute interval, took 2 minutes rest, and did a 2 minute interval.  Got something out of it but it wasn't quite the effort I was looking for.  Coming home there were a ton of people downtown; more than I've ever seen even on a game day.
Easy lakeshore run in the morning.  The weather was great and my legs felt better than I thought they would.  Went to the Brewers playoff game this afternoon...9-4 win for a 2-0 series lead!
Easy run on the usual route.  Perfect weather, felt good.

Out and back to the church.  My life flashed before my eyes as an idiot driver failed to stop before turning right on a red light and plowed through the intersection at about 30 miles per hour.  He didn't see me but thankfully I was able to slam on my brakes just in time.  Strides afterward, legs felt good.  Big workout tomorrow.

This workout was hard.  I did six Picnic Point repeats last fall and averaged right around 4:00, so I decided to do it again this year and see how I compared.  On the warmup I was actually a little bit nervous for this; not sure when the last time I was nervous for a workout was.  The trail is pretty hilly and somewhere between 1250 and 1300 meters long.  I ran 3:50, 3:55, 3:57, 3:55, 3:58, 3:57.  I was shocked that I ran 3:50 on the first one because for some reason I thought it was going to be like 4:05.  I knew that this wasn't sustainable for six repeats to I slowed it down a bit for the second one.  Unfortunately I ended up slowing down a little more on the last couple...maybe if I hadn't run the first one so fast I would have been able to finish faster.  The 1 minute and 30 second intervals basically served to simulate the discomfort of the last 1000 meters of a race.  I was pretty dead when I finished but I don't think I over reached.

2 mile morning shakeout...I liked it before last Tuesday's workout so decided to do it again.
Late morning Arb 10.  My legs were pretty dead from yesterday.  The weather feels more like June than October.

I originally was pretty sure I was going to take tonight off since I had a pretty long day and didn't feel the greatest on my first run but I ended up deciding I'd rather get this run in and then only run once tomorrow.  Legs were a little drained starting out from being on my feet talking to people at the career fair all afternoon, but everything smoothed out eventually.
Eagle Heights.  I'm logging this on Monday and don't remember anything special about this run so I'm guessing I felt alright.

20 minute tempo in the arb in Northfield.  It was nice to go for a run in the arb again but my legs were still not totally recovered from Tuesday so the pace was a little bit slower than usual.  I ran at the right effort level though and got the entire 20 minutes in, so that was good.  Finished with 4 x 40 seconds faster; just trying to feel good on these so probably like 35 second 200 pace.

Afternoon shakeout before the Brewers game.  I did an out and back from Aleta's house and it was ridiculously windy.  Running up the hill right before the turn on to Jefferson was into the wind and I was probably going 8 minute pace.  Felt good to move the legs.  Brewers move on to the NLCS thanks to Go Go Gomez and T Plush!

I went to Schaar's Bluff in Hastings with the Olaf guys for a long run.  It was a little bit weird because there are only about 15 people still on the team that I ran with and half of them weren't there.  Ran mostly with Tim, Saksa, and Grant, and Stretch and Block were around for a little while.  We had to repeat a lot of the same paths because there were only about 4 miles worth of trails, but for one run it was a nice new location.  Tim and Saksa pulled off at 90 minutes and Grant and I finished up with about 12 more, where we ended up picking it up a bit.  I didn't get tired until the add on.  Good to see some of the guys, and the drive up and back with Phil was fun as always.
Easy short arb loop.  Felt good, glad I went early so that I didn't have to deal with the heat.
Picnic point.  I was still a little tired and probably should have eaten some breakfast, but the legs felt good.  Low six minute pace.

Got going a little late so instead of doing Eagle Heights I had to do Standard 10.  The weather was once again perfect, 70 degrees and no wind.  For about the last six miles I felt like I was running on air.  Strides also felt great.  I'm getting excited for Saturday's race...need to rein in the enthusiasm though since it's still 5 days away.
I was up studying until 3:30 last night.  Wish I wasn't, but what's done is done so I can't worry about it.

Short tuneup workout.  I've done this workout (or pretty similar variations of it) a couple times the weeks of big cross country races and usually felt real good the day of the race so I'll try it again.  I felt great tonight.  14 minutes of intervals with rests is a lot different than a 5 mile race, but if I can continue to keep this rhythm through the week I might actually run pretty well on Saturday.  My stomach was a little bit shaky from eating a couple rolls 20 minutes before heading out.
Easy.  Wished I would have eaten breakfast beforehand.
Another easy run.  It was sprinkling a little bit.  Felt a little tired, most likely from my late night on Monday.  Going to bed early tonight hopefully.

Easy Standard 10.  I went a little later than I would have liked because I ended up falling asleep this afternoon.  About halfway through I threw in 5 minutes at tempo pace and then 2 1 minute surges.  Legs felt great afterward.  It rained most of the day so the lower loop on La Crosse's course will probably be pretty soggy on Saturday.

Easy pre race run on the lakeshore path.  It was really windy and there was a little chill in the air so it felt like cross country weather.  Strides afterward and they felt great.  This is the most excited I've been for a race in a long time...as long as I can stay relaxed tomorrow morning it should be a great day.  Here we go!

On the surface this doesn't look like that great of a race, but I feel that this was a step in the right direction for my running.  I didn't psych myself out beforehand and was relaxed on the starting line and in the first mile.  After most of my races in the past year I've been depressed but after today I have a desire to race more.  There aren't very many opportunities between now and the end of the year but I will find a few.

Easy 11.  I did Eagle Heights plus some extra on the Picnic Point trail.  Felt good and had to hold myself back to not start hammering.  Probably still a bit rested from my light week this week.  The next week and a half is pretty busy with an actuarial exam and some interviews so I'm not quite sure what will be in the cards training wise.

Awesome long run this afternoon.  I went out through the arb, hooked up to Nakoma, took that all the way to Hammersly, then took the bike path all the way back to Monona and came home.  Great loop with basically no repeating.  Endless amounts of energy and beautiful fall weather.

I didn't get out until 7:00 because I just kept putting it off.  Ran Standard 10.  I felt kind of crappy all day but my legs felt great on the run which was surprising.  At about 7.5 miles I stopped and did 10 strides.
Felt pretty terrible waking up again today.  The run felt great though, so I suppose it's ok.
Arb 10.  It was super windy again and it's definitely getting colder.  Feeling good.
Stress relief run.  Felt good.

Arb 10 again.  My legs have felt really good all week.  I suppose they should though since I cut back last week and haven't done any workouts this week.  It's kind of like the week after indoor conference always was when I was at Olaf.

I must have jinxed myself with yesterday's blog comment because I felt really sluggish today.  It was really cold this morning so I wore tights for the first time this fall other than last weekend's warmup.  I did six strides at the start of the lakeshore path and then stopped at Jimmy Johns on my way home to get lunch.

Fartlek workout in the arb.  This was my first workout in a week and my legs felt really fresh for it.  I did 10 x 1 minute with 90 seconds in between and 6 x 30 seconds with 60 seconds in between.  Hit the fast parts hard and felt good.  My main goal for the next two months is to get some speed back.

Lazy today.  I did an hour run on the lakeshore trails at about 12:45.  I felt good but didn't want to go any further or double because I wanted to do some other stuff.  Not a terrible week of training, but not quite as many miles as I would have liked.

After taking Aleta to the airport I did Picnic Point.  Halfway through I started getting really hungry which was weird because I ate breakfast this morning.  I must not have had enough to eat throughout the weekend.
Eagle Heights.  Great weather and after about 25 minutes I felt great the rest of the time.  Had to take two poop breaks.  Finished with strides.

25 minute tempo on the Capital City Trail.  This went real well...I went out 11 minutes and despite having the wind in my face more on the way back I kept the exact same pace, then kept going for the extra 3 minutes.  Pulse was just over 160 at the end.  Felt strong.
Shakeout

Long run in the arb.  My long run last week was a pretty hard effort and I did a workout yesterday so I kept this on the easier side of things.  Found out right before I started that I didn't get a job in Minneapolis that I really wanted.  FML.

I didn't really sleep last night (I don't think I fell asleep until 5 AM) so there certainly was not going to be a morning run.  I took a short nap this afternoon and then ran at about 7:00.  Actually ended up feeling ok.  The middle four miles was a fartlek...no watch so no real structure.  Pickups varied from tempo pace to sprinting.
Run #1 at about 1:00.  Nothing exciting.

A cold rain had started by the time run #2 rolled around.  I hate cold rain so I ran inside.  Legs feel alright, if I can get another good night of sleep tonight I should be pretty much back to normal after not sleeping on Wednesday.

EASY shakeout.  I went out right as it was getting dark and got it in before the Badger game.  Not really sure if this was any benefit, I guess I'll see how my legs feel tomorrow.  Zero wind but a little chilly.  The Big O ran well today...2nd by 9 points without 2 of the top 5 is nothing to be ashamed of.

Kind of a crappy run in a cold light rain.  My body as a whole was pretty tired when I got up from my lack of sleep over the course of the past week.  Ran out the Wingra trail to the Sheraton.  There were a ton of cop cars parked down by Vilas Park.
Shakeout.  Weather was great tonight, 50 degrees and pretty much no wind.  Felt good.
Easy Picnic Point.  Made it to 3000 miles for the year...not going to make it to 4000.

Eagle Heights.  I had a side ache for about six miles in the middle and I was generally tired, so not the best run, but still ok.  Saw a bunch of little kids trick or treating.  I also saw a group of what looked to be middle school punks 3 times and each time they yelled 'witty' things at me.

20 minute tempo, 3:30 rest, 10 minute tempo.  I did this on Arb 12 on a beautiful afternoon.  No splits but between the tempo parts and rest (of which I jogged slowly for about half and stood for the other half) I covered about 6 miles.  Felt good but I need sleep.
Ran early with Marie.  It was dark when we started and for about the first half of the run.  I added about 20 minutes after she turned off.  Felt good.

It was windy, cold, and raining for this evening's run so I wasn't very excited about doing it.  The first half was pretty miserable running into the wind with the rain hitting my face, then when I turned around the second half was actually somewhat enjoyable.  There was one low spot at the bottom of a hill that was totally flooded...I saw a car go speeding into the puddle and it looked like Splash Mountain.  On the way back by Tenney Park some guy was walking towards me with his jacket covering his face.  He didn't move out of the way at all and I figured he didn't see me so I went on the grass.  I ended up scaring the crap out of him and he whipped around as if he was getting ready for a confrontation.  I just kept running and he yelled after me, 'Yeah, keeping running, you f*cking idiot!'
Easy morning.  Woke up before my alarm which was a little strange since I'm certainly not well rested.

10 x 2 minutes on, 2 minutes off.  I did the workout on Arb 12 again.  My legs were tired and the intervals weren't quite as easy as I had expected/hoped, but 2 minutes of rest is quite a bit and I felt like I was recovering pretty fast.  I wish the days didn't get shorter as we got closer to winter; I started this run at 5:00 and finished the last 2 miles in the dark.  Next week with daylight savings time it will be dark even earlier so I'll need to adjust my schedule seeing as I haven't started an afternoon run before 4:30 in weeks.

Capital City Trail long run.  It was a nice afternoon and since I didn't really do anything all day except phone interviews I felt decently rested going in.  Held myself back from hammering.  With a mile to go I had to stop at a light for probably 3 minutes and when I started up again my legs felt weird.  This has been a pretty dense past seven days of training with 112 miles, a race, two workouts, and a long run.  I've got plenty of time to recover this weekend though and then after next Thursday I'll be mixing in some rest so it's all good.

Didn't want to run this morning so I decided I'll double tomorrow instead.  In the afternoon I did Eagle Heights and an add on mile.  Didn't feel that great; I was tired and hungry.  The weather was nice though.
Arb 10 at about noon.  Felt better than I expected to.  Saw about 15 turkeys.
8:30 PM double.  Not that great of a run; too many snacks during the Packer game.

I couldn't get myself moving this morning so in order to finish this run and make it to class on time I had to run about 6 minute pace.  Once I started running I felt fine; I was just dead tired waking up.

4 x 5 minutes cruise intervals with 1 minute rest, then 4 x 30 seconds at (around) mile pace.  I did it on the southwest bike path.  This was really easy and I felt good the whole time.  The pace was solid; going by feel I'd say maybe around 5:10.  This might have been the last real nice day of the fall before the temperature drops...I'll hope not but looking at the forecast I might be done running in shorts and a t shirt until March.

The weather was crappy and I was guessing there would be a 'pop' quiz in my first class (he gives unannounced quizzes every 2 weeks or so), so I pulled a Sampson and studied while running inside.  My guess about the quiz was correct so it was a good choice.
Still raining but this wasn't as bad as my run in the rain last week.  Need sleep, as usual.
Terrible weather this morning.  I opted for another inside run.

Standard 10.  I waited until about 7:00 to go because by that time the precipitation had stopped so it was more comfortable running weather.  I did a tempo that was about 4.75 miles (started a bit before the 3.5 mile mark and finished at the 8 mile mark).  The pace was almost certainly a little slower than usual but that's fine.  Feels like I'm getting nice and strong aerobically.  My abdomen was really bothering me on the cool down...haven't felt anything down there for a few months but I guess I still have that sports hernia.  Hopefully it doesn't affect tomorrow's long run.  I was planning on doing an add on mile at the end for a longer cool down but I ended up cutting it short.

I did the route that I ran about three and a half weeks ago (arb to Nakoma to the bike path) but this time didn't add on at the end to make it 16.  It took me about an hour to get into it but I never really felt bad.  Just average.  Running into the wind was cold and then I was sweating quite a bit when I turned and had the wind at my back.  The next four days I will be significantly reducing mileage.  My thought/hope is that taking this little break will help me stay fresh until February, and this weekend is a good time to take it with a job interview in St Paul tomorrow, my cousin's wedding on Saturday, and the Packer game on Monday.

Ran at 6 AM on the treadmill at The Saint Paul Hotel.  Not real exciting, but a decent way to start the day before a long day of interviewing at Travelers.  I thought things went well.  Hopefully I get the job.  After I was done there I got in the car and drove to Stevens Point for Kelly's wedding weekend.

Brent Haglund was also in town for the wedding (his wife went to Gustavus with Kelly) so we ran together.  We drove to Iverson Park and went from there.  Ran through some neighborhoods and then ended up finding the Green Circle Trail about halfway through the run.  The trail was pretty snowy and icy so it made things a little slower.  I also took my first fall of the winter (I'm usually good for 2 or 3).  Nice to run with Brent and talk about what we've been up to for the past year and a half.  The Big O is going to nats!  BOOM!

I was originally thinking I might go a little further today but by the time I got home from Stevens Point I only had time for this before my family went to dinner at another family's house.  I ran the long East South River loop and then did strides.  Legs felt kind of sluggish.  I rarely feel great while doing reduced training although intuitively it would seem like I should.  That's why I don't do a dramatic taper at the end of a season.
Easy shakeout.  I had it in my head that I wanted to double today but had a lot of other stuff to do so only had time for 3 this morning.

Ran Memorial to CE this afternoon.  At Seymour St I stopped at stretched for a minute then did 12 x 30 seconds with 60 seconds in between.  At the end of the fifth rep I saw a car accident.  Nobody was hurt but the front bumpers of both cars got cracked up.  Time for the Packer game, Go Pack!

Eagle Heights.  It was a great day for running; I guess I was wrong last Monday about that being the last day for shorts and a t shirt.  Intersected with the Badger CC team.  Felt better than I expected to.
9 PM run.  It was pretty windy for this one and the temperature had gone down a bit.  It feels good to get back to normal training.  Did four strides after the turn around.

I ran inside while studying like I did last week.  Don't think it paid off as much this time though.  I also think I might have a fever.  I still want to do a workout later; I guess it will be a game time decision.

I ended up doing this in the dark because I got bogged down doing other stuff in the afternoon.  I wasn't sure what exactly I was going to do (came up with it on the warmup), but actually ended up feeling pretty good despite being fairly unmotivated to start the workout.  The plan was to do 4 sets of 3-2-1 but if I had done a 4th set I would have only had about a half mile cool down, so since I didn't want to have to extend the run I just did the 4 minute interval and called it a day.  I think next week I'd like to do a workout on the track if the weather is nice.
Ran in the dark for the second straight day, although today I started at 5:00 rather than 7:30.  Nothing really notable about this run, I think I felt alright?
First run was at noon because I slept until 11:30.  I'm getting a cough.  Shit.

Kept this one short and easy.  Legs feel great but my cold is settling into my chest.  Looks like tomorrow instead of a tempo in the morning and then another run in the afternoon I'll just do one easy run.  With a race in 6 days I need to be smart, and losing one workout and a few miles isn't a big deal.

Running/sprinting around at nationals.  Both Olaf teams did pretty well; 10th for the girls and 23rd for the guys.  Emma was All American and all 7 guys ran PRs.  It was fun to be at the race; brought back memories (some good and some bad).  A super fast course and about the best weather you could hope for in mid November led to really fast times across the board.  Sathre won.  Tommies still suck.

Short run on the treadmill.  It would have been dumb to go outside in a cold rain when I already have a cold so I just stayed in and ran during the end of the Penn State/Ohio State game.  This week is pretty much another throwaway week.

Ran on the treadmill again.  I spent enough time outside today at the Packer game so I stayed indoors and did this during the second half of the Bears game.  Legs felt great; it feels like I didn't even run this week but I still did 87 miles.  Sickness is much better.
Go Badgers!  National champs!

13 min @ tempo, 2:30 rest, 7 min about the same, 2:00 rest, 5 min a little bit faster (maybe about a 5:00 mile), 2:30 rest, 6 x 15 seconds sprint/30 seconds float.  I felt really strong today.  Did it in the arb.  I'm not running as much as I was last year at this time but I'm definitely in better shape.

Morning run on the treadmill at the Crowne Plaza in St Paul.  I'm pretty sure the love of my life was on the treadmill next to me...she appeared to be around my age, was clipping along at 9 miles per hour, and had the TV tuned to ESPN.  Sadly I'll probably never see her again.

Ran in Appleton at about 9:30 PM.  I had originally planned on running in St Paul after my interview but the company took me out for all you can eat tacos for lunch so if I would have tried running an hour and a half later I probably would have puked.  When I got home I sat around talking to my family for awhile before I finally got going.  Not the greatest run of my life, just wanted to get it in and be done.

Ran to West and back then did strides on the street.  Legs aren't feeling as sharp as a few days ago but I'll be fine for tomorrow.  This race is more for fun than anything.  I want to at least break 26...anything more than that is a bonus.
Since I didn't really cool down this morning I decided to run again tonight to loosen the legs before I went to bed.  Still full from Thanksgiving dinner, which took place 6 hours before this run.

Ran 8 miles through downtown then did 4 '200s' on Brentwood Lane with jog back, then a little over a mile.  It was 50 degrees and felt like spring...great at the time but kind of depressing since winter hasn't even started yet.  Legs felt alright.  The fast stuff was into the wind which made it a little tougher.

Easy shakeout on the treadmill.  Plenty of sports on TV and the run went by quickly.  I've been getting a lot of sleep these past few days (except for Wednesday night) and I think it's making me more tired.  It'll be good to have recharged a bit though before these next three weeks since they'll be pretty intense (not just running wise).

Started at 11:45 and went to the Neenah/Menasha Y and back.  It was 50 degrees which seems crazy for this time of year.  Got rained on for the last 10 miles.  Winter is definitely starting late this year...hopefully that doesn't mean that it is going to extend into April.
Easy Xavier loop.  Legs are a little tired but I felt pretty good.
Rude awakening this morning after sleeping in all weekend

30 minute tempo on the Capital City Trail.  I was a little tired all day but I felt amazing on the tempo this afternoon.  Got locked into a great rhythm and just let it flow.  Negative split by about 20 seconds so it was consistent.  Finished with the usual 4 x 30 seconds at mile effort and then my legs felt great on the cool down.

Eagle Heights after class.  It was really windy, running across the terrace waves were splashing several feet onto the path.  Legs were feeling a bit tired but the rest of my body feels good.  Found out last night that I got a job offer at Cirdan...I'm still waiting to hear back from Travelers but either way I'll be heading back to the Twin Cities in January.

Ran at 7:15 after taking a much needed nap.  I was still really out of it when I woke up and probably could have slept several more hours.  I think all the sleep I got during the long weekend screwed me up a bit.  Felt ok on the run, not great.
I missed my class this morning because I was too tired to go.  Five weeks from now I won't have that option so I've got to get it together.  Went out at noon and did Picnic Point.

First indoor workout of the season and the goal was to shock the system a bit with some fast repeats.  I felt absolutely atrocious warming up and even while doing ballistics I thought I might not be able to break 1:40 on the 600.  Once the first interval started I felt really strong.  The only time I got tight was the last 100 meters of the last 400.  These were the fastest intervals I've done in years.  I can't get too excited but this workout indicates that my speed is coming along fine, and I know my aerobic strength is there, so I should be capable of running some good races this winter.
Sleep cycle still needs a fix

Arb 10 only about 3 hours after my morning run.  Felt good.  Ran in shorts on December 1, don't think I've ever done that before.  Saw the Badgers CC team and congratulated them on their nationals win.

Moderate fartlek on the Root River Trail in Lanesboro.  I made this workout pretty easy since I've already had two great workouts this week and don't want to overdo it.  I did two sets of 4-3-2-1 with 2 minutes in between every interval.  It was a solid, not killer effort.  First run of the year in my winter jacket.
Shakeout.  Felt great so I went further than planned.  I'm currently #1 on the top 20 but only because Erichsen isn't showing up for some reason.

Got up early and was out the door at around 8:20.  I did the same out and back long run that I did a couple of times this summer in Lanesboro, although I'm almost certain I went further this time before I turned around.  Didn't see a single other person the entire time; it was just me and some birds on the trail.  Lightly raining for the last 20 minutes.  My groin was bugging me for a little bit in the middle but other than that I felt strong.

Big snow storm in Minnesota last night so Aleta and I ended up spending the night in Northfield after looking at apartments in St Paul rather than driving back to Lanesboro.  Luckily I had thrown some running stuff in the car so I could run before we went back.  I did kind of a random route going out Jefferson and around the dirt roads out there.  There were a couple slippery spots but I went into the run with a good attitude so I didn't really mind it.  I was pretty hungry by the time I was done.
Got up at 6:15 and drove back to Madison.  Managed to squeeze in a short run before my class.  Felt better than I thought I would after driving.  Mile repeats tonight.

This wasn't the epic workout I was hoping for but it was still a good effort.  My comfort zone ends somewhere right around 5:00 pace, as the first 3 repeats were really easy and then the fourth one I could feel a noticeable difference.  Speeding up over 1 second per lap per repeat made it tougher I think.  The last one I was 5 seconds off pace at 1200 and was working really hard so I stopped.  It was a weak moment mentally; I wish I would have just gutted out two more laps even though the time would have been slower than planned.  Nonetheless I certainly couldn't have done this workout last winter and I don't know that I could have done it two years ago either as I don't think I would have been as relaxed on the first 3, so I'm making progress.  Just have to continue to do so.
Late first run.  Picnic Point.  On the way back I was gaining ground on some freshmen on the UW team.  They noticed me coming and turned off.
Standard 10 plus an add on mile.  Felt ok, just wish I hadn't done this so late.

5K tempo in 16:39, 4 x 400 in 68, 69, 69, 67
4 min rest after 5K, 2 min jog between 400s

This was a pretty low key workout.  The 5K was super easy.  400s were ok, they just felt a little fast.  Didn't really get any lactic acid, just tired legs.

Rumor is that USATF is going to significantly tighten the qualifying standards for the Olympic Trials Marathon in 2016.  I really hope this doesn't happen.  Running sub 2:19 seems doable to me in four years, although I know it will be difficult.  I can't see myself getting down to sub 2:15.

Easy run to St Paul Lutheran Church and back then some strides.  Legs felt awesome during the run, a little sluggish during the strides.  Still no snow in the 10 day forecast.  That's fine by me as long as it doesn't mean that we'll have snow on the ground into April.

3 mile warmup, 4 mile unstructured fartlek, 2 mile cooldown

First real cold day of the year...the temperature was in the single digits when I went out this evening.  The fartlek was good; I hit a variety of paces including a couple of 30 secondish sprints.  Felt pretty good other than my face getting cold.
Eagle Heights.  Hadn't had much to eat before I ran (at 2:30), but it wasn't a problem.  I feel fit.  I also did strides.
This run may or may not have been pointless.  Not sure.  Why, Ryan Braun, why?!?!?

Beautiful day!  44 degrees and sunny...definitely doesn't feel like December 11th.  I ran long on the Capital City Trail.  Ideally I would have done 17-18 but I wanted to be back to watch the start of the Packer game so I called it good at 16.  My legs were feeling a little tired but the run was great.  Weather like this can't help but energize a person.
Extended Picnic Point.  Didn't feel all that great.

Nice run on the lakeshore trails.  It wasn't quite as nice of a day as yesterday but it was once again shorts weather.  About six miles in I tripped on a root that I didn't see and got pretty dirty.  At the end I did eight strides.  Nice to get this run in before it got dark.

Arb 10 plus an extra mile.  Would have been nice to double this morning but I slept straight through my alarm.  I was tired all day so it might have been best to skip it anyways.  Unseasonably warm weather continues.

First 5K pace focused workout.  Nothing to write home about but not a bad effort considering my current state of sleep deprivation and stress.  Pacing was kind of erratic; only twice did I hit two consecutive 400s in the same time.  None of the individual 400s felt too hard but by the end of the workout I was tired.  Tried to keep the jogs around 7:00 - 7:10 pace.
Ran in the arb.  Legs were tired.  Had some bad luck with the lights on the way back and was ready to be done.

I was up until 4 last night doing a take home test, then spent the day doing other things.  This evening I was going to force in a run but really didn't want to so I ended up just saying screw it and taking the day off.  Means my mileage will suck this week since I won't get much in on Sunday with graduation, but oh well.
Back on the horse.  There was an inch or two of snow on the ground.

Worked out at the shell because it snowed last night and the sidewalks were too icy to tempo effectively outside.  2 x 2 miles with 2 minutes rest in 10:20 (5:13/5:07) and 10:24 (5:11/5:13).  On the first one I started off slow then picked it up and kept it going.  The second one the pacing was sloppier.  My first 200 was 36, then I slowed down a little too much, then I got on it.  Running clockwise felt very unnatural.  Finished with 5 x 150m at probably 29 second 200 pace,  Tried to focus on running on my toes and moving fast.  It's kind of cool that I can now run faster than my high school 2 mile PR twice and have it be a threshold workout.

Today was graduation so I wasn't able to get around to running until the evening.  It's been a long week (still have one day of finals left) and I was tired so I almost took another day off but eventually told myself to man up and go out and do Standard 10.  Legs didn't feel very good for the first two miles but then I felt ok from there.

Ran this afternoon after my LAST FINAL EVER.  I went down past Vilas Park then over to Olin Park then turned around and came back.  Tired before starting but felt good while I was out there.  On the way back through Vilas Park it was pitch dark and I narrowly avoided spraining my ankle a couple times.  Strides afterward.
Picnic Point.  The construction at the top of the trail is done so I walked around for a minute to admire it.  Last time I'll be on this trail for quite a while.
I set out planning to run 10 but by the time I got to the 2 mile mark I knew I wouldn't make it because of lack of fuel, so I ended up cutting the run in half.  Poor planning today.  Shoot.
First run.  I was feeling really motivated after watching the Chris Erichsen video on Flotrack.

Solid workout tonight.  On the warmup I felt kind of similar to last night and thought that I might need to do this on Friday instead but once I started things went well.  The 2nd 800 I screwed myself with a 37 on the second 200, but other than that they were good.  The 400s were nice and smooth, and I thought it was funny that the hundredths on the first 3 were so close.  The 200s felt much better than 200s at this pace did last winter, and on the last one I was able to crank out a 29.0 without trouble.  Kept the recovery jogs honest and didn't dilly dally between intervals.  I honestly think I'm only one or two tuneup races away from being able to PR in any event.

Last run from my apartment in Madison.  Fittingly it was Standard 10.  For the most part I felt pretty sluggish.  It's weird to think that I'll never run this route again after doing it so many times over the past 16 months.  Madison is a good city and treated me well...I'll miss it.
Shakeout at home.  I'm tired.

Accidentally woke up at 11 today, so everything was a little rushed.  I did a 5 mile tempo outside.  Didn't time it because I knew the time would be discouraging with the icy sidewalks and cold wind that I had to fight.  Definitely a slower pace than what I've been doing, but with tempos the effort is really what matters and that was there.  Finished with 3 long strides...did them the opposite direction than usual so that I could run with the wind.  Legs feel ok.

Double on the treadmill.  I was told in no uncertain terms that I needed to get off the treadmill at 5:10 so that my family could go to a Christmas party, so had to cut the run a half mile short.  Didn't feel too bad even though I only had 3 hours rest after my first run.  My left hamstring is a little tight so I'll have to keep an eye on that.
Longest treadmill run ever.  It actually wasn't too bad since there was football on.
