Xavier with an add on in the middle to make it 11.  Felt just ok.

Ran the downtown loop that for some reason I've gotten in the habit of doing on Mondays when I'm in Appleton (which there's been about 5 of in the past year).  Weather was nice and I wore shorts but my legs were feeling dead.  Time to go buy some more iron pills.

Easy treadmill run.  Legs felt pretty good while running (as they should when I'm only going 7 minute pace and am on a treadmill) but they're dead now.  Tomorrow's workout will be a gametime decision.
Tried to start fixing my sleep cycle in preparation for starting work next Thursday but I fell back asleep.  Maybe tomorrow I'll be more successful.

Good fartlek.  1 x 5:00 (2:00), 2 x 3:00 (2:00), 3 x 2:00 (1:00), 4 x 1:00 (1:00).  The first interval was into the wind and my arms got flooded with lactic acid.  After that I got faster but it wasn't as difficult since the wind was either a crosswind or tailwind.  Considering that yesterday I didn't know if I'd even be able to work out at all today I'm pleased with the effort.
Nice run through Kimberly.  Legs feeling much better.  While I was running down Kimberly Ave a church's bell rang 43 times.  Not sure what it was for since there were hardly any cars in the lot.
Treadmill double.  Hamstring was bothering me at points.

The first two intervals felt a little harder than I would have liked but that's fine.  The hills weren't bad...I think knowing that I only had to do 6 made them seem easier.  On the last interval my goal was to get out fast and feel the lactic acid and that definitely happened; for about the last 40 seconds the bear was on my back and I had to fight through it.  This should help me be more prepared for racing.
Early morning East South River.  I had a bad headache last night and this morning my legs were dead.  Glad this is it for the day.

Ran with Pez around some lakes in Minneapolis before I moved my stuff into my new apartment.  The first 20 minutes or so we were probably running a little under 6 minute pace for no real reason, then we slowed down.  Good to see him.

That's it for 2011.  I'm not going to bother with a 'year in review' other than acknowledging that racing wise it was not a good year.  However, since starting up again in mid July after my injuries finally healed I've realized that I really do enjoy running and I've been able to make it a positive in my life rather than being stressed and obsessive about it.  2012 will be an interesting and exciting year in my life.  Hopefully some fast races will be part of that.

I was going to double this morning but I laid in bed for too long and then had to get going in order to make it to Green Bay to tailgate. After I got home from the Packer game I got on the treadmill and watched the last bit of the late games. I did 4 x 5 minute cruise intervals. Not a big fan of trying to do workouts on a treadmill; I sweat like crazy.

Didn't want to miss any football so I treadmilled it again. Felt good until the last 15 minutes when I started getting really hungry. Timing wise this worked out well because I finished pretty much right as the first couple bowl games were all ending.

Ran with the Run N Fun guys for the first time. There was a huge group including a couple familiar faces, and I had fun. We ran down by the river and then came back up Summit. The only bad thing was it was extremely icy.

***INTERVAL***
Warm-up: 
Set...Reps...Distance/Time...Goal...Actual...Rep rest...Set rest
1.........3.....1 Mile....____....5:00....2:00 jog....____
2.........4.....40 Seconds....____....Hard Stride....1:20 jog....____
Cool-down: 

I did the mile repeats on the treadmill and everything else outside. It was still really icy and I couldn't find a place to do the miles (doesn't help that I don't really have any idea where to run here yet). I was a little surprised how easy they were. The treadmill only went up to 12 miles per hour, otherwise I would have liked to do some faster repeats. The 40 second intervals felt terrible. I can't go almost a week without doing any strides. It's supposed to be pretty warm for the next couple days so hopefully the ice will melt.
First day at Cirdan. Did a morning run before I went to work. I never got into a deep sleep last night and kept waking up, so I was a bit tired.

Ran along the river. On the way back I got a little bit turned around and ended up coming back on Snelling, which has an extremely long, winding downhill. Legs felt really good but I had to stop to pee 3 times. Did a good set of strides afterward. The warmer weather today got rid of a lot of the ice.

Short morning run. I realized after waking up that I didn't actually need to run this morning to hit my goal mileage for the week but decided that since I was already awake I might as well get a little something in.

***INTERVAL***
Warm-up: 
Set...Reps...Distance/Time...Goal...Actual...Rep rest...Set rest
1.........16.....1 Minute....5K Effort....____....1:00 jog....____
Cool-down: 

Did this workout on the path along the river. I was tired going in from lack of sleep (not adjusted to my new schedule yet) and my legs didn't feel snappy. The last 5 or 6 were a bit tough but I got through. This 'winter' weather is awesome...the only other times I've run outside in shorts in January were when I was in the Caribbean 4 years ago.

Ran at 10 with Phil and Nick. We went around St Paul. Felt a little tired starting out but by about 20 minutes in I was good to go. It was fun to run with these guys and we had a good conversation the whole way. Phil stopped at about 77 minutes and Nick and I finished up, then I stayed at Nick's house for about 2 hours talking and eating pizza.

Too tired to run before church so I did my first run at about 1:30. It was once again warm enough for shorts. Felt good other than some GI distress with 10 minutes left. Afi died a year ago today. Still miss him.
Ran again after the Broncos game ended. I felt pretty bad, glad it was only 5 miles. Also did strides.

***INTERVAL***
Warm-up: 
Set...Reps...Distance/Time...Goal...Actual...Rep rest...Set rest
1.........6.....3 Minutes....Hard....____....2:00....____
Cool-down: 

I started the warmup just after 6 AM. This was the first time I've ever done a workout in the morning and had it be dark all the way through. I did the workout on Shepard Road. For a little while in the middle it felt like this was some form of masochism that I was subjecting myself to, but by the last two I was feeling a little better. At least it was warm enough for shorts; it's so much easier to run fast in shorts versus tights.
I got out of work 30 minutes early so I managed to squeeze in another run before going to Aleta's birthday dinner. It was still somewhat light out for the first half so that was nice.

Took a break at 10:30 AM and went for a run. The path down by the river was really nice and after about 15 minutes it starts to wind through some woods. 40 degrees again. It was great to run in the later part of the morning but I probably won't do this very often...don't want to just disappear for over an hour on a regular basis.

Despite getting out of work late it was way too nice out to not double. I did an out and back on Shepard Road to the Ford building. Felt ok; a little tired but after a long day at work that's expected.
Well the nice weather was great while it lasted, but winter's back now. I did kind of a random route that took 70 minutes so I'll call it 10. Legs felt solid, face froze. Strides afterward.
Dead this morning. Not a very fun run.

4 x 2:00 (1:00), 12 x 0:30 (1:00). The workout went well but it was one of the most uncomfortable ones I've ever done because it was so cold. Running by the river the wind chill was well below 0. I only did a 1 mile cooldown because I just wanted to get back inside. At least my legs felt good.
Ran from work at around 12:30. It was cold again but not quite as bad as yesterday. Felt good; it's always nice to just run 8 miles and call it a day.

3 mile warmup, 4 mile tempo, 2 mile cooldown, 4 strides. Ran over to Pierce Park and back through downtown Appleton. Other than getting caught at a few lights it was a good run. Exciting trials race this morning...hopefully 4 years from now I'll be in it!

Tried to go for a night run at 9:30 but the huge dinner I ate wasn't sitting well so I hung it up early. Got a shakeout and stretch in and I'll still be over my mileage goal for this week so it's all good.
Ran all around Appleton. Saw the busses in front of the Radisson getting ready to take the Giants up to the game. For the most part I felt pretty good. Now off to Lambeau; Go Pack!

Ran on a treadmill during lunch. Unfortunaely the sound on the TVs was turned off so it was kind of boring. I had a bad headache at the end of the day so I ended up not running again. Hopefully I can avoid the temptation to chase the lost miles.
Easy shakeout. I got a lot of sleep last night and felt better this morning. Workout tonight, location still TBD.

***INTERVAL***
Warm-up: 
Set...Reps...Distance/Time...Goal...Actual...Rep rest...Set rest
1.........4.....1000 Meters....____....2:55, 2:56, 2:58, 2:22 (800)....2:00 jog....____
2.........4.....300 Meters....____....46, 47, 47, 47....1:15 jog....____
Cool-down: 

I drove down to St Olaf to do this workout since there aren't any indoor tracks in the Twin Cities that I can get on. The 1000s didn't go very well. I've got plenty of possible excuses for why, but I was definitely working harder than I anticipated. The 300s actually felt fairly good. Despite not having a great workout I'm glad I got something in on a track before Saturday's race. No idea what I'll run...the way my training had been going I thought I had a chance at a PR but based on this week so far I'll be lucky to break 8:50. I guess we'll see what Saturday brings.

Easy run to the Ford building and back. The temperature has been dropping fast all evening and tomorrow it's supposed to be bitter cold. There was also a dusting of snow on the path. Felt better than the past two days.
Just shaking out the legs. Figured it might help me feel better.

8 was all I had in me tonight. On the treadmill because it was too cold to go outside. Didn't feel very good, but afterwards I did some sprints down the long hallway in my building (sort of Rupp/Webb style) and after those my legs felt a lot better.

I was squeezed for time since I got out of work half an hour late and was going to the Gopher hockey game. The path had about an inch of snow on it so things were a little slow going. I don't really want to race tomorrow anymore (things just haven't felt 'right' this whole week), but I found out this afternoon that Plasencia called Lundin to ask if he should let me into the meet so I'll run in order to not make Phil look bad. It'll be ok.

***RACE***
Race Name: Jack Johnson Classic
Terrain: Track (Indoor)
Warm Up: 5 (1.5 AM, 3.5 before race)
Race Splits: 4:36
Cool Down: 5

Not an exceptional performance but I am ok with this. I ran faster than last year (second fastest time ever) and considering that yesterday I didn't even want to run this race it was a good effort. Got out hard...just let the front guys go and I ran with the second pack. I was running well through the mile but then threw in a couple 36+ second laps that really hurt my time. With some more workouts and another race or two under my belt I'll be more ready to ride the red line. I feel like I'm close to a breakthrough; just have to stay on course and keep believing. It was a fun meet to be at with several jaw dropping performances (Sathre 8:07, Harun Abda 1:16.3, Mike Hutton 1:50.9).

Didn't feel like running today but managed to get a decent run in this afternoon. The path was a bit slippery and it looks like there's more freezing rain/snow on the way so it's not going to get better in the near future. I felt alright; legs aren't tired but mentally I'm not real engaged right now.

7 AM run on the treadmill in my building's fitness center. It looks like between the weather right now and going to Lanesboro for the weekend over half of my miles this week are going to be on the mill (or as Nick Ross calls it, 'the hampster wheel'). Hopefully my motivation will be there to actually get the runs in.

I was feeling ambitious tonight so I went for another 9 miler. Ran the opposite way (towards downtown) on Shepard Road than what I usually do. The path was pretty sloppy and at times I was running on about an inch of snow, but I just relaxed and didn't fight it. Legs felt good the whole time.

Before going to Run N Fun I did a short warmup jog and then a set of strides. At Run N Fun we did the Lilydale route. The sidewalks were terrible and the pace got a bit too intense for me so I dropped off the front guys and ran with Nick, Phil, and some others. Legs didn't feel very good. Considering my lack of sleep last night, poor eating the past 24 hours, and 18 miles yesterday I'm not surprised. Finished the evening with a PBR in the store.

Easy morning run. For the sixth straight day I woke up with a sore throat. I don't have any other symptoms (yet) and it's not getting worse, so at this point it's just an inconvenience. Felt a little tired, but ok.

Woah, the path on Shepard Road was clear! After the past two evenings I was expecting things to be sloppy for tonight's workout, but was pleasantly surprised to find that the path had been totally cleared off. I did a Griff style fartlek...1 x 5:00 (2:00), 2 x 3:00 (2:00), 4 x 2:00 (1:00), 2 x 1:00 (1:00). Worked hard and got a good effort in but didn't kill myself. I still felt a little sluggish on the warmup but once I started the intervals my legs felt good. There were a lot of runners out tonight.
Ran
Ran again. Pretty much the same route as last night. Didn't feel very good; looks like I am getting sick after all.

***INTERVAL***
Warm-up: 
Set...Reps...Distance/Time...Goal...Actual...Rep rest...Set rest
1.........7.....50 Seconds....Mile Effort....____....1:00....____
Cool-down: 

The goal for this workout was to simulate 300s at mile pace. It took me a long time to get going after I got out of bed. I've definitely got a cold. Looking back I should have taken more than 1 minute of rest between intervals as that would have allowed me to get in a few more and not feel quite so pressed. Still an ok effort.
Double from work before leaving. It felt good to get a second run in.

Ran 45 minutes on a treadmill in the Lanesboro fitness center. There is literally nowhere to run outside here in the winter. Aleta came and worked out at the same time. I felt ok but was glad to have a short day.

The plan was to run for 90 minutes but at 10 miles I had to get off the treadmill because the place we were going to go for dinner closed at 7:30 instead of 8:00 like we originally thought. I was getting pretty bored anyways but it would have been nice to get the full run in. Despite the monotony I felt good.

I decided to get a few more miles in after driving back up to St Paul. Also did a few strides. No long run for the second week in a row but I suppose that it's not a big deal since I'm not doing any long races for a couple months still. My cold is getting better so that's nice. After the run I looked up a bunch of results from this weekend's meets. Seems like everybody is the NCAA has come out with guns blazing this winter.

Didn't sleep well last night (too much sleep this weekend), but forced myself out of bed for the run. There was a dusting of snow on the path. Hammered a bit because I was pushed for time and wanted to get 6 in.

Walking out of work my legs felt so dead that I didn't know if I should even run tonight, but once I started out I ended up feeling really good. I bumped into Brian Anderson on the path by the river and ran with him for about 10 minutes. Strides at the end.

***INTERVAL***
Warm-up: 
Set...Reps...Distance/Time...Goal...Actual...Rep rest...Set rest
1.........6.....2.5 Minutes....3K - 5K Effort....____....2:00....____
Cool-down: 

I did this at about 11:30 on the downtown St Paul section of the path by the river. Felt horrible; I think mostly it was just the effects of being sick but I also think I might have started each interval too fast and then paid for it. It will be nice when I can do this stuff on a track. The weather was amazing (40s and sunny) so I was disappointed because it was a perfect day to really rip a workout and I couldn't take advantage of it. I'm glad I'm taking tonight off as I rarely ever get a weekday evening with no running.

I got a decent amount of sleep last night but still felt pretty tired this morning. Got a good stretch in after the run and elevated my legs for a few minutes. I just have to make it through tonight's short tempo run and then the next two days are easy.

20 minute tempo, then 4 x 30 seconds strides. Ran on the Shepard Road path. I felt a ton better today than I did during yesterday's workout...although tempos are easier and are one of my strengths whereas yesterday targeted a weakness (VO2). My cold is pretty much gone. It's looking like a pretty good field for Saturday's 3K so I'm getting excited for it!
There was a pretty dense fog this morning. I was tired waking up but my legs felt good.

Easy out and back seven. I went up St Paul Ave to Cleveland, then down to the Ford building, then a few minutes along the river until it was time to flip. My legs felt good, but I hit the snacks hard after work so my stomach was a bit uncomfortable. The groundhog saw his shadow today...I would be fine with six more weeks of this type of winter.
Easy pre race run and strides...usual route on Shepard Road. The strides felt super good; hopefully this feeling will continue to tomorrow. Time to fly.

***RACE***
Race Name: Bethel Invite
Terrain: Track (Indoor)
Warm Up: 6ish (2+ AM, 3.5 before race)
Race Splits: 2:52, 3:00, 3:06
Cool Down: 3ish
Overall Place: 7th

I produced another one of my typical races that has been the story of my past 2 years of running. We started off hitting 34s which was what I was hoping for. I felt fine through 1K but by halfway I was in trouble and then the last 1200 or so I totally fell apart. I took out some frustration on the last lap and JV kicked a Hamline guy. Even dealing with some sickness the past 10 days there's no way I should run this slow, and it's especially baffling because of how good my legs have felt the past few days. Even on the warmup I felt great and like I was ready to rock. I'm not sure where my running will go from here. I can't keep doing this to myself. Either I need to figure out how to run a race again or it's time to be done.

Long run by myself along the river. It was probably a little longer than 15 since I ran for 1:39 with my last 20 minutes below 6 minute pace and I don't think I started much slower than 6:40s. Felt fine the whole way. I'm still frustrated with my race and have decided I have 3 options.

A) Write yesterday off as an aberration, stick with the plan I had, and run the Snowshoe 3K in 2 weeks
B) Continue with a regular training load but forget about Snowshoe and just focus on this spring's races
C) Take some time off

I told myself last night that if I ran this morning I'd get McDonalds breakfast on my way to work. My legs were stiff starting out but by 10 minutes I had loosened up. As is the usual for Sunday nights it took me forever to fall asleep so I was still a bit tired.

It was a long day at work so I didn't end up getting to run until about 8:30. Ran towards downtown. The way out was into the wind but mostly downhill then the way back was more uphill but with the wind at my back. Negative split by a minute and a half. I felt pretty good tonight.
Slow morning run.  Need more sleep.

Same workout idea as last week but a longer version.  I did a 24 minute tempo then 6 x 30 seconds fast.  I felt good and strong the whole way on the tempo; visualized myself needing to dig in the last 2 miles of a 10K.  On the strides my legs were feeling a little tired and by the end I was sucking some wind.  It was colder out this evening.

I decided I'm not running Snowshoe.  I'd like to have another chance at a PR but without having done track work I'm not really in shape for a great 3K and after last Saturday I'm not excited about the idea of another race.  I had originally planned a down week for after next weekend, but since Aleta is visiting for a week starting tomorrow I'm going to go ahead and take it now.  I'll get a second workout in later this week and a long run on Sunday but the other days will be pretty light.

Ran from work at noon.  I was going to do it this morning but I was way too tired when my alarm went off so I decided to go into work early and run later.  It was nice to go when it was sunny out.  Legs felt DEAD.
Rest day.  I just did an easy 5 during lunch.  Legs felt quite a bit better than yesterday.  It's so nice to run when it's sunny out rather than in the dark.

Day off from work today.  I did my workout in the late morning.  2 x 4:00 (2:00), 2 x 3:00 (2:00), 3 x 2:00 (1:00), 2 x 1:00 (1:00).  It was real cold (-11 wind chill).  The first two intervals into the wind were terrible and my face hurt so bad I felt like I was going to cry.  Once I turned around and had the wind at my back things were better.  I felt decent on the 3 minute intervals and then pretty good on the 2s and 1s.  It took a while to warm back up after I got back inside.  Glad I got it in, as after the warmup I was strongly considering just running back to my apartment and calling it a day.

Easy 7...repeated the route I did last week going up to Cleveland and down Ford Parkway.  It was cold but not quite as bad as yesterday.  With the wind at my back I negative split by a minute on the return.  Legs felt good.  Two nights in a row of great sleep helped me a lot.

Same run as last Sunday.  It was warmer than the past two days which was much welcome.  I felt pretty lethargic and sluggish for the first half.  I'm thinking it was because I laid around for most of the afternoon before running.  Tried to keep it as just a normal run and avoided hammering the last couple miles.

Monday morning run from my apartment to downtown and back.  Dark when I started, light when I finished.  My legs were trashed last night but this morning they felt good.  Hopefully I'll squeeze a double in later.

Pounded a six miler before going out to eat with Aleta.  After turning around I did 6 x 30 seconds fast to get the legs going a little bit.  It was snowing but at this point there was less than a half inch of accumulation so basically all it did was provide some cushioning.
Easy run at lunch.  Felt ok.
Short shakeout.  Went by quickly.
1 x 5:00 (2:00), 6 x 1:00 (1:00), 4 x 15 seconds sprint.  Short workout so it wasn't much of a test but I felt fast and fit.  Maybe I can salvage a decent time on Saturday.
Tired this morning.  Didn't sleep real well last night.

We had a happy hour after work today to welcome a new employee.  I limited myself to one beer so that I could still get a run in.  Ran kind of slow this evening.  My legs feel weird, it's like my thighs are swollen.  I think it's from sitting at a desk all day.
Easy run during lunch.  Felt sluggish so I decided there wasn't much point in going further.

Same Sunday long run I've done the past couple weeks.  My legs felt fine for most of the run but at the end they were tired.  Beautiful weather; only needed one long sleeve and no hat.  At around 75 minutes I bumped into Marc Ellingson so I talked with him for a minute.

As is the usual for Monday morning I woke up tired.  About a mile into my run I started feeling great though.  Decided to do the longer run for the day this morning since the weather's supposed to be bad later today.  I threw in 4 x 30 seconds fast in the second to last mile and then did two strides at the end.

It was snowing this evening.  Footing wasn't a problem but the snow was hitting me in the face which wasn't very comfortable.  Since I haven't had to deal with these conditions very much this winter I was ok with it.  Legs felt ok.

5 x 5:00 cruise intervals along the river downtown with 1:00 rest.  It was pretty windy.  Odd ones were with the wind, even ones were into it.  Aerobically I felt really strong the whole way.  Legs held up for all five intervals then got a little heavy on the cooldown.
Pretty dead this morning
Nine easy miles.  Felt better at the end than at the beginning.

Skipped the morning run today because I was so dead when I woke up that I don't think I could have run a sub 8 minute mile.  This evening I felt a lot better and got a good 11 miler in.  Went over to St Thomas and up Summit Ave.

With my schedule for today it worked out best to tempo in the morning rather than waiting.  On the warmup and cooldown my legs felt really heavy and stiff but during the actual tempo they weren't that bad.  24 minutes.  My pace was a little slower.  First mile was 5:30 and I averaged basically the same pace the entire time.  I guess that's just what tempo pace was this morning.
Easy shakeout at the end of the work day.  Threw in some strides in the last 10 minutes.  My legs felt a good bit better than this morning.
Medium long run in Lanesboro.  The bike path was about 75% clear so I could run outside rather than on the treadmill.  Felt pretty good the whole time.
Aleta biked with me for the first 8 miles.  It was 44 degrees but there were 25-30 mile per hour winds.  Felt solid.
I decided to run again tonight when I got back to the cities rather than getting up to run tomorrow morning.  Four strides afterward.  I was tired by the end.

I wanted to do repeat 800s tonight but the outdoor tracks in the cities aren't clear so I did this on the River Road.  Went a ton better than the last time I did this workout four weeks ago.  I was working hard on the last few intervals but never doubted that I could finish the workout.  The last one was up a hill so that's why it was shorter (first six were back and forth on the path, then I started for home).  My body feels a ton better after a week of iron.

I was originally planning on doing a 16-17 miler this evening, but we're supposed to be getting freezing rain and snow all day so I decided to get the run in before that stuff hits.  Since I started this run less than 10 hours after finishing last night's workout I also decided to keep it to 15.  It was lightly snowing but there was no real accumulation yet.  Felt good through about 11 then my hips started to get sore.  Bumped into Michaela at around the midway point.
Ran inside.  Lots of snow and ice, first (only?) really bad drive to work of the winter.
Ran over to St Thomas and back.  Sidewalks were pretty sloppy.  Legs felt pretty good, but I was running slow and had only done 5 miles in the previous 36 hours.
I was tired when my alarm went off but once I actually got out of bed I felt fine.

I slipped out of work a little early and was able to get my warmup and the whole tempo in before it got dark.  28 minutes.  Out in 5:20 pace and back at like 5:12 pace and felt really strong.  My turn around was in the middle of a downhill which broke my rhythm a bit, but I got going again with no problem.  Finished up with 4 x 30 seconds fast and then a cooldown.  This workout reminded me of how I used to feel back in 2009/early 2010.  Maybe I can get back to that this spring.
Run #1 at noon.  Felt a little tired.  Need to catch up on sleep this weekend.

Ran with Schwock and Adrian between the 5K and mile at MIACs.  We just went around the neighborhoods by Macalester.  Sidewalks were pretty icy.  We made a Chipotle stop on the way back.  Felt like old times, minus Rivers and Jean Claude.

Accidental long run.  I was intending to do 90 minutes but decided to run in an area I've never been in before and ended up getting lost.  I stopped to ask for directions at one point but was sent the wrong way.  After quite a bit of wandering I finally got things straightened out.  3 extra miles shouldn't do any damage; I'll just take tomorrow a little easier.
Ran this morning before church.  My legs felt fine but I feel a little sick.
Capped the second run at 7 in hopes that I will be healthier for tomorrow's workout.  The main purpose of running again was to get some strides in; otherwise I probably would have just skipped it.
Monday morning.  Still feeling less than 100%.  We'll see if I try to warrior through the workout later today or if I push it back.  Hopefully I'll be able to do it.

30 minute warmup
6 x Ford Hill with jog down recovery
3 x 2:00 hard with 1:00 jog recovery
4 x 1:00 hard with 1:00 jog recovery
15 minute cooldown

Combined some hills and fartlek tonight.  It was a good hard effort and the changes made it a little more enjoyable.  My legs felt great after the easy day yesterday but unfortunately I'm still sick.  For some reason I get sick more than anyone else I know...this is my third time since November.  Still have 13 days until I race so I'm not concerned yet.

Day off.  Felt like shit and had a 102 degree fever and cough.  Didn't go to work and just slept all day.  I wish I could have run since it was 57 degrees this afternoon.  Hopefully I'll feel better tomorrow.

Day off #2 with the plague.  Half the people at my company have now gotten this over the course of the past week.  Fortunately I'm feeling better and didn't have a fever at all today.  Was thinking about going for a short run but ended up deciding I'd be better off taking another day to let my cough get better and then getting back into it tomorrow.

Trying to get back into it.  30 mile per hour winds and a bad sideache made for a fairly miserable run.  I still have a cough, but running didn't make it any worse.  Hopefully things will go up from here.

I didn't start running until 8:00 because I watched the second half and OT of the Gophers basketball game after work.  Other than my stomach which still feels bloated (I think from the antibiotics I'm taking) I felt pretty good.  Coughed more than I would like after finishing, so I'll have to keep an eye on it and make sure I'm not hurting myself.

3 x 5:00 cruise intervals, 1:00 in between.  I originally had this workout scheduled for Thursday with six intervals but had to slide it back.  I was hoping I would be able to do four intervals today but after the first one I decided that three would be a better decision.  I'm not sure what my pace was since I used a different course.  The last time I did cruise intervals I was running 5:00-5:10 but there's no way I was that fast today.  Probably closer to 5:15-5:20.  My cough is getting better (although still present), but mainly I just felt really weak and out of gas.  After the last one I just wanted to lie down and sleep.  I haven't had much of an appetite all week so that's probably why.  Hopefully I'll be feeling stronger for Tuesday's workout.  It was nice to run in shorts and a t shirt.  66 degrees!

After the run I watched the D3 national 5K and saw Tim Nelson absolutely kill it. He blasted away from the pack with 1200 left and ran a 2:42 last 1000 to win in 14:11.  It took 14:28 to make All American which is crazy.  Then I looked at Adrian's and Jack's logs and saw that they both went 20 today.  Nothing like following up a less than stellar workout by getting further demoralized by everyone else's great efforts.  I've got 8 days to get ready for Human Race.
Ran after the ACC Championship ended.  Felt pretty good the first half and was rolling 6:20s.  The second half I was tired.  I need to put weight back on.

Monday morning.  Ran 10 in the rain before work.  It was dark thanks to daylight savings, but I'll gladly trade light in the morning to have it be light when I get out of work.  This was the best run I've had in a week, so that's encouraging.  I won't have time to run again today, but it's probably best to keep building back up slowly.
Short easy run to prime the legs for tonight's workout

I have mixed feelings about this workout.  I was hoping to hit about 3:00 and I was a bit off of that, but I didn't fall off badly and I'm definitely not back to 100% with my breathing yet so it wasn't terrible.  I ran at Macalester and it was great to work out on the outdoor track.  I got mixed up about where some streets actually were, hence the long warmup.  If I can get a workout like this in every week I think I'll improve quite a bit in 4-6 weeks.
I was tired this morning, but it was great weather for a morning run!

Ran up the St Thomas hill.  On the way back I got chased down the hill by a little girl as her mom yelled from behind for her to come back.  Daylight savings time is great; I started this run at 6:50 and had at least some light until the last 2 miles.  I felt tired most of the day but ended up feeling good on the run.
Slow morning run.  Less tired today.

22 minute tempo.  5:26 pace on the way out, then came back slightly faster.  Felt in control...I was getting tired the last few minutes but never red lining.  Great weather.  This is the last tempo I'll be doing for a while.  My threshold is where I need/want it to be; now I need to focus on doing race specific workouts.
Ran from work at the end of the day.  I was hoping to run during lunch but a couple things came up which prevented that.  It was kind of humid; you'd never know it's March.  I felt pretty good.

2 mile morning shakeout just to loosen up the legs a little bit.  Pre race run in the afternoon.  First shirtless run of the year as it's 80 degrees.  I had an uncomfortable stomach ache for most of the run.  Did a few strides afterward as some people celebrating St Patrick's Day watched me from their lawn.  Spring racing season starts tomorrow.  This is what I've been pointing for essentially since August.  Here we go!

Easy morning run.  I intentionally kept the pace pretty slow but didn't really feel all that beat up from yesterday.  I need to start decreasing the amount of time that passes between when my alarm first goes off and when I step outside.
Shortly after the turnaround on this run the skies opened up and I got poured on.  Other than my quads being sore I felt good.  Did a light set of core afterward.

Went to the Run N Fun run for the first time in awhile.  We did the Lilydale route.  The group split up pretty quickly and I ended up running 10 miles in just about an hour with Limpf, Boumeester, and another guy.  This was the first time I've ever really talked to Boumeester despite being in the same conference for three years.  My legs and breathing felt fine but my stomach was terrible the second half.  It's been sore pretty much since Sunday's race.  The last five minutes or so I dropped back a few steps because I was cramping.  I was planning to do strides at the end but ended up scrapping them.
Once again I laid in bed for 20+ minutes before finally getting up to run.  Felt fine once I got out there; I'm just generally tired.

Not a confidence boosting workout.  My legs were dead pretty much from the first 1000 on.  Lesson learned: pounding a 10 miler the night before a workout is not a good idea, especially if you also still have a race in your legs.  I also need to try a different eating strategy on workout days, as eating lunch at 12:30 and then starting the workout at 7 is hardly optimal.  I'm just running easy now until Shamrock, so hopefully my legs will come around.
Very relaxed morning run.  I doubt a single mile of it was under 7:00.  Felt better at the end than at the start.

I got home from work at 5:30 and within 5 minutes was out the door so that I could be back for the start of the Badger game.  It was sprinkling pretty much the whole time.  My legs felt a little better than this morning but the last mile I was getting a little light headed becaue I was really hungry.  Thank you Potbelly's worker who put mayonaise on my sandwich at lunch.

Ran on the paths in the woods in Crosby Farms Park.  It was nice (although I wish they were dirt instead of asphalt) and I think I will run here more often.  Finished up on Shepard Road.  I felt ok...ran pretty easy though.  The Chipotle I ate at lunch caused some distress about halfway through.

Ran along the river in Chicago and ended at the expo for tomorrow's race.  Six of us started together but I ran primarily with Metz and Limpf.  It was cool to see part of Chicago.  We did a few strides at the end behind the Navy Pier.  For most of the run I felt pretty blah, but the last 10 minutes I started feeling good.

Easy morning run to loosen up the legs.  I thought I would sleep like a rock last night after the race and travel but I ended up not sleeping very well, then I thought I would feel like crap on the run but ended up feeling pretty good.  Who knows.

Easy out and back towards downtown.  I ran on the grass on the side of the path for probably 75% of the run which was nice.  It was 40 degrees, windy, and rainy, so about what you'd usually expect for this time of year.  Felt good.
The weekend hit me this morning as I was dead tired waking up.  I actually enjoyed the run once I got going on it as it was a nice morning.  Strides afterward.
Ran down Highland to the river and then back up Summit with the Run N Fun group.  It was super windy out.  Felt ok, glad we didn't hammer.
Needed an extra hour of sleep this morning so I just did a quick shakeout during lunch

Ran with Adrian at Macalester.  This workout was a lot harder than I thought it would be.  I never felt fast and after about six I was tired.  I think doing it as a continuous run with no walking made it more difficult.  I'm glad Adrian was doing it with me as there's no way I would have finished alone.  I'm starting to think I'm just not in as good of shape as I thought I was/would like to be in.  I've got four weeks to see how much I can change that.  Also, this was the first interval workout I've done with somebody in about 2.5 years.  Weird.
Legs felt fine, but if I don't start sleeping better by the end of this weekend I'm going to take a day off next week.

Long day at work.  I ran to the St Thomas hill and it got dark about halfway through.  Somehow two couple different times on the way back I thought I was about a mile ahead of where I actually was on the route.  Legs felt strange for the first two miles, then I started feeling good.

I got out of work just before 6 and went straight to Macalester.  The St Olaf and Mac women's lacrosse teams were warming up for a game on the infield.  Splits on the opening 3200 were 75, 76, 76, 74, 76, 76, 76, 73.  It didn't feel that hard.  On the 800s I felt decent and was recovering well in between but couldn't speed up.  Threw in the 150s at the end to try to work on some extra gears.

Long run in Lanesboro.  The run was an out and back and the last 10-12 minutes of the out leg were uphill.  Not real steep, but I could tell that I was climbing.  I felt good and probably could have gone another 4-5 miles without a problem.  That wouldn't have been a good idea though with my goal race being in less than a month.  Nice long run weather (50 and cloudy), nice to get a long run in again.
Ran out and back from Lanesboro to Whalen with Aleta on the bike.  Legs didn't feel too bad after yesterday's long run.  I negative split by a minute on the return.

Short run when I got back to St Paul to finish off a good week of training.  I essentially did tomorrow's morning run this evening.  Legs a little tired since my two runs were only 4 hours apart and I drove 110 miles in between, but got through just fine.

Solo workout.  The temperature was nice; there was some wind on the second curve but only like 10 mph.  I still feel like I'm spinning my wheels pretty quick to run a 3:00 K, but this is notable improvement from the 1000s workout that I did 3 weeks ago.  I was recovering with no problem in between intervals.  Tired at the end of the workout but not trashed.  I originally was planning on waiting until the 13th or 14th to race again, but there's going to be a stacked 5K on Friday at Hamline so I'm going to get in on it.  I'll take 3 pretty easy days and then hopefully ride the train to a fast time.
Felt good.  Need to sleep more though.
After work I came home and slept for an hour, then ran at dusk.  Felt much better after taking the nap.  I'm getting excited for Friday...got to keep my mind off of it.

I got home from work just after 6, sat down and turned on the Cardinals v Marlins baseball game (MLB season opener).  I said I was going to watch the first 3 innings, then go run, but ended up watching it until the bottom of the 7th when the Marlins got their first hit.  Then I ran a relaxed out and back 10.  With about 3 miles left I did four Jon Lambert style '200s' at race pace just to get the legs going a little bit.  Feeling good.

Ran at about 12:45 from work.  Easy pre race shakeout and strides.  Legs are feeling fresh, hopefully I can get a good night's sleep tonight and be ready to fire on all cylinders tomorrow.  This is not an opportunity that comes around often; time to take advantage of it.
Mental health day.  I didn't really feel like running.

Nice long run around the west side of Appleton.  I did this about 2 hours after eating a large Easter brunch so there were a few times where my stomach didn't feel that great but overall I was fine.  It was super windy; 25 mph steady with 35-40 mph gusts.  Legs felt good.  Running the last mile I felt like I was finishing up a normal 10 miler.
Only six hours of sleep last night after driving back to St Paul so I was tired getting up.  Kind of chilly this morning but once I got going I felt fine.
Late run on Shepard Road towards downtown and then strides.  Felt good.
Shakeout.  Should have done the whole 5.

There was a soccer game at Mac so I went to St Paul Academy.  I didn't check the forecast this morning and didn't bring enough clothes, so I was cold for pretty much the entire thing.  That and the strong wind on the backstretch made it tough to get going.  The 200s at the end were nice 'feel good' intervals (ran them with the wind).  At the end of the cooldown I was almost delirious because I was so hungry.
Ran at noon.  Didn't feel noticeably good or bad.
Short and easy.  Ran purposefully slow.  Strides afterward.  Feel good.
Ran through the woods for a little over an hour than added a little on West Seventh.  Wasn't real motivated to start the run but felt pretty good once I got going.

I was hoping to run with the Run N Fun guys this morning but ended up falling back asleep after my alarm went off and not waking up again until 8:11.  Ended up running long along the river by myself in the afternoon.  Had a pretty good pace going but never felt terrific.  By the end I was getting pretty dehydrated.
Weather was nasty so I ran inside.  Legs were tight/tired from yesterday.
Easy run over to Minnehaha.  I felt fine but was having some bathroom issues.
Nice run along the river during lunch.  I was exhausted getting up this morning.  Also did a good set of strides.
Lilydale with Run N Fun.  We took it easy.  Legs felt good but by the end I was really hungry.  Had a good time talking with everyone.

40 minute tempo run at 5:20 pace.  I surprised myself tonight...I was planning to start at 5:30ish and maybe work it down the second half, but I came through my first checkpoint 10 minutes in at 5:20 pace so I decided to just try and hold it.  One nice benefit of the track work that I've been doing is that this pace felt really easy starting out.  Even at the end it wasn't getting super difficult.  I wondered on the cool down if I could have kept it going and run a sub 1:10 half marathon tonight.
Lunch run, although I didn't actually get to go until about 1:15.  Right as I was turning around the tornado sirens went off.  Found out later that it was a statewide test.

Out and back to St Thomas.  Around 30 minutes in I wasn't feeling very good and thought it was going to turn into a struggle, but about 10 minutes later I came around and felt fine the rest of the way.
Just moved the legs for 30 minutes.  It felt good to loosen up.

Nice workout at SPA.  Aleta came along and read/watched.  The 3200 went 75, 76, 74, 75, 76, 75, 77, 72.  It felt fairly consistent, but I guess it wasn't.  My legs were tired starting out but I felt strong.  The 400s went by quickly and felt really short after doing the 2 mile.  With these two workouts this week I'm obviously fit and I've got some confidence back.
Easy run through the Crosby Farm woods.  It was lightly raining.  I felt good and by the end was cruising low 6:00 pace.

The usual 15 mile river route.  It took about six miles to get into it because I took a nap right before I ran, but the last hour I felt great.  I saw John Simons from the U of M twice...the guy seriously takes one stride for every two of mine.  I also crushed the soul of a fat girl on a bike by cruising past her while going up a hill.  Good week.
Lunch run along the river.  Beautiful day, felt good.
Late run into downtown and back after sitting around for awhile when I got home from work.  I felt good until the last mile or so when I got tired.  Also did strides.
Shakeout

Went to Mac after work and saw that there was a soccer practice going on but there were two other people running around the track so I figured I was ok.  I finished my warmup, ballistics, and strides and as I was getting set to start the baseball coach came over and told me I had to leave.  After protesting a bit I got in my car and drove to SPA.  Jogged a minute or so and did a stride then got going.  On the 1000s my breathing always felt in control; my legs just can't go faster.  This summer I'm going to do lots of 100s and 200s to fix this lack of speed.  The 200s felt good, although it's humbling to think that Levins and Lawi ran that pace for a 5K last weekend.
I just didn't feel like runing today.  Went and watched the 10K at Hamline...it was a really nice night so it's too bad that the idea of making it a fast race fell through.

3 miles easy, 3 miles unstructured fartlek, 2 miles cooldown.  Pickups ranged from tempo pace to 5K/10K pace to sprinting.  It was pretty windy and I felt a little flat, probably from not running yesterday.

I ran the cooldown with the Olaf 1500 crew after watching them tear it up at the Mac Twilight.  Awesome weather this evening, just about perfect for racing.  Unfortunately Saturday looks like it's going to be pretty much the opposite.
Easy.  Felt good.  Maybe I'll do another short run later today.
Real easy shakeout and then a couple of strides.  I'm excited for tomorrow...first 10K in a couple years.  The weather's supposed to be gross.

Ran from Aleta's parents house through the arb and on the dirt roads behind it.  It was fun to run in the old stomping grounds.  The first 80 minutes I felt really good, then I got a little tired.  This is probably an underestimation because the first 3/4 of the run I was cruising.  Didn't really feel any effects from yesterday's race.
Legs were quite tired this morning.  Staying up late to watch Payton Jordan didn't help recovery.  It was really exciting though, so whatever.
It was tough to get going tonight because I felt dead.  After just a few minutes of running my legs felt a lot better and I ended up having a good run.  There were a ton of bugs.
Ran and did strides by the river at lunch.  Still feeling a little tired.
Went to Run N Fun early and did some bonus minutes, then ran with the group.  It was pretty humid.  Nobody was pushing the pace so that was nice.  I should be good to go for a workout tomorrow.

800s at Mac.  I felt really good and under control and ended up extending the workout from 10 to 12.  Zero lactic acid at any point.  It was warm but there was pretty much no wind.  Considering how tired I felt all day at work I'm really pumped about this.  Not really because of the times, but because of how relaxed of an effort it was to hit them.  This was my first successful May workout in 3 years.  If I can keep this momentum going good things will happen in 45 days in Duluth.
Lunch run at 12:20.  Doesn't seem like yesterday beat me up.
Ran out and back to Minnehaha Park.  Kept it relaxed and felt good.  Today I worked 14-15 hours and ran 15 miles.  Unfortunately that only left 3 hours for sleeping.
Short early morning tempo after a really short night.  20 minutes.  I got through it but didn't feel very efficient or powerful.  It's going to be a pretty long day.

Ran in Madison on the lakeshore trails and up to Picnic Point.  Legs felt pretty terrible as I expected they would but I couldn't pass up the opportunity to run here again.  I miss running in Madison.

It's amazing what sleeping 12 hours will do for you.  I ran in Lanesboro on the trail and felt great the whole time.  Last half had to have been around six minute pace.  Also finally got a new pair of shoes.
Ran at noon and Aleta biked with me.  I was trying to keep it easy but still ended up running about 6:30 pace.  I guess I'm in pretty good shape right now.
Finished out the week with an easy 5.  Good stuff.
Short shakeout to loosen up for tonight's effort

My original workout plan was 2 x 3 miles at 5:05 pace but I could tell a mile into the first interval that that wasn't going to be possible today so I decided to do 3 x 2 miles instead.  Got through the first 2 reps fine although they felt more difficult than I had hoped.  The third one I stopped at a mile because I was feeling sorry for myself, then I decided to do one more mile sub 5 and call it a day.  It was a long day at work, it was pretty windy tonight, and the oiginal workout was probably unrealistic to begin with, so I'll take this.
Ran at noon.  It was raining for the first 4 miles.  Legs felt good.
High Bridge loop with Run N Fun and guest Andrew Carlson.  Really hilly route.  I felt fine starting out but the last 20 minutes my legs were tired and I was getting really hungry.
Ran at lunch.  I've been having trouble getting going in the mornings so I've been doing my first run at noon more often than not recently.  Felt good.

After work I was hungry so I ate, watched basketball for a little while, then ran at about 9.  Went to St Thomas and back.  My legs felt good but mentally it felt like the run took about 3 hours.  Also did strides.

Light workout at Mac...I wanted to get a bit of a faster stimulus in between my two longer sessions this week.  Legs were a little tired but I got though this with no problems.  Felt the same pretty much all the way through.  It was decently windy.
Ran at noon.  Took it easy and felt good.  10 mile tempo in White Bear Lake tomorrow.

Ran the Northern Lakes 10 Mile in White Bear Lake.  I got lost on my warmup and since I was cutting it close anyway I almost missed the start.  John Leaf was there and ran with me for about the first 2.5 miles.  I ended up running 54:01.  Several (if not most) of the mile markers were misplaced so I'm not sure of splits but I was 27:12 at their 5 mile.  I felt relaxed the whole time...I'd even say I was comfortable for the first 7 miles.  It was good to practice running fast for a longer distance.  Abslutely perfect running weather and a pretty nice course.

Edit (10/16/2013): I suppose I should log this as a race since after 2 failures at the TC10 this is the fastest 10 mile I've ever run (although I split faster in both of my half marathons).  This really did feel like a workout effort when I did it though.
Easy shakeout run.  Actually felt pretty good.  First ever 20+ mile day.

Nice easy recovery run through the woods.  Although I don't feel super beat up I'm going to take my planned easy days today and tomorrow in order to make sure I absorb everything I've done the past couple weeks and don't overdo it.  There's lots of cottonwood falling right now so my allergies are kind of bad.
Lunch run.  I was decently hungry at the start and starving at the finish.  Glad this was only 5 miles.
Easy second run.  Spent most of it thinking about possibly running a marathon this winter.  I'm not sure.
Made it out for a morning run!  Great weather and my legs felt good.
Lilydale with RNF.  Did some bonus minutes by myself before.  Kept it easy, felt good.
I was too slow getting out of bed this morning and wasn't going to be able to run at lunch because of a meeting, so this was the result.  Nice morning outside.

I wanted to do a track workout tonight but there was soccer going on at Mac, a little kids track meet taking place at SPA, and St Thomas's stadium was all set up for graduation (with a stage covering basically the entire backstretch).  So, after thinking for a few minutes about what to do I did a fartlek along the river.  3 sets of 3:00 (2:00), 2:00 (1:00), 1:00, with 2:00 between sets.  Zero walking during the entire thing.  I went a little too hard too early in some of the intervals and in the workout as a whole so it was a little sloppy.  I salvaged something out of the day though.

I took the morning off and kept this evening's run easy since I was feeling pretty run down.  Hopefully I'll feel better tomorrow.  Times from the TC One Mile were pretty slow across the board so I'm glad I passed on it.

Plan was 8 x mile...wasn't going to happen in 90 degree heat and 18-20 mph winds.  I never felt super good doing this...legs were a little off and I just didn't feel fully engaged.  At first I kind of felt like I wussed out by stopping after 6, but there was no way I could have done 2 more.  On the cooldown I realized that it was a pretty good workout.  I don't think it's unreasonable to say the conditions were worth 6 - 8 seconds per mile.
Crosby Farms woods.  Hot and humid, feels like August.  It would have been nice to run with somebody...would have distracted me from how bad I felt.
Felt better than on today's first run.
Not a fun long run.  My legs felt good but my stomach was terrible.  Pretty much the entire time I was having problems.  I must have eaten something bad.
Ran at lunch.  Felt decent.
Ran in the woods.  Great running weather this evening, body felt pretty good.

Started a tempo run, made it 21:30 before my side cramped up and I couldn't run anymore.  Stood for a minute then tried to get going again, made it 6 minutes, cramped again, workout over.  Ran/shuffled home.  Legs and lungs felt good but it's frustrating to not be able to finish the workout.
Lunch run.  Legs are tired.  It was extremely windy.
Took last night off because the weather sucked and based on how I've been feeling I could use some rest.  Felt alright this morning.  Ran inside because it was raining quite hard.

Horrible workout.  Felt like absolute trash; body had no fight whatsoever.  I haven't had a good workout in a while now which is concerning.  Fairly windy.  I need to do some serious recovering between now and Monday or else I'll run 16:30.
Ran down the river road and around the thumb by St Thomas then turned around.  Felt pretty lousy the first 4 miles or so but then got into it.  It rained lightly for the last 15-20 minutes.
Raining again.  Did a couple of hard sprints in the middle to sharpen up for Monday.
Short, easy run.  Didn't feel very chipper.  I then spent the afternoon sitting in the sunny, 95 degree weather at St Olaf's graduation and got super dehydrated.
Lunch run.  I forgot my access card for the fitness center but was able to get someone to let me in.  The weather has cooled down a good bit which is nice.  Pretty windy.

Ran a little by myself then did Lilydale with RNF.  Smaller crew than usual but it was a fun run.  This was actually a little under 11 but I've rounded down on a couple other runs recently.  Went out to Groveland Tap afterward.
Lunch run.  Need more sleep.
Six strides afterward.  Kept things easy tonight.

Long day...didn't get to start my warmup until 7:15.  I felt better than on my past couple workouts, but not super good.  Workouts like this are really hard to do solo...would be nice to grind through it with somebody.  Ran into Nate Hall on my cooldown so I ran with him for a bit.
Lunch run.  SLOW.
River road.  Felt better the second half than the first.

Long run/workout on the river road.  5.5 miles normal running, 15 minute tempo, 5 minutes easy, 15 minute tempo, 5 minutes easy, 4 minutes sub tempo (shooting for around 5:00 pace), 2 minutes easy, 4 minutes sub tempo, slow jog the rest of the way home.  I felt pretty good during the workout but was definitely tired at the end.  Nice to get something like this in.  The second tempo was pretty hilly which I suppose is good practice for Lemon Drop.  There were a ton of bikers on the trail.
Sunday is the Sabbath, keep it slowly.
Monday morning run to downtown St Paul and back.  I felt pretty good but should have eaten something before I started.  Hopefully I'll be able to get another run in later today.

Had to move last night's planned run to this morning because I didn't leave work until after midnight yesterday.  My boss gave me the morning off today so before I went in I did a six miler on the river road and strides.  Felt ok.
RNF.  Felt good.  Pace picked up quite a bit the last few miles.

Halfway through my warmup it started sprinkling, then by the time I started ballistics it was pouring.  I wasn't excited about working out in this, but it might rain next Saturday so I told myself to sack up.  The 5K was mostly run in a downpour and it was also a bit windy.  The rain stopped at some point in the last 2K.  Splits were 5:07, 10:13.  The miles were slightly faster which was what I was looking for.  Felt good pretty much the whole time. Wasn't really struggling aerobically and over the next 10 days I will freshen up my legs a bit.  This was a nice confidence booster.
Easy run to St Thomas and back.  Had to hold myself back a bit, so I guess that means I felt pretty good.  9 days.
Lunch run.  Felt good.  Time to start adjusting the sleep cycle.
8 x 1:00 on, 1:00 off.  Just a light session to turn the legs over a little faster.  Nothing too crazy.  I did it on the paths in the woods and for the most part I felt good.

'Long' run for this week.  I should have gone earlier...by the end it was getting really hot.  If I had been doing a real long run it might have gotten ugly.  Nick Ross caught up to me just after St Thomas so we ran together for a little while.  Felt like we were cruising but I don't know if we actually were or not.  Legs are feeling ok.

Easy run on Shepard Road.  Saw a guy pull his car over to the shoulder, jump out, and start peeing on the side of the road.  Very odd since this is a pretty busy street.  A woman on a bike passed me and summed up the moment best by asking, 'What the fuck?'  For the most part my legs feel good.  I got too much sun yesterday so I had to wear a shirt, which was a little uncomfortable seeing as it's hot.
Race week has finally arrived!  Out and back 10 to downtown St Paul.  Weather was much cooler than it has been.  Felt good.
Shakeout and strides.  I was a little tired heading out but I felt great on the run.

Last workout of this cycle.  Did it in the morning in order to practice running fast early in the day.  The weather was pretty nice...cool and breezy.  My breathing was a little heavier than I would have liked during the 3200 but it's no big deal.  The 1000 was pretty effortless which was nice since the last time I did 1000s I felt horrible.  Legs are feeling good.  I'm ready.
I had a dream last night where I ran a 2:24 marathon.  Was still kind of in a fog on the run.
Didn't get out to run until 8.  Legs felt ok, never was breathing hard.  It's been so long since I've tapered for a goal race (cross country 2009) that I had almost forgotten what it's like.

Ran along the river at about 1.  I was starting to wonder if I was going to be able to get a run in since it stormed most of the morning, but it finally let up.  My legs felt great but I was a bit hungry.  Heading to Duluth tonight!
Easy run from the hotel in Duluth.  It kind of felt like it took forever since I didn't know where I was.  Also did 5 strides.  Tomorrow's the big day!

Drove back from Duluth and went to the Twins/Brewers game.  Twins won 5-4 in 15 innings.  My quads are sore but I don't feel much worse than I did after Human Race.  I'm going to take at least three days off, then we'll see.
Rest.  Pretty tired overall from the weekend.
Rest.  My body feels a ton better.  Feels like I could start running again if I wanted to.
Rest day #4.  I'll probably run tomorrow.

Starting back up.  I'll still be taking it easy for awhile but I think 4 days was enough time totally off.  My body feels good and my motivation is high.  Tonight my legs felt a little rusty the first mile but I got into it quickly.
Easy run through the woods.  My right quad felt a little funny the first few minutes but it went away so I'm not worried.  Felt good otherwise.

Easy run on Shepard Road then did six strides, pedestal, and pushups.  With the Olympic Trials going on I'm motivated to go out and go for a hard two hour run, but I'm going to rein in that enthusiasm and take things easy.

Ran through the woods.  I wanted to check out a path that I thought looked promising on Friday but unfortunately it just led straight back to one of the main paths.  Legs felt the best they have since the half.

I wanted to run this morning but was too tired, so I did it in the evening.  Watched the 400 IM final from the swimming trials, left right after, and was back in time to see the last couple laps of the first women's 5K semi.  Good timing.  I ran out and back to downtown St Paul.  Felt good, cruised a bit.

Run N Fun.  Dan, Schmick, Brandon, and I separated from the rest of the group about 2 miles in.  As we turned onto River Road there was a guy a little ways ahead of us that on first glance I thought looked like Tim Lillehaugen, so I dropped the pace a bit to catch up.  Sure enough it was Tim.  He ran with us up Summit and then turned off at Macalester.  It was a pretty quick run but I felt good and I don't have any workouts planned so it's no big deal.  Afterwards a group of us went to Plum's and I ended up playing darts and drinking PBR until 2 AM with Branigan, Nate, and Paul.

Heat index of about 100.  My legs did not feel good...that's what you get after two fast runs and then staying out until all hours of the night.  I did my strides in the middle so that I could just go straight inside when I got home.

St Thomas out and back.  Legs still not feeling the greatest so I took it slow.  It was an exciting night at the Trials...absolute heartbreak in the women's 5K, then a jaw dropping last 400 from Rupp to beat Lagat.
Ran from work at lunch.  Also did 7 strides.  I'm tired and need to catch up on sleep.  Dan's bachelor party is tonight, so I'll be even more tired tomorrow.

Just an easy 5 today...don't want more than 60 miles this week and I'm doing 10 tomorrow.  It was pretty warm out.  Legs felt a little better than yesterday, thanks to sleeping from 2:30 AM until just before noon.

Ran at 11:30...not a good idea.  Really hot and humid.  I held it together fine enough but if this run had been any longer I really would have struggled.  It's going to be over 100 tomorrow so I have to get myself up and run in the morning.

The heat index is going to be around 105 this evening so last night I told myself that no matter how tired I was when my alarm went off this morning I had to get up.  It was still pretty sticky at 7 AM but I got 12 in no problem.  Ran on the river road.  I have some pain just in front of my heel on my left foot that I'll have to keep an eye on.  This is my last 'rest' week...plan is 70ish miles in singles.

Ran out and back to downtown St Paul and then did 8 strides.  It was a little cooler than yesterday morning but still quite humid.  Run felt ok, strides felt pretty good.  Heading up to the cabin tonight for 4th of July.

I did the usual first run from the cabin to downtown Sayner and back.  The way back felt like it took a lot longer since there was no shade on that side of the highway and it was hot.  Then I did the lake swim.

Aleta biked the first 9 with me and then we ran a mile together.  Legs felt good.  I threw in some pretty hard surges on the three hills in the last mile.  It was still really warm and the cabin had no power after a windstorm so I jumped in the lake afterward to cool off.
Ran from the cabin to the Wolf Pack Cafe where Aleta and Bob met me to eat.  Felt good for most of the run but the last 10 minutes I was getting hungry and was ready to be done.

Drove into Sayner and ran from the trailhead past Crystal Lake and towards Boulder Junction.  Aleta rode bike support for the first 13 and then we ran together for a little over a mile.  I felt good and was running six minute pace for awhile in the middle.  It was cooler this morning.
Short run from the cabin to finish out this down period and make sure I go into next week with my legs feeling good.  Nothing really to report about this one.

Pretty sloppy tempo workout tonight.  25 minutes...5:18 pace on the way out then probably 5:30ish on the way back.  I kind of expected a sub par workout since I had something else weighing on my mind and didn't really want to do this.  Also felt pretty rusty since I haven't worked out in a few weeks.  Hopefully on Saturday I will put out a better effort.

I did a double today for the first time in about a month.  The first run was at lunch, although I would like to get out of this habit.  Felt like my tank was on empty pretty much the whole time.  I need to eat more.

Lilydale with RNF.  This is actually more like 9.5 but I rounded down on several runs last week so I'm rounding this one up.  Felt pretty decent through about 8.  It was cool to hear about Greeno's mission trip.
15 miles on the river road.  Felt like crap for about the first 4, then it got better but I never felt great.  Hopefully my legs will start feeling better soon.
Ran during lunch.  Still felt really tired when I got up this morning but during and after the run I felt better.  Pretty warm and windy out.
Downtown St Paul and back and then a good set of strides.  Very light rain for a bit of the run.  Felt ok on the run and good on the strides.  Very hungry at the end.

After work I waited for a storm to finish and then ran to St Thomas and back.  My body continues to feel generally tired.  I also had some GI distress.  The nice thing was that the rain had cooled things down.

3+ mile warmup
21 minute tempo
5 minutes jog
5 x 1 min on / 1 min off
8 x 30 sec on / 1 min off
1 mile cooldown 

Combined a short tempo and some fartlek intervals on the river road.  My legs felt better than they had been feeling all week and I think I got a good effort in.  By the end it was getting quite warm and I was dehydrated.  I need to overhaul my sleeping habits and start running early in the morning.
This run was only 3 hours after my workout, so it was basically a cooldown.  At least the break gave me a chance to eat and rehydrate.  Felt fine.

Ran in the Arb in Northfield.  Both of the bridges by the entrance are broken now so I wonder if they're going to replace them.  Only saw one other person in there.  Felt decent the first 2/3 of the run but by the end I was hungry, thirsty, and sweaty.  It'd be great to get some nice 75 degree summer days, but it doesn't look like there are going to be any of those anytime soon.  Maybe I should move to Maine.

Nice run on the river road.  Started early so the temperature was relatively cool, which probably explains why my legs felt better.  Having to get ready for work right after banging out a 90 minute run isn't very fun though.
One stepped myself throughout a six miler and then did 10 strides.  It was really humid.  The strides were kind of tough.

RNF.  We ran down Highland to the river and then back up Summit.  Because of the weather and Torchlight being tomorrow it was a really small group, only 7 guys.  I felt sluggish and tired and just relaxed in the back with Dan.  After the run ended I felt horrible.  The heat is getting to me.

Cruised through this workout at SPA.  I got the idea for 3x3x400 from Dan last night and then added the 2 miles at the beginning to get a bit more volume in.  The whole workout was basically at threshold effort but it was great to get some running in at different paces.  By the last set of 400s the 30 second rest was starting to pass pretty quickly.  There was a decent headwind in the last 100 so most of the intervals were positive split.  It's good to know that I'm still in pretty good shape even though I haven't done much quality in the past month.
Ran at lunch.  My legs did not feel good when I got up this morning but by the time I ran they were ok.
Minnehaha Park, River Road, Crosby Farms Woods.  Legs felt sluggish starting out but after about 30 minutes they came around.  Chest was covered with dead bugs when I finished.
Today's an easy day.  Ran 7 at lunch in a light rain.  The rain actually felt pretty good.  Legs a little tired, but ok.
Easy run and strides.  Jager 8:06 steeple, American record...holy shit!

20 min tempo, 3 min rest, 10 min tempo.  Legs felt alright but it was humid.  It was raining when I first woke up and I was pretty tired so I got some more sleep.  Probably should have just gotten up and done the workout.  Finished with 6 x 30 second strides.
Shakeout

17 mile route but I bonked badly the last 15 minutes and ended up walking it in from the Shepard Road intersection.  Must've been dehydrated.  I need to work on pushing the distance of my long run out further so I'll try again next weekend.

Slept like garbage last night so I decided to work for a couple of hours and do my run at noon.  Not that great of an idea, very humid.  This is the worst summer I've experienced as far as heat and humidity go.  Yay for global warming.
Shakeout.  My feet are getting blisters because my socks are getting so saturated during runs.  Gross.
Ran a couple miles by myself then ran Lilydale with the RNF crew.  Didn't feel real great but the good company made me kind of forget about that.  Farewell to Paul.
My body feels terrible.  Hopefully I'll feel better tomorrow.
Better.  Still not great, but this run was hopefully a step in the right direction.

200s on the track at SPA.  Pretty much all of them were between 32.5 and 32.9; I couldn't go any faster without pressing so I just kept it there.  The last one felt the same as the first so I guess that's good.  Definitely have no speed...if I raced a mile right now I wouldn't be under 4:30.  I'm going to try to do something like this a couple more times over the next few months in order to change that.

Ran out and back to downtown.  Legs still don't feel 100% but I got through it fine.  The 65 degree temps was a very welcome change.  I think I'm going to take tonight off and try to set myself up for a good long run tomorrow.

Boom, nice run.  Felt the best I have in at least a week and a half.  Went out and back down river road and up Summit to Lexington, then an add on mile at the end.  Stopped for water at 11 and then again at about 15.

Ran in the Arb from Aleta's parents house and also did strides.  My legs felt good.  Matt Brutger caught up to me near the Arb exit so we ran together for a few minutes.  I was supposed to do a double today but decided to watch the US basketball game this morning instead and then our evening plans ended up stretching out way later than intended so I ended up scrapping it instead of doing a run at 11 PM.  I guess I'll just consider this week my down week.
Easy morning run.  Didn't sleep enough last night but I still felt fine.

22 min tempo, 3 min rest, 10 min tempo, 4 x 30 sec on/1 min off

I knocked this workout out of the park.  Didn't get to start until about 8:30, but from the first steps my legs felt really good.  Cruised through the first three miles at around 5:18 pace, then either maintained pace or dropped it a few seconds for the rest of the first segment.  During the rest I still felt really fresh and I knew my second segment would be fast.  It was basically a 10 minute 2 mile.  Considering I'm very stressed out right now I definitely did not see this coming.  Taking the miles down last week obviously helped.  Part of me is wondering if I should keep my mileage at 85-90 and make sure I'm almost always fresh for workouts.
Shakeout.  Had trouble falling asleep last night after running so late.

RNF.  We did the Highland Loop and then added on a bit.  Didn't feel very good starting out, but the last 30 minutes were good.

I've been healthy and training for a year!  4563.5 miles between 8/1/2011 and 7/31/2012.  Average of about 12.5 per day or 87 for any given 7 day stretch.  I only took 8 days off during these 12 months...2 for sickness, 2 because I just needed a day off, and 4 for end of season recovery after my half marathon.  It feels good to put together a stretch of training like this.  Now on to another one and some PRs!
Morning run.  Meh.

Ran with Adrian around Lake of the Isles and Lake Calhoun.  It was about 95 degrees out but just before we started it clouded over which made it not so bad.  Started getting a little tired towards the end, I have not been getting enough sleep this week.

I decided to do a fartlek rather than a track workout because it was pretty warm and I didn't really feel like running on the track.  1 x 5:00 (3:00), 2 x 3:00 (2:00), 3 x 2:00 (1:00), 4 x 1:00 (1:00).  Felt strong the whole time.  Good workout.
Good God I was tired this morning
Easy run in the Crosby Farms Woods.  Still a little tired, at least I can sleep in tomorrow.

Long run...same river road route that I did 2 weeks ago.  Felt pretty good but the last 3 minutes I could tell that the wall was right around the corner.  This Olympic 10K this afternoon was incredible...it ended over four hours ago and I'm still buzzing about it.
Ran to downtown St Paul and back.  Great 75 degree day!
Easy shakeout and strides.  Too nice of a day to not run again.  Good week of training.
Awesome 60 degree morning.  Where has this been all summer?

30 minute warmup, then 9 repeats on the Ford Parkway hill in the dark.  Felt as good as I could expect to when doing hill repeats.  On my cooldown a dog came out of its yard and chased me down the sidewalk.  After what must have been a sub 30 second 200 I got away from it...the thing honestly scared the shit out of me.
Ran at noon.  Legs were feeling last night's hill workout a little bit.

Small crew at Run N Fun tonight.  We started off on the High Bridge route but eventually Kelly said he was going to turn off and go shorter and a couple of us decided to just go with him.  I wasn't feeling that great so I was glad to hang it up a little early.  Plus I'm only trying to get 90-95 this week.

Ran along the river from work.  Thought about baseball most of the run in order to take my mind off of how tired I am.  Company outing this afternoon/evening, so this is it for the day.  That's probably a good thing.
Easy shakeout before tonight's workout.  I got 8 hours of sleep last night...first time I've done that in close to two weeks.

This was solid.  After the first lap of the first 1600 (77) I thought it might be a rough day but I got going.  There was a pretty stiff wind...without it I think all of the 16s could have been under 5:00.  The 4s showed that I still had something left.  I think I could run a pretty decent 10K right now, just need to extend that to 10 mile and half marathon fitness over the next couple months.
Slow morning run.  Feeling the workout from last night.
Easy run on the river road.  Legs still a little dead, but better than this morning.

In Northfield for Dan's wedding so I drove up to St Olaf and did a big loop from there.  I was originally only planning 15 but ended up doing 18 since it was a beautiful day and my legs were feeling good.  11 mile tempo course to Holyoke to 320th to Eveleth then finish on the first/last mile of the course.  My face was bothering me the first part since I slept in a cat infested area last night but other than that I felt good.  Glad I took the opportunity to get a good one in.
Ran around the Lake Harriet area with Pez and Joe Paille.  Felt better than I expected to after the long run and wedding yesterday.  It was fun to run with those guys.

Ran at noon.  Just after I turned around some guy caught up to me on his bike and just creepily sat behind me for 2 or 3 minutes.  He said that at first I was going 9.2 miles per hour and that after I first saw him I sped up to 9.7 miles per hour.  Then he moved along.  I also did strides.
Pretty easy 10.  Logging it 2 days later and don't remember anything notable about it.

26 minute tempo (covered somewhere around 5 miles), 5 minutes jog/walk, then 10 x 30 seconds fast with 1:00 jog between.  This was another good tempo run on the river road.  Maybe started off a bit hot the first two minutes but I was 'in the zone' the rest of the time.  The 30 second intervals went well too...I think doing these consistently will make a big difference by the time indoor track comes around.  Ran the entire run in my flats because my trainers are shot.

Unplanned recovery day.  I got home at about 7:30 and was really hungry so I decided to have a snack and watch some of the US v Mexico soccer game.  Ended up watching the whole thing.  Finally at around 10 PM I got out the door for a short run.  I was due for a down day at some point this week; I guess today was the winner.

Morning run.  I had a fartlek workout scheduled for this evening, but at about 3 PM I got a call from my dad asking if I would come help move my brother's furniture into his new apartment in Minneapolis after work.  This was originally planned for tomorrow, but they decided at the last minute to do it today instead.  Saying I couldn't help because I had to go running wasn't really an option, and since it was after 10:00 by the time I got home from doing this and then eating the morning run was all I got in today.

Attempted to do yesterday's workout...did one 3 minute interval and stopped.  Legs didn't feel good and I wasn't mentally in the mood to work out.  Felt fine once I decided to just do a normal run.  I did some strides at the end.

Ran 8.5 miles along the river road and then up Summit to Lexington.  After turning around I did a 10 min pickup, 3 min jog, 6 min cruise, 3 min jog, 8 x 1 min hard/1 min easy.  It was nice to get some good running in during a long run...makes it a more race specific workout.  Legs were pretty tired by the end.  The ragnar relay was going on so a bunch of spectators/volunteers thought I was participating in that.
Shakeout.  Not a very fun run because I didn't eat any breakfast.  Legs are pretty dead from yesterday, I'll need to wait until Tuesday before I go hard again.

Pretty good run to downtown and back.  It was a nice 65-70 degree evening.  Thought about marathoning for most of the last half.

It seems like my mileage drops unintentionally about every 3 weeks.  I suppose most coaches/programs recommend a down week every third weeks, so I guess this is ok.  I've always been horrible at taking planned down weeks anyways.

Morning run.  Didn't feel very good.  Weather felt like fall.

Edit: Ended up not doing an evening run.  I'm not really sure why, but I just didn't feel like it.  Haven't had that much desire to run recently.
Time to get back on the horse.  I'm going to try to put in a solid 10 day block before I back off for my first two races.  Started it off with a good run at lunch.
Untimed 6 mile tempo.  Goal was 5:30s and I'd guess that's about what I did.  Legs felt good; that's what should happen though given my recent training.
Running and striding.  Felt a little hungry.
